infection	O
is	O

by	O
a	O

.	O

virus	O

the	O

.	O

West	B-Virus

virus	O
exists	O

.	O

very	O

A	O
horse	O
property	O
in	O
southwest	O
Kansas	B-Province
is	O
under	O
quarantine	O
following	O
confirmation	O
of	O
6	O
cases	O
of	O
equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
in	O
horses	O
.	O

The	O
infected	O
horses	O
on	O
the	O
property	O
in	O
Finney	B-City
County	I-City
will	O
be	O
euthanized	O
because	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
cure	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
risk	O
the	O
animals	O
may	O
infect	O
other	O
horses	O
.	O

The	O
Kansas	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
's	O
Division	O
of	O
Animal	O
Health	O
was	O
told	O
this	O
month	O
[	O
August	O
2017	O
]	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
positive	O
test	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
Swamp	O
fever	O
.	O

The	O
horse	O
facility	O
was	O
quarantined	O
and	O
all	O
the	O
exposed	O
horses	O
were	O
tested	O
,	O
with	O
5	O
additional	O
positive	O
cases	O
detected	O
.	O

The	O
remaining	O
horses	O
at	O
the	O
facility	O
will	O
be	O
observed	O
and	O
retested	O
in	O
60	O
days	O
.	O

Equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
is	O
most	O
commonly	O
spread	O
by	O
biting	O
flies	O
and	O
ticks	O
,	O
or	O
sometimes	O
through	O
the	O
shared	O
used	O
of	O
blood-contaminated	O
instruments	O
or	O
needles	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
does	O
not	O
affect	O
people	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O
to	O
horses	O
,	O
mules	O
and	O
donkeys	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
attacks	O
the	O
immune	O
system	O
,	O
with	O
signs	O
including	O
bleeding	O
in	O
mucus	O
membranes	O
and	O
a	O
gradual	O
loss	O
of	O
condition	O
and	O
muscle	O
weakness	O
.	O

Other	O
signs	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
depression	O
and	O
anemia	O
.	O

Infected	O
horses	O
can	O
run	O
a	O
low-grade	O
fever	O
or	O
become	O
lethargic	O
,	O
but	O
often	O
there	O
are	O
no	O
clinical	O
signs	O
.	O

Infected	O
horses	O
continue	O
to	O
carry	O
the	O
virus	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
further	O
infections	O
,	O
hence	O
the	O
protocol	O
to	O
euthanize	O
infected	O
animals	O
.	O

All	O
infected	O
horses	O
,	O
including	O
those	O
who	O
have	O
no	O
signs	O
,	O
are	O
carriers	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
vaccine	O
or	O
treatment	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
typically	O
a	O
small	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
every	O
year	O
,	O
although	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
common	O
in	O
other	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
world	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
controlled	O
in	O
the	O
US	O
by	O
regular	O
testing	O
before	O
horses	O
are	O
allowed	O
to	O
travel	O
across	O
state	O
lines	O
and/or	O
to	O
shows	O
.	O

The	O
pathogen	O
causing	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
categorized	O
as	O
a	O
lentivirus	O
:	O
it	O
contains	O
genetic	O
RNA	O
material	O
,	O
which	O
it	O
uses	O
to	O
produce	O
DNA	O
.	O

This	O
DNA	O
is	O
then	O
incorporated	O
into	O
the	O
genetic	O
makeup	O
of	O
infected	O
cells	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
was	O
first	O
identified	O
in	O
France	O
in	O
1843	O
and	O
first	O
tentatively	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
in	O
1888	O
.	O

Several	O
cases	O
of	O
whooping	O
cough	O
were	O
detected	O
in	O
Washington	B-City
County	I-City
,	O
Indiana	B-Province
earlier	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

The	O
health	O
department	O
says	O
3	O
people	O
,	O
2	O
juveniles	O
and	O
an	O
adult	O
,	O
are	O
being	O
treated	O
with	O
antimicrobials	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Whooping	O
cough	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
pertussis	O
,	O
can	O
cause	O
coughing	O
fits	O
which	O
can	O
lead	O
to	O
ongoing	O
breathing	O
issues	O
and	O
in	O
some	O
cases	O
can	O
also	O
lead	O
to	O
pneumonia	O
and	O
seizures	O
.	O

Generally	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
milder	O
in	O
children	O
and	O
adults	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
health	O
leaders	O
say	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
very	O
dangerous	O
for	O
infants	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
can	O
easily	O
spread	O
,	O
''	O

ca	O

.	O

The	O

and	O
can	O

from	O

to	O

can	O

.	O

.	O

is	O

of	O

[	O

Saskatchewan	B-Province
has	O

disease	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
(	O

)	O
.	O

Birds	O
found	O
in	O

Lake	I-City
and	O

Lake	O

are	O

for	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Double-crested	O

and	O
gulls	O
were	O
found	O
to	O
have	O
lesions	O
consistent	O
with	O
NDV	O
.	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Environment	O
says	O
there	O
are	O
occasional	O
outbreaks	O
that	O
happen	O
naturally	O
,	O
but	O
they	O
are	O
short-lived	O
and	O
kill	O
limited	O
numbers	O
.	O

NDV	O
does	O
n't	O
pose	O
a	O
large	O
health	O
risk	O
for	O
people	O
,	O
but	O
in	O

many	O

birds	O
have	O

or	O

about	O

.	O

or	O
gulls	O

and	O
should	O

to	O
the	O
nearest	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Environment	O
Office	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
locally	O

case	O
of	O

in	O
Miami-Dade	B-City
County	I-City
in	O

.	O

,	O

.	O

a	O

tests	O
.	O

where	O
the	O
man	O
acquired	O
the	O
painful	O

disease	O
.	O

Dengue	B-Virus
fever	O
has	O
been	O
on	O
the	O
rise	O
in	O
Florida	B-Province
for	O
2	O
years	O
.	O

Key	O
West	O
has	O
reported	O
57	O
locally	O
acquired	O
cases	O
in	O
2009	O
and	O
2010	O
.	O

One	O
locally	O
acquired	O
case	O
was	O
reported	O
in	O
Broward	O
in	O
August	O
[	O
2010	O
]	O
.	O

The	O
new	O
Miami-Dade	O
case	O
was	O
a	O
different	O
strain	O
from	O
those	O
in	O
Key	O
West	O
and	O
Broward	O
,	O
so	O
was	O
not	O
acquired	O
there	O
,	O
Leguen	O
said	O
.	O

The	O

that	O
the	O
new	O
case	O
was	O
contracted	O
locally	O
means	O
it	O
apparently	O
was	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
a	O
bite	O
of	O
a	O
mosquito	O
that	O
had	O
bitten	O
another	O
Dade	O
resident	O
who	O
was	O
infected	O
,	O
health	O
officials	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
does	O
not	O
pass	O
from	O
mosquito	O
to	O
mosquito	O
.	O

It	O
raises	O
questions	O
about	O
whether	O
the	O
disease	O
might	O
become	O
endemic	O
,	O
occurring	O
widely	O
in	O
a	O
local	O
area	O
and	O
feeding	O
upon	O
itself	O
.	O

The	O
new	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	O
case	O
occurred	O
in	O
a	O
densely	O
populated	O
area	O
of	O
77	O
properties	O
somewhere	O
in	O
Miami-Dade	B-City
County	I-City
,	O
said	O
county	O
Mosquito	O
Control	O
Director	O
Sandra	O
Fisher	O
.	O

County	O
crews	O
have	O
gone	O
house	O
to	O
house	O
with	O
hand	O
held	O
sprayers	O
and	O
have	O
emptied	O
bird	O
baths	O
,	O
rain-filled	O
tires	O
,	O
stagnant	O
pools	O
and	O
even	O
bottle	O
caps	O
filled	O
with	O
water	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

Removing	O
stagnant	O
water	O
is	O
more	O
effective	O
than	O
spraying	O
from	O
trucks	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
,	O
because	O
the	O
_Aedes	O
aegypti_	O
mosquito	O
that	O
carries	O
the	O
dengue	B-Virus
virus	O
from	O
one	O
human	O
to	O
others	O
seeks	O
close	O
contact	O
with	O
humans	O
.	O

She	O
urged	O
residents	O
to	O
remove	O
stagnant	O
water	O
sources	O
in	O
their	O
own	O
yards	O
.	O

``	O
This	O
mosquito	O
lives	O
and	O
breathes	O
around	O
people	O
,	O
''	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

``	O

actually	O
flies	O

houses	O
looking	O
for	O
a	O
blood	O
meal	O
so	O
it	O
can	O
lay	O

.	O

So	O
checking	O
yards	O
is	O
our	O
1st	O
line	O
of	O
prevention	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
everywhere	O
in	O
Dade	O

.	O

Everyone	O
should	O
consider	O
themselves	O
at	O
risk	O
no	O
matter	O
where	O
they	O
live	O
.	O
''	O

The	O

Organization	O
's	O

that	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
's	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

The	O
health	O
body	O
noted	O
that	O
humans	O
could	O
be	O
exposed	O
to	O
the	O
disease	O
by	O
encountering	O
feces	O
or	O
urine	O
from	O
rodents	O
and	O
urged	O
good	O
community	O
hygiene	O
that	O
discourages	O
rodents	O
from	O
entering	O
homes	O
.	O

A	O
parasite	O
spread	O
through	O
fecal	O
matter	O
apparently	O
is	O
to	O
blame	O
for	O
dozens	O
of	O
dead	O
or	O
very	O
weak	O
mule	O
deer	O
in	O
and	O
around	O
Roundup	B-City
.	O

Montana	O
Fish	O
,	O
Wildlife	O
and	O
Parks	O
[	O
FWP	O
]	O
biologists	O
have	O
fielded	O
numerous	O
reports	O
in	O
recent	O
weeks	O
of	O
mule	O
deer	O
with	O
extreme	O
diarrhea	O
in	O
and	O
around	O
Roundup	B-City
.	O

Many	O
of	O
those	O
mule	O
deer	O
have	O
died	O
.	O

Jennifer	O
Ramsey	O
of	O
Bozeman	O
,	O
FWP	O
's	O
wildlife	O
veterinarian	O
,	O
said	O
necropsies	O
on	O
several	O
of	O
the	O
dead	O
deer	O
revealed	O
an	O
extreme	O
number	O
of	O
parasitic	O
trichostrongylid	O
worms	O
and	O
eggs	O
--	O
enough	O
to	O
seriously	O
disable	O
deer	O
and	O
kill	O
young	O
animals	O
.	O

Diarrhea	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
parasites	O
results	O
in	O
dehydration	O
,	O
emaciation	O
,	O
and	O
anemia	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
,	O
particularly	O
to	O
young	O
deer	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
parasitic	O
worms	O
specifically	O
attack	O
ruminants	O
--	O
or	O
animals	O
with	O
split	O
hooves	O
and	O
multiple-chambered	O
stomachs	O
,	O
Ramsey	O
said	O
.	O

Those	O
include	O
deer	O
,	O
elk	O
,	O
antelope	O
,	O
moose	O
,	O
goats	O
,	O
sheep	O
,	O
and	O
cattle	O
.	O

The	O
parasites	O
occur	O
naturally	O
in	O
such	O
animals	O
and	O
become	O
debilitating	O
or	O
fatal	O
only	O
when	O
they	O
reach	O
extremely	O
high	O
numbers	O
in	O
an	O
animal's	O
stomach	O
.	O

The	O
worms	O
spread	O
between	O
animals	O
through	O
fecal	O
matter	O
,	O
Ramsey	O
said	O
.	O

They	O
reach	O
fatal	O
concentrations	O
when	O
infected	O
animals	O
eat	O
grass	O
or	O
browse	O
that	O
is	O
covered	O
with	O
infected	O
fecal	O
matter	O
.	O

Artificial	O
concentration	O
of	O
deer	O
in	O
and	O
around	O
Roundup	B-City
is	O
contributing	O
to	O
the	O
problem	O
as	O
wildlife	O
congregates	O
around	O
scarce	O
food	O
sources	O
,	O
including	O
livestock	O
feed	O
grounds	O
and	O
places	O
where	O
people	O
have	O
left	O
food	O
for	O
them	O
,	O
FWP	O
wildlife	O
biologist	O
Jay	O
Newell	O
of	O
Roundup	O
said	O
.	O

Deer	O
are	O
more	O
susceptible	O
to	O
parasites	O
at	O
this	O
time	O
of	O
year	O
because	O
they	O
are	O
emerging	O
from	O
a	O
long	O
winter	O
,	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

While	O
the	O
parasite	O
could	O
spread	O
to	O
livestock	O
,	O
Ramsey	O
said	O
,	O
most	O
farmers	O
and	O

routinely	O
treat	O
their	O

with	O
a	O

that	O
stops	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Trichostrongylosis	O
infection	O
in	O
humans	O
,	O
dogs	O
,	O
and	O
cats	O
is	O
quite	O
rare	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
and	O
easily	O
treated	O
with	O
inexpensive	O
medicine	O
,	O
Ramsey	O
said	O
.	O

To	O
catch	O
the	O
parasitic	O
disease	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
,	O
a	O
person	O
or	O
pet	O
would	O
have	O
to	O
directly	O
consume	O
unwashed	O
vegetables	O
or	O
water	O
that	O
was	O
contaminated	O
with	O
deer	O
feces	O
.	O

Normal	O
,	O
reasonable	O
hygiene	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
washing	O
hands	O
,	O
prevents	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
parasite	O
to	O
humans	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

Namibia	B-Country

,	O

.	O

(	O

``	O

.	O

:	O

.	O

medRxiv	O
.	O

5	O

2021	O
.	O

Abstract	O
Background	O
:	O
As	O
of	O
26	O
Mar	O
2021	O
,	O
the	O
Africa	O
CDC	O
had	O

4	O

055	O

of	O

and	O
111	O

among	O
the	O
55	O
African	O
Union	O
Member	O
States	O
;	O
however	O

no	O
country	O
has	O
published	O
a	O

representative	O

as	O
of	O
May	O
2021	O
.	O

Such	O
data	O
are	O
vital	O
for	O
understanding	O
the	O

's	O
progression	O
on	O
the	O
continent	O
,	O
evaluating	O

measures	O
,	O
and	O
policy	O

.	O

Methods	O
:	O
We	O
conducted	O
a	O
cross-sectional	O
,	O
nationally	O
representative	O
,	O
age-stratified	O
serosurvey	O
in	O
Sierra	B-Country
Leone	I-Country
in	O
March	O
2021	O
by	O
randomly	O
selecting	O
120	O
Enumeration	O
Areas	O
throughout	O
the	O
country	O
and	O
10	O
randomly	O
selected	O
households	O
in	O
each	O
of	O
these	O
.	O

One	O
to	O
2	O
persons	O
per	O
selected	O

were	O
interviewed	O
to	O
collect	O
information	O
on	O
socio-demographics	O
,	O
symptoms	O
suggestive	O
of	O
COVID-19	B-Disease
,	O
exposure	O
history	O
to	O
laboratory-confirmed	O
COVID-19	O
cases	O
,	O
and	O
history	O
of	O
COVID-19	O
illness	O
.	O

Capillary	O
blood	O
was	O
collected	O
by	O
fingerstick	O
,	O
and	O
blood	O
samples	O
were	O
tested	O
using	O
the	O
Hangzhou	O
Biotest	O
Biotech	O
RightSign	O
COVID-19	B-Disease
IgG/IgM	O
Rapid	O
Test	O
Cassette	O
.	O

Total	O
seroprevalence	O
was	O
estimated	O
after	O
applying	O
sampling	O
weights	O
.	O

Findings	O
:	O
The	O
overall	O
weighted	O
seroprevalence	O
was	O
2.6	O
%	O
(	O
95	O
%	O
CI	O
1.9-3.4	O
)	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
43	O
times	O
higher	O
than	O
the	O
reported	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
.	O

Rural	O

was	O
1.8	O
%	O
(	O
95	O
%	O
CI	O
1.0-2.5	O
)	O

and	O
urban	O
seropositivity	O
was	O
4.2	O
%	O
(	O
95	O
%	O
CI	O
2.6-5.7	O
)	O
.	O

Interpretation	O
:	O
Although	O
overall	O
seroprevalence	O
was	O
low	O
compared	O
to	O
countries	O
in	O
Europe	O
and	O
the	O
Americas	O
(	O
suggesting	O
relatively	O
successful	O
containment	O
in	O
Sierra	B-Country
Leone	I-Country
)	O
,	O
our	O

indicate	O
enormous	O
underreporting	O
of	O
active	O
cases	O
.	O

This	O
has	O
ramifications	O
for	O
the	O
country	O
's	O
3rd	O
wave	O
(	O
which	O
started	O
in	O

where	O

of	O

was	O

month	O

be	O
on	O
the	O
order	O
of	O
3700	O
actual	O

,	O

.	O

.	O

A	O
Scott	B-City

chicken	O
has	O

anthrax	B-Disease
.	O

.	O

.	O

At	O

5	O

in	O
Washington	B-Province
have	O

from	O
_Campylobacter_	O
after	O

.	O

The	O
Washington	B-Province

of	O

reports	O
that	O
the	O
creamery	O
has	O
recalled	O
all	O
of	O

milk	O
with	O

of	O
13	O
Apr	O

.	O

The	O

in	O

,	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

.	O

was	O

in	O

Washington	B-Province
in	O
the	O

store	O
,	O

and	O

.	O

is	O

and	O

with	O
the	O
dairy	O
in	O

``	O

to	O

until	O

We	O

to	O

,	O

.	O

Anyone	O

.	O

The	O
bacterium	O
is	O
particularly	O

to	O
the	O
elderly	O
and	O

Washington	B-Province
State	O

of	O

of	O

)	O

.	O

``	O
Unpasteurized	O
raw	O
milk	O
can	O

harmful	O

and	O
other	O

.	O

by	O

foods	O
;	O
however	O
,	O

milk	O
is	O
one	O

,	O
''	O

,	O

A	O
case	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
infection	I-Disease
has	O
been	O

in	O
a	O
user	O
of	O

heroin	O
in	O
France	B-Country
in	O

,	O

four	O

,	O

,	O
were	O

in	O

in	O
the	O

,	O

was	O

Friday	O
from	O

.	O

An	O

of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
related	O
to	O

of	O

heroin	O

119	O
people	O
in	O

,	O

.	O

The	O

by	O

,	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
,	O
was	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
France	B-Country
on	O

9	O
in	O
an	O

heroin	O
user	O
,	O

27	O
,	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

is	O

,	O
''	O
the	O

of	O

ARS-Sydney	O

.	O

``	O

no	O

)	O

French	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

``	O
No	O
other	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
to	O
date	O
in	O
France	B-Country
,	O
''	O
said	O
the	O
LRA	O
.	O

The	O
bacillus	O
takes	O
the	O
form	O
of	O
spores	O
that	O
allows	O
it	O
to	O
live	O
in	O
a	O
hostile	O
environment	O
such	O
as	O
earth	O
.	O

In	O
a	O
supportive	O
environment	O
,	O
i.e	O
.	O

inside	O
the	O
body	O
,	O
the	O
bacterium	O
becomes	O
active	O
and	O
toxic	O
,	O
says	O
Durand	O
.	O

Heroin	O
users	O
may	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
by	O
turning	O
to	O
substitute	O
products	O
.	O

Any	O
route	O
of	O
administration	O
(	O
injection	O
or	O
ingestion	O
)	O
does	O
not	O
eliminate	O
the	O
risk	O
,	O
and	O
inhalants	O
who	O
sniff	O
the	O
product	O
do	O
not	O
protect	O
themselves	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
Contamination	O
of	O
heroin	O
by	O
the	O
spores	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
seen	O
with	O
the	O
naked	O
eye	O
.	O

Especially	O
in	O
case	O
of	O
fever	O
,	O
or	O
local	O
events	O
such	O
as	O
injection	O
-	O
redness	O
,	O
pain	O
,	O
swelling	O
,	O
or	O
which	O
are	O
swelling	O
rapidly	O
,	O
a	O
physician	O
should	O
be	O
consulted	O
stating	O
that	O
you	O
are	O
a	O
drug	O
user	O
,	O
she	O
advises	O
.	O

The	O
Regional	O
Health	O
Agency-Sydney	O
and	O
recommends	O
calling	O
or	O
making	O
an	O

to	O
the	O
hospital	O
in	O

presence	O
of	O
these	O
symptoms	O
or	O
an	O

fever	O
of	O
>	O
38.5°	O
.	O

.	O

,	O
[	O

]	O

.	O

A	O
mumps	B-Virus
outbreak	O
in	O
Asturias	O
was	O
confirmed	O
yesterday	O
after	O
the	O
Health	O
Department	O
indicated	O
that	O
150	O
cases	O
had	O
been	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
recent	O
weeks	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
3rd	O
outbreak	O
occurring	O
in	O
the	O
region	O
in	O
the	O
last	O
decade	O
.	O

Epidemiological	O
Surveillance	O
experts	O
relate	O
it	O
to	O
the	O
ease	O
of	O
transmission	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
which	O
1/3rd	O
of	O
the	O
infections	O
are	O
so	O
mild	O
that	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
warning	O
of	O
an	O

.	O

Most	O
of	O
the	O
patients	O
are	O
male	O
,	O
aged	O
between	O
15	O
and	O
34	O
years	O
.	O

Langreo	B-City
is	O
the	O
area	O
with	O
the	O
largest	O
number	O
of	O
detected	O
cases	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
outbreak	O
has	O
spread	O
to	O
Gijon	B-City
,	O
Oviedo	B-City
,	O
and	O
Aviles	B-City
.	O

Although	O
much	O
of	O
the	O
population	O
is	O
vaccinated	O
,	O
the	O
Health	O
Ministry	O
stated	O
yesterday	O
that	O
the	O
virus	O
spreads	O
easily	O
because	O
the	O
vaccine	O
is	O
not	O
100	O
percent	O
effective	O
,	O
and	O
occasionally	O
there	O
can	O
be	O
an	O
abrupt	O

in	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
.	O

One	O
of	O

was	O
centered	O
in	O
the	O

of	O
biology	O
at	O
Oviedo	B-City

the	O
disease	O
,	O

among	O

.	O

The	O

General	O
of	O
Public	O

recommends	O
that	O
patients	O
do	O
not	O

4	O

.	O

under	O
35	O

.	O

can	O

their	O
1st	O
compensations	O
of	O
BGN	O
300	O
.	O

A	O
3-month	O
quarantine	O
was	O
declared	O
in	O
Rezovo	B-City
.	O

People	O
who	O
do	O
not	O
live	O
in	O
the	O
village	O
would	O
not	O
be	O
allowed	O
to	O
pass	O
in	O
a	O
radius	O
of	O
4	O
km	O
[	O
2.5	O
mi	O
]	O
.	O

All	O
vehicles	O
leaving	O
the	O
area	O
will	O
be	O
disinfected	O
.	O

At	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
January	O
[	O
2011	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
1st	O
case	O
of	O
FMD	O
in	O
Bulgaria	B-Country
in	O
the	O
past	O
12	O
years	O
was	O
announced	O
.	O

It	O
was	O
found	O
in	O
a	O
wild	O
boar	O
that	O
has	O
been	O
killed	O
in	O
the	O
region	O
of	O
the	O
southeastern	O
city	O
of	O
Burgas	B-Province
.	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
of	O
Egypt	B-Country
has	O
announced	O
2	O
new	O
cases	O
of	O
human	O
infection	O
with	O
H5N1	B-Virus
avian	I-Virus
influenza	I-Virus
.	O

A	O
28-year-old	O
woman	O
from	O
Manshaet	O
district	O
of	O
Damnhouar	O
governorate	O
developed	O
symptoms	O
on	O
12	O
Dec	O
2010	O
.	O

She	O
was	O
admitted	O
to	O
hospital	O
on	O
14	O
Dec	O
2010	O
and	O
subsequently	O
was	O
discharged	O
on	O
the	O
22	O
Dec	O
2010	O
in	O
good	O
and	O
stable	O
condition	O
.	O

She	O
has	O
a	O
history	O
of	O
exposure	O
in	O
a	O
market	O
where	O
live	O
animals	O
are	O
sold	O
.	O

An	O
11-year-old	O
girl	O
from	O
Esna	B-City
district	O
of	O
Luxor	B-Province
governorate	O
developed	O
symptoms	O
on	O
18	O
Dec	O
2010	O
and	O
was	O
admitted	O
to	O
the	O
hospital	O
the	O
following	O
day	O
.	O

She	O
experienced	O
severe	O
respiratory	O
symptoms	O
requiring	O
mechanical	O
ventilation	O
and	O
died	O
on	O
23	O
Dec	O
2010	O
.	O

No	O
information	O
is	O
available	O
regarding	O
poultry	O
exposure	O
.	O

Investigations	O
into	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
infection	O
are	O
underway	O
.	O

Laboratory	O
tests	O
have	O
confirmed	O
H5N1	O
virus	O
and	O
both	O
patients	O
were	O
treated	O
with	O
antiviral	O
medications	O
.	O

Of	O
the	O
115	O
cases	O
confirmed	O
to	O
date	O
in	O
Egypt	B-Country
,	O
38	O
have	O
been	O
fatal	O
.	O

The	O
number	O
of	O
reported	O
anthrax	B-Disease
infections	O
in	O
Bangladesh	B-Country
continues	O
to	O
rise	O
,	O
with	O
8	O
more	O
people	O
found	O
to	O
be	O
infected	O
.	O

The	O
8	O
new	O
infections	O
bring	O
the	O
total	O
number	O
of	O
infections	O
in	O
Sirajganj	B-City
and	O
Pabna	B-City
to	O
171	O
,	O
BDNews24.com	O
reports	O
.	O

All	O
eight	O
of	O
the	O
newest	O
infections	O
were	O
from	O
the	O
Shahjadpur	B-City
Upazila	I-City
[	O
sub	O
district	O
]	O
area	O
,	O
which	O
has	O
seen	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
48	O
anthrax	B-Disease
infections	O
so	O
far	O
.	O

To	O
fight	O
the	O
infections	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
believed	O
to	O
have	O
stemmed	O
from	O
the	O
consumption	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
tainted	O
meat	O
,	O
teams	O
have	O
been	O
dispatched	O
to	O
vaccinate	O
cattle	O
in	O
Belkuchi	O
,	O
Kamarkhand	O
,	O
and	O
Shahjadpur	B-City
Upazila	I-City
in	O
Sirajganj	B-City
.	O

No	O
human	O
deaths	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
to	O
date	O
as	O
a	O
result	O
of	O
the	O
anthrax	B-Disease
infections	O
,	O
which	O
were	O
first	O
detected	O
in	O
Sirajganj	B-City
on	O
19	O
Aug	O
2010	O
.	O

The	O
anthrax	B-Disease
form	O
affecting	O
the	O
Bangladeshi	O
villagers	O
is	O
a	O
cutaneous	O
form	O
that	O
produces	O
black	O
lesions	O
on	O
the	O
skin	O
.	O

While	O
not	O
directly	O
transferable	O
between	O
people	O
,	O
anthrax	B-Disease
spores	O
are	O
able	O
to	O
infect	O
people	O
through	O
the	O
air	O
.	O

As	O
the	O
threat	O
of	O
bioterror	O
anthrax	B-Disease
has	O
grown	O
,	O
attention	O
is	O
also	O
focused	O
on	O
preventing	O
and	O
containing	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
anthrax	O
breakouts	O
.	O

Bangladesh	B-Country
is	O
the	O
7th	O
most	O
populous	O
country	O
in	O
the	O
world	O
.	O

The	O
south	O
Asian	O
nation	O
also	O
has	O
the	O
highest	O
population	O
density	O
in	O
the	O
world	O
among	O
countries	O
with	O
more	O
than	O
10	O
million	O
people	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O
2005	O
United	O
Nations	O
study	O
.	O

Zebra	B-Disease
chip	I-Disease
hits	O
Northwest	O
Zebra	O
chip	O
,	O
a	O
disease	O
that	O
annually	O
costs	O
Southwest	O
US	O
potato	O
growers	O
millions	O
of	O
dollars	O
in	O
crop	O
loss	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
Washington	B-Province
and	O
Oregon	B-Province
.	O

USDA	O
and	O
Oregon	B-Province
State	O
University	O
[	O
OSU	O
]	O
confirmed	O
zebra	B-Disease
chip	I-Disease
in	O
tuber	O
samples	O
submitted	O
by	O
growers	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
was	O
identified	O
in	O
5	O
different	O
fields	O
in	O
the	O
southern	O
Columbia	O
Basin	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
5	O
cultivars	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
Idaho	O
.	O

Researchers	O
do	O
not	O
know	O
if	O
the	O
disease	O
develops	O
or	O
spreads	O
in	O
storage	O
.	O

Growers	O
who	O
plan	O
to	O
store	O
potatoes	O
are	O
advised	O
to	O
scout	O
and	O
treat	O
for	O
the	O
psyllid	O
if	O
they	O
find	O
symptoms	O
and	O
green	O
tissue	O
is	O
present	O
.	O

Swine	B-Disease
flu	I-Disease
deaths	O
continued	O
their	O
upwards	O
surge	O
since	O
the	O
onset	O
of	O
monsoon	O
with	O
17	O
fatalities	O
reported	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
since	O
21	O
Jun	O
2010	O
,	O
the	O
largest	O
numbers	O
of	O
which	O
occurred	O
in	O
Kerala	B-Province
and	O
Maharashtra	B-Province
.	O

Both	O
the	O
states	O
reported	O
7	O
deaths	O
each	O
while	O
Andhra	B-Province
Pradesh	I-Province
reported	O
2	O
and	O
Uttar	B-Province
Pradesh	I-Province
one	O
,	O
health	O
ministry	O
officials	O
said	O
today	O
.	O

All	O
345	O
cases	O
reported	O
during	O
the	O
week	O
are	O
indigenous	O
cases	O
.	O

Up	O
to	O
the	O
present	O
,	O

from	O
143	O
285	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
tested	O
for	O
influenza	B-Virus
H1N1	I-Virus
[	O
virus	O
infection	O
]	O
and	O
33	O
083	O
(	O
23	O
per	O
cent	O
)	O
of	O
them	O
have	O
been	O
found	O
positive	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
new	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
swine	B-Disease
flu	I-Disease
toll	O
in	O
Kerala	B-Province
since	O

hit	O
the	O
state	O
has	O
risen	O

32	O
.	O

Kerala	B-Province

The	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
(	O
DOH	O
)	O
-	O
Calabarzon	O
(	O
Cavite	B-Province
,	O
Laguna	B-Province
,	O
Batangas	B-Province
,	O
Rizal	B-Province
,	O
Quezon	B-Province
)	O
on	O
Tuesday	O
reported	O
an	O
uptick	O
in	O
recorded	O
cases	O
of	O
acute	B-Disease
bloody	I-Disease
diarrhea	I-Disease
in	O
various	O
provinces	O
of	O
the	O
region	O
.	O

To	O
avert	O
a	O
possible	O
surge	O
,	O
DOH	O
Regional	O
Director	O
Eduardo	O
Janairo	O
said	O
that	O
they	O
are	O
currently	O
monitoring	O
the	O
increase	O
in	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
province	O
of	O
Quezon	B-Province
and	O
Rizal	B-Province
.	O

Janairo	O
said	O
that	O
19	O
were	O
recorded	O
in	O
Quezon	B-Province
and	O
13	O
in	O
Rizal	B-Province
.	O

``	O
The	O
regional	O
office	O
is	O
continuing	O
its	O
disease	O
surveillance	O
and	O
is	O
directly	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
local	O
health	O
officials	O
in	O
the	O
provinces	O
,	O
''	O
Janairo	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
Regional	O
Epidemiology	O
and	O
Surveillance	O
Unit	O
has	O
recorded	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
44	O
acute	B-Disease
bloody	I-Disease
diarrhea	I-Disease
cases	O
from	O
1	O
Jan	O
to	O
15	O
May	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
.	O

Age	O
of	O
cases	O
ranged	O
from	O
one	O
year	O
to	O
57	O
years	O
old	O
.	O

Majority	O
of	O
the	O
cases	O
were	O
female	O
with	O
23	O
(	O
52	O
%	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
cases	O
belonged	O
to	O
the	O
one-to-10-year-old	O
age	O
group	O
.	O

The	O
province	O
with	O
the	O
highest	O
cases	O
of	O
acute	B-Disease
bloody	I-Disease
diarrhea	I-Disease
was	O
recorded	O
in	O
Quezon	B-Province
with	O
19	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
Rizal	B-Province
with	O
13	O
,	O
Laguna	B-Province
with	O
8	O
,	O
and	O
Cavite	B-Province
with	O
4	O
.	O

Janairo	O
warned	O
that	O
diarrhea	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
ignored	O
,	O
saying	O
the	O
ailment	O
may	O
result	O
in	O
death	O
.	O

Diarrhea	O
has	O
been	O
noted	O
to	O
be	O
common	O
during	O
the	O
dry	O
season	O
.	O

A	O
person	O
suffering	O
with	O
an	O
acute	B-Disease

diarrhea	I-Disease

in	O

faith	O
,	O
''	O
the	O
statement	O
said	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
ABC	O
,	O
the	O
bakery	O
was	O
also	O
struck	O
by	O
a	O
salmonellosis	B-Disease
outbreak	O
in	O
October	O
2016	O
which	O
affected	O
8	O
people	O
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
of	O
salmonellosis	B-Disease
include	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
fever	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
headaches	O
,	O
stomach	O
cramps	O
and	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
typically	O
appear	O
12	O
to	O
36	O
hours	O
after	O
exposure	O
but	O
can	O
appear	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
6	O
hours	O
and	O
up	O
to	O
72	O
hours	O
afterwards	O
.	O

Infection	O
is	O
usually	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
ingesting	O
bacteria	O
from	O
contaminated	O
food	O
,	O
water	O
,	O
or	O
hands	O
.	O

High-risk	O
foods	O
include	O
poultry	O
,	O
meat	O
,	O
eggs	O
,	O
and	O
milk	O
.	O

Verticillium	B-Disease
wilt	I-Disease
has	O
been	O
widespread	O
in	O
Europe	O
for	O
decades	O
and	O
was	O
first	O
identified	O
in	O
the	O
south	O
of	O
England	B-Province
in	O
2007	O
,	O
said	O
Dr	O
Peter	O
Gladders	O
,	O
ADAS	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
causes	O
premature	O
ripening	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
cause	O
seed	O
shedding	O
during	O
harvest	O
.	O

Harvesting	O
contractors	O
were	O
alerted	O
to	O
a	O
cluster	O
of	O
cases	O
in	O
south	O
Lincolnshire	B-City
last	O
year	O
[	O
2009	O
]	O
,	O
leading	O
to	O
fears	O
that	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
working	O
its	O
way	O
north	O
and	O
could	O
affect	O
growers	O
in	O
Leicestershire	O
.	O

It	O
affects	O
brassicas	O
and	O
closely	O
related	O
weed	O
species	O
such	O
as	O
charlock	O
and	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
spores	O
that	O
remain	O
viable	O
in	O
the	O
soil	O
for	O
years	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
hard	O
to	O
control	O
,	O
Dr	O
Gladders	O
said	O
.	O

Despite	O
being	O
present	O
on	O
the	O
Continent	O
for	O
50	O
years	O
,	O
no	O
resistant	O

have	O
yet	O
been	O
bred	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
is	O
no	O

treatment	O
.	O

Dr	O
Gladders	O
said	O
:	O
``	O
At	O
the	O
moment	O
,	O
the	O
only	O
control	O
mechanism	O
is	O
to	O
avoid	O
growing	O
oilseed	O
too	O
tightly	O
in	O
the	O
rotation	O
.	O

Research	O
completed	O
in	O
Germany	O
suggests	O
it	O
should	O
be	O
grown	O
no	O
more	O
frequently	O
than	O
once	O
in	O
every	O
4	O
years	O
.	O

Later	O
drilling	O
also	O
seems	O
to	O
help	O
control	O
it	O
.	O

By	O
contrast	O
,	O
early	O
drilling	O
in	O
warmer	O
conditions	O
may	O
encourage	O
it	O
.	O
''	O

Farmers	O
are	O
also	O
advised	O
to	O
be	O
on	O
the	O

for	O

,	O

can	O

yield	O

.	O

.	O

A	O
pathogen	O
,	O
which	O
until	O
now	O

in	O

America	O
and	O
the	O

has	O
been	O
reported	O
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
in	O
soybeans	O
in	O
Germany	B-Country
.	O

The	O
bacterium	O
_Curtobacterium	O
flaccumfaciens_	O
was	O
discovered	O
in	O
a	O
soybean	O
field	O
trial	O
in	O
the	O
state	O
of	O
Thuringia	B-Province
by	O

from	O

of	O

.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
leaf	O

and	O

resemble	O

of	O
the	O

_Pseudomonas	O

.	O

The	O

warn	O
that	O
this	O
represents	O

,	O

.	O

In	O

,	O
it	O
could	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
to	O
French	O
beans	O
.	O

These	O

than	O
the	O

.	O

Germany	B-Country
.	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

Diego	O

.	O

Cats	O
are	O
particularly	O

to	O
plague	B-Disease
,	O

can	O

of	O

said	O

.	O

People	O
who	O
work	O
with	O
free-roaming	O
cats	O
need	O
to	O
watch	O
for	O
plague	B-Disease
symptoms	O
in	O
both	O
animals	O
and	O
humans	O
,	O
it	O
said	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
deadly	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
cycling	O
between	O
rodents	O
and	O
fleas	O
.	O

People	O
usually	O
get	O
the	O
disease	O
from	O
the	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
,	O
including	O
rodents	O
and	O
pets	O
.	O

[	O
Signs	O
]	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
cats	O
can	O
include	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
abscesses	O
,	O
discharge	O
or	O
bloody	O
sputum	O
,	O
the	O
statement	O
said	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
humans	O
include	O
sudden	O
onset	O
of	O
fever	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O

,	O
and	O

of	O
the	O
lymph	O
node	O
in	O
the	O

,	O

or	O
neck	O
areas	O
.	O

The	O
risk	O
of	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O

in	O
Arcos	B-City
,	O
in	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
state	O
,	O
has	O
the	O
population	O
worried	O
.	O

Dogs	O
are	O
the	O
main	O
hosts	O
of	O
the	O
parasite	O
[	O
_Leishmania	O
chagasi_	O
]	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
dangerous	O
to	O
humans	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
transmitted	O
by	O
a	O
vector	O
.	O

Leishmaniasis	B-Disease
is	O
considered	O
by	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
to	O
be	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
6	O
largest	O
parasitic	O
epidemics	O
in	O
the	O
world	O
.	O

In	O
Minas	B-Province
Gerais	I-Province
last	O
year	O
[	O
2011	O
]	O
,	O
there	O
were	O
19	O
677	O
cases	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

To	O
prevent	O
further	O
contamination	O
,	O
agents	O
of	O
the	O
Control	O
Center	O
for	O
Zoonoses	O
(	O
CCZ	O
)	O
will	O
test	O
all	O
residences	O
for	O
leishmaniasis	B-Disease
by	O
withdrawing	O
a	O
drop	O
of	O
blood	O
from	O
the	O
animal	O
's	O
ear	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
the	O
test	O
will	O
be	O
available	O
in	O
about	O
10	O
minutes	O
.	O

With	O
the	O
test	O
,	O
housewife	O
Lucia	O
Narciso	O
Silva	O
found	O
that	O
one	O
of	O
her	O
3	O
dogs	O
is	O
contaminated	O
.	O

``	O
I	O
did	O
not	O
know	O
he	O
had	O
this	O
problem	O
.	O

So	O
I	O
think	O
it	O
's	O
good	O
,	O
this	O
work	O
,	O
''	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
test	O
result	O
is	O
positive	O
,	O
the	O
veterinarian	O
removes	O
a	O
blood	O
sample	O
and	O
sends	O
it	O
to	O
the	O
Ezequiel	O
Dias	O
Foundation	O
,	O
Belo	O
Horizonte	O
,	O
responsible	O
for	O
testing	O
in	O
the	O
state	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
agents	O
collect	O
blood	O
,	O
and	O
I	O
return	O
to	O
the	O
homes	O
and	O
harvest	O
the	O
blood	O
from	O
the	O
vein	O
of	O
the	O
animals	O
that	O
tested	O
positive	O
,	O
''	O
explained	O
veterinarian	O
Ana	O
Luiza	O
Teixeira	O
.	O

In	O
Arcos	B-City
,	O
5000	O
dogs	O
will	O
be	O
examined	O
,	O
including	O
homeless	O
animals	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
,	O
51	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
confirmed	O
,	O
but	O
agents	O
believe	O
that	O
the	O
number	O
is	O
higher	O
,	O
because	O
10	O
percent	O
of	O
residents	O
will	O
not	O
allow	O
examination	O
of	O
their	O
animals	O
.	O

Despite	O
this	O
refusal	O
,	O
infected	O
dogs	O
were	O
found	O
throughout	O
the	O
city	O
.	O

A	O
survey	O
by	O
the	O
Regional	O
Health	O
Management	O
(	O
GRS	O
)	O
found	O
that	O
the	O
sandfly	O
[	O
_Lutzomyia	O
longipalpis_	O
]	O
,	O
better	O
known	O
as	O
the	O
``	O
straw	O
mosquito	O
,	O
''	O
responsible	O
for	O
transmitting	O
the	O
disease	O
to	O
humans	O
is	O
present	O
in	O
all	O
city	O
neighborhoods	O
.	O

Officials	O
in	O
Cochise	B-City
County	I-City
say	O
they	O
've	O
seen	O
a	O
sharp	O
rise	O
in	O
wildlife	O
with	O
rabies	B-Virus
.	O

The	O
potentially	O
deadly	O
virus	O
can	O
infect	O
any	O
animal	O
and	O
is	O
most	O
commonly	O
transmitted	O
through	O
bites	O
.	O

Most	O
of	O
the	O
county	O
's	O
15	O
cases	O
so	O
far	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
have	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
skunks	O
and	O
foxes	O
.	O

The	O
average	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
has	O
increased	O
from	O
a	O
handful	O
annually	O
between	O
2011	O
and	O
2015	O
to	O
around	O
40	O
per	O
year	O
since	O
2016	O
.	O

County	O
health	O
officials	O
say	O
people	O
should	O
vaccinate	O
their	O
pets	O
and	O
domesticated	O
animals	O
to	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
infection	O
and	O
report	O
any	O
strange	O
animal	O
behavior	O
.	O

They	O
say	O
pet	O
food	O
also	O
should	O
be	O
kept	O
indoors	O
to	O
avoid	O
attracting	O
other	O
animals	O
.	O

Santa	O
Cruz	O
and	O
Pima	O
counties	O
have	O
also	O
confirmed	O
several	O
rabies	B-Virus
cases	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
[	O
infection	O
with	O
]	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Burkholderia	O
cepacia_	O
,	O
at	O
Hospital	O
Dr	O
Luis	O
Felipe	O
Guevara	O
Rojas	O
in	O
El	O
Tigre	O
,	O
Anzoátegui	B-Province
State	O
,	O
Venezuela	B-Country
has	O
sickened	O
22	O
infants	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
College	O
of	O
Physicians	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
(	O
computer	O
translated	O
)	O
.	O

Pediatric	O
infectious	O
disease	O
physician	O
,	O
Irimar	O
Del	O
Moral	O
,	O
suggests	O
the	O
outbreak	O
is	O
linked	O
to	O
water	O
shortages	O
,	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
going	O
on	O
for	O
6	O
months	O
.	O

``	O

have	O
worsened	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
30	O
days	O
.	O

The	O

is	O
then	O
stored	O
and	O
is	O
likely	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
''	O
,	O

.	O

To	O
make	O

,	O

Moral	O
says	O
shortages	O
of	O
antibiotics	O
are	O
a	O
major	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
problem	O
as	O
no	O
antibiotics	O
have	O
been	O
available	O
for	O
2	O
days	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
reports	O
of	O
another	O
hospital-acquired	O
infection	O
popping	O
up	O
at	O
the	O
hospital	O

A	O
dog	O
that	O
went	O
swimming	O
in	O
a	O
New	B-Province
Brunswick	I-Province
river	O
notorious	O
for	O
toxic	B-Disease
algae	I-Disease
has	O
died	O
,	O
and	O
animal	O

experts	O
are	O
warning	O
pet	O
owners	O
of	O
the	O
risk	O
.	O

The	O

was	O

in	O
the	O
St	O
John	O
River	O
in	O
Fredericton	B-City
when	O

began	O
to	O

,	O

to	O
a	O

who	O

the	O

.	O

The	O
dog	O
's	O
owners	O
rushed	O
the	O
animal	O
to	O
the	O
vet	O
,	O
but	O
it	O

.	O

Bray	O

in	O

with	O
blue-green	B-Virus
algae	I-Virus
.	O

At	O
least	O
3	O
dogs	O
died	O
last	O
summer	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
in	O
the	O

river	O
from	O
the	O

algae	I-Disease
blooms	O
,	O

.	O

''	O

2	O

of	O
blue-green	B-Virus
algae	I-Virus
.	O

A	O
seasoning	O
mix	O
has	O
been	O
withdrawn	O
from	O
Swedish	O
supermarkets	O
after	O
it	O
was	O

to	O
one	O
of	O
the	O

outbreaks	O
in	O

country	O
in	O

years	O
.	O

people	O

up	O
salmonellosis	B-Disease
at	O
a	O

on	O
the	O

of	O
Oland	B-Province
last	O
week	O

's	O

Authority	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

''	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

A	O
spokesperson	O
for	O
Sweden	B-Country
's	O
Public	O
Health	O
Agency	O
(	O
Folkhalsomyndigheten	O
)	O

it	O

now	O

out	O
tests	O

similar	O
spices	O

said	O
that	O

had	O
submitted	O
more	O
samples	O
to	O
be	O
checked	O
over	O
by	O
experts	O
.	O

But	O
Sevan	O
said	O
it	O
was	O
recalling	O
all	O
Allkrydda	O
products	O
sold	O
since	O
2014	O
,	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
avoid	O
exposing	O
customers	O
to	O
any	O

.	O

It	O
advised	O

who	O
had	O
the	O

at	O
home	O
to	O
return	O

to	O

where	O
they	O
would	O
be	O
granted	O
a	O

,	O
with	O
Sevan	O
footing	O
the	O

.	O

The	O
recalled	O
spice	O
products	O
are	O
:	O
-	O
Sevan	O
Allkrydda	O
900g	O
(	O
serial	O
number	O
7221217881469	O
)	O
-	O
Sevan	O
Allkrydda	O
450g	O
(	O
serial	O
number	O
7331217881452	O
)	O
-	O
Sevan	O
Allkrydda	O
Hink	O
5kg	O
(	O
serial	O
number	O
7331217010708	O
)	O

A	O
jar	O
of	O
home-canned	O
salmon	O
sent	O
an	O
Anchorage	B-City
man	O
to	O
the	O
hospital	O
with	O
a	O
life-threatening	O
illness	O
for	O
a	O
week	O
this	O
summer	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
state	O
epidemiologists	O
.	O

The	O
man	O
ate	O
the	O
salmon	O
on	O
19	O
Aug	O
2019	O
and	O
the	O
next	O
day	O
reported	O
feeling	O
lightheaded	O
.	O

His	O
vision	O
and	O
speech	O
began	O
to	O
blur	O
as	O
his	O
face	O
weakened	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
an	O
epidemiology	O
bulletin	O
.	O

He	O
went	O
to	O
the	O
hospital	O
and	O
was	O
immediately	O
treated	O
for	O
botulism	B-Disease
.	O

The	O
illness	O
is	O
rare	O
but	O
occurs	O
with	O
higher	O
per-capita	O
frequency	O
in	O
Alaska	B-Province
than	O
in	O
the	O
Lower	O
48	O
,	O
said	O
Eric	O
Mooring	O
,	O
a	O
disease	O
detective	O
with	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
.	O

The	O
toxin	O
that	O
causes	O
botulism	B-Disease
can	O
develop	O
in	O
improperly	O
preserved	O
foods	O
,	O
and	O
symptoms	O
appear	O
within	O
18	O
to	O
36	O
hours	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
causes	O
muscle	O
paralysis	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
deadly	O
if	O
left	O
untreated	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
Lower	O
48	O
,	O
the	O
antitoxin	O
cure	O
is	O
kept	O
at	O
CDC	O
quarantine	O
stations	O
in	O
large	O
airports	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
treatment	O
is	O
shipped	O
to	O
the	O
impacted	O
patient	O
.	O

In	O
Alaska	B-Province
,	O
the	O
antitoxin	O
is	O
stored	O
at	O
8	O
hospitals	O
across	O
the	O
state	O
.	O

Mooring	O
said	O
there	O
are	O
about	O
a	O
half-dozen	O
or	O
fewer	O
cases	O
of	O
botulism	B-Disease
in	O
Alaska	B-Province
annually	O
,	O
and	O
there	O
are	O
only	O
a	O
few	O
dozen	O
throughout	O
the	O
entire	O
country	O
.	O

Mooring	O
said	O
the	O
sooner	O
patients	O
receive	O
treatment	O
,	O
the	O
better	O
off	O
they	O
are	O
.	O

The	O
antitoxin	O
stops	O
symptoms	O
from	O
worsening	O
but	O
does	O
n't	O
reverse	O
any	O
damage	O
that	O
has	O
already	O
set	O
in	O
.	O

Although	O
the	O
disease	O
has	O
the	O
potential	O
to	O
be	O
fatal	O
,	O
Mooring	O
said	O
``	O
it	O
's	O
hardly	O
a	O
death	O
sentence	O
,	O
''	O
because	O
only	O
4	O
%	O
of	O
patients	O
with	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
botulism	B-Disease
die	O
.	O

The	O
Anchorage	B-City
man	O
told	O
investigators	O
the	O

The	O

is	O

that	O

through	O

)	O

Syngenta	O

advised	O

of	O

and	O

between	O
season	O

.	O

The	O
Pennsylvania	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
received	O
notice	O
Wednesday	O
from	O
the	O
USDA	O
confirming	O
rabbit	B-Virus
hemorrhagic	I-Virus
disease	I-Virus
(	O
RHD	O
)	O
in	O
2	O
pet	O
rabbits	O
that	O
died	O
on	O
in	O
Clover	B-City
Township	I-City
,	O
Jefferson	O
County	O
.	O

The	O
site	O
is	O
under	O

and	O
is	O
being	O
cleaned	O
and	O

.	O

The	O
disease	O
poses	O
no	O
risk	O
to	O
human	O
health	O
,	O
nor	O
to	O
animals	O
other	O
than	O
rabbits	O
.	O

RHD	O
causes	O
sudden	O
death	O
in	O
rabbits	O
having	O
previously	O
exhibited	O
no	O
signs	O
of	O
disease	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
spreads	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
rabbits	O
,	O
their	O
meat	O
or	O
fur	O
,	O
or	O
materials	O
they	O
have	O
touched	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
has	O
2	O
strains	O
.	O

This	O
strain	O
,	O
RHD1	B-Virus
,	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
Pennsylvania	B-Province
before	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
not	O
known	O
to	O
affect	O
wild	O
rabbits	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
vaccine	O
available	O
in	O
the	O
USA	O
.	O

A	O
strain	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
known	O
to	O
affect	O
wild	O
and	O
domestic	O
rabbits	O
was	O
confirmed	O
in	O
Ohio	O
in	O
September	O
2018	O
.	O

owners	O
who	O

this	O

their	O

.	O

.	O

in	O
Western	B-Province

viruses	O
after	O

.	O

WA	O

[	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

that	O

.	O

``	O

n't	O

.	O

of	O
wound	B-Disease

a	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
flea-borne	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
has	O
hit	O
downtown	O
Los	B-City
Angeles	I-City
[	O
CA	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
county	O
Department	O
of	O
Public	O
Health	O
said	O
Thursday	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
say	O
they	O
are	O
investigating	O
several	O
cases	O
of	O
flea-borne	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
,	O
a	O
disease	O
that	O
infected	O
fleas	O
can	O
spread	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

Although	O
the	O
fleas	O
can	O
come	O
from	O
cats	O
,	O
rats	O
,	O
and	O
opossums	O
,	O
pets	O
and	O
animals	O
do	O
not	O
get	O
sick	O
from	O
typhus	O
.	O

In	O
people	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
typhus	O
can	O
cause	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
and	O
rash	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
not	O
transmitted	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
treated	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
.	O

``	O
Although	O
typhus	O
normally	O
occurs	O
throughout	O
LA	O
County	O
,	O
we	O
are	O
observing	O
several	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
downtown	O
Los	B-City
Angeles	I-City
area	O
,	O
''	O
Los	O
Angeles	O
County	O
Health	O
Officer	O
Muntu	O
Davis	O
said	O
in	O
a	O
statement	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
encourage	O
pet	O
owners	O
to	O
practice	O
safe	O
flea	O
control	O
and	O
encourage	O
all	O
cities	O
in	O
the	O
county	O
to	O
ensure	O
maintenance	O
of	O
their	O
trash	O
clean-up	O
and	O
rodent	O
control	O
activities	O
.	O
''	O

Typhus	O
can	O
spread	O
in	O
areas	O
where	O
there	O
is	O
an	O
accumulation	O
of	O
trash	O
that	O
attracts	O
wild	O
animals	O
like	O
feral	O
cats	O
,	O
rats	O
,	O
and	O
opossums	O
.	O

To	O
help	O
prevent	O
typhus	O
,	O
the	O
department	O
recommended	O
that	O
residents	O
:	O
-	O
Practice	O
safe	O
flea	O
control	O
.	O

-	O
Use	O
flea	O
control	O
products	O
on	O
pets	O
.	O

-	O
When	O
outside	O
,	O
wear	O
pants	O
tucked	O
into	O
socks	O
or	O
boots	O
when	O
outside	O
.	O

Spray	O
insect	O
repellent	O
with	O
DEET	O
on	O
socks	O
and	O
pant	O
cuffs	O
.	O

-	O
Avoid	O
being	O
near	O
wild	O
or	O
stray	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Never	O
feed	O
or	O
touch	O
wild	O
animals	O
,	O
especially	O
opossums	O
,	O
rats	O
,	O
and	O
stray	O
or	O
feral	O
cats	O
.	O

-	O
Store	O
trash	O
in	O
cans	O
with	O
secure	O
lids	O
to	O
avoid	O
attracting	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Clear	O
areas	O
where	O
rats	O
and	O
stray	O
animals	O
sleep	O
,	O
hide	O
or	O
find	O
food	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
crawl	O
spaces	O
,	O
attics	O
,	O
or	O
under	O
decks	O
,	O
and	O
wear	O
gloves	O
and	O
a	O
mask	O
when	O
clearing	O
these	O
areas	O
.	O

After	O
27	O
years	O
with	O
no	O
detected	O
cases	O
,	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
occurred	O
in	O
a	O
beef	O
cattle	O
herd	O
in	O
the	O
south	O
of	O
Sweden	B-Country
.	O

The	O
outbreak	O
was	O
unusual	O
as	O
it	O
occurred	O
in	O
winter	O
,	O
in	O
animals	O
not	O
exposed	O
to	O
meat-and-bone	O
meal	O
,	O
in	O
a	O
non-endemic	O
country	O
.	O

The	O
affected	O
herd	O
consisted	O
of	O
90	O
animals	O
,	O
including	O
calves	O
and	O
young	O
stock	O
.	O

The	O
animals	O
were	O
kept	O
in	O
a	O
barn	O
on	O
deep	O
straw	O
bedding	O
and	O
fed	O
only	O
roughage	O
.	O

7	O
animals	O
died	O
during	O
10	O
days	O
,	O
with	O
no	O
typical	O
previous	O
clinical	O
signs	O
except	O
fever	O
.	O

The	O
carcasses	O
were	O
reportedly	O
normal	O
in	O
appearance	O
,	O
particularly	O
as	O
regards	O
rigor	O
mortis	O
,	O
bleeding	O
,	O
and	O
coagulation	O
of	O
the	O
blood	O
.	O

Subsequently	O
,	O
3	O
more	O
animals	O
died	O
and	O
anthrax	B-Disease
was	O
suspected	O
at	O
necropsy	O
and	O
confirmed	O
by	O
culture	O
and	O
PCR	O
on	O
blood	O
samples	O
.	O

The	O
isolated	O
strain	O
was	O
susceptible	O
to	O
tetracycline	O
,	O
ciprofloxacin	O
,	O
and	O
ampicillin	O
.	O

Subtyping	O
by	O
MLVA	O
showed	O
the	O
strain	O
to	O
cluster	O
with	O
isolates	O
in	O
the	O
A	O
lineage	O
of	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
.	O

Environmental	O
samples	O
from	O
the	O
holding	O
were	O
all	O
negative	O
except	O
for	O
2	O
soil	O
samples	O
taken	O
from	O
a	O
spot	O
where	O
infected	O
carcasses	O
had	O
been	O
kept	O
until	O
they	O
were	O
picked	O
up	O
for	O
transport	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
likely	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
infection	O
was	O
concluded	O
to	O
be	O
contaminated	O
roughage	O
,	O
although	O
this	O
could	O
not	O
be	O
substantiated	O
by	O
laboratory	O
analysis	O
.	O

The	O
suspected	O
feed	O
was	O
mixed	O
with	O
soil	O
and	O
dust	O
and	O
originated	O
from	O
fields	O
where	O
flooding	O
occurred	O
the	O
previous	O
year	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
dry	O
summer	O
with	O
a	O
very	O
low	O
water	O
level	O
in	O
the	O
river	O
allowing	O
for	O
the	O
harvesting	O
on	O
soil	O
usually	O
not	O
exposed	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
early	O
1900s	O
,	O
animal	O
carcasses	O
are	O
said	O
to	O
have	O
been	O
dumped	O
in	O
this	O
river	O
during	O
anthrax	B-Disease
outbreaks	O
and	O
it	O
is	O
most	O
likely	O
that	O
some	O
anthrax	O
spores	O
could	O
remain	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

The	O
case	O
indicates	O
that	O
atypical	O
cases	O
in	O
non-endemic	O
areas	O
may	O
be	O
missed	O
to	O
a	O
larger	O
extent	O
than	O
previously	O
thought	O
.	O

Field	O
tests	O
allowing	O
a	O
preliminary	O
risk	O
assessment	O
of	O
animal	O
carcasses	O
would	O
be	O
helpful	O
for	O
increased	O
sensitivity	O
of	O
detection	O
and	O
prevention	O
of	O
further	O
exposure	O
to	O
the	O
causative	O
agent	O
.	O

Maitland	B-City
City	O
Council	O
has	O
been	O
made	O
aware	O
of	O
a	O
suspected	O
case	O
of	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
at	O
Maitland	O
Pool	O
,	O
New	B-Province
South	I-Province
Wales	I-Province
Australia	B-Country
(	O
Hunter	O
Valley	O
)	O
.	O

Council	O
is	O
urging	O
anyone	O
with	O
symptoms	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
to	O
see	O
a	O
doctor	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
possible	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
an	O
onset	O
of	O
slight	O
fever	O
,	O
runny	O
nose	O
,	O
and	O
feeling	O
generally	O
unwell	O
;	O
and	O
an	O
itchy	O
skin	O
rash	O
which	O
usually	O
appears	O
as	O
small	O
lumps	O
,	O
turns	O
into	O
blisters	O
and	O
then	O
scabs	O
over	O
a	O
3	O
--	O
4	O
day	O
period	O
.	O

An	O
individual	O
with	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
is	O
contagious	O
from	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
the	O
illness	O
-	O
up	O
to	O
2	O
days	O
before	O
the	O
spots	O
appear	O
-	O
until	O
about	O
5	O
days	O
after	O
the	O
1st	O
spots	O
appear	O
.	O

Early	O
in	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
the	O
virus	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
coughing	O
and	O
sneezing	O
.	O

Later	O
in	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
the	O
virus	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
fluid	O
in	O
the	O
blisters	O
.	O

People	O
with	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
should	O
avoid	O
others	O
until	O
at	O
least	O
5	O
days	O
after	O
onset	O
of	O
the	O
rash	O
and	O
up	O
until	O
all	O
the	O
blisters	O
have	O
dried	O
.	O

They	O
should	O
cover	O
their	O
nose	O
and	O
mouth	O
when	O
coughing	O
or	O
sneezing	O
,	O
dispose	O
of	O
soiled	O
tissues	O
,	O
wash	O
their	O
hands	O
well	O
and	O
not	O
share	O
eating	O
utensils	O
,	O
food	O
or	O
drinking	O
cups	O
.	O

People	O
who	O
have	O
a	O
past	O
history	O
of	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
and	O
are	O
vaccinated	O
against	O
the	O
virus	O
are	O
less	O
likely	O
to	O
contract	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Anyone	O
who	O
has	O
not	O
had	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
or	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
can	O
get	O
chickenpox	O
.	O

In	O
particular	O
,	O
pregnant	O
women	O
,	O
newborn	O
babies	O
and	O
people	O
with	O
a	O
weakened	O
immune	O
system	O
should	O
avoid	O
anyone	O
with	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
and	O
should	O
see	O
their	O
doctor	O
immediately	O
if	O
they	O
have	O
been	O
around	O
someone	O
with	O
this	O
virus	O
.	O

A	O
person	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
chickenpox	B-Disease
should	O
rest	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
possible	O
and	O
avoid	O
contact	O
with	O
other	O
until	O
no	O
longer	O
infected	O
.	O

For	O
more	O
information	O
,	O
contact	O
your	O
doctor	O
,	O
or	O
visit	O
the	O
NSW	O
Health	O
website	O
.	O

are	O
closed	O
at	O
Plast	O
Camp	O
in	O
Geauga	B-City
County	I-City
as	O

health	O

why	O

.	O

.	O

coli_	O

coli_	O

.	O

)	O

.	O

``	O

''	O
cases	O

(	O

by	O

)	O

.	O

_Plasmodium	O
vivax_	O
malaria	B-Disease
,	O
a	O
less	O

of	O
the	O
infection	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
occurrence	O
of	O
malaria	B-Disease
in	O
the	O
Vizhinjam	B-City
coast	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2015	O
]	O
.	O

More	O
health	O
workers	O
have	O
been	O
deployed	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

The	O
vector	O
density	O
of	O
_Anopheles	O
mosquitoes_	O
in	O
the	O
locality	O
is	O
high	O
.	O

Elimination	O
of	O
adult	O
mosquitoes	O
and	O
active	O
fever	O
surveillance	O
in	O
the	O
field	O
are	O
the	O
main	O
strategies	O
being	O
adopted	O
by	O
health	O
workers	O
.	O

Spraying	O
of	O
larvicides	O
in	O
wells	O
and	O
idling	O
boats	O
(	O
which	O
have	O
stagnant	O
water	O
pools	O
and	O
are	O
major	O
breeding	O
sites	O
for	O
mosquitoes	O
)	O
are	O
also	O
on	O
.	O

Mukkola	O
panchayat	O
in	O
Vizhinjam	B-City
has	O
always	O
been	O
vulnerable	O
to	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

had	O

to	O

.	O

``	O

.	O

.	O

A	O
virus	O
outbreak	O
has	O
killed	O
60	O
000	O
juvenile	O
steelhead	O
fish	O
at	O
Robertson	O
Creek	O
Hatchery	O
and	O
prompted	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
Canadian	O
Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
.	O

Fisheries	O
and	O
Oceans	O
Canada	B-Country
has	O
confirmed	O
that	O
there	O
was	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
infectious	B-Virus
hematopoietic	I-Virus
necrosis	I-Virus
(	O
IHN	O
)	O
virus	O
at	O
the	O
Robertson	O
Creek	O
Hatchery	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
was	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
January	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
after	O
extensive	O
laboratory	O
testing	O
,	O
said	O
Fisheries	O
and	O
Oceans	O
Canada	B-Country
(	O
DFO	O
)	O

Carrie	O
Mishima	O
,	O
who	O
only	O

to	O

from	O
the	O
News	O
by	O
e-mail	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
has	O
infected	O
more	O
than	O
60	O
000	O
juvenile	O
steelhead	O
at	O
the	O
hatchery	O
,	O
which	O
have	O
since	O
been	O
destroyed	O
,	O
officials	O
said	O
.	O

of	O

after	O

higher	O
than	O
normal	O

in	O
juvenile	O
steelhead	O
.	O

Staff	O
noticed	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
and	O
initiated	O
lab	O
tests	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
fisheries	O
department	O
,	O
IHN	O
is	O
a	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
pathogen	O
in	O
wild	O
fish	O
throughout	O
the	O
Pacific	O
West	O
Coast	O
from	O
Alaska	O
to	O
California	O
.	O

IHN	O
poses	O
no	O
risk	O
to	O
humans	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
spread	O
quickly	O
and	O
has	O
a	O
100	O
per	O
cent	O
mortality	O
rate	O
if	O
a	O
fish	O
population	O
becomes	O
infected	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
known	O
to	O
exist	O
in	O
Great	O
Central	O
Lake	O
where	O
the	O
hatchery	O
draws	O
its	O
water	O
supplies	O
.	O

Lab	O
tests	O
identified	O
the	O
virus	O
as	O
the	O
endemic	O
,	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
strain	O
that	O
is	O
commonly	O
found	O
in	O
Pacific	O
sockeye	O
.	O

The	O

Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
[	O
CFIA	O
]	O
was	O
called	O
because	O
IHN	O
is	O
a	O

.	O

Staff	O

of	O

has	O
met	O
their	O

.	O

of	O
Agriculture	O
and	O
Livestock	O
called	O
for	O

in	O

``	O
tar	B-Disease

''	O

[	O

.	O

nov.	O
)	O

Western	B-Province

.	O

South	O
Australian	O
farmers	O
affected	O
by	O
beet	B-Virus
western	I-Virus
yellows	I-Virus
say	O

.	O

7000	O

state	O
could	O

Australia	B-Country
.	O

.	O

News	O
of	O

virus	O
is	O

.	O

Australia	B-Country
is	O

canola	O
,	O

South	B-Province
Australia	I-Province
a	O

to	O
Europe	O
.	O

A	O
Dundee	B-City
[	O
Scotland	B-Province
]	O
primary	O
school	O
has	O
been	O
hit	O
by	O
an	O

of	O
scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
.	O

One	O
parent	O
of	O
children	O
at	O
Downfield	O
Primary	O
School	O
claimed	O
that	O
at	O
least	O
20	O

.	O

today	O

to	O

infected	O
,	O

to	O

.	O

Scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
is	O

for	O
the	O

it	O

.	O

.	O

''	O

.	O

''	O

has	O
been	O
filed	O
despite	O
the	O
lack	O
of	O

.	O

We	O

a	O
phase	O
of	O
observation	O
.	O

In	O

,	O
there	O
is	O
minimal	O
risk	O
to	O
humans	O
since	O
infected	O
animals	O
are	O

for	O

and	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
not	O

.	O

``	O

virus	O
is	O

not	O

actually	O
moves	O
from	O
one	O
individual	O

,	O

.	O

a	O

,	O
''	O

Ceppi	O
,	O
cantonal	O

,	O
Jura	B-Province
.	O

Schmallenberg	O
is	O

of	O
the	O
German	O
city	O

.	O

A	O

[	O
O.C	O
.	O

]	O

typhus	I-Disease
during	O
the	O
past	O
3	O
months	O
,	O
the	O
county	O
's	O
Health	O
Care	O
Agency	O
[	O
HCA	O
]	O
reported	O
Wednesday	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
and	O
a	O
rash	O
on	O
the	O
chest	O
,	O
back	O
,	O
arms	O
or	O
legs	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
treatable	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
if	O
left	O
untreated	O
,	O
says	O
Michael	O
Hearst	O
,	O
district	O
manager	O
for	O
the	O
county	O
's	O
Vector	O
Control	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
endemic	O
typhus	O
,	O
is	O
n't	O
passed	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
.	O

Instead	O
,	O
it's	O
transmitted	O
by	O
the	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
.	O

In	O
most	O
of	O
the	O
O.C	O
.	O

cases	O
the	O
past	O
few	O
years	O
,	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
by	O
a	O
family	O
cat	O
,	O
although	O
other	O
animals	O
can	O
carry	O
the	O
fleas	O
,	O
including	O
rats	O
,	O
opossums	O
and	O
raccoons	O
.	O

``	O
Everybody	O
we	O
talked	O
to	O
had	O
adopted	O
a	O
feral	O
cat	O
,	O
or	O
had	O
a	O
cat	O
that	O
was	O
in	O
and	O
out	O
a	O
lot	O
,	O
''	O

said	O
.	O

``	O

,	O

no	O

of	O

in	O

.	O

one	O

in	O

6	O
in	O

in	O

and	O

.	O

.	O

of	O
the	O
county	O
.	O

What	O
can	O
people	O
do	O
to	O
protect	O
themselves	O
from	O
flea-borne	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
?	O

Here	O
are	O
some	O
tips	O
offered	O
by	O
HCA	O
:	O
-	O
Treat	O
pets	O
regularly	O
with	O
flea-prevention	O
medications	O
.	O

-	O
Avoid	O
contact	O
with	O
rodents	O
,	O
opossums	O
,	O
feral	O
cats	O
or	O
other	O
animals	O
that	O
may	O
have	O
fleas	O
.	O

-	O
Close	O
openings	O
to	O
attics	O
and	O
crawl	O
spaces	O
in	O
your	O
home	O
,	O
and	O
keep	O
vents	O
and	O
screens	O
in	O
good	O
repair	O
to	O
prevent	O
animals	O
from	O
getting	O
in	O
.	O

-	O
Report	O
dead	O
animals	O
to	O
your	O
local	O
Animal	O
Control	O
agency	O
.	O

OC	O
Animal	O
Care	O
covers	O
17	O
O.C	O
.	O

cities	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O

areas	O
.	O

,	O
-	O

or	O

or	O

may	O
hide	O

.	O

and	O

.	O

A	O

,	O
Westernaires	O
,	O

about	O
230	O

outbreak	O
that	O

.	O

Over	O
80	O
of	O
the	O

in	O
their	O
care	O
have	O
contracted	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Westernaires	O
is	O
a	O
``	O
mounted	O
precision	O
drill	O
organization	O
composed	O
of	O
Jefferson	B-City
County	O
,	O
Colorado	B-Province
,	O
youngsters	O
from	O
9	O
to	O
19	O
years	O
of	O
age	O
''	O
.	O

They	O
were	O
founded	O
in	O
1949	O
and	O
have	O
been	O
serving	O
the	O
greater	O
Denver	O
area	O
since	O
then	O
.	O

``	O
Strangles	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
highly	O
contagious	O
equine	O
disease	O
that	O
's	O
like	O
strep	O
throat	O
,	O
''	O
Westernaires	O
director	O
Glen	O
Keller	O
told	O
reporters	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
's	O
common	O
among	O
horses	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
's	O
not	O
contagious	O
to	O
people	O
or	O
other	O
animals	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
very	O
contagious	O
among	O
horses	O
and	O
they	O
get	O
it	O
by	O
contact	O
,	O
either	O
by	O
touching	O
each	O
other	O
or	O
drinking	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
same	O
water	O
.	O
''	O

Horses	O
that	O
have	O
recovered	O
from	O
strangles	B-Disease
are	O
contagious	O
for	O
up	O
to	O
6	O
weeks	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
organization	O
is	O
looking	O
at	O
a	O
long	O
and	O
costly	O
quarantine	O
and	O
rehabilitation	O
process	O
.	O

A	O
voluntary	O
quarantine	O
has	O
been	O
put	O
in	O
place	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
entire	O
herd	O
from	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
loss	O
of	O
rental	O
and	O
lesson	O
fees	O
have	O
led	O
to	O
an	O

loss	O
of	O
USD	O

per	O

for	O
the	O

.	O

most	O
recent	O
available	O
990	O
,	O
2016	O
,	O
shows	O
a	O

of	O
just	O
over	O
USD	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

St.	O
Joseph	O
County	O
Health	O
Officer	O
Dr.	O
Thomas	O
A.	O
Felgerhas	O
announced	O
that	O
laboratory	O
tests	O
have	O
confirmed	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
as	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
gastrointestinal	O
outbreak	O
that	O
affected	O
106	O
students	O
attending	O
a	O
sport	O
camp	O
at	O
the	O
University	O
of	O
Notre	O
Dame	O
earlier	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

29	O
of	O
those	O
students	O
were	O
treated	O
and	O
released	O
from	O
local	O
emergency	O
departments	O
for	O
the	O
intestinal	O
illness	O
.	O

Norovirus	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
very	O
contagious	O
virus	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
common	O
``	O
stomach	O
bug	O
''	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
.	O

Norovirus	B-Virus
can	O
be	O
spread	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
,	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
,	O
or	O
by	O
touching	O
contaminated	O
surfaces	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
usually	O
occur	O
12-48	O
hours	O
after	O
exposure	O
,	O
and	O
include	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
stomach	O
pain	O
,	O
nausea	O
,	O
and	O
vomiting	O
.	O

Most	O
people	O
recover	O
in	O
1-3	O
days	O
,	O
but	O
remain	O
contagious	O
for	O
up	O
to	O
2	O
weeks	O
after	O
recovery	O
.	O

Hand	O
washing	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
effective	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
.	O

Wash	O
hands	O
with	O
warm	O
water	O
and	O
soap	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
20	O
seconds	O
,	O
and	O
be	O
sure	O
to	O
wash	O
hands	O
after	O
using	O
the	O
bathroom	O
,	O
after	O
changing	O
a	O
diaper	O
,	O
after	O
taking	O
care	O
of	O
someone	O
else	O
who	O
is	O
sick	O
,	O
and	O
before	O
eating	O
or	O
preparing/handling	O
food	O
.	O

After	O
throwing	O
up	O
or	O
having	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
immediately	O
clean	O
and	O
disinfect	O
contaminated	O
surface	O
using	O
a	O
chlorine	O
bleach	O
solution	O
with	O
a	O
concentration	O
of	O
1000-5000	O
ppm	O
(	O
5-25	O
tablespoons	O
of	O
household	O
bleach	O
per	O
gallon	O
of	O
water	O
)	O
or	O
other	O
disinfectant	O
registered	O
as	O
effective	O
against	O
Norovirus	B-Virus
by	O
the	O
Environmental	O
Protection	O
Agency	O
(	O
EPA	O
)	O
.	O

Those	O
who	O
are	O
ill	O
should	O
stay	O
home	O
,	O
preferably	O
at	O
least	O
3	O
days	O
after	O
symptoms	O
resolve	O
.	O

The	O
St.	O
Joseph	O
County	O
Health	O
Department	O
will	O
continue	O
to	O
work	O
with	O
the	O
University	O
of	O
Notre	O
Dame	O
and	O
the	O
Indiana	B-Province
State	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
to	O
gather	O
and	O

information	O
.	O

Norovirus	B-Virus
can	O

on	O
the	O

for	O
Disease	O

.	O

A	O

``	O

.	O

in	O
the	O
head	O
.	O

``	O

is	O
needed	O
for	O
an	O

lab	O
test	O
,	O

an	O
animal	O
in	O
the	O
head	O
can	O

and	O

results	O
,	O
''	O

Amanda	O

.	O

When	O

is	O
incomplete	O
or	O
inconclusive	O
,	O
the	O
specimen	O
is	O
treated	O
as	O
if	O
rabid	O
,	O
leading	O
to	O
potentially	O

courses	O
of	O
action	O

as	O
human	O

and	O
animal	O

.	O

Experts	O
say	O
rabies	B-Virus
is	O
always	O
present	O
in	O
the	O
wildlife	O
population	O
throughout	O
Humboldt	O
County	O
,	O
especially	O
among	O
skunks	O
,	O
bats	O
and	O

.	O

Preventive	O
measures	O
include	O

contact	O
with	O
wild	O
and	O
stray	O
animals	O
,	O

pet	O
foods	O
indoors	O
at	O

,	O

animal	O

to	O

or	O

animal	O
control	O
officer	O
,	O
and	O
if	O

are	O

the	O

immediately	O
with	O

and	O

and	O

medical	O
attention	O
.	O

fully	O

against	O
rabies	B-Virus
,	O

,	O

and	O
select	O

.	O

A	O

in	O

that	O

A	O

of	O
viruses	O
as	O

as	O

and	O

,	O

is	O

in	O
districts	O
of	O

.	O

]	O

,	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

As	O
of	O

``	O

risks	O
manifold	O
.	O

have	O

the	O
problem	O
[	O

]	O

[	O
that	O
]	O
spread	O

.	O

.	O

virus	O
invasions	O
make	O
[	O
it	O
]	O
more	O

to	O
get	O

.	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
(	O
MOH	O
)	O
has	O
identified	O
the	O
disease	O
that	O
has	O
been	O
claiming	O
the	O
lives	O
of	O
people	O
in	O
Manafwa	B-Province
district	I-Province
as	O
blackwater	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
,	O
a	O
severe	O
complication	O
of	O
malaria	O
in	O
which	O
red	O
blood	O
cells	O
burst	O
in	O
the	O
bloodstream	O
,	O
releasing	O
haemoglobin	O
directly	O
into	O
the	O
blood	O
vessels	O
and	O
the	O
urine	O
and	O
leading	O
to	O
kidney	O
failure	O
.	O

In	O
May	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
,	O
14	O
people	O
died	O
under	O
unclear	O
circumstances	O
in	O

district	I-Province
.	O

were	O
passing	O
urine	O
laced	O
with	O
blood	O
.	O

Last	O
month	O
[	O

2018	O
]	O
,	O

directed	O

to	O

,	O

that	O

in	O
the	O
country	O
's	O

system	O
,	O
adding	O
that	O
the	O
recent	O

has	O
shown	O
an	O
increase	O
in	O
the	O

of	O

.	O

``	O

,	O

an	O

,	O
''	O
he	O

.	O

``	O

2017	O
we	O
recorded	O
9	O
deaths	O
,	O
but	O
we	O
have	O
almost	O
doubled	O
that	O
figure	O
this	O
month	O
.	O
''	O

Records	O
from	O
the	O
MOH	O
show	O
that	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
which	O
first	O
manifested	O
itself	O
in	O
2003	O
,	O
has	O
affected	O
500	O
people	O
and	O
claimed	O
32	O

.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
common	O
in	O
Bukomero	O
Subcounty	O
,	O
Kiboga	O
district	O
.	O

The	O
cause	O
of	O

disease	O
is	O

,	O
but	O

is	O
suspected	O
to	O

reaction	O

malaria	B-Virus
parasite	I-Virus
and	O
malaria	O
medication	O
such	O
as	O
quinine	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
Dr	O
Olar	O
,	O
investigations	O
are	O
ongoing	O
to	O
establish	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
blackwater	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
.	O

The	O

of	O
the	O
disease	O
include	O
a	O
rapid	O
pulse	O
,	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O

passage	O
of	O

that	O
is	O

.	O

On	O

,	O

[	O
Colorado	B-Province
]	O
.	O

The	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

and	O

.	O

.	O

This	O
is	O
one	O
of	O
a	O
few	O
instances	O
of	O
the	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
domestic	O
and	O
wild	O
animals	O
so	O
far	O
this	O
summer	O
[	O
2021	O
]	O
across	O
the	O
state	O
of	O
Colorado	B-Province
though	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
no	O
human	O
cases	O
to	O
date	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
has	O
been	O
present	O
in	O
Colorado	B-Province
since	O
at	O
least	O
the	O
1940s	O
and	O
is	O
most	O
frequently	O
discovered	O
amongst	O
rodents	O
in	O
the	O
summer	O
months	O
.	O

Domestic	O
animals	O
can	O
be	O
infected	O
with	O
the	O
plague	B-Disease
when	O
the	O
infection	O
spills	O
over	O
from	O
rodent	O
populations	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
by	O
infected	O
animal	O
tissue	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
an	O
animal	O
carcass	O
,	O
fluid	O
,	O
or	O
respiratory	O
droplets	O
spread	O
through	O
coughing	O
or	O
sneezing	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
most	O
often	O
spread	O
to	O
people	O
through	O
a	O
bite	O
from	O
an	O
infected	O
flea	O
.	O

While	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
human	O
vaccine	O
for	O
plague	B-Disease
,	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
treated	O
successfully	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
when	O
caught	O
early	O
.	O

The	O
infection	O
occurred	O
in	O
San	O
Bernardo	O
at	O
9400	O
feet	O
[	O
2865	O
m	O
]	O
of	O
elevation	O
.	O

San	B-City
Miguel	I-City
County	O
Public	O
Health	O
is	O
currently	O
working	O
with	O
regional	O
campgrounds	O
to	O
watch	O
for	O
dead	O
rodents	O
,	O
fleas	O
,	O
and	O
other	O
possible	O
signs	O
of	O
disease	O
prevalence	O
.	O

``	O

the	O

,	O

and	O
your	O
pets	O

,	O
''	O

``	O

,	O

,	O
or	O

.	O

plague	B-Disease
is	O

.	O
''	O

The	O

of	O
the	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O

of	O
breath	O
;	O

in	O
the	O

or	O
muscles	O
;	O
-	O
fever	O
;	O
-	O
chills	O
;	O
-	O
fatigue	O
If	O
you	O
or	O
someone	O
you	O
know	O
has	O
been	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O

infected	O

A	O
cat	O
in	O
Pueblo	B-City
West	I-City
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
tularemia	B-Disease
,	O
a	O

that	O
can	O

on	O
to	O

.	O

said	O

and	O

with	O

.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
serious	O
illness	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bacteria	O
found	O
in	O
animals	O
,	O
especially	O
rodents	O
,	O
rabbits	O
,	O
and	O
prairie	O
dogs	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
said	O
the	O
illness	O
can	O
be	O
passed	O
on	O
to	O
humans	O
in	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
ways	O
including	O
:	O
being	O
bitten	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
tick	O
,	O
deerfly	O
,	O
or	O
other	O
insect	O
;	O
handling	O
infected	O
animal	O
carcasses	O
;	O
eating	O
or	O
drinking	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
;	O
breathing	O
in	O
the	O
bacteria	O
.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
treated	O
with	O
the	O
right	O
antibiotics	O
.	O

Health	O

or	O

to	O

their	O

.	O

in	O

[	O

,	O

]	O

[	I-Disease

]	I-Disease

in	O
Inukjuak	B-City
[	O

.	O

.	O

Dr	O

.	O

came	O
back	O

.	O

had	O

even	O
before	O
walrus	O
was	O

and	O

in	O

.	O

``	O

to	O

in	O
such	O

as	O
much	O

can	O

[	O

]	O

cases	O

,	O

,	O
have	O

.	O

Medecins	O
Sans	O
Frontieres/Doctors	O
Without	O

(	O

)	O

are	O
currently	O

this	O
crisis	O
in	O
the	O

Aweil	B-City
.	O

Interview	O
with	O
Dr	O
Andre	O
Munger	O
:	O
What	O
is	O
the	O
scale	O
of	O
this	O
crisis	O
?	O

Between	O

and	O
August	O
2012	O
MSF	O
teams	O
have	O
admitted	O
more	O
than	O
1000	O
children	O

from	O
malaria	B-Disease

The	O
death	O
toll	O
due	O
to	O
Japanese	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
has	O
reached	O
38	O
in	O
Odisha	B-Province
's	O
Malkangiri	B-City
district	O
while	O
the	O
disease	O
continues	O
to	O
spread	O

to	O
other	O

.	O

An	O
11-year-old	O
boy	O
of	O
Bengama	O
village	O
in	O
Brahmagiri	B-City
area	O
of	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
,	O
sometimes	O
called	O
hare	O
plague	O
,	O
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
that	O
every	O
few	O
years	O
causes	O
local	O
outbreaks	O
among	O
rabbits	O
and	O
rodents	O
,	O
particularly	O
in	O
lemmings	O
.	O

Humans	O
can	O
become	O
infected	O
through	O
direct	O
or	O
indirect	O
contact	O
with	O
sick	O
,	O
dead	O
,	O
or	O
disease-carrying	O
animals	O
.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
through	O
contaminated	O
drinking	O
water	O
when	O
animal	O
tissue	O
has	O
contaminated	O
the	O
water	O
source	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
can	O
also	O
spread	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
such	O
animals	O
and	O
by	O
inhalation	O
of	O
dust	O
with	O
infected	O
feces	O
or	O
urine	O
.	O

,	O

,	O

2011	O

.	O

Meanwhile	O
,	O
we	O

for	O

in	O
more	O
than	O

(	O

.	O

mansoni_	O
)	O
.	O

Three	O
out	O
of	O
4	O
members	O
of	O
a	O

family	O
showed	O
high	O

with	O
all	O

.	O

In	O
an	O

boy	O
vital	O
_S	O
.	O

haematobium_	O
eggs	O
were	O
found	O
in	O
urine	O
specimens	O
(	O
5-10/ml	O
)	O
processed	O
by	O
sedimentation	O
and	O
filtration	O
techniques	O
.	O

The	O
patient	O
showed	O
moderate	O
blood	O
eosinophila	O
(	O
490/microliter	O
)	O
and	O

but	O
no	O

of	O

.	O

Repeated	O

investigations	O
were	O
negative	O
in	O
the	O
other	O
family	O
members	O
.	O

All	O
family	O
members	O
received	O
a	O
one-day	O

with	O
praziquantel	O
which	O
was	O
repeated	O
after	O
4	O
to	O
6	O
weeks	O
.	O

Exposure	O
of	O
this	O
family	O
was	O
limited	O
to	O
several	O
occasions	O
of	O
swimming	O
in	O
the	O
Cavu	O
river	O
during	O
August	O
2013	O
.	O

This	O
report	O
shows	O
that	O
significant	O
infection	O
with	O
_S	O
.	O

haematobium_	O
may	O
be	O
acquired	O
even	O
with	O
very	O
limited	O
exposure	O
and	O
that	O
exposure	O
risk	O
still	O
existed	O
in	O
the	O
summer	O
of	O
2013	O
.	O

In	O
northern	O
India	B-Country
in	O
recent	O
years	O
,	O
rice	B-Disease
root	I-Disease
knot	I-Disease
has	O
emerged	O
as	O
a	O
major	O
problem	O
in	O
flooded	O
and	O
irrigated	O
rice	O
.	O

Farmers	O
are	O
not	O
able	O
to	O
recognize	O
this	O
disease	O
because	O
specific	O
symptoms	O
on	O
roots	O
remain	O
hidden	O
in	O
the	O
soil	O
.	O

As	O
a	O
result	O
,	O
its	O
identity	O
is	O
misjudged	O
,	O
and	O
fertilizer	O
or	O
an	O
inappropriate	O
pesticide	O
are	O
applied	O
,	O
which	O
give	O
no	O
economic	O
return	O
[	O
and	O
cause	O
]	O
environmental	O
contamination	O
.	O

Root-knot	O
of	O
rice	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
nematode	O
(	O
_Meloidogyne	O
graminicola_	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
crop	O
has	O
reduced	O
tillering	O
,	O
and	O
yield	O
is	O
severely	O
affected	O
.	O

Consequently	O
,	O
farmers	O
plough	O
the	O
field	O
and	O
discard	O
the	O
crop	O
.	O

Rice	O
varieties	O
grown	O
in	O
India	B-Country
are	O
generally	O
susceptible	O
and	O
exhibit	O
significant	O
yield	O
loss	O
100	O
percent	O
in	O
heavily	O
infested	O
fields	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
can	O
be	O
controlled	O
by	O
nematicides	O
available	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

The	O
control	O

should	O
be	O
taken	O
in	O
the	O
nursery	O
bed	O
as	O
well	O
as	O

.	O

to	O

plough	O
the	O
nursery	O
beds	O
and	O
remove	O
weeds	O
and	O
crop	O
debris	O
.	O

[	O

or	O
]	O

should	O
be	O
disinfested	O
.	O

Biopesticides	O
as	O
seed	O

,	O
soil	O
treatment	O
in	O
nursery	O
beds	O
,	O
or	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

,	O

,	O
vegetables	O
and	O
cucurbits	O
as	O
per	O

suitability	O
.	O

state	O

on	O

.	O

.	O
''	O

.	O

,	O

``	O

the	O

]	O

The	O
Windsor-Essex	O
County	O
Health	O
Unit	O
says	O
confirmed	O
human	O
cases	O
of	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
reported	O
have	O
jumped	O
.	O

It	O
says	O
they	O
have	O
gone	O
from	O
one	O
in	O
2014	O
,	O
to	O
20	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
.	O

Mosquito	O
pools	O
that	O
tested	O
positive	O
rose	O
from	O
just	O
one	O
in	O
2014	O
to	O
29	O
in	O
2017	O
.	O

This	O
year	O
's	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
(	O
WNV	O
)	O
program	O
is	O
being	O
launched	O
on	O
.	O

The	O
program	O
includes	O
larviciding	O
catch	O
basins	O
,	O
standing	O
water	O
sites	O
,	O
and	O
lagoons	O
to	O
disrupt	O
mosquito	O
breeding	O
.	O

The	O
campaign	O
also	O
educates	O
residents	O
on	O
self-protection	O
,	O
conducts	O
adult	O
mosquito	O
surveillance	O
,	O
and	O
investigates	O
human	O
cases	O
.	O

The	O
health	O
unit	O
urges	O
people	O
to	O
use	O
insect	O
repellents	O
containing	O
DEET	O
,	O
Icaridin	O
,	O
or	O
other	O
approved	O
ingredients	O
on	O
clothing	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
exposed	O
skin	O
,	O
wear	O
long-sleeved	O
shirts	O
,	O
pants	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
hat	O
when	O
outdoors	O
.	O

Light-coloured	O
clothing	O
is	O
best	O
as	O
mosquitoes	O
tend	O
to	O
be	O
attracted	O
to	O
dark	O
colours	O
.	O

The	O
public	O
is	O
also	O
asked	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
that	O
door	O
and	O
window	O
screens	O
fit	O
securely	O
and	O
are	O
free	O
of	O
holes	O
,	O
and	O
remove	O
any	O
hazards	O
that	O
could	O
become	O
a	O
reservoir	O
for	O
standing	O
water	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
old	O
tires	O
,	O
upturned	O
wheelbarrows	O
,	O
animal	O
dishes	O
,	O
and	O
unused	O
flower	O
pots	O
.	O

``	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
serious	O
illness	O
that	O
is	O

through	O

an	O

.	O

,	O

to	O

and	O

that	O
mosquitoes	O
are	O
carrying	O
the	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
,	O
''	O

,	O

.	O

.	O

on	O
.	O

from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
.	O

Rabies	B-Virus
is	O

:	O

went	O
for	O
treatment	O
to	O
the	O
Canete	O
hospital	O
and	O
was	O
immediately	O
referred	O
to	O
the	O
regional	O
hospital	O
,	O
but	O
regretfully	O
,	O
he	O
died	O
,	O
''	O
she	O
added	O
.	O

American	B-Disease
Foulbrood	I-Disease
(	O
AFB	O
)	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
by	O
the	O
Scottish	O
government	O
at	O
one	O
hive	O
in	O
the	O
Stranraer	B-City
area	O
.	O

An	O
infected	O
area	O
has	O
been	O
declared	O
5km	O
(	O
3	O
miles	O
)	O
around	O
the	O
apiary	O
involved	O
,	O
prohibiting	O
the	O
movement	O
of	O
bees	O
or	O
equipment	O
in	O
or	O
out	O
of	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

Foulbrood	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bacterium	O
getting	O
inside	O
bee	O
larvae	O
and	O
using	O
up	O
their	O
food	O
supplies	O
,	O
starving	O
them	O
to	O
death	O
.	O

Hives	O
with	O
AFB	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
treated	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
and	O
have	O
to	O
be	O
destroyed	O
.	O

There	O
were	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
and	O
European	O
Foulbrood	O
(	O
EFB	O
)	O
in	O
Perthshire	O
last	O
year	O
.	O

The	O
Scottish	O
government	O
is	O
currently	O
working	O
on	O
a	O
control	O
strategy	O
for	O
the	O
diseases	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
public	O
health	O
risk	O
from	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

State	O
health	O
officials	O
now	O
say	O
there	O
are	O
13	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
blastomycosis	B-Disease
connected	O
to	O
the	O
Little	B-City
Wolf	I-City
River	I-City
in	O
Waupaca	B-City
County	O
.	O

The	O
Wisconsin	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
Services	O
[	O
DHS	O
]	O
issued	O
a	O
statement	O
on	O
Friday	O
,	O
saying	O
that	O
another	O
13	O
cases	O
are	O
probable	O
.	O

Officials	O
believe	O
exposure	O
happened	O
starting	O
with	O
Memorial	O
Day	O
weekend	O
and	O
continued	O
at	O
least	O
through	O
July	O
[	O
2015	O
]	O
.	O

DHS	O
says	O
they	O
anticipate	O
more	O
cases	O
to	O
be	O
confirmed	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
[	O
CDC	O
]	O
,	O
blastomycosis	B-Disease
lives	O
in	O
soil	O
and	O
decaying	O
organic	O
matter	O
,	O
like	O
leaves	O
and	O
wood	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
soil	O
is	O
disturbed	O
,	O
the	O
fungal	O
spores	O
become	O
airborne	O
.	O

Breathing	O
in	O
those	O
spores	O
can	O
cause	O
people	O
to	O
become	O
ill.	O
Health	O
officials	O
say	O
that	O
if	O
you	O
're	O
experiencing	O
symptoms	O
of	O
blastomycosis	B-Disease
and	O
you	O
visited	O
the	O
Little	B-City
Wolf	I-City
River	I-City
during	O
the	O
estimated	O
exposure	O
time	O
to	O
contact	O
your	O
health	O
provider	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
,	O
and	O
fatigue	O
,	O
which	O
may	O
progress	O
to	O
weight	O
loss	O
,	O
chest	O
pain	O
and	O
a	O
persistent	O
cough	O
.	O

DHS	O
will	O
be	O
updating	O
case	O
numbers	O
weekly	O
on	O
its	O
website	O
.	O

into	O
contact	O
with	O

,	O
which	O
can	O
spread	O
plague	B-Disease
,	O
a	O

by	O

can	O

very	O

.	O

``	O

in	O

''	O

``	O

is	O
to	O

with	O
squirrels	O
and	O
the	O
fleas	O
they	O

.	O

're	O

,	O

up	O

.	O

at	O
Cedar	B-City
Grove	I-City
Campground	I-City
near	O
Palomar	O
Mountain	O
;	O
the	O
3rd	O
was	O

at	O
nearby	O
Doane	O
campground	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
mainly	O
a	O
disease	O
of	O
wild	O
rodents	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O

that	O
feed	O
on	O
the	O
blood	O
of	O
a	O

animal	O
and	O
then	O
bite	O
humans	O
.	O

San	B-City
Diego	I-City
County	O
's	O
environmental	O
health	O
department	O
monitors	O
flea	O
populations	O
at	O
campgrounds	O
and	O
takes	O
measures	O
to	O
control	O
those	O
populations	O
whenever	O
necessary	O
.	O

People	O
who	O
visit	O
or	O
stay	O
in	O
rural	O
mountain	O
areas	O
should	O
look	O
for	O
Plague	B-Disease
Warning	O
signs	O
and	O
always	O
follow	O
these	O
easy	O
precautions	O
to	O
make	O
sure	O
they	O
do	O
n't	O
come	O
into	O
contact	O
with	O
plague-carrying	O
fleas	O
:	O
-	O
Avoid	O
contact	O
with	O
ground	O
squirrels	O
,	O
chipmunks	O
and	O
other	O
wild	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Do	O
not	O
feed	O
,	O
touch	O
or	O
handle	O
wild	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Do	O
not	O
rest	O
,	O
camp	O
or	O
sleep	O
near	O
animal	O
burrows	O
in	O
the	O
ground	O
.	O

-	O
Do	O
not	O
touch	O
sick	O
or	O
dead	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Protect	O
your	O
pets	O
by	O
keeping	O
them	O
on	O
a	O
leash	O
;	O
use	O
flea	O
control	O
,	O
or	O
,	O
best	O
of	O
all	O
,	O
leave	O
pets	O
at	O
home	O
.	O

-	O

your	O

immediately	O
if	O
you	O

sick	O
within	O
a	O
week	O
of	O
visiting	O
an	O
area	O
known	O
to	O
have	O
plague	B-Disease
.	O

(	O

include	O

of	O
fever	O
,	O

and	O
tender	O

.	O

.	O

Hepatitis	B-Virus
E	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
liver	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
hepatitis	O
E	O
virus	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
transmitted	O
from	O
one	O
person	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
mainly	O
through	O
contaminated	O
water	O
.	O

Scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
remains	O
a	O
concern	O
for	O
doctors	O
after	O
a	O
sharp	O
rise	O
across	O
the	O
country	O
during	O
2015	O
--	O
and	O
health	O
officials	O
have	O
warned	O
that	O
we	O
're	O
not	O
at	O
the	O
peak	O
of	O
infections	O
yet	O
.	O

,	O

fever	I-Disease
cases	O
in	O

,	O

during	O
the	O
week	O
ending	O
.	O

Nationally	O
,	O
scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
cases	O
have	O
risen	O
dramatically	O
,	O
up	O
from	O
4643	O
cases	O
in	O
2013	O
to	O
15	O
637	O
in	O
2014	O
and	O
17	O
637	O
in	O
2015	O
.	O

Scarlet	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
was	O
often	O
deadly	O
in	O
the	O
Victorian	O
era	O
but	O
became	O
milder	O
in	O
the	O
late	O

.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
a	O

.	O

of	O

.	O

[	O

[	O

of	O

are	O
relatively	O
low	O

areas	O

year	O

.	O

MVE	O
is	O
a	O
rare	O
disease	O
,	O
but	O
can	O
potentially	O
be	O
fatal	O
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
can	O
include	O
severe	O
headache	O
,	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
drowsiness	O
,	O
tremor	O
,	O
seizures	O
(	O
especially	O
in	O
young	O
children	O
)	O
and	O
in	O
some	O
cases	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
progress	O
to	O
delirium	O
,	O
coma	O
,	O
permanent	O
brain	O
damage	O
or	O
death	O
.	O

People	O
most	O
at	O
risk	O
include	O
campers	O
,	O
infants	O
and	O
young	O
children	O
residing	O
near	O
mosquito-breeding	O
areas	O
.	O

People	O
in	O
remote	O
Top	O
End	O
communities	O
and	O
anyone	O
visiting	O
parks	O
and	O
recreation	O
areas	O
where	O
mosquitoes	O
may	O
be	O
active	O
are	O
also	O
at	O
greater	O
risk	O
of	O
contracting	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
disease	O
,	O
including	O
MVE	O
.	O

To	O
minimise	O
the	O
chance	O
of	O
being	O
bitten	O
by	O
mosquitoes	O
,	O
people	O
should	O
:	O
-	O
use	O
a	O
protective	O
repellent	O
containing	O
20	O
per	O
cent	O
DEET	O
or	O
Picaridin	O
as	O
a	O
supplement	O
to	O
protective	O
clothing	O
when	O
outdoors	O
in	O
mosquito	O
prone	O
areas	O
-	O
wear	O
light-coloured	O
clothing	O
with	O
long	O
sleeves	O
,	O
long	O
trousers	O
and	O
socks	O
,	O
between	O
dusk	O
and	O
dawn	O
in	O
areas	O
where	O
mosquito	O
bites	O
are	O
likely	O
-	O
avoid	O
outdoor	O
exposure	O
around	O
dusk	O
and	O
at	O
night	O
near	O
areas	O
of	O
dense	O
vegetation	O
and	O
other	O
areas	O
of	O
high	O
mosquito	O
activity	O
-	O
use	O
mosquito-proof	O
accommodation	O
and	O
camping	O
facilities	O
at	O
night	O
-	O
use	O
mosquito	O

,	O

and	O
barrier	O
sprays	O
containing	O
bifenthrin	O
in	O
patio	O
and	O
outdoor	O
areas	O
near	O
houses	O
-	O
ensure	O
children	O
are	O
adequately	O
protected	O
against	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

.	O

Botulism	B-Disease
(	O
from	O
Latin	O
Botulinus	O
meaning	O
``	O
sausage	O
''	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
serious	O
paralytic	O
illness	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bacterial	O
neurotoxin	O
,	O
botulinum	O
toxin	O
.	O

In	O
July	O
1998	O
,	O
in	O
Setif	O
and	O
its	O
surroundings	O
,	O
a	O
large	O
outbreak	O
of	O
botulism	B-Disease
that	O
killed	O
44	O
people	O
and	O
hospitalized	O
dozens	O
more	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
traced	O
to	O
cachir	O
.	O

[	O

]	O

of	O

In	O
2014	O
,	O
potato	B-Virus
spindle	I-Virus
tuber	I-Virus
viroid	I-Virus
(	O

)	O

micro	O

and	O
tested	O
for	O
PSTVd	O
.	O

.	O

a	O

.	O

.	O

Additional	O
surveys	O
revealed	O
no	O
further	O
infections	O
in	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
.	O

They	O
included	O
testing	O
of	O
each	O
plant	O
in	O
all	O
crossing	O
glasshouses	O
,	O
random	O
samples	O
of	O
seed	O
potatoes	O
[	O
and	O
]	O
samples	O
from	O
all	O
varieties	O
introduced	O
since	O
2009	O
.	O

Spread	O
via	O
true	O
seed	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
obvious	O
route	O
for	O
the	O
infections	O
in	O
micro	O
propagated	O
plants	O
since	O
they	O
shared	O
a	O
common	O
PSTVd-infected	O
parent	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
[	O
this	O
]	O
does	O
not	O
provide	O
insight	O
if	O
it	O
is	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
internal	O
or	O
external	O
presence	O
of	O
viroid	O
.	O

Previous	O
experiments	O
were	O
unable	O
to	O
show	O
mechanical	O
transmission	O
of	O
PSTVd	O
under	O
field	O
conditions	O
in	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
.	O

It	O
was	O
concluded	O
that	O
germplasm	O
poses	O
the	O
highest	O
risk	O
of	O
introducing	O
this	O
viroid	O
in	O
potatoes	O
in	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
.	O

Phylogenetic	O
analysis	O
showed	O
that	O
all	O
potato	O
isolates	O
from	O
the	O
Netherlands	B-Country
cluster	O
with	O
potato	O
isolates	O
from	O
other	O
countries	O
and	O
separate	O
from	O
PSTVd	O
genotypes	O
from	O
other	O

species	O
,	O
both	O
from	O

abroad	O
.	O

This	O
indicates	O
that	O
the	O
[	O
potato	O
]	O
isolates	O
originate	O
in	O
(	O
wild	O
)	O
potato	O
accessions	O
rather	O

The	O

:	O
``	O

did	O

and	O

.	O
''	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
US	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
,	O
scabies	B-Disease
is	O
an	O
infestation	O
of	O
the	O
skin	O
by	O
the	O
human	O
itch	O
mite	O
.	O

The	O
microscopic	O
scabies	B-Disease
mite	O
burrows	O
into	O
the	O
upper	O
layer	O
of	O
the	O
skin	O
where	O
it	O
lives	O
and	O
lays	O
its	O
eggs	O
.	O

The	O
most	O
common	O
symptoms	O
of	O
scabies	B-Disease
are	O
intense	O
itching	O
and	O
a	O
pimple-like	O
skin	O
rash	O
.	O

The	O
scabies	B-Disease
mite	O
usually	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
direct	O
,	O
prolonged	O
,	O
skin-to-skin	O
contact	O
with	O
a	O
person	O
who	O
has	O
scabies	O
.	O

If	O
you	O
never	O
had	O
scabies	B-Disease
,	O
symptoms	O
could	O
take	O
4	O
to	O
6	O
weeks	O
to	O
appear	O
.	O

``	O
Presumably	O
at	O
a	O
hospital	O
,	O
it	O
gets	O
brought	O
in	O
by	O
a	O
patient	O
.	O

It	O
gets	O
transmitted	O
to	O
a	O
healthcare	O
[	O
provider	O
,	O
and	O
because	O
it	O
's	O
highly	O
contagious	O
,	O
healthcare	O
]	O
providers	O
can	O
transmit	O
it	O
to	O
other	O
healthcare	O
providers	O
and	O
even	O
potentially	O
to	O
other	O
patients	O
.	O

So	O
even	O
if	O
you	O
're	O
taking	O
the	O
best	O

hand	O

and	O

it	O
is	O

,	O

]	O

A	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
[	O
infection	O
]	O
causes	O
a	O

.	O

that	O
50	O

it	O

.	O

are	O

and	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O

,	O

,	O

pain	O
,	O

.	O

The	O
US	O
Embassy	O
wishes	O
to	O
inform	O
US	O
citizens	O
about	O
one	O
confirmed	O
and	O
one	O
suspected	O
case	O
of	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
in	O
northern	O
Togo	B-Country
.	O

This	O
message	O
is	O
for	O
informational	O
purposes	O
only	O
.	O

Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
is	O
a	O
rare	O
but	O
potentially	O
life-threatening	O
viral	O
hemorrhagic	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
risk	O
of	O
contamination	O
is	O
low	O
,	O
but	O
can	O
occur	O
if	O
someone	O
comes	O
into	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
's	O
blood	O
or	O
bodily	O
fluids	O
.	O

Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
can	O
not	O
be	O
spread	O
through	O
casual	O
contact	O
,	O
including	O
skin	O
to	O
skin	O
contact	O
,	O
without	O
exchange	O
of	O
bodily	O
fluids	O
.	O

Those	O
at	O
highest-risk	O
would	O
be	O
health	O
care	O
workers	O
treating	O
patients	O
in	O
facilities	O
known	O
to	O
have	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
and	O
family	O
members	O
caring	O
for	O
infected	O
patients	O
.	O

Early	O
diagnosis	O
and	O
supportive	O
care	O
are	O
essential	O
.	O

You	O
should	O
consult	O
a	O
medical	O
professional	O
if	O
you	O
have	O
been	O
in	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
within	O
the	O
past	O
3	O
weeks	O
and	O
have	O
symptoms	O
of	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
,	O
which	O
include	O
:	O
fever	O
,	O
chest	O
,	O
stomach	O
or	O
back	O
pain	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
or	O
mucosal	O
bleeding	O
.	O

more	O
information	O
on	O
Lassa	B-Virus
hemorrhagic	O
fever	O
,	O
please	O
visit	O
the	O
CDC	O

at	O

In	O

After	O

''	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

come	O
and	O
go	O
.	O

Mild	O

are	O

.	O

(	O
