]	O
.	O

The	O

works	O
in	O
Building	O
15	O
and	O
follows	O
2	O
previous	O

in	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

Because	O
there	O
were	O
2	O

of	O

'	O

``	O

,	O
''	O

.	O
''	O

.	O

He	O
said	O

members	O

work	O
in	O
that	O
building	O
to	O
another	O
location	O
.	O

A	O
farmer	O
raising	O
livestock	O
in	O
Huaraz	B-City
,	O
Ancash	B-Province
(	O
north-central	O
Peru	B-Country
,	O
a	O
main	O
agricultural	O
center	O
)	O
is	O
in	O
serious	O
condition	O
after	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
2nd	O
case	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
and	O
was	O
confirmed	O
by	O
the	O
Head	O
of	O
Epidemiology	O
,	O
Regional	O
Health	O
Authority	O
,	O
Jaime	O
Salazar	O
.	O

This	O
case	O
involves	O
a	O
rancher	O
(	O
livestock	O
breeder	O
)	O
in	O
Huaraz	B-City
who	O
is	O
in	O
critical	O
condition	O
at	O
the	O
Hospital	O
Guard	O
Victor	O
Ramos	O
,	O
said	O
the	O
authorities	O
.	O

The	O

man	O
presented	O

a	O

ago	O
with	O
a	O

on	O

to	O

to	O

of	O
the	O
body	O
;	O
he	O
also	O
had	O
a	O

.	O

Currently	O
,	O
he	O
has	O
been	O

to	O
an	O

and	O
is	O

[	O

do	O

that	O
anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
not	O

;	O
the	O
staff	O
looking	O
after	O
this	O
patient	O
are	O
in	O
no	O
danger	O
.	O

-	O
Mods.SB/MHJ	O
]	O
.	O

The	O
doctor	O
,	O
Ricardo	O
Natividad	O
,	O
in	O
charge	O
of	O
Epidemiology	O
at	O
Huaraz	B-City
,	O
said	O
that	O
an	O
investigation	O
is	O
underway	O
as	O
to	O
the	O
mode	O
of	O
transmission	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
is	O
likely	O
to	O
have	O
been	O
by	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
.	O

Reliable	O
sources	O
in	O
the	O
Huaracino	O
hospital	O
last	O
June	O
[	O
2013	O
?	O
]	O

reported	O
an	O
anthrax	B-Disease
fatality	O
whose	O
case	O
was	O
kept	O
in	O
reserve	O
.	O

[	O
Not	O
quite	O
sure	O
what	O
they	O
mean	O
by	O
this	O
;	O
was	O
it	O
not	O
reported	O
?	O

-	O
Mod.MHJ	O
]	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
is	O
suspected	O
that	O
there	O
may	O
be	O
other	O
cases	O
.	O

Following	O
the	O
occurrence	O
of	O
lethal	O
encephalitis	B-Disease
in	O
3	O
breeders	O
of	O
variegated	O
squirrels	O
(	O
_Sciurus	O
variegatoides_	O
)	O
in	O
Saxony	B-Province
Anhalt	I-Province
from	O
2011	O
to	O
2013	O
,	O
comprehensive	O
investigations	O
on	O
a	O
possible	O
infectious	O
origin	O
were	O
carried	O
out	O
at	O
the	O
Bernhard	O
Nocht	O
Institute	O
for	O
Tropical	O
Medicine	O
(	O
BNITM	O
)	O
.	O

At	O
first	O
,	O
no	O
leads	O
could	O
be	O
found	O
regarding	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
Friedrich	O
Loeffler	O
Institute	O
(	O
FLI	O
)	O
on	O
the	O
isle	O
of	O
Riems	O
then	O
investigated	O
samples	O
of	O
a	O
variegated	O
squirrel	O
from	O
the	O
holdings	O
of	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
deceased	O
breeders	O
.	O

It	O
was	O
only	O
the	O
genetic	O
analysis	O
of	O
organ	O
samples	O
of	O
the	O
squirrel	O
that	O
provided	O
sequence	O
information	O
which	O
pointed	O
to	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
a	O
novel	O
Bornavirus	B-Virus
.	O

Subsequent	O
molecular	O
,	O
biological	O
,	O
and	O
immunohistological	O
tests	O
also	O
provided	O
evidence	O
for	O
its	O
presence	O
in	O
brain	O
samples	O
of	O
the	O
deceased	O
patients	O
.	O

Based	O
on	O
the	O
currently	O
available	O
information	O
,	O
the	O
new	O
virus	O
is	O
clearly	O
different	O
from	O
all	O
previously	O
known	O
Bornaviruses	O
.	O

At	O
the	O
moment	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
not	O
known	O
whether	O
these	O
are	O
isolated	O
cases	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
ruled	O
out	O
that	O
the	O
diseases	O
of	O
the	O
3	O
patients	O
could	O
have	O
been	O
caused	O
by	O
transmission	O
of	O
the	O
novel	O
Bornavirus	B-Virus
from	O
infected	O
animals	O
.	O

The	O
transmission	O
path	O
so	O
far	O
is	O
unknown	O
;	O
bites	O
and	O
scratches	O
appear	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
likely	O
means	O
of	O
acquiring	O
infection	O
.	O

Test	O
methods	O
for	O
virus	O
detection	O
were	O
developed	O
and	O
validated	O
at	O
the	O
FLI	O
and	O
are	O
available	O
for	O
further	O
analyses	O
.	O

BNITM	O
,	O
FLI	O
,	O
and	O
Robert	O
Koch	O
Institute	O
are	O
cooperating	O
with	O
veterinary	O
and	O
health	O
authorities	O
at	O
federal	O
and	O
state	O
levels	O
to	O
further	O
clarify	O
the	O
situation	O
.	O

The	O
FLI	O
on	O
the	O
isle	O
of	O
Riems	O
carries	O
out	O
tests	O
on	O
the	O
occurrence	O
of	O
this	O
virus	O
in	O
animals	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
persons	O
keeping	O
variegated	O
squirrels	O
are	O
screened	O
for	O
possible	O
other	O
cases	O
of	O
infection	O
.	O

The	O
BNITM	O
in	O
Hamburg	O
carries	O
out	O
analogous	O
analyses	O
in	O
spinal	O
fluid	O
of	O
patients	O
with	O
encephalitis	B-Disease
of	O
unknown	O
origin	O
.	O

Until	O
more	O
data	O
become	O
available	O
,	O
as	O
a	O
preventive	O
measure	O
,	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
variegated	O
squirrels	O
should	O
be	O
avoided	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
variegated	O
squirrel	O
develops	O
disease	O
or	O
dies	O
of	O
unknown	O
causes	O
,	O
the	O
owner	O
should	O
inform	O
the	O
veterinarian	O
,	O
who	O
,	O
if	O
necessary	O
,	O
can	O
then	O
initiate	O
further	O
investigations	O
.	O

In	O
connection	O
with	O
the	O
FLI	O
's	O
and	O
the	O
BNITM	O
's	O
discovery	O
of	O
this	O
new	O
,	O
possibly	O
zoonotic	O
Bornavirus	B-Virus
,	O
it	O
still	O

to	O

another	O

species	O
.	O

A	O

of	O
33	O

students	O

2	O

contracted	O
a	O
laboratory-confirmed	O
Q	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
infection	I-Disease
during	O
a	O
training	O
course	O
on	O
a	O
sheep	O
farm	O
in	O
Slovenia	B-Country
in	O
March	O
2007	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
_Coxiella	O
burnetii_	O
,	O
an	O
intracellular	O
bacterium	O
found	O
worldwide	O
in	O

species	O
of	O
farm	O
and	O
domestic	O
animals	O
.	O

Apr	O
2007	O
,	O
the	O

Disease	O
Centre	O
at	O
the	O
National	O

a	O

of	O

fever	I-Disease
in	O

a	O

.	O

.	O

to	O

the	O
outbreak	O
of	O
Ebola	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
disease	O
(	O

)	O
in	O
Equateur	B-Province
Province	I-Province
,	O
the	O
Democratic	B-Country
Republic	I-Country
of	I-Country
the	I-Country

.	O

deadly	O
anthrax	O
turned	O
out	O
to	O
be	O
a	O

form	O
of	O

bacteria	O

in	O
animal	O

.	O

.	O

Leavitt	O

Vegas	I-City
and	O

in	O

for	O
AIDS	O
and	O

.	O

*	O
*	O
*	O
Anthrax	B-Disease
happens	O
to	O
be	O
the	O
lethal	O
microbe	O
of	O
the	O
moment	O
.	O

But	O
there	O
are	O
others	O
.	O

``	O
If	O
you	O
really	O
want	O
to	O
kill	O
somebody	O
,	O
you	O
go	O
for	O
_Clostridium	O
botulinum_	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Cornelius	O
McWright	O
,	O
former	O
chief	O
of	O
scientific	O
research	O
at	O
the	O
FBI	O
,	O
now	O
adjunct	O
professor	O
of	O
forensic	O
sciences	O
at	O
George	O
Washington	O
University	O
.	O

And	O
sometimes	O
the	O
greater	O
weapon	O
is	O
not	O
these	O
microscopic	O
killers	O
themselves	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
fear	O
that	O
they	O
would	O
be	O
unleashed	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
[	O
anthrax	B-Disease
can	O
really	O
induce	O
terror	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Raymond	O
Zilinskas	O
,	O
associate	O
professor	O
at	O
the	O
University	O
of	O
Maryland	O
Biotechnology	O
Institute	O
.	O

``	O
You	O
should	O
never	O
underestimate	O
the	O
possibility	O
of	O
inducing	O
panic	O
among	O
the	O
general	O
population	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
US	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
(	O
CDC	O
)	O
issued	O
a	O
level	O
1	O
travel	O
alert	O
regarding	O
the	O
ongoing	O
outbreak	O
in	O
Pakistan	B-Country
of	O
extensively	B-Disease
drug-resistant	I-Disease
(	I-Disease
XDR	I-Disease
)	I-Disease
typhoid	I-Disease
fever	I-Disease
.	O

This	O
``	O
practice	O
usual	O
precautions	O
''	O
travel	O
alert	O
published	O
on	O
[	O
30	O
Sep	O
2019	O
]	O
is	O
very	O
important	O
since	O
XDR	O
infections	O
do	O
not	O
respond	O
to	O
most	O
antibiotics	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
ampicillin	O
,	O
chloramphenicol	O
,	O
trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole	O
,	O
ciprofloxacin	O
,	O
and	O
ceftriaxone	O
.	O

And	O
in	O
rare	O
cases	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
can	O
be	O
fatal	O
.	O

The	O
CDC	O
says	O
people	O
from	O
the	O
USA	O
,	O
Canada	O
,	O
United	O
Kingdom	O
,	O
Denmark	O
,	O
and	O
Australia	O
with	O
a	O
travel	O
history	O
to	O
Pakistan	B-Country
have	O
reported	O
XDR	O
typhoid	O
infections	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Pakistan	B-Country
Tourism	O
Development	O
Corporation	O
,	O
about	O
1.75	O
million	O
tourists	O
visited	O
Pakistan	O
in	O
2017	O
alone	O
.	O

Pakistan	B-Country
is	O
the	O
world	O
's	O
6th-most	O
populous	O
country	O
with	O
a	O
population	O
exceeding	O
210	O
million	O
people	O
,	O
located	O
in	O
South	O
Asia	O
.	O

Pakistan	B-Country
's	O
current	O
XDR	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
outbreak	O
began	O
in	O
Hyderabad	B-City
,	O
which	O
is	O
a	O
city	O
of	O
Sindh	B-Province
province	I-Province
,	O
during	O
November	O
2016	O
.	O

The	O
CDC	O
says	O
,	O
``	O
If	O
you	O
are	O
going	O
to	O
South	O
Asia	O
,	O
including	O
Pakistan	B-Country
,	O
protect	O
yourself	O
against	O
typhoid	O
infection	O
by	O
getting	O
a	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
vaccination	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
CDC	O
's	O
Advisory	O
Committee	O
on	O
Immunization	O
Practices	O
(	O
ACIP	O
)	O
recommends	O
2	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
vaccines	O
:	O
an	O
oral	O
vaccine	O
,	O
Typhim	O
,	O
and	O
an	O
injectable	O
vaccine	O
,	O
Typbar	O
.	O

The	O
oral	O
vaccine	O
Typhim	O
is	O
approved	O
for	O
people	O
6	O
years	O
old	O
or	O
older	O
,	O
should	O
be	O
taken	O
as	O
directed	O
,	O
at	O
least	O
1	O
week	O
before	O
departure	O
.	O

The	O
injectable	O
vaccine	O
is	O
approved	O
for	O
people	O
2	O
years	O
old	O
or	O
older	O
.	O

Travelers	O
should	O
receive	O
the	O
injectable	O
vaccine	O
Typbar	O
at	O
least	O
2	O
weeks	O
before	O
departure	O
.	O

Neither	O
vaccine	O
is	O
100	O
%	O
effective	O
,	O
so	O
travelers	O
should	O
also	O
practice	O
safe	O
eating	O
and	O
drinking	O
while	O
traveling	O
abroad	O
,	O
says	O
the	O
ACIP	O
.	O

Typhoid	O
fever	O
is	O
a	O
serious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Salmonella	O
Typhi_	O
and	O
spread	O
by	O
contaminated	O
food	O
and	O
water	O
.	O

Humans	O
are	O
the	O
only	O
source	O
of	O
these	O
bacteria	O
.	O

The	O
incubation	O
period	O
of	O
typhoid	O
and	O
paratyphoid	O
infections	O
is	O
6	O
to	O
30	O
days	O
,	O
says	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
typhoid	O
fever	O
often	O
include	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
weakness	O
,	O
stomach	O
pain	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
and	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
.	O

People	O
may	O
have	O
diarrhea	O
or	O
constipation	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
a	O
Deseret	O
News	O
report	O
yesterday	O
[	O
25	O
Jun	O
2019	O
]	O
,	O
a	O
migrant	O
boy	O
who	O
had	O
been	O
detained	O
at	O
a	O
U.S.	O
Customs	O
and	O
Border	O
Protection	O
camp	O
came	O
to	O
Utah	B-Province
with	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
last	O
month	O
[	O
May	O
2019	O
]	O
.	O

The	O
child	O
was	O
hospitalized	O
with	O
a	O
severe	O
case	O
in	O
Salt	B-City
Lake	I-City
County	O
soon	O
after	O
arriving	O
in	O
Utah	B-Province
.	O

He	O
was	O
treated	O
and	O
fully	O
recovered	O
and	O
released	O
after	O
a	O
week	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
say	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
additional	O
threat	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
Utah	B-Province
from	O
this	O
case	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
life-threatening	O
illness	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Salmonella_	O
Typhi	O
.	O

_Salmonella_	O
Typhi	O
lives	O
only	O
in	O
humans	O
.	O

Persons	O
with	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
carry	O
the	O
bacteria	O
in	O
their	O
bloodstream	O
and	O
intestinal	O
tract	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
a	O
small	O
number	O
of	O
persons	O
,	O
called	O
carriers	O
,	O
recover	O
from	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
but	O
continue	O
to	O
carry	O
the	O
bacteria	O
.	O

Both	O
ill	O
persons	O
and	O
carriers	O
shed	O
_S._	O
Typhi	O
in	O
their	O
feces	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
get	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
if	O
you	O
eat	O
food	O
or	O
drink	O
beverages	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
handled	O
by	O
a	O
person	O
who	O
is	O
shedding	O
_S._	O
Typhi	O
or	O
if	O
sewage	O
contaminated	O
with	O
_S._	O
Typhi	O
bacteria	O
gets	O
into	O
the	O
water	O
you	O
use	O
for	O
drinking	O
or	O
washing	O
food	O
.	O

Therefore	O
,	O
typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
is	O
more	O
common	O
in	O
areas	O
of	O
the	O
world	O
where	O
handwashing	O
is	O
less	O
frequent	O
and	O
water	O
is	O
likely	O
to	O
be	O
contaminated	O
with	O
sewage	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
can	O
be	O
successfully	O
treated	O
with	O
appropriate	O
antimicrobials	O
,	O
and	O
persons	O
given	O
antimicrobials	O
usually	O
begin	O
to	O
feel	O
better	O
within	O
2	O
to	O
3	O
days	O
.	O

After	O
8	O
days	O
fighting	O
for	O
his	O
life	O
,	O
a	O
Venezuelan	O
who	O
entered	O
the	O
country	O
as	O
part	O
of	O
a	O
migrant	O
caravan	O
died	O
of	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
and	O
cardiorespiratory	O
complications	O
in	O
the	O
internal	O
medicine	O
ward	O
of	O
the	O
Gabriela	O
Alvarado	O
Hospital	O
.	O

On	O
Wednesday	O
afternoon	O
[	O
27	O
Jul	O
2022	O
]	O
,	O
[	O
a	O
]	O
citizen	O
(	O
43	O
)	O
[	O
years	O
old	O
]	O
,	O
originally	O
from	O
[	O
Caracas	O
]	O
Venezuela	O
,	O
died	O
.	O

He	O
had	O
arrived	O
on	O
Honduran	O
soil	O
in	O
the	O
Trojes	B-Province
area	O
,	O
immediately	O
asking	O
for	O
medical	O
assistance	O
.	O

He	O
was	O
admitted	O
to	O
the	O
hospital	O
on	O
21	O
Jul	O
2022	O
,	O
presenting	O
multiple	O
complications	O
.	O

The	O
deputy	O
director	O
of	O
the	O
care	O
center	O
,	O
Marlon	O
Estrada	O
,	O
reported	O
that	O
``	O
this	O
patient	O
was	O
already	O
admitted	O
with	O
liver	O
and	O
kidney	O
failure	O
,	O
until	O
yesterday	O
[	O
27	O
Jul	O
2022	O
]	O
he	O
presented	O
cardiorespiratory	O
complications	O
and	O
died	O
.	O
''	O

``	O
The	O
steps	O
are	O

to	O

...	O

down	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
current	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
outbreak	O
in	O
Northern	B-Province
Israel	I-Province
with	O
36	O
confirmed/probably	O
and	O
583	O
suspected	O
cases	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
a	O
concerning	O
health	O
risk	O
among	O
all	O
travelers	O
visiting	O
this	O
region	O
,	O
but	O
special	O
surveillance	O
seemed	O
warranted	O
for	O
adolescents	O
.	O

(	O
1	O
)	O
Israel	B-Country
is	O
a	O
popular	O
summer	O
destination	O
among	O
youths	O
for	O
camps	O
,	O
tours	O
,	O
and	O
fresh-water	O

activities	O
;	O
making	O
up	O
to	O
40	O
%	O
of	O
all	O
visitors	O
.	O

(	O
2	O
)	O
Therefore	O
,	O
physicians	O
should	O
have	O
raised	O
clinical	O
awareness	O
for	O
young	O
travelers	O
returning	O
from	O
Israel	B-Country
with	O
an	O
acute	O
febrile	O
illness	O
.	O

We	O
report	O
three	O
cases	O
of	O
suspected	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
,	O
one	O
confirmed	O
,	O
of	O

travelers	O
to	O
Israel	B-Country
.	O

All	O
3	O
patients	O
had	O
spent	O
about	O
4	O
weeks	O
in	O
Israel	B-Country
in	O
July/August	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
and	O
had	O
visited	O
affected	O
bodies	O
of	O
water	O
in	O
the	O
Golan	O
Heights	O
with	O
various	O
fresh	O
water	O
exposure	O
(	O

,	O

)	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
patient	O
was	O
a	O
16-year-old	O
male	O
who	O
returned	O
to	O
the	O
US	O
in	O
the	O
1st	O

of	O

[	O

]	O
and	O
one	O
week	O
later	O
developed	O
general	O

,	O

,	O
headache	O
,	O
and	O
myalgia	O
.	O

He	O

with	O
signs	O
of	O
meningitis	O
.	O

The	O
diagnosis	O
of	O
leptospirosis	B-Disease
was	O
made	O
with	O
a	O
commercially	O
available	O
IgM	O
ELISA-assay	O
with	O
a	O
positive	O

sample	O
one	O
month	O
later	O
.	O

patient	O
was	O
a	O
16	O

female	O
who	O
had	O
started	O
to	O

.	O

with	O

.	O

to	O

was	O

.	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

.	O

A	O

(	O

first	O

is	O

in	O
U.S.	O

On	O

6	O
,	O

in	O
St	O
Joseph	O
's	O

West	O
,	O
in	O

,	O
Missouri	B-Province
,	O
Stewart	O
's	O

was	O

for	O

,	O
imipenem	O
,	O
and	O
cefotaxime	O
.	O

Two	O
of	O
the	O
patients	O
,	O
who	O
ranged	O
from	O
2	O
to	O
6-years-old	O
,	O
died	O
from	O

.	O

The	O
others	O
recovered	O
.	O

Genetic	O
testing	O
revealed	O
that	O
all	O
5	O
of	O
the	O
_K	O
pneumoniae_	O
isolates	O
were	O

related	O
and	O
belonged	O
to	O
the	O
sequence	O
type	O
ST11	O
,	O
while	O
the	O
_E	O
coli_	O
isolate	O
belonged	O
to	O
ST156	O
.	O

In	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
isolates	O
,	O
MCR-1	O
was	O
found	O
to	O
be	O
located	O
on	O
transferable	O
plasmids	O
.	O

These	O
small	O

pieces	O
of	O
DNA	O
can	O
transfer	O
resistance	O
genes	O
to	O
different	O
types	O
of	O
bacteria	O
.	O

The	O
isolates	O
were	O
found	O
to	O
carry	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
resistance	O
genes	O
.	O

A	O
Quang	O
Binh	O
Province	O
official	O
who	O

this	O

.	O

The	O
official	O
,	O

's	O

,	O
[	O

]	O
51	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

[	O

2020	O
]	O

of	O

,	O

.	O

Melioidosis	B-Disease
,	O
also	O
called	O
Whitmore	O
's	O
disease	O
,	O
has	O
symptoms	O
like	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

,	O
and	O

of	O
the	O
brain	O
and	O

.	O

Its	O

can	O
be	O
as	O
high	O
as	O
40	O
per	O
cent	O
.	O

The	O

was	O
first	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
Viet	O

in	O
1925	O

but	O
there	O

not	O

knowledge	O
about	O
it	O
yet	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
around	O
10	O
000	O
cases	O
worldwide	O
every	O
year	O
,	O
mostly	O
during	O
the	O
rainy	O
season	O
,	O
many	O
being	O
fatal	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O

.	O

Quang	O
Binh	O
and	O

central	O
provinces	O
were	O

,	O
which	O
caused	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

.	O

The	O
Greene	B-City
County	O
(	O
Missouri	B-Province
)	O

has	O

.	O

[	O

.	O

3	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

[	O

(	O

)	O

]	O
.	O

[	O

The	O

said	O
that	O
the	O
regions	O
that	O
have	O

in	O
this	O

period	O
were	O

National	B-Province
Capital	I-Province
Region	I-Province
(	O
NCR	O
)	O
,	O
Cagayan	B-Province
Valley	I-Province
,	O
and	O
Central	B-Province
Luzon	I-Province
.	O

Leptospirosis	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
fatal	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
that	O
affects	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
alike	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
spiral-shaped	O
_Leptospira_	O
bacteria	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
exposure	O
to	O
the	O
urine	O
of	O
infected	O
animals	O
or	O
water	O
or	O
soil	O
that	O
has	O
been	O
contaminated	O
by	O
infected	O
animal	O
urine	O
.	O

Floods	O
can	O
potentially	O
increase	O
the	O
transmission	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
know	O
that	O
every	O
time	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
rainy	O
season	O
,	O
it	O
floods	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
public	O
becomes	O
more	O
vulnerable	O
to	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
''	O
Vergeire	O
said	O
.	O

Vergeire	O
earlier	O
urged	O
the	O
public	O
to	O
take	O

when	O

through	O

:	O
to	O
wear	O
boots	O
,	O

their	O
feet	O
after	O
contact	O
with	O

,	O

to	O
get	O
checked	O
by	O
a	O

professional	O
in	O
case	O
of	O
symptoms	O
.	O

Cholera	B-Disease
is	O
surging	O
in	O
Haiti	B-Country
after	O
Hurricane	O
Matthew	O
[	O
that	O

in	O

of	O
4	O

2016	O
]	O

,	O

and	O

forced	O

to	O
drink	O

--	O

of	O

.	O

,	O

200	O

new	O

of	O

have	O

,	O

.	O

of	O

.	O

``	O

will	O

more	O

of	O
cholera	B-Disease
,	O
and	O
unnecessary	O

does	O
n't	O

,	O

said	O
Conor	O
Shapiro	O
,	O

and	O
chief	O

of	O
the	O
St	O
Boniface	O
Haiti	B-Country
Foundation	O
,	O
which	O

of	O
Haiti	O
.	O

And	O

to	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

does	O
not	O
improve	O

,	O

to	O
increase	O
.	O

,	O

left	O

of	O

,	O

and	O
dead	O
bodies	O
--	O

a	O

ground	O
for	O
the	O

disease	O
.	O

In	O
the	O

regions	O
,	O

to	O

water	O

equipment	O
have	O

by	O
debris	O
that	O
still	O
blocks	O
roads	O
.	O

And	O
even	O
those	O

that	O
have	O

``	O

,	O

(	O

.	O

``	O

a	O

against	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

.	O

A	O

[	O

-	O

1st	O

2	O

ago	O
.	O

A	O

in	O
Galveston	B-City
,	O

A	O

male	O

went	O
[	O

1	O

]	O
to	O

Disease	O
Hospital	O

,	O

,	O

1200	O

.	O

of	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
virus	O
due	O
to	O
an	O

.	O

Patients	O
seeking	O

for	O

,	O

like	O

,	O

are	O
on	O

.	O

There	O

about	O

in	O

water	O
.	O

he	O
Health	O
Services	O
of	O
Oaxaca	B-Province
(	O
SSO	O
)	O
reported	O
that	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
Unified	O
Information	O
System	O
of	O
Epidemiological	O
Surveillance	O
(	O
SUIVE	O
)	O
,	O
8	O
cases	O
of	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
were	O
reported	O
in	O
San	B-City
Mateo	I-City
del	I-City
Mar	I-City
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
region	O
affected	O
by	O
the	O
earthquakes	O
of	O
7	O
,	O
19	O
and	O
23	O
Sep	O
2017	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
agency	O
,	O
they	O
were	O
given	O
timely	O

and	O
follow-up	O
of	O
the	O

,	O
so	O
they	O
do	O
not	O
represent	O
an	O

.	O

It	O
is	O
indicated	O
through	O
a	O

that	O
operative	O

intensive	O

in	O
this	O

,	O
where	O

was	O

to	O
rule	O
out	O

in	O
the	O
population	O
.	O

A	O
brigade	O
was	O
deployed	O
to	O
strengthen	O
strategies	O
,	O
with	O
special	O
emphasis	O
on	O
sanitary	O
regulation	O
and	O
close	O

of	O
the	O
levels	O
of	O

chlorination	O
in	O
wells	O
of	O
the	O

towns	O
and	O
homes	O
in	O
the	O
municipality	O
of	O
San	B-City
Mateo	I-City
del	I-City
Mar	I-City
through	O
personnel	O
of	O
the	O
Federal	O
Commission	O
for	O
the	O
Protection	O
against	O
Sanitary	O
Risks	O
(	O
Cofepris	O
)	O
.	O

SSO	O
staff	O
reported	O
that	O
the	O
1st	O
case	O
was	O
recorded	O
in	O
August	O
2017	O
and	O
the	O
last	O
on	O
27	O
Sep	O
2017	O
.	O

They	O
do	O
not	O
report	O
on	O
the	O
others	O
.	O

The	O
patients	O
are	O
recovering	O
.	O

Certainly	O
,	O
earthquakes	O
as	O
disrupters	O
of	O
the	O
sanitary	O
capacity	O
of	O
affected	O
areas	O
can	O
predispose	O
a	O
population	O
to	O
increased	O
enterically	O
transmitted	O
infections	O
,	O
as	O
best	O
reflected	O
by	O
the	O
disastrous	O
cholera	O
epidemic	O
in	O
Haiti	O
.	O

On	O
12	O
Jan	O
2010	O
,	O
a	O
7.0	O
magnitude	O
earthquake	O
struck	O
Haiti	B-Country
,	O
which	O
borders	O
the	O
Dominican	O
Republic	O
on	O
the	O
island	O
of	O
Hispaniola	O
.	O

The	O
earthquake	O
's	O
epicenter	O
was	O
10	O
miles	O
west	O
of	O
the	O
Haiti	B-Country
capital	O
city	O
of	O
Port-au-Prince	B-City
(	O
estimated	O
population	O
:	O
2	O
million	O
)	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Haitian	O
government	O
,	O
approximately	O
200	O
000	O
persons	O
were	O
killed	O
,	O
and	O
500	O
000	O
were	O
left	O
homeless	O
(	O
1	O
)	O
.	O

Malaria	B-Disease
caused	O
by	O
_Plasmodium	O
falciparum_	O
infection	O
is	O
endemic	O
in	O
Haiti	B-Country
,	O
and	O
the	O
principal	O
mosquito	O
vector	O
is	O
_Anopheles	O
albimanus_	O
,	O
which	O
frequently	O
bites	O
outdoors	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
displaced	O
persons	O
living	O
outdoors	O
or	O
in	O
temporary	O
shelters	O
and	O
thousands	O
of	O
emergency	O
responders	O
in	O
Haiti	B-Country
are	O
at	O
substantial	O
risk	O
for	O
malaria	B-Disease
.	O

During	O
12	O
Jan-25	O
Feb	O
2010	O
,	O
CDC	O
received	O
reports	O
of	O
11	O
laboratory-confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
_P	O
.	O

falciparum_	O
malaria	B-Disease
acquired	O
in	O
Haiti	B-Country
.	O

Patients	O
included	O
7	O
U.S.	O
residents	O
who	O
were	O
emergency	O
responders	O
,	O
3	O
Haitian	O
residents	O
,	O
and	O
one	O
U.S.	O
traveler	O
.	O

This	O
report	O
summarizes	O
the	O
11	O
cases	O
and	O
provides	O
chemoprophylactic	O
and	O
additional	O
preventive	O
recommendations	O
to	O
minimize	O
the	O
risk	O
for	O
acquiring	O
malaria	B-Disease
for	O
persons	O
traveling	O
to	O
Haiti	B-Country
.	O

Of	O
the	O
7	O
emergency	O
responders	O
,	O
6	O
were	O
U.S.	O
military	O
personnel	O
.	O

Among	O
the	O
6	O
,	O
4	O
cases	O
were	O
uncomplicated	O
and	O
treated	O
locally	O
in	O
Haiti	B-Country
.	O

Two	O
other	O
patients	O
were	O
moderately	O
to	O
seriously	O
ill	O
and	O
transferred	O
to	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
for	O
intensive	O
care	O
;	O
one	O
required	O
intubation	O
and	O
mechanical	O
ventilation	O
for	O
acute	O
respiratory	O
distress	O
syndrome	O
.	O

All	O
are	O
expected	O
to	O
make	O
a	O
full	O
recovery	O
.	O

All	O
6	O
military	O
personnel	O
had	O
been	O
provided	O
oral	O
chemoprophylaxis	O
with	O
doxycycline	O
before	O
departure	O
from	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
and	O
personal	O
protective	O
equipment	O
(	O
e.g.	O
,	O
insect	O
repellent	O
and	O
insecticide-treated	O
netting	O
and	O
uniforms	O
)	O
after	O
arrival	O
in	O
Haiti	B-Country
.	O

Of	O
the	O
11	O
total	O
patients	O
,	O
chemoprophylaxis	O
was	O
indicated	O
for	O
the	O
7	O
emergency	O
responders	O
and	O
the	O
lone	O
U.S.	O
traveler	O
.	O

Six	O
of	O
these	O
8	O
patients	O
(	O
including	O
the	O
2	O
hospitalized	O
military	O
personnel	O
)	O
reported	O
non-adherence	O
to	O
the	O
recommended	O
malaria	B-Disease
medication	O
regimen	O
.	O

Adherence	O
status	O
was	O
unknown	O
for	O
the	O
remaining	O
2	O
patients	O
.	O

Three	O
cases	O
occurred	O
in	O
Haitian	O
residents	O
who	O
traveled	O
to	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
,	O
including	O
one	O
Haitian	O
adoptee	O
.	O

The	O
number	O
of	O
U.S.	O
malaria	B-Disease
cases	O
imported	O
from	O
Haiti	B-Country
likely	O
is	O
underestimated	O
because	O
,	O
typically	O
,	O
not	O
all	O
cases	O
are	O
reported	O
to	O
CDC	O
.	O

Bacterial	O
contamination	O
was	O
being	O
blamed	O
Monday	O
,	O
17	O
Jun	O
2013	O
,	O
for	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
foodborne	O
illness	O
following	O
the	O
popular	O
Burger	O
&	O
Beer	O
Bash	O
in	O
Westchester	B-City
County	O
earlier	O
in	O
June	O
2013	O
.	O

The	O
county	O
Health	O
Department	O
said	O
that	O
the	O
_Campylobacter_	O
bacterium	O
was	O
to	O
blame	O
for	O
the	O
outbreak	O
at	O
the	O
6	O
Jun	O
2013	O
outdoor	O
food	O
festival	O
at	O
the	O
Kenisco	O
Dam	O
in	O
Valhalla	B-City
.	O

The	O
bacterium	O
was	O
identified	O
through	O
tests	O
on	O
samples	O
from	O
several	O
people	O
who	O
got	O
sick	O
at	O
the	O
event	O
.	O

The	O
department	O
did	O
not	O
specify	O
exactly	O
how	O
many	O
people	O
were	O
sickened	O
.	O

But	O
health	O
officials	O
have	O
not	O
determined	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
bacterium	O
,	O
since	O
most	O
attendees	O
ate	O
food	O
from	O
many	O
of	O
the	O
30	O
different	O
vendors	O
at	O
the	O
event	O
,	O
the	O
department	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
department	O
has	O
launched	O
an	O
investigation	O
and	O
has	O
been	O
interviewing	O
people	O
in	O
an	O
effort	O
to	O
trace	O
the	O
source	O
.	O

For	O
most	O
people	O
sickened	O
by	O
the	O
campylobacteriosis	B-Disease
outbreak	O
,	O
the	O
illness	O
will	O
resolve	O
without	O
medication	O
within	O
3	O
to	O
5	O
days	O
--	O
although	O
it	O
could	O
be	O
up	O
to	O
10	O
days	O
,	O
the	O
department	O
said	O
.	O

In	O
cases	O
where	O
a	O
person	O
's	O
immune	O
system	O
is	O
weakened	O
by	O
illness	O
or	O
medication	O
,	O
or	O
in	O
especially	O
severe	O
cases	O
,	O
antibiotics	O
may	O
be	O
prescribed	O
,	O
the	O
department	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Anyone	O
who	O
has	O
not	O
already	O
become	O
sick	O
following	O

Kansas	B-Province
officials	O
are	O
investigating	O
an	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
outbreak	O
among	O
people	O
who	O

an	O
annual	O
festival	O
at	O
Louisburg	B-City
Cider	O

,	O
with	O
the	O
cause	O
proving	O
elusive	O
after	O
initial	O

did	O

the	O
pathogen	O
in	O
the	O

,	O

.	O

coli_	O

Josh	O

.	O

for	O

ill.	O
''	O
``	O
According	O
to	O
the	O
CDC	O
,	O
staphylococcal	O
food	B-Disease
poisoning	I-Disease
results	O
from	O
eating	O
food	O
contaminated	O
with	O
toxins	O
produced	O
by	O
this	O
bacteria	O
.	O

The	O
toxin	O
can	O
cause	O
of	O
a	O
variety	O
of	O
symptoms	O
,	O
including	O
nausea	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
stomach	O
cramps	O
and	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
''	O
states	O
the	O
update	O
from	O
the	O
county	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
avoid	O
food	B-Disease
poisoning	I-Disease
by	O
_Staphylococcus	O
aureus_	O
is	O
to	O
prevent	O

food	O
from	O
being	O
held	O
at	O
room	O
temperature	O
for	O
more	O
than	O
2	O
hours	O
.	O
''	O

[	O
A	O
]	O
child	O
who	O
attended	O
Splendour	O
in	O
the	O
Grass	O
is	O
the	O
3rd	O
meningococcal	B-Disease
case	O
.	O

Splendour	O
in	O
the	O
Grass	O
festival	O
patrons	O
and	O

who	O
have	O
had	O
contact	O
with	O
them	O
are	O
being	O
urged	O
to	O
monitor	O
for	O
symptoms	O
of	O
meningococcal	B-Disease
disease	I-Disease
after	O
a	O
child	O
became	O
the	O
3rd	O
reveller	O
to	O
contract	O
the	O

.	O

Although	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
uncommon	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
severe	O
and	O
a	O

from	O

,	O
aged	O
in	O
his	O
40s	O
,	O
who	O
attended	O
the	O
festival	O
died	O
of	O
meningococcal	B-Disease
[	O
disease	O
]	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
are	O
urging	O
people	O
and	O
their	O
close	O
contacts	O
who	O
attended	O
the	O
event	O
in	O
the	O
North	O
Byron	O
Parklands	O
on	O
21-24	O
Jul	O
2022	O
to	O
be	O
alert	O
to	O
the	O
symptoms	O
of	O
meningococcal	B-Disease
disease	I-Disease
and	O
act	O
immediately	O
if	O
they	O
appear	O
,	O
''	O
NSW	O
Health	O
said	O
in	O
a	O
statement	O
issued	O
on	O
Friday	O
[	O
12	O
Aug	O
2022	O
]	O
.	O

So	O
far	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2022	O
]	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
17	O
cases	O
of	O
meningococcal	B-Disease
disease	I-Disease
reported	O
in	O
New	B-Province
South	I-Province
Wales	I-Province
(	O
NSW	O
)	O
.	O

Five	O
to	O
10	O
%	O
of	O
patients	O
with	O
meningococcal	B-Disease
disease	I-Disease
die	O
,	O
even	O
despite	O
rapid	O
treatment	O
,	O
NSW	O
Health	O
says	O
.	O

The	O
lowest	O
rates	O
of	O
childhood	O
vaccination	O
against	O
the	O
disease	O
are	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
where	O
the	O
festival	O
was	O
held	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
include	O
a	O
sudden	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
neck	O
stiffness	O
,	O
joint	O
pain	O
,	O
a	O
rash	O
of	O
red	O
spots	O
or	O
bruises	O
,	O
a	O
dislike	O
of	O
bright	O
lights	O
,	O
nausea	O
and	O
vomiting	O
,	O
but	O
not	O
all	O
the	O
symptoms	O
may	O
be	O
present	O
at	O
once	O
.	O

Children	O
under	O
5	O
and	O
15-	O
to	O
25-year-olds	O
are	O
at	O
the	O
greatest	O
risk	O
of	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
in	O
young	O
children	O
include	O
irritability	O
,	O
difficulty	O
walking	O
,	O
high-pitched	O
crying	O
and	O
refusing	O
food	O
.	O

People	O
can	O
carry	O
meningococcal	B-Disease
bacteria	O
in	O
their	O
throats	O
and	O
not	O
have	O
symptoms	O
,	O
but	O
pass	O
it	O
on	O
to	O
close	O
contacts	O
.	O

For	O
more	O
information	O
on	O
vaccination	O
or	O
symptoms	O
,	O
transmission	O
,	O
risks	O
and	O
treatment	O
of	O
meningococcal	B-Disease
,	O
go	O
to	O
the	O
NSW	O
Health	O
website	O
.	O

St.	O
Joseph	O
County	O
Health	O
Officer	O
Dr.	O
Thomas	O
A.	O
Felgerhas	O
announced	O
that	O
laboratory	O
tests	O
have	O
confirmed	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
as	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
gastrointestinal	O
outbreak	O
that	O
affected	O
106	O
students	O
attending	O
a	O
sport	O
camp	O
at	O
the	O
University	O
of	O
Notre	O
Dame	O
earlier	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

29	O
of	O
those	O
students	O
were	O
treated	O
and	O
released	O
from	O
local	O
emergency	O
departments	O
for	O
the	O
intestinal	O
illness	O
.	O

Norovirus	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
very	O
contagious	O
virus	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
common	O
``	O
stomach	O
bug	O
''	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
.	O

Norovirus	B-Virus
can	O
be	O
spread	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
,	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
,	O
or	O
by	O
touching	O
contaminated	O
surfaces	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
usually	O
occur	O
12-48	O
hours	O
after	O
exposure	O
,	O
and	O
include	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
stomach	O
pain	O
,	O
nausea	O
,	O
and	O
vomiting	O
.	O

Most	O
people	O
recover	O
in	O
1-3	O
days	O
,	O
but	O
remain	O
contagious	O
for	O
up	O
to	O
2	O
weeks	O
after	O
recovery	O
.	O

Hand	O
washing	O
is	O
the	O
most	O
effective	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
.	O

Wash	O
hands	O
with	O
warm	O
water	O
and	O
soap	O
for	O
at	O
least	O
20	O
seconds	O
,	O
and	O
be	O
sure	O
to	O
wash	O
hands	O
after	O
using	O
the	O
bathroom	O
,	O
after	O
changing	O
a	O
diaper	O
,	O
after	O
taking	O
care	O
of	O
someone	O
else	O
who	O
is	O
sick	O
,	O
and	O
before	O
eating	O
or	O
preparing/handling	O
food	O
.	O

After	O
throwing	O
up	O
or	O
having	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
immediately	O
clean	O
and	O
disinfect	O
contaminated	O
surface	O
using	O
a	O
chlorine	O
bleach	O
solution	O
with	O
a	O
concentration	O
of	O
1000-5000	O
ppm	O
(	O
5-25	O
tablespoons	O
of	O
household	O
bleach	O
per	O
gallon	O
of	O
water	O
)	O
or	O
other	O
disinfectant	O
registered	O
as	O
effective	O
against	O
Norovirus	B-Virus
by	O
the	O
Environmental	O
Protection	O
Agency	O
(	O
EPA	O
)	O
.	O

Those	O
who	O
are	O
ill	O
should	O
stay	O
home	O
,	O
preferably	O
at	O
least	O
3	O
days	O
after	O
symptoms	O
resolve	O
.	O

The	O
St.	O
Joseph	O
County	O
Health	O
Department	O
will	O
continue	O
to	O
work	O
with	O
the	O
University	O
of	O
Notre	O
Dame	O
and	O
the	O
Indiana	B-Province
State	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
to	O
gather	O
and	O
disseminate	O
information	O
.	O

Additional	O
information	O
about	O
Norovirus	B-Virus
can	O
be	O
found	O
on	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O

and	O

.	O

of	O

that	O
hit	O
tournament	O
participants	O

was	O
``	O
characteristic	O
of	O
a	O
norovirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
''	O
.	O

Highly	O
infectious	O
norovirus	B-Virus
causes	O
vomiting	O
and	O
diarrhea	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
spread	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
people	O
,	O
and	O
contaminated	O
food	O
and	O

.	O

Generally	O

is	O
present	O
in	O
the	O
community	O
in	O
various	O
strains	O
and	O
outbreaks	O
are	O
periodically	O
linked	O
to	O

,	O
such	O
as	O
hospitals	O
and	O
rest	O
homes	O
,	O
and	O
where	O
people	O
are	O
confined	O
in	O
close	O

with	O
each	O
other	O
.	O

Wards	O
in	O

in	O
Christchurch	B-City
and	O
Dunedin	O
have	O
been	O
closed	O
in	O
2007	O
through	O
norovirus	B-Virus
outbreaks	O
.	O

Dr	O
Humphrey	O
told	O
NZPA	O
(	O

Zealand	I-Country

)	O

]	O

``	O

''	O

's	O

.	O

norovirus	B-Virus
was	O

.	O

``	O

at	O

,	O
[	O

]	O
likely	O
to	O
have	O
been	O

virus	O
during	O
the	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
food	O
,	O
''	O
Dr.	O
Humphrey	O
said	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
the	O
pattern	O
of	O
illness	O
--	O
a	O
short	O
incubation	O
period	O
,	O
with	O
short-lived	O
symptoms	O
of	O
vomiting	O
and	O
diarrhoea	O
--	O
was	O
consistent	O
with	O
a	O
norovirus	B-Virus
outbreak	O
.	O

Norovirus	B-Virus
was	O
spread	O
directly	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
,	O
but	O
could	O
involve	O
an	O
``	O

vector	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
food	O
.	O
''	O

Computer	O
analysis	O
of	O
data	O
from	O
questionnaires	O

by	O

competitors	O
and	O

as	O

most	O

.	O

said	O

to	O

on	O
Wednesday	O
[	O

Apr	O
2007	O
]	O
helped	O

.	O

and	O
was	O

.	O

No	O

.	O

``	O

.	O

No	O

.	O

California	B-Province

[	O

]	O

that	O

in	O

cases	O

,	O

over	O
the	O

2	O

.	O

``	O
The	O
increase	O
in	O
congenital	O
syphilis	B-Disease
is	O
particularly	O
concerning	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Smith	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Congenital	O
syphilis	B-Disease
occurs	O
when	O
syphilis	O
is	O
transmitted	O
from	O
an	O
infected	O
mother	O
to	O
her	O
child	O
during	O
pregnancy	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
a	O
needless	O
tragedy	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
prevented	O
with	O
good	O
prenatal	O
care	O
and	O
timely	O
and	O
effective	O
treatment	O
.	O
''	O

From	O
2012	O
to	O
2014	O
,	O
the	O
annual	O
number	O
of	O
reported	O
early	O
syphilis	B-Disease
cases	O
among	O
women	O
more	O
than	O
doubled	O
from	O
248	O
cases	O
to	O
594	O
.	O

The	O
annual	O
number	O
of	O
reported	O
congenital	O
syphilis	B-Disease
cases	O
more	O
than	O
tripled	O
during	O
the	O
same	O
period	O
,	O
from	O
30	O
to	O
100	O
.	O

Syphilitic	O
stillbirths	O
also	O
increased	O
,	O
from	O
one	O
case	O
in	O
2012	O
to	O
6	O
cases	O
in	O
2014	O
.	O

The	O
increasing	O
trend	O
of	O
syphilis	B-Disease
among	O
women	O
appears	O
to	O
continue	O
in	O
2015	O
.	O

Most	O
of	O
the	O
congenital	O
syphilis	B-Disease
cases	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
Central	B-City
Valley	I-City
and	O
Los	B-City
Angeles	I-City
County	O
.	O

CDPH	O
has	O
not	O
identified	O
a	O
cause	O
for	O
the	O
increase	O
in	O
congenital	O
syphilis	B-Disease
,	O
which	O
is	O
often	O
associated	O
with	O
poverty	O
and	O

access	O
to	O

.	O

of	O

who	O

to	O

with	O
congenital	O
syphilis	B-Disease
did	O
not	O
receive	O
adequate	O
or	O
timely	O
prenatal	O
care	O
.	O

On	O
12	O
Apr	O
2017	O
,	O

Niger	B-Country
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
notified	O
WHO	O
of	O
a	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
E	I-Virus
virus	O
(	O

)	O
outbreak	O
in	O

Diffa	B-City
region	O

in	O

of	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

On	O
[	O
Wed	O
19	O

2017	O
]	O
,	O

EPPO	O
was	O

about	O
the	O
possible	O
presence	O
of	O
_Xylella	O
fastidiosa_	O
(	O
EPPO	O
A1	O
List	O
)	O
on	O
olive	O
trees	O
(	O
_Olea	O
europaea_	O
)	O
in	O
southern	O
Italy	B-Country
.	O

Shortly	O
after	O
,	O
the	O
NPPO	O
of	O
Italy	B-Country
provided	O
information	O
about	O
the	O

of	O
_X	O
.	O

fastidiosa_	O
in	O
the	O
[	O
olive	O
]	O
disease	O
that	O
is	O
currently	O
observed	O
.	O

An	O
extensive	O
leaf	B-Disease
scorch	I-Disease
and	O
dieback	O
of	O
olive	O
trees	O
is	O
spreading	O
rapidly	O
in	O
the	O
Puglia	B-Province
region	O
.	O

To	O
identify	O
the	O
possible	O
causal	O
agent	O
,	O
surveys	O
were	O
carried	O
out	O
.	O

Symptomatic	O
olive	O
trees	O
(	O
many	O
of	O
them	O
were	O
a	O
century	O
old	O
)	O
revealed	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
extensive	O
brown	O
discolouration	O
of	O
the	O
vascular	O
system	O
.	O

Fungal	O
species	O
of	O
genus	O
_Phaeoacremonium_	O
and	O
genus	O
_Phaeomoniella_	O
were	O
found	O
.	O

Samples	O
from	O
olive	O
trees	O
were	O
subjected	O
to	O
molecular	O
analysis	O
specific	O
for	O
_X	O
.	O

fastidiosa_	O
which	O
gave	O
positive	O
results	O
.	O

The	O
analysis	O
was	O
extended	O
to	O
almond	O
(	O
_Prunus	O
dulcis_	O
)	O
and	O
oleander	O
(	O
_Nerium	O
oleander_	O
)	O
plants	O
which	O
were	O
growing	O
in	O
the	O
vicinity	O
of	O
affected	O
olive	O
trees	O
and	O
showing	O
symptoms	O
of	O
leaf	B-Disease
scorch	I-Disease
.	O

The	O
results	O
were	O
also	O
positive	O
.	O

Further	O
serological	O
tests	O
confirmed	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
_X	O
.	O

fastidiosa_	O
.	O

The	O
NPPO	O
stressed	O
that	O
the	O
definitive	O
identification	O
of	O
the	O
bacterium	O
still	O
awaits	O
its	O
isolation	O
in	O
pure	O
culture	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
perform	O
pathogenicity	O
tests	O
.	O

(	O
s	O
)	O
.	O

Surveys	O
are	O
being	O

out	O
in	O
Puglia	B-Province
to	O
delimit	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
infected	O

.	O

is	O

to	O

.	O

Korea	I-Country

3100	O

outbreak	O

the	O

,	O

.	O

FMD	O
is	O
often	O
fatal	O
[	O
see	O
comment	O
]	O
for	O
cloven-hoofed	O
animals	O
including	O
cows	O
,	O
sheep	O
,	O
pigs	O
and	O
goats	O
,	O
causing	O
blisters	O
on	O
the	O
mouth	O
and	O
feet	O
.	O

It	O
does	O
not	O
affect	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
last	O
hit	O
South	B-Country
Korea	I-Country
in	O
2002	O
when	O
some	O
160	O
000	O
pigs	O
either	O
died	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
or	O
were	O
slaughtered	O
to	O
prevent	O
its	O
spread	O
.	O

The	O
Georgia	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Public	O
Health	O
Northwest	O
Health	O
District	O
has	O
concluded	O
that	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
foodborne	O
illness	O
outbreak	O
related	O
to	O
a	O
catered	O
Thanksgiving	O
meal	O
employee	O
event	O
at	O
Toyo	O
Tire	O
in	O
White	B-City
,	O
GA	O
on	O
14	O
and	O
15	O
Nov	O
2017	O
was	O
salmonellosis	B-Disease
.	O

The	O
determination	O
is	O
based	O
on	O
multiple	O
positive	O
lab-test	O
results	O
for	O
salmonella	B-Virus
from	O
employees	O
who	O
attended	O
the	O
event	O
.	O

There	O
have	O
been	O
5	O
hospitalizations	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

The	O
specific	O
food	O
source	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
identified	O
by	O
officials	O
.	O

The	O
permitted	O
Bartow	O
County	O
restaurant	O
in	O
Cartersville	O
,	O
GA	O
that	O
catered	O
the	O
event	O
has	O
voluntarily	O
closed	O
and	O
will	O
remained	O
closed	O
until	O
the	O
week	O
of	O
27	O
Nov	O
2017	O
.	O

Employees	O
of	O
the	O
restaurant	O
have	O
received	O
rigorous	O
training	O
in	O
safe	O
food	O
handling	O
from	O
Bartow	O
County	O
Health	O
Department	O
environmental	O

.	O

as	O

's	O

and	O

,	O

.	O

Health	O
Department	O

to	O

who	O

the	O
event	O

have	O

.	O

.	O

,	O

.	O

to	O

.	O

Mr	O

A	O
diphtheria	B-Disease
outbreak	O
has	O
killed	O
73	O
people	O
in	O
war-torn	O
Yemen	B-Country
since	O
August	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
(	O
WHO	O
)	O
on	O
.	O

In	O
a	O

,	O
the	O
UN	O
agency	O
said	O
some	O
1294	O
suspected	O
cases	O
of	O

have	O
been	O
recorded	O
in	O
20	O
of	O
Yemen	B-Country
's	O
23	O
provinces	O
.	O

It	O
listed	O
Ibb	B-Province
and	O
al-Hodeidah	B-Province
provinces	O
in	O
central	O
and	O
western	O
Yemen	B-Country
as	O
the	O
hardest-hit	O
by	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Diphtheria	B-Disease
spreads	O
as	O
easily	O
as	O
the	O
common	O
cold	O
through	O
sneezing	O
,	O
coughing	O
,	O

even	O
talking	O

according	O
to	O

.	O

,	O
diphtheria	B-Disease
can	O
cause	O
devastating	O
epidemics	O
if	O
left	O
unchecked	O
.	O

Yemen	B-Country
has	O
been	O
racked	O
by	O
violence	O
since	O
2014	O
,	O
when	O
Houthi	O
rebels	O
overran	O
much	O
of	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

The	O
conflict	O
escalated	O
in	O
2015	O
when	O
Saudi	O
Arabia	O
and	O
its	O
allies	O
launched	O
a	O
devastating	O
air	O
campaign	O
aimed	O
at	O
rolling	O
back	O
Houthi	O
gains	O
.	O

ongoing	O

has	O

,	O

and	O

to	O

as	O

``	O

's	O

in	O
modern	O

''	O
.	O

of	O

.	O

(	O
_Cyprinus	O

(	O

16	O
C	O
[	O
60	O

]	O
)	O

may	O

up	O

contact	O
,	O
and	O
also	O
via	O
angling	O
equipment	O

.	O
''	O

``	O

.	O

virus	O
for	O

:	O
``	O

''	O

If	O

.	O

to	O

,	O

.	O

COVID	O
spreads	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
through	O
small	O

,	O

and	O

when	O

with	O
the	O

or	O
touch	O
them	O
.	O

Senecavirus	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
confirmed	O
in	O
Ontario	B-Province

away	O

of	O

Senecavirus	O

Ontario	O
.	O

Senecavirus	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
(	O
formerly	O
called	O
Seneca	O
Valley	O
virus	O
or	O
SVV	O
)	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
in	O
Ontario	B-Province
.	O

Clinical	O
signs	O
of	O
this	O
disease	O
closely	O
resemble	O
foot-and-mouth	O
disease	O
,	O
so	O

U.S.	O

have	O
turned	O
away	O
at	O

8	O
truckloads	O
of	O
pigs	O
which	O
apparently	O
showed	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
Canadian	O
Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
is	O
testing	O
all	O
swine	O
at	O
federal	O
processing	O
plants	O
that	O
are	O

.	O

Processing	O
plants	O
can	O

shut	O
down	O
up	O
to	O
72	O
hours	O
while	O
testing	O
is	O
being	O
conducted	O

the	O
flow	O
of	O

and	O

of	O
pork	O
products	O
from	O
that	O

.	O

is	O
shut	O
down	O
,	O
its	O
customers	O
and	O
suppliers	O
will	O
be	O

pending	O

and	O
product	O
delays/cancellations	O
.	O

Manitoba	O
producers	O
should	O
take	O
the	O
following	O
biosecurity	O
measures	O
.	O

-	O
Know	O
the	O
symptoms	O
of	O
Senecavirus	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
(	O
blisters/vesicles	O
or	O

of	O
the	O

,	O

,	O
and/or	O
just	O
above	O
the	O
hoof	O
;	O

,	O

,	O

;	O

;	O
4	O

African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
general	O
contagious	O
disease	O
affecting	O
pigs	O
(	O
domestic	O
and	O
wild	O
boars	O
)	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
almost	O
always	O
fatal	O
and	O
incurable	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
way	O
to	O
protect	O
the	O
pigs	O
with	O
preventive	O
vaccination	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
directly	O
from	O
animal	O
to	O
animal	O
or	O
indirectly	O
via	O
contaminated	O
objects	O
(	O
clothing	O
,	O
shoes	O
,	O
vehicles	O
)	O
and	O
food	O
moved	O
to	O
other	O
areas	O
by	O
humans	O
.	O

ASF	O
is	O
not	O
contagious	O
or	O
dangerous	O
for	O
humans	O
or	O
other	O
animal	O
species	O
.	O

A	O
panda	O
in	O
northwest	O
China	B-Country
's	O
Shaanxi	B-Province
Province	O
has	O

.	O

4	O

Canine	B-Virus
distemper	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
affects	O
the	O
gastrointestinal	O
and	O
respiratory	O
tract	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
the	O
spinal	O
cord	O
and	O
the	O
brain	O
.	O

The	O
infected	O
animals	O
usually	O
have	O
signs	O
including	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
eye	O
inflammation	O
,	O
coughing	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
lethargy	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
highly	O
contagious	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
high	O
fatality	O
rate	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
commonly	O
spread	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
body	O
fluids	O
or	O
contaminated	O
food	O
and	O
water	O
.	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

Health	O
officials	O
confirmed	O
on	O
Saturday	O
,	O
that	O
41	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
with	O
anthrax	B-Disease
,	O
a	O
deadly	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
notoriously	O
used	O
in	O
biological	O
warfare	O
,	O
after	O
they	O
ate	O
the	O
meat	O
from	O
2	O
carabaos	O
that	O
had	O
died	O
from	O
sickness	O
in	O
Villaviciosa	B-City
town	O
.	O

Dr	O
Myrna	O
Cabotaje	O
,	O
director	O
of	O
the	O
Center	O
for	O
Health	O
Development	O
(	O
CHD	O
)	O
in	O
Cordillera	B-Province
,	O
said	O
the	O
victims	O
were	O
lucky	O
that	O
none	O
of	O
them	O
died	O
.	O

Cabotaje	O
said	O
the	O
situation	O
has	O
been	O
put	O
under	O
control	O
after	O
antibiotics	O
were	O
immediately	O
distributed	O
to	O
the	O
residents	O
to	O
mitigate	O
the	O
effects	O
of	O
the	O
anthrax	B-Disease
disease	O
.	O

Based	O
on	O
the	O
report	O
from	O
the	O
National	O
Epidemiology	O
and	O
Surveillance	O
Center	O
,	O
which	O
conducted	O
a	O

in	O
the	O
town	O
after	O
the	O
reported	O
anthrax	B-Disease
outbreak	O
,	O
there	O
were	O
41	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
.	O

Most	O
of	O
the	O
patients	O
were	O
men	O
but	O
all	O
of	O
them	O
had	O
skin	O
lesions	O
.	O

Cabotaje	O
explained	O
that	O
a	O
suspected	O
anthrax	B-Disease
case	O
would	O
experience	O
pruritic	O
(	O
itchy	O
)	O
skin	O
lesions	O
from	O
which	O
lesions	O
progressed	O
from	O
papule	O
(	O
raised	O
portion	O
of	O
skin	O
)	O
,	O
to	O
vesicle	O
(	O
skin	O
lesion	O
with	O
fluid	O
)	O
,	O
then	O
to	O
a	O
black	O
eschar	O
and	O
may	O
be	O
accompanied	O
by	O
edema	O
(	O
swelling	O
)	O
or	O
abdominal	O
pain	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
dyspnea	O
(	O
difficulty	O
in	O
breathing	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
fever	O
.	O

The	O
Research	O
Institute	O
of	O
Tropical	O
Medicine	O
(	O

)	O
conducted	O
the	O
laboratory	O
tests	O
that	O
confirmed	O
2	O
samples	O
from	O
swabbed	O
lesions	O
were	O
positive	O
for	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
or	O
anthrax	B-Disease
.	O

said	O

the	O
patients	O

that	O

all	O

A	O
vegetable	O
farm	O
in	O
Chongpyong	B-City
County	I-City
suffered	O
from	O
poor	O
crop	O
yields	O
due	O
to	O
pests	O
and	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
farm	O
produces	O
cabbage	O
and	O
cucumber	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
cabbage	O
began	O
rotting	O
from	O
the	O
roots	O
and	O
falling	O
apart	O
due	O
to	O
damage	O
from	O
an	O
unidentified	B-Disease
disease	I-Disease
,	O
along	O
with	O
pests	O
.	O

The	O
farm	O
was	O
only	O
able	O
to	O
meet	O
40	O
%	O
of	O
its	O
production	O
target	O
.	O

The	O
farmers	O
attempted	O
to	O

situation	O
on	O
their	O
own	O
,	O
but	O
were	O
ultimately	O
unable	O
to	O

so	O
.	O

[	O

]	O
requested	O
that	O
authorities	O

to	O
resolve	O
the	O
problem	O
,	O

and	O

would	O

.	O

The	O

quickly	O
formed	O
a	O

``	O

''	O
[	O
which	O
]	O
discovered	O
that	O

.	O

This	O

.	O

]	O

last	O

[	O

.	O

,	O

of	O
165	O

[	O
74	O
C	O
]	O
should	O
kill	O
_Salmonella_	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
United	B-Country
Kingdom	I-Country
,	O
the	O
largest	O
outbreak	O
in	O
20	O
years	O
of	O
whooping	B-Disease
cough	I-Disease
is	O
taking	O

.	O

However	O

announced	O
that	O
cases	O
have	O
fallen	O
off	O
slightly	O
.	O

In	O

for	O

1st	O

in	O
the	O

18	O

warned	O
that	O

cough	I-Disease
does	O
generally	O

[	O

have	O

cough	O

.	O

.	O

free	O
from	O
both	O

.	O

The	O

Agency	O
(	O

)	O
says	O

Blossom	O
Farm	O

's	O

look	O
or	O
smell	O
spoiled	O
but	O
can	O
still	O
make	O
you	O
sick	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
can	O
include	O
nausea	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
fatigue	O
,	O
dizziness	O
,	O
blurred	O
or	O
double	O
vision	O
,	O
dry	O
mouth	O
,	O
respiratory	O
failure	O
,	O
and	O
paralysis	O
.	O

The	O
CFIA	O
says	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
no	O
reported	O
illnesses	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
relish	O
.	O

Biotechnology	O
company	O
,	O
Ridgeback	O
Biotherapeutics	O
,	O
announced	O
recently	O
that	O
the	O
U.S.	O
Food	O
and	O
Drug	O
Administration	O
(	O
FDA	O
)	O
approved	O
EbangaTM	O
for	O
the	O
treatment	O
of	O
Ebola	O
.	O

Ebanga	O
is	O
now	O
approved	O
for	O
treatment	O
of	O
infection	O
caused	O
by	O
_Zaire	O
ebolavirus_	O
in	O
adult	O
and	O
pediatric	O
patients	O
(	O
including	O
neonates	O
born	O
to	O
a	O
mother	O
who	O
is	O
RT-PCR	O
positive	O
for	O
_Zaire	O
ebolavirus_	O
infection	O
)	O
.	O

Ebanga	O
is	O
the	O
only	O
FDA	O
approved	O
,	O
single	O
injection	O
Ebola	O
treatment	O
which	O
is	O
available	O
in	O
a	O
lyophilized	O
form	O
.	O

Ebanga	O
(	O
ansuvimab-zykl	O
,	O
formerly	O
referred	O
to	O
as	O
mAb114	O
)	O
is	O
a	O
monoclonal	O
antibody	O
isolated	O
from	O
a	O
human	O
survivor	O
of	O
the	O
1995	O
Ebola	O
outbreak	O
in	O
Kikwit	O
,	O
a	O
city	O
in	O
the	O
DRC	O
.	O

Wendy	O
Holman	O
,	O
CEO	O

of	O
Ridgeback	O
,	O

``	O

.	O

''	O

fever	I-Virus

The	O
Minister	O
said	O

a	O

for	O

of	O

any	O

this	O

season	O
.	O

Last	O
year	O
[	O
2009	O
]	O
the	O
government	O
invested	O
some	O
500	O
million	O
shillings	O
to	O
undertake	O
the	O
off-take	O
exercise	O
during	O
the	O
drought	O
.	O

RVF	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
hemorrhagic	O
fever	O
which	O
primarily	O
affects	O
animals	O
but	O
can	O
also	O
infect	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
also	O
results	O
in	O
significant	O
economic	O
losses	O
due	O
to	O
death	O
and	O
abortion	O
among	O
animals	O
infected	O
.	O

A	O
probable	O
case	O
occurs	O
when	O
a	O
person	O
or	O
animal	O
has	O
acute	O
fever	O
with	O
unexplained	O
bleeding	O
in	O
stool	O
,	O
vomit	O
,	O
sputum	O
,	O
gums	O
,	O
nose	O
,	O
skin	O
and	O
eyes	O
.	O

The	O
vision	O
deteriorates	O
,	O
altered	O
[	O
and	O
]	O
then	O
loses	O
consciousness	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
was	O
1st	O
identified	O
in	O
1931	O
during	O
an	O
investigation	O
into	O
an	O
epidemic	O
among	O
sheep	O
on	O
a	O
farm	O
in	O
the	O
Rift	O
Valley	O
of	O
Kenya	B-Country
.	O

A	O
major	O
outbreak	O
occurred	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
In	O
1997-98	O
,	O
during	O
the	O
El-Nino	O
rains	O
.	O

In	O
December	O
2006	O
,	O
several	O
deaths	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
Garissa	O
District	O
.	O

Other	O
hemorrhagic	O
fevers	O
that	O
occur	O
in	O
sub-Saharan	O
Africa	O
are	O
yellow	O
fever	O
,	O
Ebola	O
,	O
Crimean-Congo	O
hemorrhagic	O
fever	O
,	O
and	O
dengue	O
viruses	O
.	O

More	O
than	O
30	O
000	O
cattle	O
have	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
against	O
anthrax	B-Disease
in	O
Bikita	B-City
and	O
Gutu	B-City
districts	O
in	O
Masvingo	B-Province
Province	I-Province
following	O
the	O
outbreak	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O

,	O
an	O

has	O
said	O
.	O

in	O
the	O
wake	O
of	O

continued	O
to	O

with	O
anthrax	B-Disease
as	O
the	O
districts	O
have	O

70	O
patients	O

have	O
also	O

as	O
of	O
.	O

and	O
Gutu	B-City

a	O

.	O

``	O

Arkansas	B-Province
A	O
family	O
's	O
pet	O
dog	O
,	O
living	O
in	O
the	O
community	O
of	O
Imboden	O
in	O
Lawrence	B-City
County	I-City
,	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
rabid	O
by	O
the	O
Arkansas	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
this	O
week	O
.	O

The	O
dog	O
became	O
ill	O
around	O
25	O
Jan	O
2010	O
,	O
and	O
progressively	O
declined	O
until	O
it	O
was	O
euthanized	O
and	O
submitted	O
for	O
rabies	B-Virus
testing	O
.	O

Several	O
people	O
who	O
were	O
exposed	O
to	O
the	O
dog	O
will	O
be	O
undergoing	O
a	O
series	O
of	O
rabies	B-Virus
vaccinations	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
development	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
dog	O
was	O
an	O
inside/outside	O
dog	O
and	O
stayed	O
in	O
a	O
fenced	O
yard	O
when	O
outside	O
,	O
but	O
had	O
not	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
against	O
rabies	B-Virus
.	O

The	O
dog	O
had	O
been	O
sprayed	O
by	O
a	O
skunk	O
a	O
month	O
or	O
2	O
ago	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
transmitted	O
in	O
skunk	O
spray	O
.	O

Undoubtedly	O
he	O
had	O
been	O
bitten	O
as	O
well	O
,	O
although	O
no	O
skunk	O
was	O
seen	O
or	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
yard	O
.	O

New	B-Province
Jersey	I-Province
A	O
raccoon	O
recently	O
captured	O
here	O
has	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
rabies	B-Virus
after	O
getting	O
into	O
a	O
fight	O
with	O
a	O
dog	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
Ocean	O
County	O
Health	O
Department	O
.	O

The	O
owner	O
of	O
the	O
dog	O
,	O
a	O
local	O
resident	O
,	O
was	O
exposed	O
to	O
the	O
rabies	B-Virus
virus	O
through	O
the	O
saliva	O
of	O
the	O
raccoon	O
while	O

for	O
his	O
pet	O
after	O
the	O

Jennifer	O
Crawford	O
,	O
supervisor	O
of	O

for	O

.	O

The	O
man	O
,	O
whom	O

did	O
not	O

,	O
is	O
receiving	O
rabies	B-Virus

.	O

The	O
dog	O
was	O
vaccinated	O
against	O
rabies	B-Virus
and	O
has	O
been	O
given	O
a	O
booster	O
shot	O
since	O
the	O
incident	O
.	O

Dr	O
Ella	O
Boyd	O
,	O
county	O
public	O
health	O
coordinator	O
,	O
said	O
rabies	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
year-round	O
concern	O
in	O
Ocean	O
County	O
.	O

``	O
Rabies	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
virus	O
that	O
is	O
present	O
mainly	O
in	O
the	O
saliva	O
of	O
rabid	O
animals	O
.	O

In	O
Ocean	O
County	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
most	O
prevalent	O
in	O
raccoons	O
,	O
skunks	O
,	O
foxes	O
,	O
and	O
bats	O
,	O
although	O
rabies	B-Virus
has	O
also	O
been	O
detected	O
in	O
feral	O
cats	O
,	O
''	O
Boyd	O
said	O
in	O
a	O
prepared	O
release	O
.	O

vCJD	O
statistics	O
The	O
number	O
of	O
deaths	O
due	O
to	O
definite	O
or	O
probable	O
vCJD	O
as	O
of	O
Mon	O
2	O
Apr	O
2012	O
remains	O
176	O
.	O

No	O
definite/probable	O
patient	O
remains	O
alive	O
,	O
so	O
the	O
total	O
number	O
of	O
definite	O
or	O
probable	O
vCJD	O
cases	O
(	O
dead	O
and	O
alive	O
)	O
remains	O
176	O
.	O

The	O
overall	O
picture	O
remains	O
consistent	O
with	O
the	O
view	O
that	O
the	O
vCJD	O
outbreak	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O
is	O
in	O
decline	O
,	O
albeit	O
now	O
with	O
a	O
pronounced	O
tail	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
cases	O
were	O
observed	O
in	O
1995	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
peak	O
number	O
of	O
deaths	O
was	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
outbreak	O
in	O
Louisville	B-City
.	O

The	O

was	O

in	O

of	O
2017	O
.	O

As	O
of	O
,	O

3	O

.	O

The	O
Louisville	B-City
Metro	O
Department	O
of	O
Public	O

and	O
Wellness	O
continues	O
to	O
work	O
to	O
control	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
acute	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
that	O
has	O
centered	O
in	O
the	O
city	O
's	O
homeless	O
,	O
people	O
with	O
unstable	O

who	O
with	O

use	O
(	O

)	O
.	O

Hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
vaccine-preventable	O
,	O
communicable	O
disease	O
of	O
the	O
liver	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
virus	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
usually	O
transmitted	O
person-to-person	O
through	O
the	O
fecal-oral	O
route	O
or	O
consumption	O
of	O
contaminated	O
food	O
or	O
water	O
.	O

The	O
best	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
infection	I-Disease
is	O
to	O
get	O
vaccinated	O
.	O

As	O
of	O
at	O
least	O
almost	O
67	O
000	O
people	O
living	O
in	O
our	O
region	O
have	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
by	O
us	O
and	O
our	O
community	O
partners	O
.	O

Of	O
those	O
,	O
more	O
than	O
5700	O
food	O
service	O
workers	O
have	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
.	O

with	O
629	O
cases	O
and	O
6	O
deaths	O
with	O
about	O
45	O
new	O
cases	O
per	O
week	O
.	O

The	O
city	O
should	O
be	O
applauded	O
for	O
its	O
aggressive	O
approach	O
to	O
immunizing	O
food	O
handlers	O
.	O

AK	O
is	O
an	O
animal	O
handler	O
.	O

The	O
National	O
Institute	O
for	O

Diseases	O
(	O
NICD	O
)	O
in	O
South	O
Africa	O

the	O

cholera	B-Disease
in	O
a	O

Zimbabwe	B-Country
.	O

29	O
Sep	O
2018	O
(	O

.	O

a	O

,	O

.	O

,	O
and	O

.	O

Household	O

were	O

and	O
borehole	O
and	O
tap	O
water	O
samples	O
collected	O
for	O
investigations	O
.	O

Household	O
contacts	O
are	O
currently	O
under	O
surveillance	O
.	O

Cholera	B-Disease
is	O
typically	O
transmitted	O
through	O
drinking	O
water	O
or	O
food	O
contaminated	O
with	O
cholera	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
cholera	B-Disease
can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
following	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
infective	O
material	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
stool	O
or	O
vomitus	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
transmission	O
within	O
households	O
is	O
not	O
uncommon	O
.	O

In	O
this	O
case	O
,	O
the	O
risk	O
for	O
further	O
spread	O
in	O
the	O
community	O
is	O
negligible	O
.	O

Further	O
testing	O
at	O
NICD	O
has	O
confirmed	O
that	O
the	O
isolate	O
is	O
a	O
toxin-producing	O
_Vibrio	O
cholerae_	O
serotype	O
Ogawa	O
,	O
and	O
is	O
multidrug	O
resistant	O
;	O
it	O
is	O
resistant	O
to	O
most	O
1st-line	O
antimicrobials	O
including	O
tetracycline	O
,	O
co-trimoxazole	O
,	O
doxycycline	O
,	O
and	O
ciprofloxacin	O
)	O
but	O
is	O
susceptible	O
to	O
azithromycin	O
.	O

The	O
mainstay	O
of	O
cholera	B-Disease
treatment	O
is	O
fluid	O
replacement	O
;	O
mild-to-moderate	O
cases	O
may	O
be	O
treated	O
with	O
oral	O
rehydration	O
fluid	O
,	O
but	O
severe	O
cases	O
require	O
hospitalisation	O
and	O
intravenous	O
fluid	O
administration	O
.	O

Antimicrobial	O
treatment	O
is	O
recommended	O
for	O
patients	O
with	O
moderate	O
to	O
severe	O
dehydration	O
,	O
as	O
it	O
reduces	O
disease	O
severity	O
and	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
further	O
transmission	O
;	O
azithromycin	O
is	O
the	O
antimicrobial	O
of	O
choice	O
for	O
this	O
strain	O
.	O

The	O
public	O
are	O
urged	O
to	O
drink	O
water	O
from	O
safe	O
water	O
sources	O
,	O
ensure	O
good	O
hand	O
hygiene	O
before	O
and	O
after	O
using	O
the	O
toilet	O
,	O
and	O
before	O
and	O
after	O
handling	O
food	O
.	O

South	O
African	O
healthcare	O
workers	O
are	O
advised	O
to	O
suspect	O
cholera	B-Disease
in	O
any	O
individual	O
with	O
acute	O
onset	O
of	O
watery	O
diarrhea	O
.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
_Potato	O
spindle	B-Disease
tuber	I-Disease
viroid_	O
(	O
PSTVd	O
)	O

at	O
a	O
tomato	O
production	O
nursery	O
in	O
the	O
north	O
of	O
England	B-Province
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
2nd	O
outbreak	O
of	O
this	O
viroid	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
was	O
in	O
Kent	O
in	O
2003	O
,	O
also	O
on	O
a	O
tomato	O
crop	O
.	O

The	O
viroid	O
is	O
listed	O
as	O
a	O

organism	O
in	O
EU	O
.	O

UK	O

in	O

to	O
prevent	O

and	O

fruit	O
.	O

Fera	O
are	O

cause	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
and	O
whether	O

.	O

PSTVd	O
is	O
closely	O
related	O
to	O
_Columnea	O
latent	O
viroid_	O
(	O
CLVd	O
)	O
and	O
_Tomato	O

(	O

)	O

was	O
confirmed	O
in	O
2007	O
and	O
2009	O
in	O
4	O
tomato	O
production	O
nurseries	O
in	O
the	O
UK	O

and	O
both	O

and	O

are	O
occasionally	O
found	O
in	O
solanaceous	O

where	O

are	O

.	O

There	O

.	O

.	O

The	O
highly	O
contagious	O
upper	O
respiratory	O
disease	O
of	O
equids	O
,	O
known	O
as	O
strangles	B-Disease
,	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
gram-positive	O
B-hemolytic	O
bacterium	O
_Streptococcus	O
equi_	O
ssp	O
.	O

_equi_	O
.	O

The	O
organism	O
,	O
_Streptococcus	O
equi_	O
ssp._	O
equi_	O
,	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
via	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
nasal	O
or	O
ocular	O
secretions	O
or	O
lymph	O
node	O
discharge	O
from	O
infected	O
horses	O
or	O
via	O
indirect	O
exposure	O
to	O
contaminated	O
trailers	O
,	O
stalls	O
,	O
riding	O
equipment	O
,	O
buckets	O
,	O
halters	O
,	O
lead	O
ropes	O
,	O
brushes	O
,	O
clothing	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

The	O
incubation	O
period	O
typically	O
ranges	O
between	O
2	O
and	O
6	O
days	O
but	O
may	O
last	O
up	O
to	O
14	O
days	O
.	O

Classic	O
signs	O
may	O
include	O
fever	O
(	O
103	O
F	O
[	O
39.4	O
C	O
]	O
or	O
higher	O
)	O
,	O
mucopurulent	O
nasal	O
discharge	O
,	O
lymphadenopathy	O
(	O
with	O
or	O
without	O
abscessation	O
)	O
,	O
general	O
malaise	O
,	O
pharyngitis	O
,	O
dysphagia	O
,	O
upper	O
airway	O
stridor	O
and	O
respiratory	O
distress	O
.	O

Clinical	O
signs	O
are	O
often	O
age-related	O
,	O
with	O
older	O
horses	O
exhibiting	O
milder	O
signs	O
of	O
shorter	O
duration	O
.	O

A	O
fungal	O
disease	O
,	O
a	O
systemic	O
form	O
of	O
downy	B-Disease
mildew	I-Disease
,	O
is	O
causing	O
entire	O
paddock	O
losses	O
in	O
poppy	O
growing	O
regions	O
across	O
Tasmania	B-Province
.	O

Downy	B-Disease
mildew	I-Disease
stunts	O
plant	O
growth	O
,	O
yellows	O
the	O
leaves	O
and	O
has	O
spores	O
that	O
can	O
travel	O
hundreds	O
of	O
kilometres	O
in	O
the	O
air	O
.	O

Poppy	O
Growers	O
Tasmania	B-Province
president	O
Glynn	O
Williams	O
says	O
that	O
while	O
mildew	O
has	O
been	O
in	O
Tasmania	O
for	O
over	O
a	O
decade	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
behaving	O
differently	O
this	O
season	O
.	O

The	O
presence	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
has	O
sparked	O
a	O
coordinated	O
,	O
industry-wide	O
response	O
,	O
[	O
including	O
]	O
the	O
Tasmanian	O
Department	O
of	O
Primary	O
Industries	O
,	O
companies	O
,	O
the	O
Tasmanian	O
Institute	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
,	O
and	O
Poppy	O
Growers	O
Tasmania	B-Province
.	O

The	O
island	O
state	O
grows	O
almost	O
half	O
the	O
world	O
's	O
supply	O
of	O
opium	O
poppies	O
.	O

Growers	O
are	O

that	O
some	O
crop	O

could	O
be	O
write-offs	O
and	O
commonly	O
used	O
fungicides	O
have	O
proved	O

in	O

the	O
mildew	O
,	O
because	O
of	O
its	O

.	O

.	O

Tasmanian	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

2	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

Measles	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
serious	O
and	O
highly	O
contagious	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
can	O
cause	O
complications	O
and	O
can	O
even	O
prove	O
fatal	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
starts	O
with	O
cold	O
or	O
flu-like	O
symptoms	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
rash	O
after	O
2-4	O
days	O
.	O

Public	O
Health	O
Wales	B-Province
said	O
crowds	O
of	O
people	O
provide	O
the	O
``	O
perfect	O
environment	O
''	O
for	O
infectious	O
diseases	O
like	O
measles	B-Virus
to	O
circulate	O
,	O
but	O
2	O
doses	O
of	O
the	O
safe	O
and	O
effective	O
MMR	O
vaccine	O
offer	O
protection	O
.	O

Dr	O
Christopher	O
Johnson	O
,	O
acting	O
consultant	O
in	O
health	O
protection	O
for	O
Public	O
Health	O
Wales	B-Province
,	O
said	O
:	O
``	O
We	O
know	O
both	O
these	O
cases	O
attended	O
the	O
festival	O
and	O
are	O
therefore	O
asking	O
anyone	O
else	O
who	O
attended	O
to	O
be	O
aware	O
of	O
the	O
symptoms	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
.	O

``	O
Many	O
people	O
who	O
catch	O
measles	B-Virus
will	O
have	O
a	O
fever	O
,	O
cough	O
,	O
red	O
eyes	O
,	O
and	O
blocked	O
nose	O
and	O
feel	O
generally	O
unwell	O
.	O

The	O

Measles	B-Virus
is	O
highly	O
contagious	O
.	O

The	O

can	O
be	O

through	O

.	O

against	O
the	O
virus	O

of	O

the	O
disease	O
.	O

.	O

is	O

said	O
,	O
but	O
the	O

's	O

members	O
are	O
being	O
[	O

]	O
vaccine	O
.	O

Most	O

who	O

of	O
rabies	B-Virus
do	O

.	O

.	O

of	O

Department	O

(	I-Disease

)	I-Disease
[	I-Disease
infection	I-Disease
]	I-Disease

2010	O
.	O

Leprosy	B-Disease
is	O
a	O

infectious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
_Mycobacterium	O
leprae._	O
The	O

,	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
upper	O

the	O

.	O

is	O
curable	O
and	O
treatment	O
provided	O
in	O
the	O
early	O
stages	O
averts	O
disability	O
.	O

,	O
made	O
available	O
by	O
WHO	O
free	O
of	O
charge	O
to	O
all	O
patients	O
worldwide	O
since	O
1995	O

for	O

of	O

disease	O
characterized	O
by	O
a	O
high	O
temperature	O
and	O
red	O
spots	O
all	O
over	O
the	O
body	O
.	O

Large	O

outbreaks	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
in	O
30	O
African	O
countries	O
threaten	O
to	O

against	O
the	O

in	O
the	O
past	O
2	O

(	O

)	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

.	O

ahead	O

.	O

Leishmaniasis	B-Disease
is	O
a	O

disease	O
spread	O
to	O
humans	O
by	O
bites	O
of	O
sandflies	O
that	O
are	O
usually	O
active	O
from	O
May	O
to	O
September	O
each	O
year	O
.	O

Deputy	O

Olga	O
Dulovic	O
of	O
Belgrade	O
's	O
Clinic	O
for	O
Infectious	O
and	O

reported	O
on	O

that	O
the	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
[	O

]	O
has	O
claimed	O
the	O

of	O
3	O

people	O
in	O
Serbia	B-Country
.	O

[	O

]	O
,	O
and	O

,	O

.	O

,	O

that	O

with	O

,	O

by	O

.	O

,	O

in	O
Serbia	B-Country

.	O

.	O

Earlier	O

had	O

.	O

,	O

has	O
no	O

for	O

can	O

.	O

,	O

in	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

The	O

agency	O
,	O
Doctors	O
Without	O
Borders	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O

,	O

a	O

is	O
gripping	O
citizens	O
in	O
Central	B-Country
African	I-Country
Republic	I-Country
(	O
CAR	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
country	O
has	O
been	O
plagued	O
by	O
political	O
instability	O
and	O
insecurity	O
,	O
and	O

it	O
is	O

alarming	O
increase	O
in	O
the	O
number	O
of	O

cases	O
.	O

,	O

calls	O
on	O

to	O

their	O

to	O

the	O

.	O

``	O

[	O

]	O
malaria	B-Disease
cases	O

[	O

``	O

,	O

''	O

``	O

.	O
''	O

She	O
said	O
rabies	B-Virus
was	O
a	O
re-emerging	O
disease	O
in	O
South	B-Country
Africa	I-Country
,	O
particularly	O
in	O
densely	O
populated	O
rural	O
areas	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
infected	O
people	O
can	O
survive	O
if	O
they	O
are	O
treated	O
in	O
time	O
.	O

``	O
If	O
a	O
person	O
comes	O
into	O
contact	O
with	O
a	O
rabid	O
animal	O
,	O
whether	O
it	O

a	O

a	O

.	O

There	O
is	O
an	O

,	O
safe	O
vaccine	O
against	O
rabies	B-Virus
,	O
''	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

She	O
stressed	O
that	O
domestic	O
pets	O
must	O
be	O
vaccinated	O
against	O
rabies	B-Virus
regularly	O
.	O

The	O
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
is	O
currently	O
vaccinating	O
pets	O
free	O
of	O
charge	O
in	O
communities	O
across	O
the	O
province	O
.	O

``	O
Dogs	O
and	O
cats	O
should	O
be	O
vaccinated	O
at	O
3	O
months	O
of	O
age	O
,	O
with	O
a	O
booster	O
at	O
9	O
months	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
every	O
3	O
years	O
afterwards	O
.	O

In	O
high	O
risk	O
areas	O
,	O
annual	O
revaccination	O
is	O
recommended	O
,	O
''	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

She	O
said	O
stray	O
animals	O
,	O
animals	O
that	O
are	O
behaving	O
strangely	O
or	O
that	O
appear	O
sick	O
must	O
be	O
avoided	O
.	O

Once	O
the	O
rabies	B-Virus
virus	O
has	O
entered	O
the	O
body	O
,	O
it	O
goes	O
to	O
the	O
brain	O
where	O
the	O
virus	O
multiplies	O
,	O
causing	O
brain	O
dysfunction	O
and	O
ultimately	O
death	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
spread	O
from	O
animal	O
to	O
animal	O
,	O
and	O
occasionally	O
from	O
animals	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

Two	O
people	O
lost	O
their	O
lives	O
on	O
Wednesday	O
in	O
a	O
recent	O
outbreak	O
of	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
in	O
Nigeria	B-Country
's	O
middle-belt	O
Plateau	B-Province
state	I-Province
,	O
according	O
to	O
an	O
official	O
.	O

Plateau	B-Province
State	I-Province
Commissioner	O
for	O
Health	O
Fom	O

,	O

(	O

)	O
and	O
Vom	O
Christian	O

.	O

``	O

2	O

currently	O

Vom	O

to	O

for	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
,	O

.	O

Lassa	B-Virus
virus	O
is	O
usually	O
transmitted	O
when	O
the	O

,	O
urine	O
,	O
and	O

of	O

through	O
their	O

.	O

the	O

which	O
is	O
why	O

is	O
usually	O

to	O
as	O

,	O

.	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

In	O

,	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
has	O
similar	O

to	O

,	O

for	O

,	O

to	O

,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
,	O

and	O

,	O

.	O

In	O

,	O
Lassa	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
claimed	O

set	O
up	O
a	O
Lassa	B-Virus
Fever	I-Disease
Rapid	O

to	O

.	O

within	O

Rullepolser	O

a	O

of	O

,	O
''	O
he	O

DR.	O
SSI	O
said	O
that	O
the	O

of	O

who	O

been	O

_Listeria_	O

.	O

rates	O
among	O

individuals	O
is	O
25	O
percent	O
,	O
the	O
institute	O
said	O
.	O

Denmark	B-Country
normally	O
sees	O
around	O
50	O
listeriosis	B-Disease
cases	O
per	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
in	O
the	O
years	O
2009-2014	O
,	O
that	O
number	O
was	O
closer	O
to	O
100	O
.	O

The	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
of	O
hemorrhagic	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
with	I-Disease
renal	I-Disease
syndrome	I-Disease
(	O
HFRS	O
)	O
in	O
the	O
Yaroslavl	B-Province
oblast	I-Province
increased	O
by	O
a	O
third	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2009	O
]	O
in	O
comparison	O
with	O
2008	O
.	O

There	O
were	O
118	O
cases	O
last	O
year	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
high	O
rate	O
of	O
infection	O
has	O
continued	O
into	O
this	O
year	O
.	O

During	O
the	O
1st	O
week	O
of	O
2010	O
,	O
7	O
new	O
cases	O
of	O
HFRS	O
have	O
been	O
detected	O
.	O

The	O
reason	O
for	O
the	O
high	O
morbidity	O
is	O
thought	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
consequence	O
of	O
the	O
mild	O
winter	O
weather	O
and	O
the	O
abundance	O
of	O
rodents	O
.	O

The	O
rodents	O
have	O
congregated	O
near	O
human	O
dwellings	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
holiday	O
areas	O
.	O

Often	O
people	O
contract	O
infection	O
when	O
picnicking	O
in	O
the	O
countryside	O
.	O

The	O
rodent	O
vectors	O
of	O
HFRS	O
contaminate	O
the	O
environment	O
with	O
their	O
droppings	O
.	O

Humans	O
can	O
become	O
infected	O
by	O
inhaling	O
contaminated	O
dust	O
or	O
by	O
consuming	O
contaminated	O
food	O
.	O

The	O
public	O
health	O
authorities	O
have	O
stated	O
that	O
the	O
incidence	O
of	O
infection	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
decline	O
throughout	O
December	O
2009	O
and	O
January	O
2010	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
the	O
epidemic	O
situation	O
is	O
serious	O
,	O
and	O
rodent	O
control	O
measures	O
have	O
been	O
inadequate	O
in	O
recent	O
times	O
.	O

Several	O
years	O
ago	O
,	O
a	O
state-funded	O
rodent	O
control	O
programme	O
was	O
in	O
force	O
,	O
but	O
that	O
programme	O
has	O
lapsed	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
expected	O
that	O
local	O
administrations	O
will	O
take	O
over	O
this	O
responsibility	O
and	O
initiate	O
their	O
own	O
programmes	O
.	O

The	O
aim	O
will	O
be	O
to	O
exterminate	O
the	O
rodent	O
vector	O
by	O
all	O
possible	O
means	O
.	O

In	O
the	O
meantime	O
,	O
to	O
avoid	O
infection	O
,	O
residents	O
and	O
visitors	O
to	O
the	O
countryside	O
should	O
wear	O
gloves	O
and	O
respirators	O
when	O
cleaning	O
surfaces	O
,	O
and	O
wash	O
their	O
hands	O
frequently	O
.	O

Massive	O
pest	O
(	O
stem	O
borer	O
)	O
attack	O
and	O
stem	B-Disease
rot	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
are	O
wreaking	O
havoc	O
on	O
the	O
transplanted	O
aman	O
in	O
Taraganj	O
,	O
Rangpur	B-Province
division	O
.	O

Frustration	O
has	O

.	O

At	O
least	O
20	O
to	O
25	O
percent	O
of	O
the	O

have	O

.	O

The	O

said	O
that	O

at	O

up	O
.	O

``	O

,	O

.	O
''	O

They	O

,	O
aman	O
has	O
been	O

on	O
9800	O
hectares	O
in	O
Taraganj	O
.	O

Little	O
known	O
before	O
the	O
early	O
2000s	O
,	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
C	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
(	I-Disease
HCV	I-Disease
)	I-Disease
infection	I-Disease
has	O

in	O

Montreal	B-City

.	O

.	O

Montreal	B-City

.	O
''	O

Nearly	O
50	O

of	O

are	O
or	O

users	O
of	O

.	O

``	O

is	O

.	O

Needle	O
re-use	O
is	O
the	O
main	O
route	O
of	O

,	O
''	O

to	O

.	O

HCV	O

is	O
3	O

commoner	O
in	O
men	O
than	O
in	O
women	O
.	O

In	O
95	O

who	O
exchange	O

will	O
become	O

1st	O
6	O
months	O

.	O

Dr	O

that	O

should	O
be	O

.	O

``	O

must	O

to	O
prevent	O
the	O
problem	O
snowballing	O

of	O

.	O
''	O

To	O
a	O
lesser	O

,	O

of	O
other	O

of	O
drug	O
pose	O

(	O

)	O

.	O

Sandra	O
Trifa	O
,	O

``	O

[	O

]	O
also	O
represent	O
a	O

because	O

may	O

and	O

.	O
''	O

Nurse	O
Trifa	O
also	O

that	O

is	O
another	O
route	O
of	O

passages	O

to	O

,	O
which	O
is	O
a	O
more	O

[	O
contagious	O
?	O
]	O

virus	O
than	O
HIV	O
.	O

``	O

can	O

hours	O

can	O

for	O
as	O

as	O
163	O
days	O
in	O
a	O
contaminated	O
syringe	O
,	O
''	O

to	O
Nurse	O
Trifa	O
.	O

In	O
2009	O
,	O
45	O
per	O
cent	O

in	O
Quebec	B-Province
[	O
province	O
]	O
were	O
made	O
in	O
Montreal	B-City
.	O

A	O
serious	O
outbreak	O
of	O

in	O
Burundi	B-Country
has	O
reached	O

as	O

in	O

nearby	O
Democratic	O
Republic	O
of	O
the	O
Congo	O
.	O

in	O
the	O
tiny	O
Great	O
Lakes	O
country	O
has	O
infected	O
almost	O
half	O
the	O
total	O
population	O
,	O

about	O
1800	O
people	O
since	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
year	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
.	O

According	O
to	O

World	O

Organisation	O
,	O
almost	O
6	O
million	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O

since	O
the	O
1st	O

of	O

of	O

[	O
2019	O
]	O
,	O

infections	O
reaching	O
crisis	O

in	O

.	O

The	O
figures	O

on	O
course	O

outstrip	O
the	O

of	O
2017	O
,	O
when	O
more	O

for	O

.	O

The	O

to	O

as	O
the	O

of	O
Burundi	B-Country
has	O

to	O

.	O

The	O

of	O

for	O

.	O

``	O

.	O

.	O

of	O
the	O
disease	O

.	O

The	O
climate	O

has	O

factor	O
.	O

Mosquitoes	O
,	O
which	O

disease	O

are	O

in	O

,	O

.	O

.	O

Hantavirus	B-Virus
[	O

]	O
[	O
are	O
]	O

to	O
humans	O
from	O

when	O

.	O

``	O

to	O
[	O
a	O
]	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
when	O

of	O

.	O

Some	O

that	O
AHS	O

include	O
:	O

when	O

mouse	O
droppings	O

and	O
droppings	O
in	O
a	O

solution	O
and	O
never	O

a	O

to	O

up	O
droppings	O
or	O
dead	O
mice	O
,	O
as	O
the	O

can	O

.	O

fatal	O
.	O

.	O

the	O
situation	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Merck	O
Veterinary	O
Manual	O
:	O
Strangles	B-Disease
is	O
an	O
infectious	O
,	O
contagious	O
disease	O
of	O
the	O
upper	O
respiratory	O
tract	O
of	O
equines	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
fever	O
and	O
nasal	O
discharge	O
.	O

Abscesses	O
form	O
in	O
the	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
in	O
the	O
horse	O
's	O
neck	O
and	O
throat	O
area	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
_Streptococcus	O
equi	O
equi_	O
and	O
only	O
affects	O
horses	O
,	O
mules	O
and	O
donkeys	O
,	O
not	O
humans	O
.	O

Strangles	B-Disease
is	O
highly	O
contagious	O
although	O
not	O
usually	O
fatal	O
.	O

The	O
incubation	O
period	O
is	O
up	O
to	O
2	O
weeks	O
.	O

to	O
require	O
proof	O
of	O

within	O
a	O
year	O
or	O
6	O

of	O
the	O
show	O

[	O

]	O

Karachi	B-City
was	O

of	O
a	O
_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O
outbreak	O
that	O
killed	O
10	O
people	O
in	O
the	O
summer	O
of	O
2012	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
US	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
(	O
CDC	O
)	O
,	O
_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O
is	O
a	O
free-living	O
amoeba	O
that	O
can	O
cause	O
a	O
rare	O
and	O
devastating	O
infection	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
called	O
primary	B-Disease
amebic	I-Disease
meningoencephalitis	I-Disease
(	O
PAM	O
)	O
.	O

People	O
get	O
infected	O
when	O
water	O
containing	O
the	O
amoeba	O
enters	O
the	O
body	O
through	O
the	O
nose	O
.	O

This	O
typically	O
occurs	O
when	O
people	O
go	O
swimming	O
or	O
diving	O
in	O
warm	O
freshwater	O
places	O
,	O
like	O
lakes	O
and	O
rivers	O
.	O

The	O
_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O
ameba	O
then	O
travels	O
up	O
the	O
nose	O
to	O
the	O
brain	O
where	O
it	O
destroys	O
the	O
brain	O
tissue	O
.	O

In	O
Pakistan	B-Country
,	O
the	O
amoeba	O
has	O
been	O
reported	O
contracted	O
by	O
performing	O
ablution	O
.	O

The	O
practice	O
of	O
ablution	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
Yogic	O
,	O
Ayurvedic	O
,	O
and	O
Islamic	O
traditions	O
.	O

Within	O
the	O
Islamic	O
faith	O
,	O
ritual	O
nasal	O
rinsing	O
is	O
included	O
in	O
a	O
cleansing	O
process	O
called	O
wudu	O
,	O
or	O
ablution	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
usually	O
performed	O
several	O
times	O
a	O
day	O
in	O
preparation	O
for	O
prayer	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

The	O
deadly	O
parasite	O
has	O
also	O
been	O
contracted	O
via	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
neti	O
pots	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
infected	O
with	O
_Naegleria	O
fowleri_	O
by	O
drinking	O
contaminated	O
water	O
,	O
the	O
CDC	O
notes	O
.	O

Hungary	B-Country
,	O

of	O

(	O

.	O

Bergecot	O
and	O

)	O

.	O

_Xanthomonas	O

_pruni_	O

_X	O
.	O

arboricola_	O

.	O

_pruni_	O

Hungary	B-Country
.	O

open	O
defecation	O
by	O
the	O
locals	O
of	O
Dhiyal	O
VDC	O
in	O
Makawanpur	O
even	O
after	O
the	O
district	O
was	O
declared	O
open	O
defecation	O
free	O
.	O

Dhiyal	O
VDC	O
is	O
located	O
upstream	O
of	O
the	O
stream	O
that	O
flows	O
past	O
Gaidakot	O
.	O

Since	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
2017	O
,	O
the	O
Texas	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
State	O
Health	O
Services	O
says	O
it	O
has	O
seen	O
more	O
than	O
400	O
reported	O
cases	O
of	O
flea-borne	O
typhus	O
,	O
the	O
highest	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
16	O
years	O
.	O

Due	O
to	O
the	O
increase	O
in	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
across	O
the	O
state	O
,	O
the	O
state	O
agency	O
is	O
reminding	O
people	O
to	O
take	O
precautions	O
to	O
prevent	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Flea-borne	O
typhus	O
,	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
murine	B-Disease
typhus	I-Disease
,	O
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
infection	O
that	O
most	O
commonly	O
occurs	O
when	O
infected	O
flea	O
feces	O
are	O
scratched	O
into	O
the	O
site	O
of	O
the	O
flea	O
bite	O
or	O
another	O
break	O
in	O
the	O
skin	O
.	O

Fleas	O
are	O
infected	O
when	O
they	O
bite	O
animals	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
rodents	O
,	O
opossums	O
and	O
cats	O
,	O
that	O
can	O
maintain	O
and	O
transmit	O
the	O
bacteria	O
.	O

Rat	O
and	O
cat	O
fleas	O
are	O
the	O
primary	O
vectors	O
.	O

In	O
2017	O
,	O
the	O
increased	O
typhus	O
activity	O
has	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
Dallas-Fort	O
Worth	O
and	O
Houston	O
areas	O
.	O

In	O
2016	O
,	O
the	O
state	O
recorded	O
364	O
cases	O
.	O

Travis	O
County	O
Flea-Borne	O
Typhus	O
Cases	O
(	O
Travis	O
County	O
contains	O
Austin	O
,	O
the	O
state	O
capital	O
-	O
Mod.LL	O
)	O
2017	O
:	O
25	O
(	O
as	O
of	O
11/30/17	O
)	O
2016	O
:	O
30	O
2014	O
:	O
4	O
2013	O
:	O
15	O
2012	O
:	O
42	O
The	O
state	O
is	O
also	O
requesting	O
health	O
care	O
professionals	O
keep	O
an	O
eye	O
out	O
for	O
patients	O
who	O
have	O
a	O
fever	O
have	O
one	O
or	O
more	O
of	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
headache	O
,	O
myalgia	O
,	O
anorexia	O
,	O
rash	O
,	O
nausea/vomiting	O
,	O
thrombocytopenia	O
,	O
or	O
any	O
hepatic	O
transaminase	O
elevation	O
.	O

Early	O
symptoms	O
of	O
flea-borne	O
typhus	O
develop	O
within	O
14	O
days	O
of	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
fleas	O
and	O
include	O
headache	O
,	O
fever	O
,	O
nausea	O
and	O
body	O
aches	O
.	O

Five	O
or	O
6	O
days	O
after	O
the	O
initial	O
symptoms	O
,	O
a	O
rash	O
that	O
starts	O
on	O
the	O
trunk	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
and	O
spreads	O
to	O
the	O
arms	O
and	O
legs	O
may	O
occur	O
.	O

Flea-borne	O
typhus	O
is	O
easily	O
treated	O
with	O
certain	O
antimicrobials	O
,	O
and	O
people	O
will	O
not	O
get	O
it	O
again	O
after	O
they	O
recover	O
.	O

Precautions	O
to	O
prevent	O
flea-borne	O
typhus	O
:	O
-	O
Keep	O
yards	O
clean	O
so	O
that	O
rodents	O
,	O
opossums	O
and	O
stray	O
cats	O
can	O
not	O
live	O
there	O
by	O
removing	O
any	O
brush	O
or	O
trash	O
,	O
keeping	O
the	O
grass	O
mowed	O
and	O
keeping	O
firewood	O
off	O
the	O
ground	O
.	O

-	O
Do	O
not	O
leave	O
pet	O
food	O
out	O
at	O
night	O
as	O
this	O
attracts	O
other	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Prevent	O
rodents	O
from	O
living	O
in	O
houses	O
.	O

-	O
Treat	O
for	O
fleas	O
with	O
a	O
commercial	O
flea	O
control	O
product	O
before	O
beginning	O
rodent	O
control	O
in	O
houses	O
or	O
yards	O
.	O

Fleas	O
will	O
search	O
for	O
new	O
hosts	O
when	O
rodents	O
die	O
.	O

-	O
Control	O
the	O
fleas	O
on	O
pets	O
regularly	O
.	O

Ask	O
a	O
veterinarian	O
about	O
flea	O
control	O
products	O
that	O
are	O
safe	O
to	O
use	O
on	O
pets	O
.	O

-	O
Wear	O
gloves	O
and	O
insect	O
repellent	O
when	O
handling	O
sick	O
or	O
dead	O
animals	O
.	O

-	O
Use	O
insect	O
repellent	O
when	O
hunting	O
,	O
camping	O
or	O
engaging	O
in	O
any	O
other	O
outdoor	O
activities	O
.	O

An	O
unfavourable	O
epidemiological	O
situation	O
with	O
regard	O
to	O
measles	B-Virus
incidence	O
has	O
developed	O
in	O
the	O
Nizhniy	B-City
Novgorod	I-City
region	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O

of	O

of	O

.	O

on	O

.	O

affected	O
2	O

,	O
who	O

in	O
a	O

with	O

.	O

8	O
cases	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
were	O
recorded	O
in	O
these	O
2	O
families	O
.	O

5	O
children	O
were	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
class	O
of	O
a	O

a	O

,	O

``	O

Gymnasium	O
''	O

and	O
40	O
employees	O
have	O
refused	O
to	O
accept	O
immunization	O
on	O
grounds	O
of	O
religious	O
conviction	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
measure	O
of	O
prevention	O
of	O
measles	B-Virus
infection	O
is	O
vaccination	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
available	O
in	O
all	O
countries	O
of	O
the	O
world	O
,	O
using	O
an	O
attenuated	O
live	O
virus	O
vaccine	O
.	O

As	O
prescribed	O
in	O
the	O
national	O
calendar	O
of	O
preventive	O
inoculations	O
of	O
the	O
Russian	O
Federation	O
,	O
vaccination	O
against	O
measles	B-Virus
is	O
carried	O
out	O
twice	O
:	O
children	O
under	O
the	O
age	O
of	O
12	O
months	O
(	O
primary	O
vaccination	O
)	O
and	O
at	O
6	O
years	O
(	O
booster	O
)	O
.	O

[	O
Unvaccinated	O
]	O
adults	O
under	O
35	O
years	O
of	O
age	O
should	O
be	O
vaccinated	O
twice	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
person	O
was	O
not	O
vaccinated	O
in	O
childhood	O
and	O
never	O
suffered	O
measles	B-Virus
,	O
or	O
when	O
data	O
on	O
vaccination	O
has	O
been	O
lost	O
,	O
vaccination	O
should	O
be	O
carried	O
out	O
with	O
an	O
interval	O
of	O
at	O
least	O
3	O
months	O
between	O
vaccinations	O
.	O

Refusal	O
on	O

to	O
accept	O
prophylactic	O
vaccination	O
can	O
result	O
in	O
greater	O

of	O
the	O
infection	O
,	O

of	O
a	O

of	O
susceptibles	O
and	O
outbreaks	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

At	O

66	O
people	O
people	O
have	O

of	O
Japanese	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
this	O

[	O
_Diphyllobothrium	O
latum_	O
]	O
at	O
Puerto	O
Octay	O
Hospital	O
.	O

Also	O

say	O

.	O

,	O

,	O

that	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

Three	O

La	B-City
Plata	I-City
,	O
Buenos	B-Province
Aires	I-Province
Province	O
have	O

the	O

disease	O
,	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O
Clarin	O

(	O

)	O
.	O

They	O
are	O

for	O

.	O

The	O
3	O

were	O

by	O
a	O
source	O
from	O
Sanitary	O
Region	O
XI	O
,	O
who	O
detailed	O
that	O
those	O
affected	O
had	O
been	O
working	O
or	O
walking	O
in	O
the	O
rural	O
area	O
of	O
La	B-City
Plata	I-City
.	O

Hantaviruses	O
are	O
carried	O
by	O
certain	O
species	O
of	O
rats	O
and	O
mice	O
that	O
shed	O
the	O
virus	O
in	O
their	O
urine	O
,	O
droppings	O
and	O
saliva	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
to	O
people	O
when	O
nesting	O
materials	O
or	O
dust	O
contaminated	O
by	O
infected	O
rat	O
or	O
mouse	O
urine	O
,	O
droppings	O
and	O
saliva	O
are	O
stirred	O
up	O
,	O
allowing	O
the	O
virus	O
to	O
be	O
breathed	O
in	O
by	O
humans	O
.	O

Early	O
symptoms	O
of	O
[	O
a	O
]	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
include	O
fatigue	O
,	O
fever	O
and	O
muscle	O
aches	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
accompanied	O
by	O
headaches	O
,	O
dizziness	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
nausea	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
diarrhea	O
and	O
abdominal	O
pain	O
.	O

Later	O
symptoms	O
include	O
coughing	O
and	O
shortness	O
of	O
breath	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
is	O
suspected	O
,	O
people	O
should	O
contact	O
their	O
health	O
care	O
provider	O
immediately	O
and	O
mention	O
any	O
potential	O
exposure	O
to	O
rodents	O
,	O
their	O
nests	O
or	O
their	O
waste	O
.	O

A	O
``	O
viral	O
''	O
disease	O
has	O
attacked	O
date	O
palms	O
in	O
Khairpur	B-City
[	O
district	O
]	O
for	O
the	O
3rd	O

.	O

the	O

of	O
date	O

in	O

.	O

.	O

resolve	O
the	O
problem	O
.	O

Two	O
British	O
babies	O
have	O
contracted	O
a	O
rare	O

disease	O
triggered	O
by	O
eating	O

.	O

The	O

,	O

3	O
months	O
and	O
5	O

,	O
had	O
to	O
be	O

machines	O

from	O
infant	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
.	O

Both	O
had	O
been	O
feeding	O
badly	O
and	O

:	O
a	O

.	O

The	O

,	O

,	O

that	O

,	O
which	O
can	O
carry	O
[	O
spores	O
of	O
]	O
the	O

.	O

have	O
not	O

.	O

But	O

to	O

Health	O
England	O
,	O
the	O
5-month-old	O
was	O

in	O
late	O

2013	O
in	O

.	O

In	O

According	O

Organization	O
CCHF	O
is	O
a	O

a	O

Legionnaires	B-Disease
'	O

is	O

of	O

is	O
not	O

or	O

water	O
.	O

The	O

.	O

.	O

``	O

Pradesh	I-Province

``	O
Botulism	O
does	O
not	O
spread	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
,	O
so	O
there	O
is	O
no	O

.	O

However	O
,	O
these	O
cases	O
are	O
a	O
good	O

of	O
how	O
important	O
it	O
is	O
to	O

preserve	O
and	O
handle	O
food	O
in	O
the	O
home	O
.	O
''	O

A	O
variety	O
of	O
foods	O
can	O
be	O
associated	O
with	O
foodborne	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
,	O
including	O

foods	O
that	O
were	O
improperly	O
canned	O
or	O
preserved	O
.	O

The	O
most	O

source	O
of	O
home	O
canning	O
related	O
botulism	O
cases	O
come	O
from	O
foods	O
with	O

content	O

such	O
as	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

.	O

to	O

recent	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
last	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
foodborne	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
in	O
Colorado	B-Province
