have	O
_Dickeya	O
solani_	O
.	O

*	O
*	O

*	O
[	O
2	O
]	O
_Dickeya_	O
stem	O
and	O
root	O
rot	O
,	O
sweetpotato	O
-	O
China	O
:	O
1st	O
report	O
,	O
(	O
Guangdong	O
Province	O
)	O
Source	O
:	O
Plant	O
Disease	O
[	O
edited	O
]	O
Since	O
2006	O
,	O
stem	O
and	O
root	O
rot	O
of	O
sweetpotato	O
has	O
been	O
observed	O
in	O
fields	O
at	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
sweetpotato-production	O
areas	O
in	O
Guangdong	O
Province	O
.	O

Initially	O
,	O
the	O
leaves	O
turn	O
yellow	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
black	O
,	O
water-soaked	O
rot	O
occurs	O
on	O
the	O
bottom	O
of	O
the	O
stems	O
that	O
gradually	O
extends	O
to	O
the	O
top	O
of	O
the	O
stems	O
.	O

Finally	O
,	O
the	O
entire	O
plant	O
collapses	O
and	O
dies	O
.	O

Bacteria	O
were	O
consistently	O
isolated	O
from	O
stems	O
of	O
diseased	O
seedlings	O
.	O

Twelve	O
representative	O
isolates	O
chosen	O
for	O
further	O
characterization	O
were	O
similar	O
to	O
_Erwinia	O
chrysanthemi_	O
.	O

The	O
[	O
nucleotide	O
]	O
sequence	O
of	O
isolated	O
strain	O
H12	O
was	O
99	O
per	O
cent	O
identical	O
to	O
_E	O
.	O

chrysanthemi_	O
,	O
99	O
per	O
cent	O
identical	O
to	O
_Dickeya	O
dadantii_	O
,	O
and	O
98	O
per	O
cent	O
identical	O
to	O
_D	O
.	O

dianthicola_	O
.	O

Recently	O
,	O
_E	O
.	O

chrysanthemi_	O
was	O
transferred	O
to	O
_Dickeya_	O
gen.	O
nov.	O
Seedlings	O
were	O
injected	O
with	O
a	O
bacteria	O
suspension	O
.	O

One	O
to	O
2	O
days	O
after	O
inoculation	O
,	O
symptoms	O
were	O
observed	O
in	O
all	O
inoculated	O
plants	O
and	O
appeared	O
to	O
be	O
identical	O
to	O
those	O
observed	O
in	O
the	O
field	O
.	O

No	O
symptoms	O
were	O
noted	O
on	O
control	O
plants	O
.	O

The	O
bacterium	O
was	O
re-isolated	O
from	O
symptomatic	O
stems	O
of	O
sweetpotato	O
plants	O
.	O

This	O
pathogen	O
was	O
previously	O
reported	O
on	O
sweetpotato	O
in	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
in	O
1974	O
.	O

To	O
our	O
knowledge	O
,	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
report	O
of	O
a	O
_Dickeya_	O
sp	O
.	O

causing	O
bacterial	O
stem	O
and	O
root	O
rot	O
of	O
sweetpotato	O
in	O
China	O
.	O

From	O
various	O
reliable	O
diplomatic	O
sources	O
in	O
Manila	B-City
and	O
elsewhere	O
,	O
I	O
am	O
informed	O
that	O
it	O
all	O
started	O
when	O
a	O
carabao	O
(	O
water	O
buffalo	O
)	O
suddenly	O
became	O
lethargic	O
,	O
which	O
persisted	O
for	O
a	O
week	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
died	O
.	O

The	O
animal	O
was	O
eventually	O
slaughtered	O
and	O
eaten	O
by	O
some	O
local	O
citizens	O
.	O

Those	O
who	O
ate	O
the	O
meat	O
developed	O
somewhat	O
cutaneous-like	O
symptoms	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
such	O
as	O
skin	O
rashes	O
and	O
sore	O
muscles	O
,	O
and	O
other	O
signs	O
such	O
as	O
stomach	O
pains	O
,	O
headaches	O
,	O
difficulty	O
in	O
breathing	O
,	O
sore	O
throat	O
,	O
and	O
dry	O
cough	O
.	O

Although	O
these	O
symptoms	O
might	O
suggest	O
anthrax	B-Disease
,	O
it	O
was	O
not	O
confirmed	O
in	O
either	O
the	O
humans	O
or	O
the	O
carabao	O
.	O

In	O
relation	O
to	O
the	O
latter	O
,	O
they	O
collected	O
soil	O
samples	O
which	O
were	O
immediately	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
diagnostic	O
laboratory	O
.	O

The	O
result	O
was	O
negative	O
.	O

Should	O
there	O
be	O
other	O
available	O
tests	O
to	O
confirm	O
the	O
result	O
,	O
they	O
are	O
more	O
than	O
willing	O
to	O
provide	O
samples	O
again	O
...	O
For	O
the	O
mean	O
time	O
,	O
continuous	O
livestock	O
vaccination	O
efforts	O
were	O
being	O
made	O
to	O
control	O
the	O
possible	O
occurrence	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
veterinary	O
service	O
also	O
employs	O
protocols	O
such	O
as	O
animal	O
movement	O
control	O
and	O
updating	O
of	O
database	O
of	O
animal	O
population	O
.	O

The	O
region	O
conducts	O
regular	O
updating	O
meetings	O
regarding	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Any	O
errors	O
in	O
this	O
are	O
my	O
fault	O
,	O
not	O
of	O
my	O
informants	O
.	O

Cases	O
of	O
hemorrhagic	O
fever	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
an	O
area	O
of	O
Congo	O
that	O
is	O
facing	O
an	O
Ebola	B-Virus
epidemic	O
as	O
far	O
back	O
as	O
December	O
[	O
2017	O
]	O
and	O
the	O
1st	O
deaths	O
were	O
reported	O
in	O
January	O
[	O
2018	O
]	O
,	O
a	O
spokesman	O
for	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
said	O
,	O
as	O
4	O
new	O
suspected	O
cases	O
surfaced	O
.	O

...	O
An	O
interval	O
of	O
as	O
long	O
as	O

Dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
hits	O
UPDF	O
in	O
Somalia	B-Country
A	O
total	O
of	O
122	O
UPDF	O
soldiers	O
in	O
Somalia	O
have	O

by	O

,	O

.	O

was	O

together	O

fever	O
in	O
Somalia	B-Country
.	O

of	O
the	O
disease	O
into	O
Uganda	O
by	O
returning	O
soldiers	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
permanent	O
secretary	O
of	O
the	O
health	O
ministry	O
,	O
Dr	O
Asuman	O
Lukwago	O
,	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
is	O
a	O
viral	O
infection	O
and	O
is	O
spread	O
by	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

Its	O
symptoms	O
are	O
nose	O
bleeding	O
,	O
general	O
body	O
weakness	O
,	O
and	O
red	O
eyes	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
eventually	O
leads	O
to	O
total	O
organ	O
failure	O
if	O
not	O
treated	O
,	O
he	O
added	O
.	O

Lukwago	O
said	O
the	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
managed	O
in	O
Nairobi	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organisation	O
,	O
the	O
disease	O
causes	O
a	O
severe	O
flu-like	O
illness	O
and	O
sometimes	O
a	O
lethal	O
complication	O
called	O
dengue	B-Virus
haemorrhagic	O
fever	O
.	O

WHO	O
disclosed	O
that	O
global	O
incidence	O
of	O
dengue	B-Virus
has	O
grown	O
dramatically	O
in	O
recent	O
decades	O
,	O
with	O
about	O
2/5	O
of	O
the	O
world	O
's	O
population	O
at	O
risk	O
.	O

Dengue	B-Virus
is	O
found	O
in	O
tropical	O
and	O
sub-tropical	O
climates	O
worldwide	O
,	O
mostly	O
in	O
urban	O
and	O
semi-urban	O
areas	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
specific	O
treatment	O
for	O
dengue	B-Virus
,	O
but	O
appropriate	O
medical	O
care	O
frequently	O
saves	O
lives	O
,	O
WHO	O
added	O
.	O

The	O
only	O
way	O
to	O
prevent	O
transmission	O
of	O
dengue	B-Virus
virus	O
is	O
to	O
get	O
rid	O
of	O
the	O
disease-carrying	O
mosquitoes	O
,	O
WHO	O
said	O
.	O

.	O

As	O
per	O
the	O
news	O

,	O
the	O
VIP	O
Spa	O
in	O

Albuquerque	B-City
(	O

that	O
2	O

had	O
contracted	O
HIV	B-Virus
after	O
obtaining	O
a	O
vampire	O
facial	O
.	O

A	O
vampire	O
facial	O
is	O
a	O
common	O
phrase	O
for	O
platelet-rich	O
plasma	O
therapy	O
treatments	O
.	O

These	O
treatments	O
typically	O
include	O
blood	O
from	O
a	O
consumer	O
's	O
arm	O
being	O
removed	O
for	O
the	O
platelet-rich	O
plasma	O
through	O
a	O
centrifuge	O
(	O
a	O
piece	O
of	O
equipment	O
)	O
and	O
then	O
reuse	O
to	O
the	O
patient	O
's	O
face	O
.	O

While	O
doing	O
this	O
could	O
leave	O
the	O
patient	O
with	O
a	O
more	O
youthful	O
appearance	O
,	O
if	O
not	O
done	O
properly	O
then	O
he/she	O
subjected	O
to	O
blood-borne	O
infections	O
.	O

After	O
conducting	O
an	O
investigation	O
,	O
the	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
stated	O
that	O

and	O
handling	O
of	O
needles	O

the	O
donor	O
to	O
contract	O
HIV	B-Virus
.	O

The	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
Department	O
of	O

has	O
since	O

urging	O

have	O
[	O

]	O

to	O

.	O

.	O

,	O

for	O

and	O
many	O

.	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
and	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Livestock	O
and	O
Fisheries	O
have	O
declared	O
a	O
Rift	B-Virus
Valley	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
(	O
RVF	O
)	O
outbreak	O
today	O
in	O
Yirol	B-City
East	O
,	O
Yirol	O
West	O
,	O
and	O
Awerial	O
Counties	O
of	O
Eastern	O
Lakes	B-Province
state	O
.	O

The	O
declaration	O
was	O
preceded	O
by	O
a	O
joint	O
high-level	O
advocacy	O
mission	O
led	O
by	O
the	O
Minister	O
of	O
Health	O
,	O
Dr	O
Riak	O
Gai	O

.	O

The	O
mission	O
,	O
comprised	O
of	O
representatives	O
from	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
,	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Livestock	O
and	O
Fisheries	O
,	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
(	O
WHO	O
)	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
Food	O
and	O
Agriculture	O
Organization	O
of	O
the	O
United	O
Nations	O
(	O
FAO	O
)	O
,	O
visited	O
Yirol	B-City
East	O
on	O
6	O
Mar	O
2018	O
to	O
consolidate	O
response	O
efforts	O
and	O
solicit	O
more	O
commitments	O
by	O
all	O
stakeholders	O
to	O
contain	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

The	O
RVF	O
outbreak	O
was	O
1st	O
suspected	O
in	O
December	O
2017	O
.	O

Following	O
the	O
reported	O
cases	O
and	O
deaths	O
,	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
and	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Livestock	O
and	O
Fisheries	O
,	O
with	O
support	O
from	O
WHO	O
,	O
FAO	O
and	O
other	O
human	O
and	O
animal	O
experts	O
,	O
launched	O
a	O
multi-sectoral	O
response	O
in	O
the	O
context	O
of	O
One	O
Health	O
for	O
in-depth	O
investigations	O
to	O
establish	O
the	O
exact	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
reported	O
deaths	O
and	O
illnesses	O
in	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
.	O

One	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
7	O
animal	O
samples	O
tested	O
at	O
UVRI	O
(	O
Uganda	O
Virus	O
Research	O
Institute	O
)	O
was	O
positive	O
for	O
RVF	O
.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O
8	O
out	O
of	O
21	O
samples	O
collected	O
from	O
animals	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
RVF	O
at	O
the	O
World	O
Organisation	O
for	O
Animal	O
Health	O
(	O
OIE	O
)	O
reference	O
laboratory	O
in	O
South	O
Africa	O
.	O

A	O
joint	O
multi-sectoral	O
contingency	O
plan	O
has	O
been	O
developed	O
,	O
which	O
will	O
be	O
fully	O
rolled	O
out	O
in	O
Eastern	O
Lakes	B-Province
to	O
ensure	O
RVF	O
is	O
contained	O
.	O

This	O
will	O
involve	O
intensified	O
surveillance	O
in	O
both	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
,	O
risk	O
communication	O
,	O
and	O
case	O
management	O
.	O

RVF	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
zoonotic	O
disease	O
that	O
primarily	O
affects	O
animals	O
,	O
but	O
also	O
has	O
the	O
capacity	O
to	O
infect	O
humans	O
.	O

People	O
are	O
infected	O
with	O
RVF	O
virus	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
blood	O
,	O
body	O
fluids	O
,	O
or	O
tissues	O
of	O
RVF	O
virus-infected	O
animals	O
,	O
mainly	O
livestock	O
.	O

This	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
can	O
occur	O
during	O
slaughter	O
or	O
veterinary	O
procedures	O
,	O
like	O
assisting	O
an	O
animal	O
giving	O
birth	O
.	O

Less	O
commonly	O
,	O
people	O
can	O
be	O
infected	O
with	O
RVF	O
virus	O
from	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
mosquitoes	O
and	O
,	O
rarely	O
,	O
from	O
other	O
biting	O
insects	O
that	O
have	O
the	O
virus	O
on	O
their	O
mouthparts	O
.	O

Spread	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
documented	O
.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
in	O
the	O
Colima	B-City
Prison	O
Colima	O
kills	O
5	O

who	O
allegedly	O

.	O

,	O

of	O

.	O

.	O

A	O

virus	O
with	O

similar	O
to	O
dengue	O
fever	O
is	O
spreading	O
rapidly	O
in	O
Burma	O
[	O
Myanmar	B-Country
]	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
doctors	O
who	O
asserted	O
,	O
however	O
,	O
that	O
it	O
has	O
a	O
low	O
fatality	O
rate	O
.	O

The	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
virus	O
only	O
became	O
commonplace	O
in	O
Burma	O
[	O
Myanmar	B-Country
]	O
in	O
mid-2009	O
,	O
although	O
cases	O
were	O
reported	O
as	O
far	O
back	O
as	O
1975	O
.	O

It	O
comes	O
as	O
doctors	O
warn	O
of	O
a	O
new	O
wave	O
of	O
the	O
A	O
(	O
H1N1	O
)	O
and	O
A	O
(	O
H5N1	O
)	O
viruses	O
in	O
Burma	O
[	O
Myanmar	B-Country
]	O
that	O
have	O
struck	O
more	O
than	O
60	O
people	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
fortnight	O
.	O

``	O
Chikungunya	B-Virus
[	O
disease	O
]	O
begins	O
like	O
a	O
normal	O
flu	O
with	O
symptoms	O
such	O
as	O

and	O
pains	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
the	O
joints	O
,	O
''	O
[	O
said	O
]	O
a	O
specialist	O
doctor	O
in	O
Rangoon	O
[	O
Yangon	O
]	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
joint	O
pain	O
can	O
be	O
so	O
severe	O
that	O
elderly	O
patients	O
may	O
be	O
unable	O
to	O
walk	O
.	O
''	O

Although	O
the	O
flu	O
has	O
strong	O
symptoms	O
,	O
it	O
has	O
a	O
low	O
fatality	O
rate	O
,	O
particularly	O
if	O
the	O
patient	O
receives	O
proper	O
treatment	O
at	O
inception	O
,	O
the	O
doctor	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Personal	O
hygiene	O
is	O
important	O
for	O
flu	O
diseases	O
.	O

Wash	O
hands	O
properly	O
and	O
avoid	O
getting	O
bitten	O
by	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

Chikungunya	B-Virus
[	O
virus	O
]	O
is	O
mainly	O
contracted	O
[	O
transmitted	O
]	O
by	O
mosquitoes	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

At	O
least	O
9	O
people	O
involved	O
with	O
the	O
processing	O
of	O
an	O
anthrax-tainted	O
dead	O
cow	O
have	O
been	O
sickened	O
with	O
anthrax	B-Disease
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
Bangladeshi	O
news	O
source	O
The	O
Independent	O
today	O
.	O

The	O
report	O
states	O
that	O
the	O
individuals	O
were	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
anthrax	B-Disease
at	O
Ambaria	B-City
village	O
in	O
Madhupur	B-City
upazila	I-City
.	O

Apparently	O
,	O
the	O
infected	O
bull	O
[	O
sic	O
]	O
was	O
purchased	O
at	O
a	O
bazaar	O
a	O
year	O
and	O
a	O
half	O
ago	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
animal	O
got	O
sick	O
.	O

The	O
infected	O
[	O
people	O
developed	O
]	O
skin	O
sores	O
and	O
sought	O
medical	O
treatment	O
,	O
when	O
doctors	O
diagnosed	O
anthrax	B-Disease
.	O

Cutaneous	O
anthrax	B-Disease
occurs	O
when	O
the	O
spore	O
(	O
or	O
possibly	O
the	O
bacterium	O
)	O
enters	O
a	O
cut	O
or	O
abrasion	O
on	O
the	O
skin	O
.	O

It	O
starts	O
out	O
as	O
a	O
raised	O
bump	O
that	O
looks	O
like	O
an	O
insect	O
bite	O
.	O

It	O
then	O
develops	O
into	O
a	O
blackened	O
lesion	O
called	O
an	O
eschar	O
that	O
may	O
form	O
a	O
scab	O
.	O

Lymph	O
glands	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
may	O
swell	O
,	O
plus	O
edema	O
may	O
be	O
present	O
.	O

This	O
form	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
responds	O
well	O
to	O
antibiotics	O
.	O

If	O
untreated	O
,	O
deaths	O
can	O
occur	O
if	O
the	O
infection	O
goes	O
systemic	O
;	O
95	O
percent	O
of	O
cases	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
are	O
cutaneous	O
.	O

As	O
of	O
noon	O
today	O
,	O
17	O
Aug	O
2015	O
,	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
:	O
1105	O
laboratory	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
of	O
MERS-CoV	B-Virus
infection	I-Disease
,	O
including	O
479	O
deaths	O
,	O
590	O
recoveries	O
,	O
and	O
36	O
currently	O
active	O
cases	O
including	O
3	O
on	O
home	O
isolation	O
.	O

Daily	O
changes	O
in	O
case	O
counts	O
since	O
the	O
last	O
update	O
include	O
:	O
17	O
Aug	O
2015	O
9	O
newly	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
-	O
all	O
in	O
Riyadh	B-City
,	O
1	O
healthcare	O
worker	O
,	O
4	O
in	O
critical	O
condition	O
,	O
5	O
stable	O
,	O
all	O
with	O
history	O
of	O
contact	O
with	O
other	O

For	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
Japanese	O
researchers	O
have	O
found	O
and	O
identified	O
a	O
tick	O
as	O
carrying	O
the	O
virus	O
that	O
causes	O
severe	B-Virus
fever	I-Virus
with	I-Virus
thrombocytopenia	I-Virus
syndrome	I-Virus
(	O
SFTS	O
)	O
that	O
has	O
so	O
far	O
caused	O
8	O
deaths	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
since	O
the	O
summer	O
of	O
2012	O
.	O

15	O
people	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
across	O
10	O
prefectures	O
ever	O
since	O
the	O
virus	O
was	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
in	O
January	O
2013	O
.	O

The	O
tick	O
was	O
discovered	O
in	O
a	O
woman	O
in	O
her	O
60s	O
at	O
a	O
national	O
medical	O
center	O
in	O
Iwakuni	B-City
city	O
,	O
western	O
Japan	B-Country
.	O

She	O
was	O
hospitalized	O
in	O
early	O
April	O
[	O
2013	O
]	O
and	O
had	O
high	O
fever	O
and	O
slipped	O
in	O
and	O
out	O
of	O
consciousness	O
.	O

She	O
also	O
complained	O
that	O
she	O
found	O
it	O
hard	O
to	O

and	O
was	O
once	O

to	O
the	O

unit	O
.	O

Her	O
doctors	O
found	O
a	O
3	O
millimeter	O
tick	O
on	O
her	O
arm	O
and	O
the	O
researchers	O
at	O
the	O
National	O
Institute	O
of	O
Infectious	O
Diseases	O
confirmed	O
that	O
it	O
carried	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

The	O
tick	O
is	O
the	O
kind	O
that	O
preys	O
on	O
animals	O
in	O
the	O
wild	O
.	O

This	O
virus	O
was	O
first	O
discovered	O
in	O
China	O
back	O
in	O
2009	O
but	O
the	O
Health	O
Ministry	O
confirmed	O
that	O
the	O
strain	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
infected	O
patients	O
has	O
genetic	O
origins	O
in	O
Japan	B-Country
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
for	O
SFTS	O
usually	O
develop	O
within	O
2	O
weeks	O
of	O
the	O
initial	O
stage	O
of	O

.	O

No	O

at	O
this	O
time	O
but	O

of	O
the	O
tick	O
might	O

to	O
one	O
being	O
developed	O
in	O
the	O
near	O
future	O
.	O

.	O

Signs	O
of	O
botulism	B-Disease
appear	O
within	O
2-36	O
hours	O
after	O
consuming	O
the	O
contaminated	O
product	O
,	O
sometimes	O

latent	O

8-10	O
days	O
,	O

.	O

In	O

begins	O

.	O

the	O

.	O

.	O

,	O

5	O

.	O

promed	O
@	O

.	O

During	O

2012	O
,	O
Estonia	O
,	O
Latvia	O
,	O
and	O
Lithuania	B-Country
have	O
informed	O

detection	O
of	O
a	O
significant	O
number	O
of	O
animals	O
,	O
mostly	O
cattle	O
,	O
serologically	O
positive	O
to	O
bluetongue	B-Disease
virus	I-Disease
.	O

In	O
the	O
3	O
countries	O
,	O
the	O
samples	O
were	O
taken	O
in	O
the	O
framework	O
of	O
the	O
bluetongue	O
surveillance	O
.	O

Serologically	O
positive	O

were	O

by	O
RT-PCR	O
and	O
found	O
negative	O
in	O

in	O
Lithuania	B-Country
where	O
15	O

.	O

Poland	O
has	O
reported	O
that	O
,	O

within	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
bluetongue	O

,	O
3	O
cattle	O

have	O
been	O

to	O
include	O
positive	O
animals	O
both	O

as	O
well	O
by	O

.	O

Furthermore	O
,	O

was	O

the	O

a	O

14	O
.	O

Positive	O

and	O
Lithuania	B-Country
.	O

.	O

(	O

)	O

Carlos	O

.	O

state	O

'cleaning	O

'	O

of	O

tuberculosis	I-Disease
so	O

can	O

to	O
the	O
United	O
States	O
.	O

At	O

,	O

Sanchez	O
announced	O
that	O

to	O
ensure	O

of	O

.	O

To	O
date	O
,	O
10	O
municipalities	O
of	O
Costa	O
Chica	O
have	O
been	O
declared	O
with	O
low	O

of	O

and	O
are	O

to	O

,	O

.	O

,	O

farms	O
have	O
been	O
placed	O
under	O
quarantine	O
,	O
20	O

of	O
Costa	O

.	O

Sagarpa	O

.	O

MXN	O
16	O

to	O

8000	O
that	O

because	O

.	O

,	O

and	O

(	O

)	O

in	O

.	O

Dr	O
Jude	O
Gedeon	O
met	O
with	O
the	O
media	O
on	O
Wed	O
11	O
Oct	O
2017	O
,	O
to	O
give	O
an	O
update	O
on	O
the	O
pneumonic	B-Disease
plague	I-Disease
situation	O
in	O
Seychelles	B-Country
.	O

Speaking	O
to	O
several	O
media	O
houses	O
,	O
he	O
addressed	O
the	O
case	O
of	O
pneumonic	B-Disease
plague	I-Disease
that	O
was	O
confirmed	O
yesterday	O
,	O
10	O
Oct	O
2017	O
.	O

He	O
also	O
stressed	O
on	O
current	O
and	O
additional	O
measures	O
being	O
taken	O
by	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
to	O
prevent	O
this	O
from	O
spreading	O
.	O

New	O
measures	O
being	O
implemented	O
against	O
pneumonic	B-Disease
plague	I-Disease
:	O
-	O
everyone	O
entering	O
Seychelles	B-Country
from	O
Madagascar	O
will	O
immediately	O
be	O
referred	O
to	O
the	O
isolation	O
centre	O
in	O
Perseverance	O
-	O
no	O
foreigners	O
coming	O
to	O
Seychelles	O
from	O
Madagascar	O
will	O
be	O
granted	O
entry	O
.	O

Only	O
Seychelles	B-Country
citizens	O
will	O
be	O
allowed	O
to	O
enter	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

-	O
a	O
Travel	O
Advisory	O
has	O
been	O
issued	O
,	O
in	O
collaboration	O
with	O
Seychelles	B-Country
Tourism	O
Board	O
requesting	O
all	O
transiting	O
points	O
(	O
Mauritius	O
,	O
Kenya	O
,	O
and	O
Reunion	O
)	O
to	O
redirect	O
all	O
passengers	O
who	O
are	O
not	O
a	O
citizen	O
of	O
Seychelles	O
.	O

-	O
cargo	O
ships	O
will	O
continue	O
to	O
be	O
monitored	O
as	O
before	O
.	O

If	O
anyone	O
presents	O
with	O
symptoms	O
within	O
less	O
than	O
7	O
days	O
of	O
leaving	O
Madagascar	O
,	O
the	O
ship	O
will	O
remain	O
in	O
isolation	O
at	O
sea	O
.	O

If	O
anyone	O
on	O
board	O
is	O
sick	O
,	O
they	O
will	O
receive	O
treatment	O
;	O
-	O
cruise	O
ships	O
are	O
advised	O
to	O
remain	O
at	O
sea	O
for	O
at	O
least	O

Barrie	O

off	O

.	O

``	O
I	O
believe	O
it	O
's	O
in	O
the	O

,	O
the	O
neonicotinoids	O
,	O
''	O
says	O
Schuit	O

.	O

``	O
I	O
believe	O
it	O
's	O
in	O
the	O
water	O
and	O
it	O
's	O
in	O
the	O
pollen	O
.	O
''	O

Neonicotinoids	O
are	O
extremely	O
toxic	O
to	O
bees	O
,	O
even	O
in	O
tiny	O
amounts	O
.	O

They	O
are	O
now	O
widely	O
used	O
to	O
protect	O
corn	O
,	O
soy	O
,	O
and	O
wheat	O
seed	O
.	O

The	O
pesticide	O
is	O
water-soluble	O
and	O
persists	O
in	O
the	O
environment	O
for	O
several	O
years	O
.	O

Neonicotinoids	O
were	O
recently	O
banned	O
in	O
Europe	O
while	O
more	O
research	O
is	O
being	O
done	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Ontario	B-Province
Bee	O
Keepers	O
Association	O
,	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
acute	O
poisonings	O
like	O
this	O
is	O
mounting	O
this	O
summer	O
and	O
the	O
total	O
number	O
of	O
incidents	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
surpass	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2012	O
]	O
when	O
240	O
were	O
reported	O
.	O

Laboratory	O
testing	O
confirmed	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
neonicotinoids	O
in	O
80	O
per	O
cent	O
of	O
those	O
cases	O
.	O

Today	O
inspectors	O
from	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
collected	O
samples	O
for	O
testing	O
to	O
see	O
if	O
the	O
pesticide	O
or	O
something	O
else	O
is	O
killing	O
these	O
bees	O
.	O

Results	O
are	O
not	O
expected	O
for	O
several	O
months	O
.	O

Health	O
Canada	B-Country
is	O
currently	O
re-evaluating	O
at	O
least	O
7	O
crop	O
protection	O
products	O
that	O
contain	O
the	O
chemical	O
.	O

In	O
July	O
[	O
2013	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
province	O
created	O
a	O
new	O
working	O
group	O
made-up	O
of	O
beekeepers	O
,	O
farmers	O
,	O
and	O
scientists	O
to	O
look	O
into	O
the	O
crisis	O
.	O

A	O
farmer	O
who	O
is	O
seeing	O
this	O
with	O
his	O
own	O
eyes	O
for	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
says	O
,	O
``	O
When	O
I	O
see	O
dead	O
canaries	O
in	O
the	O
mine	O
I	O
know	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
problem	O
,	O
when	O
I	O
see	O
dead	O
bees	O
I	O
know	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
bigger	O
problem	O
.	O

I	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
where	O
to	O
point	O
the	O
finger	O
.	O

I	O
hardly	O
know	O
here	O
to	O
start	O
but	O
we	O
have	O
to	O
start	O
some	O
place	O
because	O
our	O
entire	O
biodiversity	O
is	O
seriously	O
at	O
risk	O
,	O
if	O
not	O
even	O
our	O
food	O
supply	O

[	O

.	O

.	O

have	O

in	O

and	O
central	O
parts	O
of	O
Utah	B-Province
at	O

have	O

to	O

.	O

now	O

a	O

would	O
like	O
the	O
community	O
to	O
continue	O
to	O

West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	I-Virus
by	O

on	O
their	O

.	O
''	O

The	O

unit	O
has	O

following	O

in	O

an	O

DEET	O
.	O

''	O

Septicemic	O
plague	B-Disease
accounts	O
for	O
as	O
much	O
as	O
25	O
percent	O
of	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
cases	O
.	O

Septicemic	O
plague	B-Disease
has	O
no	O
specific	O
features	O
or	O
detectable	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
node	O
,	O
by	O
which	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
distinguished	O
from	O
other	O
infectious	O
diseases	O
,	O
although	O
abdominal	O
pain	O
,	O
vomiting	O
,	O
and	O
diarrhea	O
are	O
common	O
.	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
potentially	O
fatal	O
illness	O
in	O
people	O
that	O
occurs	O
in	O
many	O
parts	O
of	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
.	O

It	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
bacteria	O
found	O
in	O
rodents	O
,	O
especially	O
ground	O
squirrels	O
,	O
rabbits	O
,	O
and	O
hares	O
.	O

Most	O
human	O
cases	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
are	O
acquired	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
.	O

Dogs	O
and	O
cats	O
are	O
also	O
susceptible	O
to	O
plague	B-Disease
and	O
are	O
infected	O
either	O
through	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
or	O
by	O
eating	O
an	O
animal	O
that	O
has	O
died	O
from	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
in	O
people	O
usually	O
develop	O
2	O
to	O
8	O
days	O
after	O
exposure	O
.	O

Typical	O
symptoms	O
include	O
sudden	O
fever	O
,	O
chills	O
,	O
headaches	O
,	O
and	O
swelling	O
of	O
the	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
in	O
the	O
neck	O
,	O
armpit	O
,	O
or	O
groin	O
areas	O
.	O

As	O
stated	O
earlier	O
,	O
no	O
detectable	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
node	O
is	O
found	O
in	O
cases	O
of	O
primary	O
septicemic	O
plague	B-Disease
.	O

In	O
addition	O
to	O
the	O
3	O
human	O
cases	O
,	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
7	O
cases	O
of	O
plague	B-Disease
this	O
year	O
[	O
2015	O
]	O
in	O
dogs	O
and	O
cats	O
,	O
including	O
pets	O
from	O
Bernalillo	O
,	O
Santa	O
Fe	O
,	O
and	O
Torrance	O
counties	O
.	O

The	O
Equine	O
Disease	O
Communication	O
Center	O
(	O
EDCC	O
)	O
reported	O
on	O
13	O
Jan	O
2017	O
that	O
equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
(	O
EIA	O
)	O
was	O
confirmed	O
in	O
Illinois	B-Province
in	O
late	O
2016	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
Illinois	B-Province
State	O
Veterinarian	O
's	O
Office	O
received	O
positive	O
EIA	O
test	O
results	O
from	O
a	O
horse	O
stabled	O
in	O
Northeast	O
Illinois	O
in	O
mid-November	O
2016	O
,	O
''	O
the	O
EDCC	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Prior	O
to	O
the	O
results	O
being	O
returned	O
,	O
the	O
horse	O
was	O
removed	O
from	O
the	O
premises	O
and	O
has	O
been	O
lost	O
to	O
follow-up	O
.	O

USDA	O
Investigative	O
and	O
Enforcement	O
Services	O
is	O
involved	O
in	O
the	O
case	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
premises	O
was	O
quarantined	O
,	O
''	O
the	O
report	O
continued	O
.	O

``	O
Additional	O
testing	O
of	O
equines	O
on	O
the	O
premises	O
disclosed	O
one	O
additional	O
positive	O
animal	O
.	O

That	O
animal	O
has	O
been	O
euthanized	O
.	O

The	O
remaining	O
animals	O
were	O
negative	O
for	O
EIA	O
.	O
''	O

Equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
attacks	O
horses	O
'	O
immune	O
systems	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
transmitted	O
through	O
the	O
exchange	O
of	O
body	O
fluids	O
from	O
an	O
infected	O
to	O
a	O
non-infected	O
animal	O
,	O
often	O
by	O
blood-feeding	O
insects	O
such	O
as	O
horseflies	O
,	O
and	O
more	O
rarely	O
through	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
blood-contaminated	O
instruments	O
or	O
needles	O
.	O

A	O
Coggins	O
test	O
screens	O
horses	O
'	O
blood	O
for	O
antibodies	O
that	O
are	O
indicative	O
of	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
EIA	O
,	O
and	O
most	O
states	O
require	O
horses	O
to	O
have	O
proof	O
of	O
a	O
negative	O
Coggins	O
test	O
in	O
order	O
to	O
travel	O
.	O

Once	O
an	O
animal	O
is	O
infected	O
with	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
serious	O
infectious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
gram-positive	O
,	O
rod-shaped	O
bacteria	O
known	O
as	O
_Bacillus	O
anthracis_	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
information	O
posted	O
on	O
the	O
website	O
of	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
.	O

Although	O
it	O
is	O
rare	O
,	O
people	O
can	O
get	O
sick	O
with	O
anthrax	B-Disease
if	O
they	O
come	O
into	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
or	O
contaminated	O
animal	O
products	O
.	O

Signs	O
and	O
symptoms	O
can	O
range	O
from	O
skin	O
sores	O
to	O
vomiting	O
and	O
shock	O
.	O

Rapid	O
treatment	O
with	O
antibiotics	O
can	O
cure	O
most	O
anthrax	B-Disease
infections	O
.	O

.	O

``	O
The	O
route	O
of	O
infection	O
is	O
hand	O
to	O
mouth	O
.	O

_Shigella	O
flexneri_	O
is	O
an	O
endemic	O
bacterium	O
,	O
which	O
circulates	O
in	O
the	O
population	O
throughout	O
the	O
year	O
.	O

As	O
the	O
temperature	O
increases	O
,	O
the	O
level	O
of	O
circulation	O
increases	O
.	O

It	O
occurs	O
in	O
places	O
where	O
cleaning	O
is	O
not	O
taken	O
care	O
of	O
and	O
where	O
there	O
is	O
not	O
good	O
handling	O
of	O
the	O
food	O
or	O
the	O
cold	O
chain	O
.	O

When	O
it	O
occurs	O
in	O
enclosed	O
establishments	O
,	O
as	O
happened	O
in	O
this	O
case	O
in	O
a	O
school	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
affect	O
many	O
people	O
.	O

The	O
solution	O
is	O
to	O
take	O
the	O
appropriate	O
measures	O
so	O
that	O
the	O
bacterium	O
disappears	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Cali	O
.	O

,	O

(	O

for	O

with	O

.	O

.	O

``	O

in	O

is	O

.	O
''	O

to	O

.	O

.	O

'Jupiter	O
'	O
appears	O
to	O
have	O
resistance	O
,	O

is	O

.	O

[	O

,	O

were	O

.	O

no	O

where	O

.	O

They	O
should	O

water	O
or	O
put	O
Abate	O
sand	O
in	O
the	O
water	O
.	O

of	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
can	O

,	O

should	O

to	O

the	O
doctor	O
urgently	O
.	O

on	O

thronged	O
Mahalapye	B-City
health	O

with	O
the	O
same	O
problem	O
.	O

A	O
horse	O
that	O
died	O
nearly	O
a	O
month	O
ago	O
has	O
been	O
confirmed	O
as	O
carrying	O
a	O
potentially	O
lethal	O
disease	O
for	O
both	O
humans	O
and	O
horses	O
.	O

The	O
North	O
Bay/Parry	O
Sound	O
District	O
Health	O
Unit	O
has	O
been	O
informed	O
by	O
Ontario	B-Province

,	O
Food	O
and	O
Rural	O
Affairs	O
,	O
and	O
Public	O
Health	O
Ontario	O
of	O
a	O
dead	O
horse	O
in	O
the	O
Sundridge	B-City
area	O
testing	O
positive	O
for	O
eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
virus	O
(	O
EEEv	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
risk	O
of	O
a	O
person	O
being	O
infected	O
with	O
EEEv	O
remains	O
extremely	O
low	O
.	O

There	O
has	O
never	O
been	O
a	O
human	O
case	O
of	O
EEEv	O
reported	O
in	O
Ontario	B-Province
or	O
Canada	B-Country
,	O
although	O
it	O
has	O
been	O
identified	O
in	O
horses	O
and	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

Eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
virus	O
that	O
causes	O
inflammation	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
acquired	O
when	O
bitten	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
mosquito	O
.	O

Horses	O
or	O
people	O
infected	O
with	O
EEEv	O
can	O
not	O
spread	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

In	O
2015	O
,	O
the	O
Health	O
Unit	O
's	O
mosquito	O
surveillance	O
program	O
had	O
no	O
mosquito	O
pools	O
test	O
positive	O
for	O
EEEv	O
.	O

The	O
last	O
time	O
our	O
district	O
had	O
a	O
positive	O
EEEv	O
mosquito	O
pool	O
was	O
5	O
years	O
ago	O
,	O
in	O
the	O
Parry	O
Sound	O
District	O
.	O

You	O
can	O
reduce	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
being	O
infected	O
by	O
EEEv	O
during	O
active	O
mosquito	O
season	O
by	O
doing	O
the	O
following	O
:	O
-	O
Cover	O
your	O
skin	O
when	O
outside	O
by	O
wearing	O
long	O
pants	O
and	O
loose	O
fitting	O
shirts	O
with	O
long	O
sleeves	O
.	O

-	O
Use	O
insect	O
repellent	O
containing	O
DEET	O
.	O

The	O
concentration	O
of	O
DEET	O
should	O
be	O
no	O
greater	O
than	O
30	O
percent	O
for	O
adults	O
,	O
no	O
greater	O
than	O
10	O
percent	O
for	O
children	O
and	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
used	O
on	O
children	O
under	O
6	O
months	O
old	O
.	O

-	O
Eliminate	O
standing	O
water	O
on	O
your	O
property	O
as	O
this	O
is	O
where	O
mosquitoes	O
lay	O
their	O
eggs	O
.	O

Health	O
protection	O
officers	O
are	O
investigating	O
an	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
outbreak	O
in	O
Plymouth	B-City
believed	O
to	O
be	O
linked	O
to	O
crab	O
meat	O
.	O

Environmental	O
health	O
officers	O
and	O
the	O
Health	O
Protection	O
Agency	O
(	O
HPA	O
)	O
launched	O
an	O
inquiry	O
after	O
9	O
cases	O
were	O
confirmed	O
in	O
the	O
city	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
believed	O
to	O
be	O
the	O
1st	O
reported	O
outbreak	O
of	O
the	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
O157	O
strain	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
consumption	O
of	O
crab	O
.	O

The	O
investigation	O
is	O
continuing	O
but	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
suspected	O
link	O
with	O
an	O
unapproved	O
crab	O
supplier	O
.	O

Investigators	O
revealed	O
they	O
took	O
action	O
after	O
9	O
cases	O
emerged	O
in	O
August	O
2011	O
.	O

There	O
have	O
been	O
no	O
further	O
reports	O
of	O

linked	O
to	O
crab	O
since	O
.	O

HPA	O
and	O
Plymouth	B-City
City	O

``	O

(	O

.	O

Islamabad	O

Chikungunya	B-Virus

.	O

Chikungunya	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
,	O
non-lethal	O
viral	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
species	O
of	O

called	O
_Aedes	O
aegypti_	O
,	O
which	O
also	O
carry	O
the	O
dengue	O
and	O
zika	O
viruses	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
experts	O
,	O
the	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
virus	O
causes	O
fever	O
and	O
severe	O
joint	O
pain	O
,	O
while	O
other	O
symptoms	O
include	O
muscle	O
pain	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
nausea	O
,	O
fatigue	O
and	O
rashes	O
.	O

testing	O

that	O

were	O
positive	O
for	O
group	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
_Streptococcus_	I-Virus
[	I-Virus
_Streptococcus	I-Virus
pyogenes_	I-Virus
]	I-Virus
.	O

COVID-19	O
pneumonia	O
has	O
been	O
ruled	O
out	O
.	O

Many	O

.	O

pathogen	O

to	O
be	O
group	O
A	O
_Streptococcus_	O
.	O

The	O
potentially	O
deadly	O
porcine	B-Virus
epidemic	I-Virus

virus	O
[	O

]	O
has	O
been	O
found	O
on	O
a	O
3rd	O

in	O

eastern	O
Manitoba	B-Province
.	O

Manitoba	B-Province
Pork	O
Council	O
's	O
general	O

Andrew	O
Dickson	O
confirmed	O
on	O
Monday	O
that	O
the	O

26	O

.	O

from	O

the	O
problem	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
,	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Salmonella	O
[	O
enterica_	O
serotype	O
]	O
Typhi	O
,	O
is	O
a	O
life-threatening	O
bacterial	O
infection	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
is	O
still	O
common	O
in	O
the	O
developing	O
world	O
,	O
where	O
it	O
affects	O
about	O
21	O
million	O
people	O
annually	O
.	O

Typhoid	B-Disease
fever	O
can	O
be	O
successfully	O
treated	O
with	O
appropriate	O
antibacterials	O
,	O
and	O
treated	O
persons	O
usually	O
begin	O
to	O
feel	O
better	O
within	O
2	O
to	O
3	O
days	O
.	O

Farmers	O
should	O
not	O
underestimate	O
the	O
black	B-Disease
streaked	I-Disease
dwarf	I-Disease
rice	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
,	O
which	O
has	O
been	O
causing	O
widespread	O
panic	O
because	O
of	O
its	O
complicated	O
development	O
and	O

,	O

to	O

.	O

that	O

Measles	B-Virus

up	O

2015	O

this	O

.	O

The	O
country	O

in	O
2013	O
.	O

Baghdad	B-Province
and	O
Babylon	B-City
governorates	O
have	O
registered	O
most	O
cases	O
.	O

A	O
nation-wide	O
measles	B-Virus
campaign	O
is	O
yet	O
to	O
take	O
place	O
this	O
year	O
.	O

The	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
along	O
with	O
health	O
partners	O
are	O
organizing	O
mop-up	O
vaccinations	O
at	O
the	O
localities	O
reporting	O
measles	B-Virus
cases	O
to	O
contain	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
disease	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
World	O
Health	O
Organisation	O
,	O
measles	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
highly	O
contagious	O
,	O
serious	O
disease	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
virus	O
.	O

In	O
1980	O
,	O
before	O
widespread	O
vaccination	O
,	O
measles	B-Virus
caused	O
an	O
estimated	O
2.6	O
million	O
deaths	O
each	O
year	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
remains	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
leading	O
causes	O
of	O
death	O
among	O
young	O
children	O
globally	O
,	O
despite	O
the	O
availability	O
of	O
a	O
safe	O
and	O
effective	O
vaccine	O
.	O

Approximately	O
145	O
700	O
people	O
died	O
from	O
measles	B-Virus
in	O
2013	O
--	O
mostly	O
children	O
under	O
the	O
age	O
of	O
5	O
.	O

A	O
Boulder	B-City
resident	O
is	O
suspected	O
of	O
being	O
the	O
1st	O
to	O
contract	O
tularemia	B-Disease
in	O
2016	O
,	O

from	O
health	O

.	O

Boulder	B-City
County	I-City
Public	O
Health	O
officials	O
investigated	O
last	O
week	O
the	O
1st	O
case	O
in	O
Boulder	O
County	O
of	O
tularemia	B-Disease
,	O
saying	O
a	O
65-year-old	O
is	O

of	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
after	O
showing	O
symptoms	O
of	O
a	O

,	O

a	O

.	O

The	O
man	O
reportedly	O

his	O

and	O
worked	O
with	O
a	O

before	O
showing	O
symptoms	O
.	O

Officials	O
released	O
a	O
warning	O
to	O
the	O
public	O
,	O
saying	O
residents	O
should	O
be	O
cautious	O
while	O
working	O
outside	O
of	O
dead	O
animals	O
.	O

Tularemia	B-Disease
is	O
transmitted	O
by	O
contact	O
with	O
dead	O
animals	O
,	O
particularly	O
through	O
tick	O
and	O
deer	O
fly	O
bites	O
,	O
or	O
skin	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
.	O

Rabbits	O
and	O
rodents	O
are	O
most	O
commonly	O
carriers	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Officials	O
listed	O
some	O
top	O
tips	O
for	O
avoiding	O
contracting	O
the	O
disease	O
:	O
-	O
Use	O
a	O
long-handled	O
shovel	O
to	O
pick	O
up	O
dead	O
animals	O
,	O
double	O
bagging	O
them	O
to	O
dispose	O
of	O
their	O
bodies	O
.	O

-	O
While	O
working	O
outside	O
,	O
use	O
DEET-infused	O
insect	O
repellants	O
.	O

-	O
Wash	O
any	O
cuts	O
or	O
scratches	O
incurred	O
from	O
outdoors	O
work	O
as	O
quickly	O
as	O
possible	O
.	O

-	O
Do	O
n't	O
let	O
pets	O
drink	O
from	O
groundwater	O
.	O

-	O
Never	O
mow	O
over	O
animal	O
carcasses	O
.	O

See	O
a	O
doctor	O
immediately	O
if	O
you	O
quickly	O
contract	O
a	O
fever	O
or	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
after	O
outside	O
work	O
.	O

Residents	O
of	O
Washington	B-City
,	I-Province

,	O

the	O
man	O
contracted	O
the	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

Cases	O
of	O

are	O
rare	O
in	O
Australia	B-Country
due	O

of	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

The	O
Nebraska	B-Province
Game	O
and	O
Parks	O
Commission	O
says	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
is	O
killing	O
deer	O
along	O
the	O
Platte	B-City
River	I-City
and	O
possibly	O
over	O
a	O
much	O
wider	O
area	O
.	O

Epizootic	B-Virus
hemorrhagic	I-Virus
disease	I-Virus
spreads	O
from	O
deer	O
to	O
deer	O
by	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
a	O
small	O
flying	O
insect	O
known	O
as	O
a	O
midge	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
causes	O
hemorrhaging	O
within	O
the	O
body	O
.	O

A	O
high	O
fever	O
may	O
result	O
,	O
causing	O
the	O
deer	O
to	O
seek	O
water	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
why	O
deer	O
killed	O
by	O
the	O
disease	O
usually	O
are	O
found	O
in	O
or	O
near	O
water	O
.	O

The	O
deer	O
may	O
show	O
bleeding	O
from	O
body	O
openings	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
not	O
a	O
threat	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
commission	O
wants	O
people	O
to	O
report	O
any	O
deer	O
deaths	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
attributed	O
to	O
this	O
disease	O
to	O
their	O
nearest	O
Game	O
and	O
Parks	O
office	O
.	O

The	O
Virginia	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
and	O
Consumer	O
Services	O
(	O
VDACS	O
)	O
announced	O
on	O
27	O
Aug	O
2018	O
that	O
another	O
horse	O
from	O
the	O
Hampton	B-City
Roads	I-City
area	O
had	O
contracted	O
eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
[	O
EEE	O
]	O
via	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
mosquito	O
and	O
has	O
been	O
euthanized	O
.	O

The	O
animal	O
,	O
an	O
American	O
Quarter	O
Horse	O
stabled	O
in	O
Chesapeake	O
,	O
is	O
the	O
2nd	O
to	O
be	O

with	O
EEE	O
and	O
the	O
2nd	O
fatality	O
from	O
the	O
disease	O
in	O
August	O
2018	O
.	O

Earlier	O
in	O
August	O
2018	O
,	O
a	O
Quarter	O
Horse	O
mare	O
stabled	O
in	O
the	O
Suffolk	O
area	O
also	O
succumbed	O
to	O
the	O
illness	O
,	O
which	O
has	O
a	O
fatality	O
rate	O
of	O
80-90	O
percent	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
VDACS	O
,	O
both	O
of	O
the	O
horses	O
had	O
an	O
``	O
incomplete	O
vaccination	O
history	O
.	O
''	O

For	O
full	O
effectiveness	O
,	O
horses	O
must	O
receive	O
the	O
initial	O
vaccination	O
and	O
a	O
booster	O
,	O
then	O
be	O
re-vaccinated	O
every	O
6-12	O
months	O
,	O
said	O
Elaine	O
Lidholm	O
,	O
communications	O
director	O
for	O
VDACS	O
.	O

Sometimes	O
called	O
sleeping	O
sickness	O
,	O
Lidholm	O
said	O
EEE	O
is	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
illness	O
causing	O
inflammation	O
or	O
swelling	O
of	O
the	O
brain	O
and	O
spinal	O
cord	O
.	O

Signs	O
include	O
impaired	O
vision	O
,	O
aimless	O
wandering	O
,	O
head	O
pressing	O
,	O
circling	O
,	O
inability	O
to	O
swallow	O
,	O
irregular	O
staggering	O
gait	O
,	O
paralysis	O
,	O
convulsions	O
and	O
death	O
.	O

Once	O
a	O
horse	O
has	O
been	O
bitten	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
mosquito	O
,	O
it	O
may	O
take	O
3	O
to	O
10	O
days	O
for	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
to	O
appear	O
.	O

Besides	O
vaccination	O
,	O
recommended	O
prevention	O
methods	O
include	O
eliminating	O
standing	O
water	O
that	O
can	O
provide	O
breeding	O
sites	O
for	O
mosquitoes	O
,	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
insect	O
repellents	O
,	O
and	O
removing	O
animals	O
from	O
mosquito-infested	O
areas	O
during	O
peak	O
biting	O
times	O
,	O
usually	O
dusk	O
to	O
dawn	O
.	O

Garvin	O
said	O
horse	O
owners	O
should	O
consult	O
their	O
veterinarians	O
if	O
an	O
animal	O
exhibits	O
any	O

signs	O
such	O
as	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

Why	O
you	O
should	O
take	O
note	O
?	O

The	O
Public	O
Health	O
Agency	O
of	O
Canada	B-Country
is	O

an	O

_Escherichia	O

,	O

_E.coli_	O
O121	O
.	O

the	O

has	O
not	O

,	O
and	O
the	O
investigation	O
is	O

.	O

The	O

to	O
Canadians	O
is	O
low	O
.	O

However	O
,	O

are	O

to	O

to	O

illness	O
.	O

Investigation	O
Summary	O

24	O
cases	O
of	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
O121	O
with	O

(	O

.	O

What	O
the	O

of	O
Canada	B-Country
is	O
doing	O
The	O
Government	O
of	O
Canada	O
is	O
committed	O
to	O
food	O
safety	O
.	O

The	O
Public	O
Health	O
Agency	O
of	O
Canada	B-Country
leads	O
multi-jurisdictional	O
human	O
health	O
investigations	O
of	O
outbreaks	O
and	O
is	O
in	O
regular	O
contact	O

provincial	O
partners	O
to	O
monitor	O
and	O

to	O
address	O

.	O

Health	O
Canada	B-Country
provides	O
food-related	O
health	O
risk	O
assessments	O
to	O
determine	O
if	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
a	O
certain	O
substance	O
or	O
microorganism	O
poses	O
a	O
health	O

to	O
consumers	O
.	O

The	O

Food	O
Inspection	O
Agency	O
(	O

)	O
conducts	O
food	O
safety	O
investigations	O
into	O
the	O
possible	O
food	O

of	O
an	O
outbreak	O
.	O

of	O
Canada	B-Country
will	O

becomes	O

.	O

Crimean-Congo	B-Virus
hemorrhagic	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
virus	O
,	O
the	O
main	O
transmission	O
mechanism	O
of	O
which	O
is	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
the	O
_Hyalomma_	O
genus	O
tick	O
,	O
although	O

can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
patient	O
's	O
blood	O
or	O
fluids	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
occur	O
especially	O
in	O
healthcare	O
personnel	O
when	O
they	O
are	O
not	O
properly	O
protected	O
.	O

Bovine	B-Disease
tuberculosis	I-Disease
was	O

in	O
a	O
2-year-old	O
steer	O
[	O

]	O
the	O
state	O
's	O
thumb	O

.	O

United	B-Country

Bovine	O

[	O

[	O

2	O

]	O

is	O

ill	O
heard	O
about	O
illnesses	O
from	O
the	O
picnic	O
and	O
contacted	O
the	O
health	O
department	O
,	O
Wharton	O
said	O
.	O

Bob	O
Neff	O
,	O
owner	O
of	O
the	O
family	O

that	O
hosts	O

that	O

became	O

from	O

.	O

``	O

's	O

,	O

.	O

.	O

do	O

.	O

Leningrad	B-Province
Oblast	I-Province
is	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
Russian	O
regions	O
which	O
has	O
the	O
highest	O
incidence	O
of	O
tick-borne	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
.	O

From	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
the	O
season	O
this	O
year	O
(	O
April	O
2015	O
)	O
,	O
16	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
registered	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
3.2	O
times	O
more	O
than	O
in	O
the	O
same	O
period	O
of	O
last	O
year	O
(	O
2014	O
)	O
.	O

Among	O
the	O
cases	O
is	O
one	O
14-year-old	O
child	O
.	O

Epidemiologists	O
carry	O
out	O
constant	O
monitoring	O
of	O
the	O
situation	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
1st	O
6	O
months	O
of	O
2015	O
,	O
there	O
were	O
5066	O
cases	O
of	O
tick	O
bites	O
,	O
including	O
1220	O
children	O
.	O

Compared	O
with	O
the	O
same	O
period	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2014	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
bites	O
increased	O
by	O
67	O
per	O
cent	O
.	O

Cases	O
of	O
chikungunya	O
and	O
dengue	B-Virus
are	O
being	O
registered	O
in	O
the	O
Gabonese	O
provinces	O
of	O
Haut-Ogooue	B-Province
and	O
Ogooue-Lolo	B-Province
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
director	O
general	O
of	O
Health	O
of	O
Gabon	B-Country
,	O
Mr	O
Khouilla	O
,	O
``	O
Out	O
of	O
616	O
samples	O

by	O
the	O

(	O

)	O
,	O
[	O

]	O

of	O

virus	O
and	O
15	O

[	O

]	O
.	O

So	O

[	O

Khouilla	O
has	O

that	O

out	O

people	O

.	O

]	O
.	O

On	O

2021	O
,	O
Rainbow	O
Equine	O
Hospital	O
Laboratory	O

of	O

[	O
equine	B-Virus
influenza	I-Virus
]	O
in	O
a	O

Cob	O
gelding	O
on	O
a	O

in	O
North	B-City
Yorkshire	I-City
.	O

The	O

had	O
recently	O

on	O
a	O

6	O

of	O

.	O

.	O

on	O
12	O
Nov	O
2021	O
.	O

Disclaimer	O

data	O
presented	O
in	O
this	O
report	O

with	O

,	O

likely	O
to	O

way	O
that	O

are	O

for	O

and	O
subsequently	O
reported	O
.	O

Consequently	O
,	O

do	O
not	O

frequency	O
within	O

.	O

.	O

Heyuan	B-City
municipal	O

agencies	O
monitored	O
wild	O
birds	O
for	O
epidemic	O
sources	O
and	O
disease	O
in	O
7	O
provincial-level	O
reserves	O
and	O
found	O
no	O

.	O

There	O
are	O
no	O
reports	O
of	O
suspected	O
human	O
cases	O
of	O
H7N9	O
avian	O
influenza	O
in	O
Heyuan	B-City
.	O

There	O
had	O
been	O
24	O
cases	O
of	O
cryptosporidiosis	B-Disease
reported	O
since	O
the	O
start	O
of	O
the	O
year	O
[	O
2013	O
]	O
compared	O
with	O
none	O
for	O
the	O
same	O
period	O
last	O
year	O
[	O
2012	O
]	O
,	O
Dr	O
Jonathan	O
Jarman	O
said	O
yesterday	O
.	O

``	O
Cryptosporidium	B-Virus
is	O
not	O
normally	O
a	O
serious	O
disease	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
be	O
dangerous	O
for	O
people	O
with	O
lowered	O
immunity	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Diarrhoea	O
and	O
tummy	O
cramps	O
for	O
2	O
weeks	O
are	O
n't	O
much	O
fun	O
.	O
''	O

``	O
Some	O
of	O
the	O
cases	O
were	O
children	O
but	O
half	O
were	O
adults	O
,	O
and	O
similar	O
outbreaks	O
have	O
also	O
been	O
seen	O
in	O
other	O
parts	O
of	O
New	B-Country
Zealand	I-Country
.	O

``	O
The	O
main	O
symptoms	O
are	O
diarrhoea	O
,	O
often	O
watery	O
,	O
stomach	O
cramps	O
,	O
lack	O
of	O
appetite	O
and	O
weight	O
loss	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Jarman	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
may	O
last	O
2	O
weeks	O
or	O
more	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
treatment	O
except	O
for	O
making	O
sure	O
that	O
the	O
patient	O
does	O
not	O
become	O
dehydrated	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
tiny	O
parasite	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
guts	O
of	O
birds	O
,	O
fish	O
,	O
reptiles	O
(	O
such	O
as	O
geckos	O
and	O
turtles	O
)	O
,	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
such	O
as	O
cattle	O
,	O
sheep	O
,	O
cats	O
and	O
dogs	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
passed	O
on	O
in	O
the	O
faeces	O
of	O
infected	O
animals	O
and	O
humans	O
.	O

The	O
usual	O
risk	O
factors	O
for	O
cryptosporidiosis	B-Disease
are	O
living	O
on	O
a	O
farm	O
and	O
having	O
contact	O
with	O
farm	O
animals	O
.	O

``	O
However	O
,	O
some	O
cases	O
in	O
Taranaki	B-Province
became	O
unwell	O
after	O
recently	O
swimming	O
in	O
a	O
pool	O
,	O
''	O
Dr	O
Jarman	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
is	O
important	O
that	O
people	O
with	O
recent	O
tummy	O
bug	O
symptoms	O
stay	O
away	O
from	O
swimming	O
pools	O
,	O
otherwise	O
they	O
may	O
spread	O
the	O
illness	O
to	O
others	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
bugs	O
are	O
excreted	O
by	O
sick	O
people	O
for	O
several	O
weeks	O
once	O
they	O
have	O
recovered	O
from	O
the	O
illness	O
.	O

People	O
should	O
not	O
go	O
swimming	O
in	O
a	O
pool	O
if	O
they	O
have	O
diarrhoea	O
.	O

Wait	O
until	O
at	O
least	O
2	O
weeks	O
after	O
the	O
symptoms	O
have	O
gone	O
.	O

See	O
a	O
doctor	O
if	O
the	O
symptoms	O
are	O
severe	O
,	O
if	O
worried	O
or	O
if	O
the	O
illness	O
does	O
not	O
get	O
better	O
after	O
2-3	O
days	O
.	O

Wash	O
hands	O
thoroughly	O
after	O
contact	O
with	O
animals	O
or	O
animal	O
faeces	O
,	O
after	O
caring	O
for	O
people	O
with	O
diarrhoea	O
,	O
after	O
going	O
to	O
the	O
toilet	O
,	O
and	O
before	O
and	O
during	O
food	O
preparation	O
.	O

Use	O
plenty	O
of	O
soap	O
,	O
clean	O
under	O
your	O
fingernails	O
,	O
rinse	O
your	O
hands	O
well	O
and	O
dry	O
them	O
on	O
a	O
clean	O
towel	O
.	O

A	O
3rd	O
case	O
of	O
meningococcal	O
[	O
serogroup	O
]	O
C	O
has	O
occurred	O
in	O
Sarlat	B-City
in	O
3	O
weeks	O
.	O

This	O
time	O
it	O
is	O
a	O
municipal	O
officer	O
in	O
the	O
city	O
of	O
Sarlat	B-City
.	O

She	O
was	O
admitted	O
to	O
hospital	O
in	O
Perigueux	O
on	O
Friday	O
.	O

3	O
of	O
her	O
close	O
colleagues	O
have	O
received	O
preventive	O
treatment	O
.	O

The	O
Institute	O
for	O
Public	O
Health	O
Surveillance	O
will	O
investigate	O
why	O
these	O
3	O
cases	O
have	O
occurred	O
in	O
such	O
close	O
proximity	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
case	O
was	O
a	O
19-year-old	O
girl	O
in	O
the	O
canton	O
of	O
Saint	O
Cyprien	O
,	O
next	O
a	O
young	O
child	O
,	O
in	O
Sarlat	B-City
;	O
and	O
now	O
a	O
Sarlat	O
commune	O
employee	O
on	O
Thursday	O
.	O

The	O
Institute	O
for	O
Public	O
Health	O
Surveillance	O
acknowledges	O
that	O
Dordogne	B-Province
is	O
facing	O
an	O
unusual	O
situation	O
.	O

This	O
department	O
[	O
Dordogne	B-Province
]	O
usually	O
sees	O
between	O
1	O
and	O
5	O
cases	O
per	O
year	O
,	O
but	O
according	O
to	O
Patrick	O
Rolland	O
,	O
the	O
head	O
of	O
the	O
intelligence	O
unit	O
of	O
the	O
INVS	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
reason	O
to	O
worry	O
.	O

First	O
,	O
because	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
only	O
be	O
transmitted	O
after	O
close	O
contact	O
,	O
through	O
coughing	O
or	O
even	O
saliva	O
.	O

Second	O
,	O
.	O

In	O
November	O
2017	O
,	O
the	O
Kentucky	B-Province
Department	O
for	O
Public	O
Health	O
(	O
DPH	O
)	O
identified	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
acute	B-Disease
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
.	O

The	O
increase	O
in	O
cases	O
observed	O
in	O
Kentucky	B-Province
was	O
well	O
over	O
the	O
10-year	O
average	O
of	O
reported	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
cases	O
.	O

Several	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
infected	O
with	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
virus	O
strains	O
genetically	O
linked	O
to	O
outbreaks	O
in	O
California	O
,	O
Utah	O
,	O
and	O
Michigan	O
.	O

Similar	O
to	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
outbreaks	O
in	O
other	O
states	O
,	O
the	O
primary	O
risk	O
factors	O
remain	O
illicit	O
drug	O
use	O
and	O
homelessness	O
.	O

A	O
contaminated	O
food	O
source	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
identified	O
,	O
and	O
transmission	O
is	O
believed	O
to	O

.	O

family	O

.	O

DHEC	O

rabies	B-Virus
clinics	O
across	O
the	O
state	O
,	O
in	O

.	O

''	O

(	O
UNICEF	O
)	O
and	O

if	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

He	O
said	O
those	O
below	O
5	O
years	O
are	O
at	O
great	O
risk	O
of	O
getting	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
adding	O
that	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
Measles	B-Virus
is	O
fast	O
in	O
the	O
community	O
.	O

Measles	B-Virus
,	O
or	O
rubeola	O
,	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
infection	O
of	O
the	O
respiratory	O
system	O
.	O

Measles	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
very	O
contagious	O
disease	O
that	O
can	O
spread	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
mucus	O
and	O
saliva	O
.	O

Measles	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
leading	O
cause	O
of	O
death	O
in	O
children	O
.	O

Of	O
the	O
114	O
900	O
global	O

related	O
to	O
measles	B-Virus
in	O
2014	O
,	O
the	O

were	O
under	O
the	O
age	O
of	O
5	O
,	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
(	O
WHO	O
)	O
said	O
.	O

Azerbaijani	O

have	O

a	O
bird	B-Virus

outbreak	O

equine	I-Virus

(	I-Virus
EEE	I-Virus
)	I-Virus
virus	I-Disease
infection	I-Disease
this	O

[	O
2020	O
]	O
.	O

.	O

According	O
to	O
a	O
release	O
,	O

news	O
of	O
a	O

case	O
of	O
EEE	O

state	O
announced	O

week	O
that	O
horses	O
in	O
3	O
northwestern	O
Wisconsin	B-Province
counties	O
were	O
infected	O
with	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

Officials	O
say	O
EEE	O
is	O
a	O
rare	O
but	O
potentially	O
fatal	O
disease	O
,	O
that	O
can	O
affect	O
people	O
of	O
all	O
ages	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
mosquito	O
.	O

Mosquitoes	O
acquire	O
EEE	O
virus	O
by	O
feeding	O
on	O
infected	O
birds	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
not	O
spread	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
or	O
between	O
humans	O
and	O
animals	O
.	O

The	O
last	O
human	O
case	O
of	O
EEE	O
in	O
Wisconsin	B-Province
was	O
reported	O
in	O
2017	O
.	O

At	O
least	O
242	O
residents	O
of	O
Sikka	B-City
,	O
East	B-Province
Nusa	I-Province
Tenggara	I-Province

with	O
the	O
rabies	B-Virus
virus	O
,	O

.	O

[	O

.	O

``	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

''	O

.	O

The	O

is	O
also	O

.	O

Currently	O
there	O
are	O
169	O

of	O

,	O
but	O
this	O
could	O
only	O

.	O

would	O
be	O

and	O

of	O

dogs	O
.	O

``	O

for	O

are	O
very	O

,	O
while	O
the	O
ones	O
for	O
dogs	O
are	O
much	O
cheaper	O
,	O
''	O

said	O
.	O

For	O
the	O
1st	O
time	O
,	O
2	O
cases	O
of	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
have	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
Kathmandu	B-City
.	O

Dengue	B-Virus
is	O
caused	O
by	O
dengue	O
virus	O
(	O
DENV	O
)	O
,	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
flavivirus	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
transmitted	O
by	O
_Aedes_	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

``	O
This	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
discovery	O
of	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
in	O
the	O
Kathmandu	B-City
Valley	O
even	O
though	O
the	O
disease	O
was	O
detected	O
in	O
the	O
Tarai	O
and	O
inner-Tarai	O
districts	O
some	O
5	O
years	O
ago	O
,	O
''	O
according	O
Sukraraj	O
Tropical	O
and	O
Infectious	O
Disease	O
Hospital	O
,	O
Teku	O
.	O

``	O
_Aedes_	O
mosquitoes	O
are	O
found	O
in	O
cold	O
water	O
,	O
freeze	O
[	O
?	O

]	O
,	O
cooler	O
houses	O
and	O
other	O
cold	O
places	O
,	O
and	O
rich	O
people	O
are	O
vulnerable	O
to	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr	O
Bashu	O
Dev	O
Pandey	O
at	O
Teku	O
Hospital	O
on	O
Monday	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
communicable	O
from	O
one	O
person	O
to	O
another	O
,	O
and	O
its	O
symptoms	O
are	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
bleeding	O
and	O
unconsciousness	O
.	O

``	O
If	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
is	O
not	O
treated	O
on	O
time	O
,	O
the	O
patient	O
may	O
die	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

_Aedes_	O
mosquitoes	O
also	O
breed	O
in	O
water	O
collections	O
in	O
artificial	O
containers	O
such	O
as	O
plastic	O
cups	O
,	O
used	O
tires	O
,	O
broken	O
bottles	O
,	O
flower	O
pots	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O

Dr	O
Pandey	O
advised	O
people	O
to	O
keep	O
their	O
freezes	O
[	O
?	O
]	O

and	O

the	O
disease	O
.	O

Dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
is	O
an	O
acute	O
febrile	O
disease	O
which	O
normally	O
occurs	O
in	O
the	O
tropics	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
also	O
known	O
as	O
break-bone	O
fever	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
life-threatening	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
tested	O
and	O
approved	O
vaccine	O
for	O
the	O
dengue	B-Virus
flavivirus	O
.	O

of	O
dengue	B-Virus

in	O

control	O
.	O

may	O

Bluetongue	B-Disease
is	O
a	O

which	O
affects	O

but	O

are	O

are	O

.	O

the	O

,	O

Allier	B-City
,	O

,	O
and	O

regions	O
of	O

country	O

.	O

has	O

these	O

has	O
been	O
the	O

since	O

2016	O
.	O

Clinical	O
signs	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
1	O
.	O

In	O

(	O

)	O

collecting	O

The	O
leishmaniases	O
are	O
a	O
group	O
of	O
diseases	O
caused	O
by	O
protozoan	O
parasites	O
from	O
more	O
than	O
20	O
_Leishmania_	O
species	O
.	O

These	O
parasites	O
are	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
by	O
the	O
bites	O
of	O
the	O
infected	O
female	O
phlebotomine	O
sandfly	O
--	O
a	O
tiny	O
,	O
only	O
2-3	O
mm	O
long	O
,	O
insect	O
vector	O
.	O

There	O
are	O
3	O
main	O
forms	O
of	O
leishmaniasis	B-Disease
:	O
cutaneous	O
,	O
visceral	O
or	O
kala-azar	O
,	O
and	O
mucocutaneous	O
.	O

The	O
President	O
of	O
the	O
Bio-Bio	O
Cordillera	O
territory	O
called	O
that	O

not	O

this	O
season	O

to	O
hanta	O
[	O
virus	O
]	O
cases	O
.	O

[	O

]	O

]	O

''	O

In	O
2013	O
,	O
the	O

for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
(	O
CDC	O
)	O
released	O

of	O
300	O
000	O
Americans	O
diagnosed	O
annually	O
.	O

Lyme	B-Disease
disease	I-Disease
is	O
an	O
illness	O
transmitted	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
an	O
infected	O
blacklegged	O
tick	O
(	O
deer	O
tick	O
)	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
include	O
fever	O
,	O
fatigue	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
and	O
joint	O
pain	O
.	O

A	O
common	O
early	O
symptom	O
is	O
a	O
red	O
rash	O
that	O
looks	O
like	O
a	O
bulls-eye	O
.	O

Ticks	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
everywhere	O
,	O
but	O
individuals	O
should	O
be	O
especially	O
cautious	O
in	O
areas	O
with	O
dense	O
bushes	O
or	O
tall	O
grass	O
.	O

When	O
outdoors	O
,	O
use	O
repellents	O
with	O
diethyltoluamide	O
(	O
DEET	O
)	O
and	O
protective	O
clothing	O
.	O

After	O
outdoor	O
activities	O
,	O
check	O
for	O
ticks	O
,	O
and	O
,	O
if	O
one	O
is	O
found	O
,	O
promptly	O
remove	O
it	O
using	O
fine-tipped	O
tweezers	O
and	O
applying	O
even	O
pressure	O
on	O
the	O
tick	O
as	O
it	O
is	O
being	O
removed	O
.	O

Noellie	O
Gay	O
,	O
Dominique	O
Rousset	O
,	O
Patricia	O
Huc	O
,	O
Severine	O
Matheus	O
,	O
Martine	O
Ledrans	O
,	O
Jacques	O
Rosine	O
,	O

Cassadou	O
,	O
and	O
Harold	O
Noel	O
.	O

Seroprevalence	O
of	O
Asian	O
Lineage	O
Chikungunya	B-Virus
Virus	I-Virus
Infection	I-Disease
on	O
Saint	B-Country
Martin	I-Country
Island	I-Country
,	O
7	O
Months	O
After	O
the	O
2013	O
Emergence	O
.	O

Abstract	O
At	O
the	O
end	O
of	O
2013	O
,	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
virus	I-Virus
(	O
CHIKV	O
)	O
emerged	O
in	O
Saint	B-Country
Martin	I-Country
Island	I-Country
,	O
Caribbean	O
.	O

The	O
Asian	O
lineage	O
was	O
identified	O
.	O

7	O
months	O
after	O
this	O
introduction	O
,	O
the	O
seroprevalence	O
was	O
16.9	O
percent	O
in	O
the	O
population	O
of	O
Saint	O
Martin	O
and	O
39.0	O
percent	O
of	O
infections	O
remained	O
asymptomatic	O
.	O

This	O
moderate	O
attack	O
rate	O
and	O
the	O
apparent	O
limited	O
size	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
in	O
Saint	O
Martin	O
could	O
be	O
explained	O
by	O
control	O
measures	O
involved	O
to	O
lower	O
the	O
exposure	O
of	O
the	O
inhabitants	O
.	O

Other	O
drivers	O
such	O
as	O
climatic	O
factors	O
and	O
population	O
genetic	O
factors	O
should	O
be	O
explored	O
.	O

The	O
substantial	O
rate	O
of	O
asymptomatic	O
infections	O
recorded	O
points	O
to	O
a	O
potential	O
source	O
of	O
infection	O
that	O
can	O
both	O
spread	O
in	O
new	O
geographic	O
areas	O
and	O
maintain	O
an	O
inconspicuous	O
endemic	O
circulation	O
in	O
the	O
Americas	O
.	O

A	O
neonatal	O
intensive	O
care	O
unit	O
in	O
a	O
hospital	O
in	O
the	O
southern	O
Brazil	B-Country
state	O
of	O
Rio	B-Province
Grande	I-Province
do	I-Province
Sul	I-Province
has	O
been	O
temporarily	O
closed	O
due	O
to	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
enterovirus	B-Virus
,	O
which	O
has	O
sickened	O
8	O
newborns	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
a	O
Globo	O
1	O
report	O
(	O
computer	O
translated	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
situation	O
reported	O
at	O
the	O
Windmills	O
Hospital	O
in	O
Porto	B-City
Alegre	I-City
is	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O
4	O
confirmed	O
,	O
3	O
suspected	O
cases	O
and	O
at	O
least	O
1	O
death	O
has	O
been	O
reported	O
.	O

report	O
does	O
not	O
specify	O
which	O
enterovirus	B-Virus
strain	O
is	O
implicated	O
in	O
the	O

.	O

do	O

that	O

have	O

admissions	O
and	O

The	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
Department	O
of	O

(	O
NMDOH	O
)	O
is	O

a	O

of	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
in	O
Bernalillo	B-City
County	I-City
.	O

The	O
man	O
in	O
his	O
30	O
's	O
is	O
hospitalized	O
and	O
has	O
reported	O
injection	O
drug	O
use	O
.	O

Antitoxin	O
to	O
prevent	O
the	O
progression	O
of	O
disease	O
was	O
shipped	O
to	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
by	O
the	O
CDC	O
.	O

Previous	O
cases	O
of	O
wound	B-Disease
botulism	I-Disease
in	O
the	O
state	O
have	O
been	O
linked	O
primarily	O
to	O
black	O
tar	O
heroin	O
use	O
,	O
and	O
,	O
in	O
some	O
cases	O
,	O
injecting	O
methamphetamine	O
.	O

Botulism	O
is	O
a	O
rare	O
but	O
serious	O
paralytic	O
illness	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
nerve	O
toxin	O
produced	O
by	O
the	O
bacterium	O
_Clostridium	O
botulinum_	O
in	O
a	O
wound	O
or	O
abscess	O
.	O

Injecting	O
drugs	O
especially	O
under	O
the	O
skin	O
can	O
introduce	O
_C	O
.	O

botulinum_	O
and	O
allow	O
it	O
to	O
grow	O
.	O

Left	O
untreated	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
lead	O
to	O
toxin	O
production	O
and	O
progressive	O
muscle	O
paralysis	O
and	O
death	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
healthcare	O
providers	O
are	O
advised	O
to	O
consider	O
the	O
possibility	O
of	O
botulism	O
in	O
any	O
patient	O
reporting	O
injecting	O
drugs	O
and	O
presenting	O
with	O
the	O
following	O
signs	O
and/or	O
symptoms	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
bacterial	O
toxin	O
:	O
-	O
double	O
vision	O
;	O
-	O
blurred	O
vision	O
;	O
-	O
drooping	O
eyelids	O
-	O
slurred	O
speech	O
;	O
-	O
difficulty	O
swallowing	O
-	O
dry	O
mouth	O
;	O
-	O
muscle	O
weakness/descending	O
paralysis	O
;	O
-	O
difficulty	O
breathing/shortness	O
of	O
breath	O
The	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
also	O
recommends	O
:	O
-	O
warning	O
drugs	O
users	O
about	O
wound	B-Disease

.	O

African	B-Virus
swine	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
(	O
ASF	O
)	O
,	O
a	O

disease	O

and	O
having	O
no	O

is	O

in	O
East	O
Asia	O
.	O

The	O
ASF	O
outbreak	O
that	O
has	O
trickled	O
from	O
North	O
to	O
South	B-Country
Korea	I-Country
is	O
akin	O
to	O
an	O
``	O
apocalypse	O
''	O

to	O
Ahn	O

,	O

.	O

On	O
,	O
the	O
South	O
Korean	O
government	O
ambushed	O

pigs	O
near	O
the	O
country	O

,	O
using	O

and	O

.	O

was	O
carried	O
out	O
after	O
wayward	O
pigs	O
that	O
had	O
wandered	O
across	O

Korean	O

to	O

ASF	O
virus	O
.	O

Pork	O
constitutes	O
80	O
percent	O
of	O
protein	O
consumption	O
in	O
East	O
Asia	O
.	O

As	O

.	O

's	O

County	I-City

after	O

[	O

has	O

in	O

.	O

The	O

.	O

James-Mesloh	O
said	O
that	O

in	O

should	O
serve	O
as	O

for	O

.	O

A	O

for	O

was	O
released	O
in	O
1995	O
.	O

That	O
vaccine	O
has	O
lowered	O
the	O
number	O
of	O

,	O
James-Mesloh	O
said	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
most	O

when	O
a	O
2nd	O
dose	O
is	O

.	O

The	O
vaccine	O
has	O
a	O
97	O
percent	O
success	O
rate	O
for	O
children	O
who	O
receive	O
a	O
2nd	O
dose	O
.	O

Most	O
of	O
the	O
Lee	B-City
County	I-City
cases	O
occurred	O
in	O
children	O
who	O
only	O

.	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

The	O
New	B-Province
Hampshire	I-Province

.	O

Hepatitis	B-Virus
C	I-Virus
is	O
a	O
viral	O
infection	O
transmitted	O
by	O
blood	O
.	O

It	O
causes	O
inflammation	O
of	O
the	O
liver	O
that	O
can	O
lead	O
to	O
chronic	O
health	O
issues	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
passed	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
infected	O
person	O
's	O
blood	O
.	O

More	O
than	O
4000	O
animals	O
have	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
after	O
an	O
anthrax	B-Disease
outbreak	O
in	O
northwest	O
Victoria	B-Province
.	O

Agriculture	O
Victoria	B-Province
[	O
AV	O
]	O
on	O
said	O
it	O
was	O
continuing	O
to	O
respond	O
to	O
an	O
anthrax	B-Disease
outbreak	O
involving	O
deaths	O
across	O
4	O
sheep	O
farms	O
around	O
Swan	B-City
Hill	I-City
.	O

Victoria	B-Province
's	O
Chief	O
Veterinary	O
Officer	O
Charles	O
Milne	O
said	O
there	O
were	O
more	O
than	O
30	O
Agriculture	O
Victoria	O
staff	O
working	O
on	O
the	O

animal	O
carcasses	O

for	O
CWD	O
.	O

.	O

Acting	O

said	O

their	O

.	O
''	O

Dr	O
Lambert	O
said	O
hemolytic	O
uremic	O
syndrome	O
(	O
HUS	O
)	O
can	O
develop	O
2-14	O
days	O
after	O
diarrhea	O
caused	O
by	O
this	O
particular	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
organism	O
.	O

``	O

further	O

of	O

and	O
other	O
similar	O
infections	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

``	O

any	O

''	O

.	O

.	O

4765	O

4035	O

Karachi	B-City

730	O
from	O

A	O
total	O
of	O
127	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
suspected	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O

in	O
Karachi	B-City
this	O
month	O
[	O
November	O
2017	O
]	O
,	O
41	O
of	O
which	O
were	O
reported	O
last	O
week	O
.	O

Experts	O
said	O
that	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
is	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
by	O
infected	O
mosquitoes	O
and	O
the	O
major	O
symptoms	O
include	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
joint	O
pain	O
,	O
joint	O
swelling	O
,	O
rash	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
muscle	O
pain	O
,	O
nausea	O
and	O
fatigue	O
.	O

Chikungunya	B-Virus
is	O
rarely	O
fatal	O
;	O
the	O
death	O
rate	O
of	O
the	O
disease-affected	O
people	O
is	O
less	O
than	O
one	O
per	O
cent	O
.	O

In	O
2016	O
,	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
405	O
suspected	O
cases	O
of	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
were	O
reported	O
from	O
Karachi	B-City
.	O

[	O
byline	O
:	O
PPI	O
]	O

The	O
Texas	B-Province
Animal	O
Health	O
Commission	O
(	O
TAHC	O
)	O
has	O
confirmed	O
3	O
more	O
horses	O
--	O
1	O
Quarter	O
Horse	O
from	O
Travis	B-City
County	I-City
and	O
2	O
horses	O
from	O
Harris	B-City
County	I-City
--	O
with	O
equine	B-Virus
infectious	I-Virus
anemia	I-Virus
(	O
EIA	O
)	O
.	O

Both	O
Harris	B-City
County	I-City
horses	O
reside	O
on	O
the	O
same	O
premises	O
.	O

Both	O
premises	O
'	O
owners	O
and	O
local	O
veterinarians	O
are	O
working	O
with	O
TAHC	O
staff	O
to	O
implement	O
biosecurity	O
protocols	O
and	O
monitor	O
potentially	O
exposed	O
horses	O
.	O

Those	O
premises	O
will	O
remain	O
under	O
quarantine	O
until	O
they	O
meet	O
TAHC	O
requirements	O
.	O

Texas	B-Province
'	O
1st	O
confirmed	O
case	O
of	O
EIA	O
occurred	O
in	O
March	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O
in	O
Kleberg	O
County	O
.	O

EIA	O
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
attacks	O
horses	O
'	O
immune	O
systems	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
transmitted	O
through	O
the	O
exchange	O
of	O
body	O
fluids	O
from	O
an	O
infected	O
to	O
an	O
uninfected	O
animal	O
,	O
often	O
by	O
blood-feeding	O
insects	O
such	O
as	O
horseflies	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
through	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
blood-contaminated	O
instruments	O
or	O
needles	O
.	O

A	O
Coggins	O
test	O
screens	O
horses	O
'	O
blood	O
for	O
antibodies	O
indicative	O
of	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
the	O
EIA	O
virus	O
.	O

Most	O
US	O
states	O
require	O
horses	O
to	O
have	O
proof	O
of	O
a	O
negative	O
Coggins	O
test	O
to	O
travel	O
across	O
state	O
lines	O
.	O

Once	O
an	O
animal	O
is	O
infected	O
with	O
EIA	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
infected	O
for	O
life	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
a	O
reservoir	O
for	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
disease	O
.	O

Not	O
all	O
horses	O
show	O
signs	O
of	O
disease	O
,	O
but	O
those	O
doing	O
so	O
can	O
exhibit	O
progressive	O
condition	O
loss	O
,	O
muscle	O
weakness	O
,	O
poor	O
stamina	O
,	O
fever	O
,	O
depression	O
,	O
and	O
anemia	O
.	O

EIA	O
has	O
no	O
vaccine	O
and	O
no	O
cure	O
.	O

A	O
horse	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
the	O
disease	O
dies	O
,	O
is	O
euthanized	O
,	O
or	O
must	O
be	O
placed	O
under	O
extremely	O
strict	O
quarantine	O
conditions	O
(	O
at	O
least	O
200	O
yards	O
away	O
from	O
unaffected	O
equids	O
)	O
for	O
the	O
rest	O
of	O
its	O
life	O
.	O

A	O
playground	O
on	O
the	O
northern	O
beaches	O
has	O
been	O
closed	O
after	O
2	O
children	O
became	O
sick	O
with	O
salmonella	B-Virus
after	O
playing	O
in	O
the	O
sandpit	O
.	O

The	O
young	O
children	O
caught	O
the	O
infection	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
believed	O
to	O
be	O
spread	O
by	O
contact	O
with	O
bandicoot	O
droppings	O
,	O
after	O
playing	O
at	O
Warriewood	B-City
Valley	O
Rocket	O
Park	O
,	O
in	O
Casuarina	O
Dr.	O
Northern	O
Sydney	O
Local	O
Health	O
District	O
director	O
of	O
public	O
health	O
Dr	O
Michael	O
Staff	O
said	O
he	O
hoped	O
to	O
have	O
contained	O
the	O
outbreak	O
by	O
advising	O
the	O
council	O
to	O
close	O
the	O
park	O
quickly	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
hope	O
that	O
the	O
closure	O
of	O
the	O
park	O
will	O
prevent	O
further	O
cases	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

A	O
sand	O
sample	O
taken	O
from	O
the	O
playground	O
was	O
tested	O
after	O
2	O
confirmed	O
_Salmonella_	O
Java	O
cases	O
were	O
reported	O
to	O
the	O
public	O
health	O
unit	O
.	O

The	O
2	O
cases	O
were	O
children	O
who	O
became	O
unwell	O
in	O
April	O
2017	O
.	O

One	O
was	O
reported	O
to	O
the	O
health	O
unit	O
in	O
late	O
April	O
2017	O
and	O
the	O
other	O
in	O
early	O
May	O
2017	O
.	O

They	O
were	O
unwell	O
with	O
fever	O
,	O
abdominal	O
pain	O
and	O
diarrhea	O
.	O

Both	O
have	O
since	O
made	O
a	O
full	O
recovery	O
without	O
requiring	O
hospital	O
treatment	O
.	O

Apparently	O
,	O
the	O
children	O
played	O
in	O
the	O
playground	O
in	O
the	O
week	O
prior	O
to	O
becoming	O
unwell	O
.	O

Dr	O
Staff	O
said	O
he	O
believed	O
they	O
contracted	O
the	O
illness	O
through	O
ingesting	O
contaminated	O
sand	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
he	O
suspected	O
that	O
the	O
bacteria	O
had	O
been	O
brought	O
to	O
the	O
sandpit	O
by	O

were	O
already	O

,	O

than	O
bandicoot	O
droppings	O
in	O
the	O

.	O

``	O

bug	O
is	O
in	O
the	O
sand	O

can	O
grow	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

of	O

closed	O
last	O

now	O

whole	O

is	O

,	O

of	O
the	O
infection	O
and	O
barriers	O
in	O
place	O
.	O

A	O

said	O

would	O
have	O
to	O

and	O
they	O
were	O
unsure	O
whether	O
to	O

.	O

most	O

of	O
young	O
children	O

to	O

mouths	O

outside	O

to	O

.	O

.	O

of	O
[	O

[	O

.	O

Classical	B-Disease
swine	I-Disease
fever	I-Disease
[	O
CSF	B-Virus
]	O
is	O
spreading	O
in	O
swine	O

of	O

oblast	I-Province
with	O

.	O

The	O

of	O
several	O

.	O

The	O

of	O

.	O

The	O

in	O

and	O
not	O
sharing	O
make	O
up	O
,	O
contact	O
lenses	O
,	O
or	O
eye	O
glasses	O
.	O

Should	O

MINSA	O

to	O
go	O
to	O

to	O

.	O

and	O

of	O
the	O

that	O
may	O
be	O

,	O

on	O
the	O

or	O

the	O

,	O
eye	O

,	O

or	O
burning	O
sensation	O
,	O
greater	O

to	O
light	O
,	O
and	O
feeling	O
like	O
there	O
is	O
'sand	O
in	O
the	O

'	O
.	O

.	O

``	O

media	O

.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
pathogen	O
in	O
livestock	O
and	O
wild	O
animals	O
.	O

Some	O
of	O
the	O
more	O
common	O
herbivores	O
are	O
cattle	O
,	O
sheep	O
,	O
goats	O
,	O
horses	O
,	O
camels	O
,	O
and	O
deer	O
.	O

It	O
infects	O
humans	O
primarily	O
through	O
occupational	O
or	O
incidental	O
exposure	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
of	O
their	O
skins	O

of	O

of	O
the	O
crop	O
has	O
been	O
decimated	O
in	O
the	O
last	O
10	O
days	O
.	O

Plant	O
experts	O
have	O
expressed	O
multiple	O
opinions	O
about	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

The	O
Mahatma	O
Phule	O
Krishi	O
Vidyapeeth	O
[	O
MPKV	O
]	O
agriculture	O
university	O
are	O
studying	O
the	O
outbreak	O
along	O
with	O
state	O
government	O
officials	O
.	O

A	O
MPKV	O
scientist	O
said	O
an	O
analysis	O
of	O
the	O
tomato	O
samples	O
is	O
underway	O
,	O
but	O
conclusions	O
have	O
not	O
been	O
reached	O
.	O

Due	O
to	O
the	O
lockdown	O
,	O
samples	O
have	O
not	O
reached	O
national	O
laboratories	O
for	O
further	O
analysis	O
.	O

Farmers	O
are	O
now	O
pointing	O
fingers	O
at	O
seed	O
companies	O
for	O
allegedly	O
selling	O
diseased	O
seeds	O
.	O

The	O
damage	O
to	O
the	O
crop	O
has	O
been	O
extensive	O
.	O

Leaves	O
are	O
drying	O
up	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
ripened	O
tomatoes	O
are	O
developing	O
irregular	O
shapes	O
and	O
losing	O
their	O
sap	O
.	O

The	O
crop	O
ready	O
for	O
harvesting	O
has	O
been	O
lost	O
to	O
the	O
viral	O
outbreak	O
.	O

Farmers	O
fear	O
if	O
this	O
viral	O
attack	O
is	O
not	O
controlled	O
,	O
it	O
could	O
spread	O
to	O
other	O
crops	O
.	O

They	O
also	O
want	O
advice	O
on	O

steps	O
before	O
replanting	O
so	O
that	O
crops	O
are	O
not	O
affected	O
all	O
over	O
again	O
.	O

.	O

The	O

should	O

to	O

to	O

:	O
-	O

.	O

.	O

agency	O
.	O

about	O
any	O
contact	O
with	O
an	O
animal	O
that	O
appears	O
sick	O
or	O
is	O

in	O
an	O
unusual	O
manner	O
.	O

Since	O
last	O
September	O
[	O
2011	O
]	O
,	O
goat	O
meat	O
has	O
not	O
been	O
consumed	O
in	O

of	O
Giharo	B-City
.	O

A	O

disease	O
has	O
been	O
indicated	O
;	O

300	O

have	O

.	O

Health	O

say	O
that	O

is	O

only	O

.	O

The	O

of	O
Agriculture	O
and	O

has	O

from	O

and	O
sheep	O
due	O
to	O
a	O

.	O

Butunagu	O
,	O
head	O
of	O

in	O
DPAE	O

's	O

.	O

``	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

''	O

Since	O
September	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2011	O
]	O
,	O

animals	O
in	O
the	O
Lower	B-City

[	O

]	O
(	O

a	O

.	O

There	O
have	O
been	O
various	O

recorded	O
--	O
hippo	O
(	O
100+	O
)	O
,	O

(	O
17	O
)	O
,	O

(	O
2	O
)	O

and	O

(	O
7	O
)	O
.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
natural	O
disease	O
that	O
can	O
affect	O
both	O
animals	O
and	O
humans	O
.	O

All	O
warm-blooded	O
animals	O
can	O
catch	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

Conservation	O
Lower	O
Zambezi	O
,	O
an	O
organisation	O
that	O
aims	O
to	O
protect	O
the	O
environment	O
of	O
the	O
Lower	O
Zambezi	O
as	O
an	O
asset	O
for	O
the	O
people	O
of	O
Zambia	B-Country
,	O
were	O
quick	O
to	O
respond	O
to	O
the	O
crisis	O
.	O

They	O
have	O

with	O
the	O
Zambia	B-Country
Wildlife	O
Authority	O
(	O
ZAWA	O
)	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O

of	O

is	O
as	O
minimal	O
as	O
possible	O
.	O

They	O
are	O

to	O

about	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O

that	O

to	O

taken	O
.	O

of	O

both	O

to	O

,	O

to	O

.	O

Dr	O
Ian	O
Parsons	O
has	O
been	O
involved	O
with	O
protecting	O
the	O
lion	O
population	O
from	O
anthrax	B-Disease
.	O

Lions	O
were	O

at	O
risk	O
over	O

months	O
but	O
the	O
outbreak	O
has	O

.	O

This	O
fast	O
response	O
has	O
ensured	O
that	O
no	O

have	O

to	O
the	O

.	O

.	O

Conservation	O
Lower	O
Zambezi	O
has	O

.	O

can	O

on	O

including	O
animal	O
population	O

.	O

rains	O

to	O

.	O

[	O
Byline	O
:	O
Nambeye	O
]	O

Gregory	O

,	O

[	O

]	O

.	O

between	O

of	I-Country
the	I-Country
Congo	I-Country
(	O

)	O
,	O
bringing	O

cumulative	O
total	O
since	O
the	O

of	O

[	O

.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
CDC	O
,	O
the	O
symptoms	O
of	O
monkeypox	B-Virus
are	O
as	O
follows	O
:	O
About	O
12	O
days	O
after	O
people	O
are	O
infected	O
with	O
the	O
virus	O
,	O
they	O
will	O
get	O
a	O
fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
,	O
and	O
backache	O
;	O
their	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
will	O
swell	O
;	O
and	O
they	O
will	O
feel	O
tired	O
.	O

1	O
to	O
3	O
days	O
(	O
or	O
longer	O
)	O
after	O
the	O
fever	O
starts	O
,	O
they	O
will	O
get	O
a	O
rash	O
.	O

This	O
rash	O
develops	O
into	O
raised	O
bumps	O
filled	O
with	O
fluid	O
and	O
often	O
starts	O
on	O
the	O
face	O
and	O
spreads	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
can	O
start	O
on	O
other	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
too	O
.	O

The	O
bumps	O
go	O
through	O
several	O
stages	O
before	O
they	O
get	O
crusty	O
,	O
scab	O
over	O
,	O
and	O
fall	O
off	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
usually	O
lasts	O
for	O
2	O
to	O
4	O
weeks	O
.	O

Rodents	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
rope	O
squirrels	O
,	O
door	O
mice	O
and	O
pouched	O
rats	O
,	O
are	O
the	O
suspected	O
reservoir	O
hosts	O
,	O
with	O
monkeys	O
and	O
humans	O
as	O
secondary	O
,	O
spill-over	O
hosts	O
.	O

People	O
at	O
risk	O
for	O
monkeypox	B-Virus
are	O
those	O
who	O
get	O
bitten	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
animal	O
or	O
if	O
you	O
have	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
animal	O
's	O
rash	O
,	O
blood	O
or	O
body	O
fluids	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
through	O
respiratory	O
[	O
droplets	O
]	O
or	O
direct	O
contact	O
and	O
contact	O
with	O
contaminated	O
bedding	O
or	O
clothing	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
specific	O
treatment	O
for	O
monkeypox	B-Virus
.	O

A	O
bite	O
by	O
a	O
wild	O
squirrel	O
is	O
suspected	O
to	O

rabies	B-Virus
.	O

wrote	O
.	O

_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
is	O
a	O
bacterium	O
normally	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
intestinal	O
tracts	O
of	O
animals	O
such	O
as	O

,	O

and	O

,	O
all	O
of	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
found	O
in	O
backyard	O

throughout	O
Hildale	O
and	O
Colorado	B-City
City	I-City
and	O
Centennial	B-City
Park	I-City
,	O
Ariz.	O
A	O
CDC	O
webpage	O
says	O
that	O
those	O
animals	O
can	O
shed	O
the	O
bacterium	O
in	O
their	O
waste	O
and	O
transfer	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
to	O
humans	O
.	O

Contaminated	O
food	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
undercooked	O

.	O

coli_	O

425	O

.	O

A	O

up	O

2017	O

had	O

,	O

in	O

of	O
Yemen	B-Country
.	O

That	O
is	O
a	O

of	O
more	O
than	O
100	O
since	O
,	O
when	O
Zagaria	O
said	O
242	O

had	O

.	O

The	O
epidemic	O
began	O
in	O
October	O
2016	O
and	O
grew	O
until	O
December	O
.	O

It	O
then	O
dwindled	O
but	O
was	O
never	O
brought	O
fully	O
under	O
control	O
,	O
and	O
a	O
new	O
surge	O
in	O
cases	O
began	O
in	O
April	O
2017	O
worsened	O
by	O
the	O
collapse	O
of	O
the	O
economy	O
and	O
the	O
health	O
system	O
.	O

The	O
total	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
reported	O
since	O
December	O
2016	O
stands	O
at	O
61	O
000	O
,	O
the	O
bulletin	O
said	O
.	O

Zagaria	O
said	O
last	O
week	O
that	O
the	O
total	O
could	O
reach	O
300	O
000	O
in	O
the	O
next	O
6	O
months	O
.	O

Caused	O
by	O
ingesting	O
the	O
_Vibrio	O
cholerae_	O
bacterium	O
from	O
water	O
or	O
food	O
contaminated	O
with	O
faeces	O
,	O
cholera	B-Disease
usually	O
manifests	O
itself	O
with	O
a	O
sudden	O
onset	O
of	O
acute	O
watery	O
diarrhea	O
and	O
can	O
kill	O
within	O
hours	O
,	O
although	O
3-quarters	O
of	O
infected	O
people	O
show	O
no	O
symptoms	O
.	O

The	O
short	O
incubation	O
period	O
means	O
outbreaks	O
can	O
spread	O
with	O
explosive	O
speed	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
places	O
without	O
safe	O
water	O
and	O
proper	O
sanitation	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
WHO	O
.	O

Yemen	B-Country
has	O
been	O
ruined	O
by	O
2	O
years	O
of	O
civil	O
war	O
,	O
with	O
18.8	O
million	O

aid	O
,	O
many	O
of	O
them	O
on	O
the	O

of	O
famine	O
.	O

Less	O
than	O
45	O
percent	O
of	O
the	O
country	O
's	O
health	O
facilities	O
are	O
fully	O
functional	O
.	O

2	O
people	O
have	O

from	O

,	O

elephants	O
were	O
found	O
with	O
the	O

still	O
on	O
their	O

,	O
meaning	O
they	O
were	O
not	O

by	O

,	O
and	O

has	O

been	O

out	O
as	O
a	O

the	O

.	O

Today	O

,	O

.	O

complaint	O
against	O
an	O
unknown	O

over	O

_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
is	O
a	O

that	O

and	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

L'Agence	O
nationale	O
de	O
securite	O
sanitaire	O
(	O
The	O
National	O
Health	O
Security	O
Agency	O
)	O
recently	O
confirmed	O
a	O
diagnosis	O
of	O
rabies	B-Virus
in	O
a	O
dead	O
bat	O
found	O
near	O
a	O
home	O
in	O
Secheval	B-City
.	O

Public	O
health	O
measures	O
were	O
immediately	O
implemented	O
:	O
the	O
investigation	O
was	O
conducted	O
by	O
doctors	O
at	O
the	O
ARS	O
Champagne-Ardenne	B-City
and	O
by	O
veterinarians	O
of	O
the	O
DDCSPP	O
.	O

It	O
appears	O
that	O
there	O
has	O
been	O
no	O
animal	O
or	O
human	O
contact	O
.	O

Over	O
the	O
last	O
20	O
years	O
,	O
50	O
cases	O
of	O
bat	O
rabies	B-Virus
have	O
been	O
recorded	O
in	O
France	B-Country
.	O

This	O
rabies	B-Virus
is	O
distinct	O
from	O
rabies	O
in	O
terrestrial	O
mammals	O
(	O
dogs	O
,	O
foxes	O
)	O
.	O

Rabies	B-Virus
,	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
from	O
rabid	O
animals	O
by	O
bites	O
or	O
scratches	O
,	O
is	O
fatal	O
if	O
treatment	O
[	O
post-exposure	O
immunization	O
]	O
is	O
not	O
quickly	O
undertaken	O
.	O

The	O
post-exposure	O
rabies	B-Virus
treatments	O
are	O
particularly	O
effective	O
.	O

No	O
(	O
locally	O
acquired	O
)	O
rabies	B-Virus
cases	O
in	O
humans	O
have	O
been	O
recorded	O
within	O
the	O
territory	O
of	O
metropolitan	O
France	B-Country
since	O
1924	O
.	O

Upon	O
discovery	O
of	O
a	O
dead	O
bat	O
or	O
of	O
an	O
affected	O
weakened	O
bat	O
with	O
flying	O
difficulty	O
,	O
such	O
animals	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
touched	O
or	O
picked	O
up	O
but	O
immediately	O
reported	O
to	O
a	O
veterinarian	O
or	O
to	O
the	O
specialised	O
officials	O
who	O
will	O
collect	O
the	O
affected	O
bat	O
(	O
for	O
testing	O
)	O
.	O

When	O
accidentally	O
bitten	O
or	O
scratched	O
by	O
a	O
bat	O
,	O
the	O
wound	O
should	O
be	O
cleaned	O
with	O
soap	O
and	O
rinsed	O
thoroughly	O
before	O
applying	O
a	O
disinfectant	O
.	O

Any	O
person	O
who	O
had	O
contact	O
with	O
a	O
bat	O
should	O
promptly	O
seek	O
advice	O
from	O
an	O
anti-rabies	O
center	O
or	O
consult	O
a	O
doctor	O
who	O
may	O
,	O
if	O
necessary	O
,	O
involve	O
the	O
center	O
.	O

Bats	O
are	O
useful	O
mammals	O
,	O
but	O
they	O
are	O
fragile	O
and	O
not	O
very	O
prolific	O
.	O

Hence	O
,	O
all	O
bat	O
species	O
are	O
protected	O
in	O
France	B-Country
and	O
Europe	O
by	O
law	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
strictly	O
forbidden	O
to	O
kill	O
,	O
capture	O
,	O
manipulate	O
,	O
or	O
transport	O
them	O
for	O
sale	O
,	O
whether	O
alive	O
or	O
dead	O
.	O

Finally	O
,	O
attention	O
is	O
drawn	O
to	O
the	O
owners	O
of	O
domestic	O
carnivores	O
(	O
dogs	O
,	O
cats	O
)	O
,	O
reminding	O
them	O
that	O
if	O
such	O
animals	O
present	O
behavioral	O
changes	O
or	O
suffer	O
an	O
unexplained	O
death	O
,	O
a	O
veterinarian	O
should	O
be	O
immediately	O
consulted	O
.	O

Sanitary	O
Zone	O
IV	O
reported	O
this	O
week	O
trichinosis	B-Disease
in	O
pork	O
slaughtered	O
domestically	O
in	O
this	O
city	O

.	O

have	O

pork	O

in	O

10	O
days	O
from	O

sellers	O
and	O
present	O

of	O

seek	O

of	O
the	O

(	O

)	O

(	O

.	O

The	O

,	O
was	O
raised	O

city	O

an	O

,	O

that	O
the	O
disease	O
may	O

to	O
other	O
animals	O
.	O

As	O

of	O
the	O

Health	O
department	O

work	O
,	O
buyers	O
of	O
this	O
meet	O
sold	O
informally	O
are	O
being	O
traced	O
.	O

There	O
's	O
been	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
a	O
highly	O
contagious	O
disease	O
among	O
wood	O
pigeons	O
on	O
.	O

That	O
's	O
according	O
to	O
Manx	O
Wild	O
Bird	O
Aid	O
(	O
MWBA	O
)	O
which	O
says	O
its	O
already	O
taken	O
in	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
the	O
animals	O
from	O
Douglas	O
,	O
Groudle	O
,	O
and	O
Crosby	O
which	O
are	O
suffering	O
with	O
'canker	O
'	O
.	O

The	O
infection	O
is	O
n't	O
harmful	O
to	O
humans	O
or	O
mammals	O
but	O
the	O
organisation	O
says	O
it	O
can	O
cause	O
growths	O
in	O
the	O
birds	O
'	O
mouths	O
which	O
can	O
lead	O
them	O
to	O
starve	O
to	O
death	O
.	O

MWBA	O
is	O
offering	O
advice	O
to	O
people	O
about	O
how	O
to	O
help	O
stop	O
it	O
spreading	O
,	O
including	O
strict	O
hygiene	O
on	O
bird-feeding	O
tables	O
and	O
if	O
you	O
come	O
across	O
a	O
sick	O
pigeon	O
to	O
take	O
it	O
to	O
the	O
nearest	O
vet	O
as	O
soon	O
as	O
possible	O
.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
an	O
illness	O
at	O
an	O
Ottawa-area	O
camp	O
for	O
economically	O
disadvantaged	O
kids	O
sent	O
several	O
children	O
to	O
hospital	O
and	O
led	O
to	O
the	O
cancellation	O
of	O
the	O
current	O
camp	O
session	O
.	O

About	O
120	O
people	O
are	O
being	O
sent	O
home	O
from	O
Christie	B-City
Lake	I-City
Kids	O
camp	O
,	O
located	O
just	O
west	O
of	O
Perth	O
,	O
Ont	O
.	O

began	O
3	O
Jul	O
[	O
2016	O
]	O

to	O

14	O
Jul	O
[	O
2016	O
]	O
.	O

after	O
a	O

20	O

According	O

Kids	O

and	O
builds	O
``	O

,	O

and	O
character	O

children	O

with	O

.	O
''	O

All	O

are	O

free	O
to	O

.	O

Children	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

and	O
games	O
,	O

hiking	O

.	O

Residents	O
and	O

fumigated	O
parts	O
of	O
Limo	B-City
,	O
Depok	B-City
,	O
on	O
Friday	O
after	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
fever	I-Virus
[	O
virus	O
]	O
infected	O
at	O
least	O
200	O
people	O
in	O
the	O
past	O
month	O
.	O

was	O

to	O
poor	O

and	O
poor	O

of	O
the	O

Councillor	O

’	O

.	O

,	O
as	O
quoted	O
by	O
kompas.com	O
.	O

The	O
Depok	B-City
administration	O
is	O
providing	O
free	O
,	O
around-the-clock	O
healthcare	O
for	O
residents	O
with	O
symptoms	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

The	O
symptoms	O
chikungunya	B-Virus
fever	I-Virus
,	O
which	O
is	O
similar	O
to	O
dengue	O
fever	O
,	O
include	O
the	O
abrupt	O
onset	O
of	O
fever	O
,	O
frequently	O

by	O
joint	O
pain	O
that	O
is	O
often	O

.	O

State	O
health	O
officials	O
said	O
Monday	O
,	O
5	O
Mar	O
2013	O
,	O
that	O
a	O
total	O
of	O
24	O
people	O
have	O
fallen	O
ill	O
,	O
2	O
of	O
whom	O
were	O
hospitalized	O
,	O
after	O
drinking	O
tainted	O
raw	O
milk	O
from	O
a	O
Kenai	B-City
Peninsula	I-City
dairy	O
.	O

Among	O
the	O
ill	O
is	O
an	O
infant	O
who	O
did	O
not	O
directly	O

the	O

,	O
but	O
got	O
sick	O
through	O
a	O

from	O
an	O
adult	O
who	O
had	O
.	O

State	O
epidemiologists	O
said	O
the	O
illnesses	O
are	O
the	O
result	O
of	O
milk	O
tainted	O
with	O
_Campylobacter_	O
,	O
a	O
bacterium	O
commonly	O
found	O
in	O
cow	O

.	O

After	O

of	O
sick	O
people	O
,	O

traced	O

outbreak	O
to	O
a	O
cow	O
share	O
program	O
at	O
the	O
Peninsula	O
Dairy	O
.	O

State	O
veterinarians	O
visited	O
the	O
farm	O
to	O

samples	O
and	O
said	O
the	O
farm	O
owner	O
is	O
being	O

with	O
their	O

.	O

Dr.	O
Brian	O
Yablon	O
,	O
an	O

with	O
the	O
State	O
of	O
Alaska	B-Province
,	O

that	O
,	O
with	O
raw	O
milk	O
,	O
infections	O
like	O
this	O
are	O
virtually	O
