.	O

``	O
The	O
bottom	O
line	O
for	O
any	O
operation	O
that	O
is	O
providing	O
raw	O
milk	O
,	O
''	O
Yablon	O
said	O
,	O
``	O
[	O
is	O
]	O
there	O
's	O
no	O
way	O
to	O
make	O
a	O
sterile	O
product	O
...	O
and	O
that	O
's	O
why	O
,	O
from	O
a	O
public	O
health	O
perspective	O
,	O
we	O
encourage	O
people	O
if	O
they	O
're	O
going	O
to	O
drink	O
milk	O
,	O
to	O
just	O
drink	O
pasteurized	O
milk	O
.	O
''	O

Backers	O
of	O
the	O
nationwide	O
raw	O
milk	O
movement	O
have	O
claimed	O
that	O
unpasteurized	O
,	O
unhomogenized	O
raw	O
milk	O
--	O
from	O
appropriately	O
clean	O
farms	O
--	O
can	O
provide	O
a	O
range	O
of	O
health	O
benefits	O
.	O

But	O
Yablon	O
said	O
the	O
realities	O
of	O
milk	O
production	O
make	O
raw	O
milk	O
inherently	O
risky	O
.	O

``	O
No	O
matter	O
how	O
safe	O
the	O
process	O
is	O
thought	O
to	O
be	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
always	O
potential	O
for	O
contamination	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
You	O
have	O
the	O
absolute	O
best	O
of	O
intentions	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
best	O
of	O
practices	O
,	O
but	O
just	O
the	O
way	O
the	O
cow	O
's	O
anatomy	O
is	O
,	O
the	O
udder	O
being	O
so	O
close	O
to	O
where	O
the	O
cow	O
is	O
excreting	O
,	O
the	O
fact	O
that	O
the	O
tail	O
can	O
flick	O
things	O
around	O
,	O
there	O
are	O
many	O
different	O
steps	O
along	O
the	O
way	O
where	O
contamination	O
can	O
be	O
introduced	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
last	O
outbreak	O
of	O
campylobacteriosis	B-Disease
state	O
epidemiologists	O
dealt	O
with	O
was	O
from	O
a	O
2011	O
outbreak	O
in	O
the	O
Mat-Su	O
Valley	O
that	O
sickened	O
18	O
people	O
.	O

That	O
outbreak	O
was	O
also	O
linked	O
to	O
raw	O
milk	O
from	O
a	O
cow-share	O
program	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
's	O
just	O
not	O
a	O
product	O
that	O
's	O
ever	O
going	O
to	O
be	O
100	O
percent	O
safe	O
,	O
''	O
Yablon	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
There	O
's	O
always	O
the	O
potential	O
for	O
contamination	O
,	O
and	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
latest	O
example	O
here	O
in	O
Alaska	B-Province
.	O
''	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
and	O
Fisheries	O
(	O
MoAF	O
)	O
has	O
announced	O
that	O
it	O
has	O
imposed	O
veterinary	O
quarantine	O
on	O
a	O
farm	O
in	O
the	O
wilayat	O
[	O
district	O
]	O
of	O
Shinas	B-City
in	O
North	O
Batinah	O
[	O
governorate	O
]	O
after	O
it	O
registered	O
a	O
case	O
of	O
Crimean-Congo	B-Virus
haemorrhagic	I-Virus
fever	I-Virus
(	O
CCHF	O
)	O
in	O
a	O
citizen	O
.	O

MoAF	O
has	O
also	O
confirmed	O
that	O
the	O
citizen	O
infected	O
is	O
undergoing	O
treatment	O
at	O
Sohar	O
Hospital	O
and	O
his	O
condition	O
is	O
stable	O
.	O

Experts	O
took	O
samples	O
of	O
tick	O
insects	O
,	O
a	O
carrier	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
from	O
the	O
animals	O
at	O
the	O
citizen	O
's	O
farm	O
and	O
other	O
animals	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
and	O
sent	O
them	O
to	O
the	O
laboratory	O
for	O
examination	O
.	O

MoAF	O
elaborated	O
that	O
experts	O
are	O
guiding	O
the	O
citizen	O
's	O
family	O
on	O
how	O
to	O
handle	O
animals	O
.	O

CCHF	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
virus	O
carried	O
by	O
ticks	O
.	O

Animals	O
like	O
sheep	O
,	O
goats	O
,	O
and	O
cows	O
become	O
carriers	O
after	O
they	O
are	O
bitten	O
by	O
the	O
infected	O
ticks	O
.	O

Humans	O
get	O
infected	O
either	O
by	O
tick-bites	O
or	O
through	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
infected	O
animal	O
's	O
blood	O
and	O
tissues	O
during	O
or	O
after	O
slaughtering	O
.	O

Human-to-human	O
transmission	O
can	O
occur	O
resulting	O
from	O
close	O
contact	O
with	O
blood	O
,	O
secretions	O
,	O
organs	O
,	O
or	O
other	O
bodily	O
fluids	O
from	O
infected	O
persons	O
,	O
the	O
ministry	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
stables	O
at	O
Saint	B-City
John	I-City
's	O
Rockwood	O
Park	O
are	O
closed	O
to	O
the	O
public	O
and	O
wagon	O
rides	O
cancelled	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
the	O
highly	O
contagious	O
horse	O
disease	O
called	O
strangles	B-Disease
.	O

That	O
brings	O
the	O
total	O
number	O
of	O
lab-confirmed	O
cases	O
in	O
New	B-Province
Brunswick	I-Province
to	O
3	O
since	O
strangles	B-Disease
hit	O
the	O
province	O
last	O
month	O
[	O
May	O
2018	O
]	O
.	O

All	O
3	O
are	O
``	O
south	O
of	O
Fredericton	B-City
''	O
,	O
but	O
in	O
separate	O
locations	O
,	O
said	O
Nicole	O
Wanamaker	O
,	O
manager	O
of	O
provincial	O
veterinary	O
services	O
.	O

She	O
declined	O
to	O
reveal	O
exactly	O
where	O
,	O
citing	O
privacy	O
reasons	O
.	O

Cases	O
have	O
also	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
Nova	B-Province
Scotia	I-Province
and	O
Prince	B-Province
Edward	I-Province
Island	I-Province
.	O

Strangles	B-Disease
can	O
cause	O
excess	O
mucus	O
,	O
cough	O
and	O
fever	O
in	O
horses	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
abscess	O
swelling	O
under	O
the	O
jaw	O
and	O
throat	O
,	O
obstructing	O
the	O
airway	O
and	O
making	O
it	O
difficult	O
for	O
them	O
to	O
chew	O
and	O
swallow	O
.	O

They	O
may	O
become	O
lethargic	O
and	O
have	O
a	O
reduced	O
appetite	O
.	O

The	O
bacteria	O
is	O
primarily	O
spread	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
between	O
horses	O
or	O
shared	O
environments	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
water	O
troughs	O
,	O
but	O
the	O
bacteria	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
transferred	O
via	O
people	O
's	O
hands	O
or	O
clothing	O
.	O

The	O
infection	O
does	O
not	O
affect	O
people	O
or	O
other	O
animals	O
.	O

The	O
actual	O
number	O
of	O
cases	O
of	O
strangles	B-Disease
in	O
New	B-Province
Brunswick	I-Province
could	O
be	O
higher	O
than	O
3	O
,	O
said	O
Wanamaker	O
.	O

Her	O
office	O
is	O
waiting	O
for	O
the	O
lab	O
results	O
on	O
some	O
other	O
swab	O
samples	O
.	O

But	O
strangles	B-Disease
is	O
not	O
a	O
reportable	O
disease	O
,	O
so	O
her	O
office	O
does	O
n't	O
necessarily	O
hear	O
from	O
private	O
veterinarians	O
who	O
treat	O
horses	O
,	O
she	O
said	O
.	O

In	O
addition	O
,	O
it	O
can	O
take	O
up	O
to	O
2	O
weeks	O
after	O
exposure	O
for	O
an	O
infected	O

Two	O
positive	O
cases	O
of	O
the	O
Polio	B-Disease
have	O
been	O
registered	O
in	O
the	O
southern	O
province	O
of	O
Kandahar	O
,	O
provincial	O
health	O
officials	O
said	O
,	O
as	O
the	O
ministry	O
of	O
public	O
health	O
with	O
the	O

of	O
the	O
United	O
Nations	O
'	O
World	O
Health	O
Organization	O
started	O
the	O
new	O
round	O
of	O
vaccination	O
.	O

The	O
cases	O
were	O
registered	O
in	O
the	O
districts	O
of	O
Spin	B-City
Boldak	I-City
and	O
Shah	B-City
Wali	I-City
Kot	I-City
,	O
according	O
to	O
the	O
officials	O
.	O

'	O
A	O
2-year	O
old	O
boy	O
and	O
a	O
2	O
and	O
1/2-year	O
old	O
girl	O
are	O

Abdul	O
Shakoor	O
Nosrat	O
,	O

the	O

.	O

that	O

the	O
2	O
new	O
cases	O
,	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
children	O
affected	O

EHV-1	O
is	O
a	O
virus	O
present	O
in	O
the	O
environment	O

most	O

.	O

typically	O

to	O
the	O
virus	O
at	O
a	O
young	O
age	O
with	O
no	O
serious	O
side	O

.	O

of	O

carry	O
the	O
virus	O
with	O
no	O
clinical	O

for	O

of	O
their	O

.	O

disease	O
.	O

ages	O
2	O
and	O
3	O
,	O
were	O
among	O
40	O
deer	O
reported	O
to	O
be	O
on	O
Hunt	O
's	O
End	O
East	O
's	O
84-acre	O
ranch	O
.	O

Both	O
deer	O
were	O
sampled	O
and	O
sent	O
to	O
the	O
National	O
Veterinary	O
Services	O
Laboratory	O
in	O
Ames	O
,	O
Iowa	O
,	O
which	O
found	O
CWD	O
in	O
the	O
deer	O
.	O

DATCP	O
rules	O
require	O
farm-raised	O
deer	O
and	O
elk	O
to	O
be	O
tested	O
after	O
they	O
are	O
killed	O
.	O

State	O
veterinarian	O
Paul	O
McGraw	O
put	O
the	O
ranch	O
,	O
as	O
well	O
as	O
2	O
others	O
that	O
are	O
owned	O
by	O
the	O
same	O
people	O
,	O
under	O
quarantine	O
.	O

That	O
means	O
deer	O
can	O
move	O
between	O
the	O
ranches	O
and	O
to	O
slaughter	O
,	O
but	O
nowhere	O
else	O
.	O

Hunts	O
will	O
still	O

allowed	O
on	O
the	O
ranches	O
,	O
because	O
DATCP	O
believes	O
properly	O
handled	O
dead	O
deer	O

the	O
ranches	O
are	O

.	O

DATCP	O
's	O

Health	O
Division	O
plans	O
an	O

deer	O
.	O

Your	O
comments	O
on	O
ProMED-mail	O
on	O
anthrax	B-Disease
outbreaks	O
worldwide	O

always	O

years	O
.	O

that	O
.	O

,	O
in	O
the	O

your	O

in	O

in	O
that	O

.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
was	O
quite	O
frequent	O
in	O
Sweden	B-Country
in	O
the	O
1st	O
half	O
of	O
1900	O
,	O
often	O
due	O
to	O
imported	O
bone	O
meal	O
.	O

The	O
Swedish	O
Board	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
banned	O
all	O
imports	O
of	O
bone	O
meal	O
in	O
1957	O
after	O
a	O
large	O
outbreak	O
,	O
and	O
after	O
that	O
the	O
numbers	O
fell	O
to	O
practically	O
zero	O
.	O

Since	O
then	O
there	O
were	O
no	O
cases	O
until	O
one	O
single	O
animal	O
in	O
1981	O
in	O
Uppsala	O
region	O
due	O
to	O
removing	O
of	O
an	O
old	O
``	O
manure	O
deposit	O
''	O
.	O

In	O
2008	O
we	O
had	O
a	O
winter	O
outbreak	O
(	O
as	O
you	O
know	O
from	O
Susanna	O
Sternberg	O
Lewerin	O
)	O
due	O
to	O
harvested	O
hay	O
from	O
a	O
riverbank	O
where	O
dead	O
pigs	O
from	O
the	O
1956-57	O
outbreak	O
were	O
dumped	O
.	O

The	O
outbreak	O
in	O
Orebro	O
in	O
2011	O
was	O
due	O
to	O
the	O
accidental	O
opening	O
of	O
an	O
old	O
grave	O
when	O
the	O
owner	O
was	O
digging	O
a	O
trench	O
.	O

The	O
grave	O
was	O
from	O
an	O
outbreak	O
in	O
1943	O
and	O
we	O
have	O
police	O
records	O
from	O
that	O
time	O
since	O
the	O
burial	O
was	O
not	O
properly	O
done	O
.	O

Since	O
those	O
outbreaks	O
we	O
are	O
investigating	O
every	O
year	O
a	O
large	O
number	O
of	O
suspect	O
anthrax	B-Disease
cases	O
all	O
over	O
Sweden	B-Country
since	O
the	O

among	O

and	O
vets	O
is	O
high	O
.	O

This	O
was	O
the	O
case	O
this	O
November	O
[	O
2013	O
]	O
as	O
well	O

A	O
39	O

old	O

Bali	B-Province
's	O

.	O

2	O

``	O

''	O

pass	O
a	O
2	O

period	O
with	O
no	O
new	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
.	O

Government	O
data	O
shows	O
a	O
decline	O
in	O
dog	O
bites	O
incidents	O
in	O
July	O
2011	O
.	O

Although	O
daily	O
reports	O
number	O
above	O
100	O
.	O

The	O
daily	O
rate	O
of	O
reported	O
''	O
bites	O
''	O
island-wide	O
appears	O
on	O
a	O
downward	O
trend	O
with	O
164	O
in	O
January	O
,	O
161	O
in	O
February	O
,	O
167	O
in	O
March	O
,	O
171	O
in	O
June	O
,	O
and	O
134	O
in	O
July	O
.	O

Since	O
,	O
the	O
Texas	B-Province
Animal	O
Health	O
Commission	O
(	O
TAHC	O
)	O
has	O
received	O
confirmation	O
of	O
3	O
additional	O
anthrax	B-Disease
cases	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
of	O
Texas	O
where	O
anthrax	O
is	O
historically	O
found	O
.	O

The	O
1st	O
anthrax	B-Disease
case	O
of	O
the	O
year	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
was	O
confirmed	O
in	O
one	O
captive	O
antelope	O
on	O
a	O
premises	O
in	O
Uvalde	B-City
County	I-City
on	O
.	O

Since	O
that	O
time	O
,	O
anthrax	B-Disease
was	O
confirmed	O
in	O
goats	O
on	O
a	O
new	O
Uvalde	B-City
County	I-City
premises	O
on	O
,	O
one	O
Sutton	B-City
County	I-City
horse	O
was	O
confirmed	O
to	O
have	O
anthrax	O
on	O
,	O
and	O
cattle	O
were	O
confirmed	O
to	O
have	O
anthrax	O
on	O
a	O
separate	O
Sutton	O
County	O
premises	O
on	O
.	O

All	O
of	O
the	O
premises	O
have	O
been	O
placed	O
under	O
quarantine	O
,	O
and	O
producers	O
were	O
advised	O
on	O
vaccinating	O
exposed	O
animals	O
and	O
the	O
proper	O
disposal	O
of	O
affected	O
carcasses	O
,	O
as	O
outlined	O
by	O
TAHC	O
's	O
rules	O
.	O

Typically	O
,	O
quarantines	O
are	O
lifted	O
10	O
days	O
from	O
vaccination	O
or	O
the	O
last	O
death	O
loss	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
is	O
common	O
to	O
see	O
an	O
increase	O
in	O
anthrax	B-Disease
cases	O
after	O
periods	O
of	O
wet	O
,	O
cool	O
weather	O
,	O
followed	O
by	O
hot	O
,	O
dry	O
conditions	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr.	O
Andy	O
Schwartz	O
,	O
TAHC	O
Executive	O
Director	O
.	O

``	O
During	O
these	O
conditions	O
,	O
animals	O
ingest	O
the	O
anthrax	B-Disease
bacteria	O
when	O
they	O
consume	O
contaminated	O
grass	O
and	O
hay	O
,	O
or	O
inhale	O
the	O
spores	O
.	O

Outbreaks	O
usually	O
end	O
when	O
cooler	O
weather	O
arrives	O
.	O
''	O

There	O
is	O
an	O
effective	O
anthrax	B-Disease
vaccine	O
available	O
for	O
use	O
in	O
susceptible	O
livestock	O
(	O
includes	O
,	O
but	O
is	O
not	O
limited	O
to	O
,	O
swine	O
,	O
equine	O
,	O
sheep	O
,	O
goats	O
,	O
cattle	O
,	O
wildlife	O
,	O
etc	O
.	O
)	O

in	O
high-risk	O
areas	O
.	O

TAHC	O
encourages	O
livestock	O
owners	O
to	O
consult	O
with	O
a	O
local	O
veterinary	O
practitioner	O
and	O
vaccinate	O
livestock	O
if	O
owners	O
live	O
within	O
the	O
triangular	O
area	O
bound	O
by	O
the	O
towns	O
of	O
Uvalde	O
,	O
Ozona	O
and	O
Eagle	O
Pass	O
.	O

Producers	O
may	O
order	O
anthrax	B-Disease
vaccines	O
directly	O
from	O
the	O
manufacturer	O
.	O

After	O
exposure	O
to	O
,	O
it	O
usually	O
takes	O
3	O
to	O
7	O
days	O
for	O
animals	O
to	O
show	O
symptoms	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
.	O

Once	O
symptoms	O
begin	O
,	O
death	O
will	O
usually	O
occur	O
within	O
48	O
hours	O
.	O

Acute	O
fever	O
followed	O
by	O
rapid	O
death	O
with	O
bleeding	O
from	O
body	O
openings	O
are	O
all	O
common	O
signs	O
of	O
anthrax	B-Disease
in	O
livestock	O
.	O

Owners	O
of	O
livestock	O
and	O
animals	O
displaying	O
symptoms	O
consistent	O
with	O
anthrax	B-Disease
or	O
experiencing	O
death	O
of	O
animals	O
should	O
contact	O
a	O
private	O
veterinary	O
practitioner	O
or	O
a	O
TAHC	O
official	O
.	O

Producers	O
are	O
encouraged	O
to	O
follow	O
basic	O
sanitation	O
precautions	O
when	O
handling	O
affected	O
livestock	O
or	O
carcasses	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
recommended	O
to	O
wear	O
protective	O
gloves	O
and	O
long-sleeved	O
shirts	O
and	O
to	O
wash	O
thoroughly	O
afterward	O
to	O
prevent	O
accidental	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
bacteria	O
to	O
people	O
.	O

For	O
more	O
information	O
on	O
how	O
anthrax	B-Disease
affects	O
humans	O
,	O
please	O
visit	O

Today	O
,	O
the	O
government	O
declared	O
a	O
health	O
alert	O
in	O
the	O
Bio	B-Province
Bio	I-Province
region	O
in	O
the	O
south	O
due	O
to	O
a	O
serious	O
outbreak	O
of	O
[	O
a	O
]	O
hantavirus	B-Virus
in	O
a	O
prison	O
,	O

has	O

,	O

Minister	O
of	O

,	O
Jaime	O

,	O

.	O

``	O

is	O
serious	O
,	O
''	O
regional	O

.	O

``	O

)	O

.	O

that	O

in	O

,	O

have	O
begun	O

bird	B-Virus

.	O

A	O

a	O

business	O
in	O
Brampton	B-City
has	O

positive	O
for	O
avian	B-Disease
chlamydiosis	I-Disease
,	O
an	O
infection	O
that	O
can	O
cause	O
avian	O
chlamydiosis	O
,	O
an	O

that	O

in	O

.	O

Peel	O
Public	O

advises	O

who	O

to	O

for	O
avian	B-Disease
chlamydiosis	I-Disease
.	O

Birds	O
carrying	O

bacteria	O
that	O
cause	O

in	O
humans	O
and	O
avian	B-Disease

infection	O
.	O

who	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

Neither	O

,	O

or	O

to	O
a	O

rabid	O
animal	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
rabies	B-Virus
is	O
endemic	O
in	O
South	B-Country
Africa	I-Country
amongst	O
dogs	O
,	O
jackals	O
and	O
mongooses	O
,	O
and	O
can	O
be	O
transmitted	O
from	O
infected	O
animals	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
minor	O
,	O
seemingly	O
harmless	O
exposures	O
to	O
rabid	O
animals	O
.	O

Scratches	O
to	O
the	O
skin	O
,	O
or	O
licks	O
of	O
mucous	O
membranes	O
such	O
as	O
the	O
eyes	O
or	O
nose	O
,	O
may	O
constitute	O
an	O
exposure	O
.	O

Sequencing	O
of	O
the	O
patient	O
sample	O
identified	O
the	O
rabies	B-Virus
virus	O
as	O
canid	O
biotype	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
therefore	O
most	O
likely	O
that	O
the	O
infection	O
was	O
contracted	O
from	O
a	O
rabid	O
dog	O
,	O
cat	O
or	O
other	O

animal	O
.	O

is	O
the	O
2nd	O

case	O

for	O
South	B-Country
Africa	I-Country
for	O
2016	O
to	O
date	O
.	O

1st	O
case	O
was	O
diagnosed	O
in	O
KwaZulu-Natal	O
Province	O
in	O
January	O
2016	O
.	O

``	O
A	O
countrywide	O
shortage	O
of	O
human	O
rabies	B-Virus
immunoglobulin	O
(	O
or	O
HRIG	O
)	O
has	O
been	O
reported	O
since	O
May	O
2016	O
.	O

As	O
the	O
shortage	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
last	O
several	O
months	O
,	O
provision	O
has	O
been	O
made	O
for	O
the	O

the	O
virus	O
.	O

The	O
head	O
of	O
the	O
country	O
's	O
sanitary	O
and	O
epidemic	O
board	O
at	O
the	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
told	O
reporters	O
he	O
did	O
not	O
see	O
a	O
reason	O
for	O
concern	O
,	O
as	O
a	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
outbreak	O
happens	O
every	O
year	O
.	O

But	O
because	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
outbreaks	O
rely	O
on	O
food	O
as	O
a	O
point	O
source	O
,	O
seasonal	O
outbreaks	O
would	O
only	O
conceivably	O
occur	O
from	O
a	O
seasonal	O
food	O
--	O
or	O
a	O
seasonally	O
contaminated	O
food	O
.	O

Speaking	O
on	O
anonymity	O
,	O
a	O
doctor	O
in	O
the	O
country	O
said	O
the	O
health	O
officials	O
were	O
``	O
covering	O
up	O
''	O
the	O
situation	O
,	O
and	O
that	O
it	O
was	O
against	O
regulations	O
to	O
cite	O
the	O
actual	O
number	O
of	O
victims	O
falling	O
ill	O
.	O

While	O
newborns	O
in	O
Uzbekistan	B-Country
are	O
vaccinated	O
for	O
hepatitis	O
B	O
,	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
vaccines	O
are	O
rare	O
and	O
difficult	O
to	O
afford	O
in	O
the	O
impacted	O
region	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
of	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
infection	O
include	O
fatigue	O
,	O
loss	O
of	O
appetite	O
,	O
nausea	O
and	O
vomiting	O
,	O
jaundice	O
,	O
and	O
dark	O
urine	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
can	O
persist	O
for	O
months	O
if	O
untreated	O
,	O
and	O
often	O
comes	O
from	O
eating	O
food	O
or	O
drinking	O
water	O
contaminated	O
via	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
fecal	O
material	O
.	O

The	O
Chinese	O
Center	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
is	O
reviewing	O
the	O
province	O
's	O
1st	O
confirmed	O
H7N9	O
case	O
.	O

The	O
patient	O
,	O
male	O
,	O
50	O

old	O
,	O
was	O

in	O

.	O

[	O

for	O
a	O

's	O

.	O

1st	O

humans	O

China	B-Country

_hordei_	O

barley	O

(	O
_P	O
.	O

striiformis_	O

.	O

_pseudo-hordei_	O
)	O

has	O

rust	O

''	O

``	O

.	O

Rabies	B-Virus
is	O
usually	O
transmitted	O
through	O
an	O
animal	O
bite	O
,	O
for	O
example	O
,	O
from	O
unvaccinated	O

.	O

,	O

,	O

,	O

.	O

As	O

2012	O

[	O

France	B-Country
's	O
champagne	O
vines	O
have	O
been	O
hit	O
hard	O
by	O
downy	B-Disease
mildew	I-Disease
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Comité	O
Interprofessionnel	O
du	O
vin	O
de	O
Champagne	O
,	O
this	O
level	O
of	O
mildew	O
attack	O
is	O
exceptional	O
,	O
some	O
even	O
say	O
unprecedented	O
in	O
recent	O
history	O
.	O

The	O
last	O
large	O
downy	B-Disease
mildew	I-Disease
outbreak	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
was	O
in	O
2012	O
,	O
a	O
smaller	O
one	O
in	O
2016	O
.	O

Grape	O
growers	O
are	O
spraying	O
fungicides	O
.	O

Traditional	O
copper	O
based	O
sprays	O
are	O
very	O
efficient	O
but	O
are	O
being	O
washed	O
off	O
by	O
rain	O
.	O

The	O
mildew	O
quickly	O
adapts	O
to	O
some	O
of	O
the	O
more	O
modern	O
synthetic	O
fungicides	O
,	O
which	O
resist	O
the	O
rain	O
.	O

Estimates	O
are	O
that	O
the	O
worst	O
hit	O
regions	O
will	O
lose	O
between	O
20	O
%	O
and	O
25	O
%	O
of	O
their	O
expected	O
yield	O
,	O
although	O
if	O
there	O
is	O
a	O
dry	O
,	O
sunny	O
August	O
and	O
September	O
,	O
losses	O
may	O
be	O
less	O
.	O

The	O
hardest	O
hit	O
regions	O
include	O
the	O
Marne	B-City
valley	O
and	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
Aube	B-City
valley	O
,	O
where	O
high	O
humidity	O
has	O
been	O
coupled	O
with	O
hot	O
conditions	O
and	O
moist	O
conditions	O
.	O

In	O
years	O
with	O
warm	O
,	O
extended	O
wet	O
periods	O
during	O
bloom	O
,	O
fruit	O
clusters	O
may	O
be	O
partially	O
or	O
totally	O
destroyed	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
can	O
cause	O
severe	O
crop	O
losses	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
occurs	O
irregularly	O
in	O
most	O
grape	O
growing	O
regions	O
worldwide	O
.	O

Spores	O
are	O
spread	O
within	O
a	O
crop	O
mainly	O
by	O
splashing	O
rain	O
,	O
wind	O
,	O
or	O
mechanical	O
means	O
.	O

The	O
pathogen	O
survives	O
between	O
crops	O
on	O
infected	O
plant	O
debris	O
as	O
oospores	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
formed	O
inside	O
the	O
host	O
tissues	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
an	O
obligate	O
parasite	O
and	O
can	O
not	O
be	O
cultured	O
_in	O
vitro_	O
.	O

Disease	O
management	O
relies	O
mainly	O
on	O
preventative	O
fungicide	O
applications	O
according	O
to	O
forecasting	O
services	O
.	O

Systemic	O
fungicides	O
are	O
also	O
available	O
.	O

All	O
commercial	O
grape	O
cultivars	O
are	O
susceptible	O
.	O

Downy	O
mildews	O
include	O
many	O
species	O
of	O
oomycetes	O
in	O
several	O
genera	O
which	O
cause	O
similar	O
symptoms	O
on	O
a	O
range	O
of	O
hosts	O
,	O
including	O
many	O
crops	O
.	O

Individual	O
species	O
usually	O
have	O
a	O
narrow	O
host	O
range	O
affecting	O
only	O
one	O
or	O
a	O
few	O
different	O
hosts	O
.	O

Maps	O
France	B-Country
:	O
and	O
Pictures	O

mildew	I-Disease
on	O
grapevine	O

&	O
bunches	O
:	O
,	O
,	O
(	O

lower	O

surface	O
)	O

,	O

Faso	I-Country

]	O

.	O

out	O

.	O

``	O

for	O

)	O

an	O

.	O
''	O

The	O

said	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
confirmed	O
case	O
in	O
Polk	B-City
County	I-City
and	O
the	O
1st	O
positive	O
in	O
Florida	B-Province
since	O
the	O
beginning	O
of	O
the	O
year	O
[	O
2016	O
]	O
.	O

A	O
viral	O
disease	O
,	O
EEE	O
affects	O
the	O
central	O
nervous	O
system	O
and	O
is	O
transmitted	O
to	O
horses	O
by	O
infected	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

Clinical	O
signs	O
of	O
EEE	O
include	O
moderate	O
to	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
depression	O
,	O
lack	O
of	O
appetite	O
,	O
cranial	O
nerve	O
deficits	O
(	O
facial	O
paralysis	O
,	O
tongue	O
weakness	O
,	O
difficulty	O
swallowing	O
)	O
,	O
behavioral	O
changes	O
(	O
aggression	O
,	O
self-mutilation	O
,	O
or	O
drowsiness	O
)	O
,	O
gait	O
abnormalities	O
,	O
or	O
severe	O
central	O
nervous	O
system	O
signs	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
head-pressing	O
,	O
circling	O
,	O
blindness	O
,	O
and	O
seizures	O
.	O

The	O
course	O
of	O
EEE	O
can	O
be	O
swift	O
,	O
with	O
death	O
occurring	O
2	O
to	O
3	O
days	O
after	O
onset	O
of	O
clinical	O
signs	O
despite	O
intensive	O
care	O
;	O
fatality	O
rates	O
reach	O
75-80	O
percent	O
among	O
horses	O
.	O

Horses	O
that	O
survive	O
might	O
have	O
long-lasting	O
impairments	O
and	O
neurologic	O
problems	O
.	O

Horse	O
owners	O
should	O
also	O
consult	O
their	O
private	O
practicing	O
veterinarian	O
to	O
determine	O
an	O
appropriate	O
disease	O
prevention	O
plan	O
for	O
their	O
horses	O
.	O

Vaccines	O
have	O
proven	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
very	O
effective	O
prevention	O
tool	O
.	O

Horses	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
in	O
past	O
years	O
will	O
need	O
an	O
annual	O
booster	O
shot	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
if	O
an	O
owner	O
did	O
not	O
vaccinate	O
their	O
animal	O
in	O
previous	O
years	O
,	O
the	O
horse	O
will	O
need	O
the	O
2-shot	O
vaccination	O
series	O
within	O
a	O
3	O
to	O
6	O
week	O
period	O
.	O

to	O

,	O
horse	O
owners	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
reduce	O
the	O
mosquito	O
populations	O
and	O
their	O
possible	O

areas	O
.	O

include	O
removing	O
stagnant	O
water	O
sources	O
,	O

animals	O
inside	O
during	O
the	O
bugs	O
'	O
feeding	O
times	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
typically	O
early	O
in	O
the	O
morning	O
and	O
evening	O
,	O
and	O
using	O
mosquito	O
repellents	O
.	O

Light	B-Disease
leaf	I-Disease
spot	I-Disease
levels	O
are	O
building	O
to	O
alarming	O
levels	O
in	O
oilseed	O
rape	O

.	O

The	O

is	O

acute	O
each	O
year	O
across	O
the	O
UK	O
--	O

''	O

Light	B-Disease
leaf	I-Disease
spot	I-Disease
is	O

A	O

[	O

in	O

's	O

.	O

261	O

19	O

6	O

.	O

)	O

A	O

salmon	I-Disease
anaemia	I-Disease
(	O

)	O

,	O

``	O
The	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
conducts	O
an	O
investigation	O
when	O
a	O
plague	B-Disease
case	O
occurs	O
to	O
ensure	O
the	O
safety	O
of	O
the	O
immediate	O
family	O
,	O

,	O
and	O
health	O
care	O
providers	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
secretary	O
Retta	O
Ward	O
,	O
MPH	O
.	O

``	O
We	O
inform	O
neighbors	O
door-to-door	O
about	O
plague	B-Disease
found	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
and	O
educate	O
them	O
on	O
reducing	O
their	O
risk	O
.	O

Health	O
care	O
providers	O
and	O
others	O
close	O
to	O
the	O
patient	O
may	O
also	O
have	O
been	O
exposed	O
,	O
and	O
are	O
assessed	O
to	O
determine	O
if	O
they	O
need	O
preventive	O
treatment	O
.	O
''	O

Plague	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
bacterial	O
disease	O
of	O
rodents	O
and	O
is	O
generally	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
the	O
bites	O
of	O
infected	O
fleas	O
,	O
but	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
by	O
direct	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animals	O
,	O
including	O
rodents	O
,	O
wildlife	O
,	O
and	O
pets	O
.	O

``	O
Plague	B-Disease
activity	O
in	O
New	B-Province
Mexico	I-Province
is	O
usually	O
highest	O
during	O
the	O
summer	O
months	O
,	O
so	O
it	O
is	O
especially	O
important	O
now	O
to	O
take	O
precautions	O
to	O
avoid	O
rodents	O
and	O
their	O
fleas	O
which	O
can	O
expose	O
you	O
to	O
plague	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr	O
Paul	O
Ettestad	O
,	O
public	O
health	O
veterinarian	O
for	O
the	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
.	O

``	O
Pets	O
that	O
are	O
allowed	O
to	O
roam	O
and	O
hunt	O
can	O
bring	O
infected	O
fleas	O
from	O
dead	O
rodents	O
back	O
into	O
the	O
home	O
,	O
putting	O
you	O
and	O
your	O
children	O
at	O
risk	O
.	O
''	O

To	O
prevent	O
plague	B-Disease
,	O
the	O
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
recommends	O
:	O
-	O
avoid	O
sick	O
or	O
dead	O
rodents	O
and	O
rabbits	O
,	O
and	O
their	O
nests	O
and	O
burrows	O
;	O
-	O
keep	O
your	O
pets	O
from	O
roaming	O
and	O
hunting	O
;	O
-	O
talk	O
to	O
your	O
veterinarian	O
about	O
using	O
an	O
appropriate	O
flea	O
control	O
product	O
on	O
your	O
pets	O
as	O
not	O
all	O
products	O
are	O
safe	O
for	O
cats	O
,	O
dogs	O
,	O
or	O
your	O
children	O
;	O
-	O
clean	O
up	O
areas	O
near	O
the	O
house	O
where	O
rodents	O
could	O
live	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
woodpiles	O
,	O
brush	O
piles	O
,	O
junk	O
,	O
and	O
abandoned	O
vehicles	O
;	O
-	O
sick	O
pets	O
should	O
be	O
examined	O
promptly	O
by	O
a	O
veterinarian	O
;	O
-	O
see	O
your	O
doctor	O
about	O
any	O
unexplained	O
illness	O
involving	O
a	O
sudden	O
and	O
severe	O
fever	O
;	O
-	O
put	O
hay	O
,	O
wood	O
,	O
and	O
compost	O
piles	O
as	O
far	O
as	O
possible	O
from	O
your	O
home	O
;	O
-	O
do	O
n't	O
leave	O
your	O
pet	O
's	O
food	O
and	O
water	O
where	O
mice	O
can	O
get	O
to	O
it	O
.	O

.	O

A	O

[	O

.	O

A	O

[	O

.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O

nearby	O
Tibba	O
Road	O
.	O

Samples	O
of	O
pigs	O
have	O

to	O
rule	O
out	O
if	O
the	O
virus	O
has	O

from	O

to	O
humans	O
.	O

Japanese	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
[	O
virus	O
]	O
is	O
transmitted	O
to	O
humans	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
infected	O
_Culex_	O
species	O
of	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

Pigs	O
and	O
wading	O
birds	O
are	O
the	O
main	O
carriers	O
of	O
the	O
Japanese	B-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
virus	O
.	O

Wheat	O
farmers	O
in	O
Lalmonirhat	B-City
[	O
district	O
]	O
are	O
grappling	O
with	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
blast	O
and	O
rust	O
fungi	O
as	O
the	O
fungicides	O
applied	O
in	O
their	O
fields	O
have	O
turned	O
out	O
ineffective	O
.	O

The	O
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
Extension	O
said	O
that	O
the	O
use	O
of	O
sub-standard	O
seeds	O
and	O
comparatively	O
high	O
temperature	O
during	O
the	O
milky	O
stage	O
were	O
responsible	O
for	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

The	O
outbreak	O
of	O
rust	O
fungi	O
is	O
severer	O
than	O
that	O
of	O
blast	O
fungi	O
.	O

Farmers	O
said	O
that	O
the	O
leaves	O
of	O
wheat	O
plants	O
with	O
blast	O
disease	O
had	O
turned	O
yellow	O
.	O

The	O
rust	O
disease	O
shows	O
the	O
same	O
symptoms	O
.	O

They	O
also	O
said	O
that	O
when	O
they	O
entered	O
a	O
wheat	O
field	O
under	O
the	O
attack	O
of	O
rust	O
fungi	O
,	O
their	O
cloths	O
turned	O
reddish	O
.	O

Other	O
farmers	O
said	O
that	O
all	O
of	O
their	O
plots	O
were	O
infested	O
with	O
either	O
blast	O
or	O
rust	O
fungi	O
;	O
some	O
said	O
that	O
the	O
leaves	O
of	O
the	O
wheat	O
plants	O
at	O
the	O
bottom	O
turned	O
yellow	O
as	O
though	O
the	O
crop	O
had	O
matured	O
for	O
harvesting	O
.	O

NSW	O
Department	O
of	O
Primary	O
Industries	O
(	O
DPI	O
)	O
has	O
advised	O
tick	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
has	O
been	O
diagnosed	O
on	O
2	O
Mid	O
North	O
Coast	O
properties	O
.	O

DPI	O
Senior	O
Veterinary	O
Officer	O
Paul	O
Freeman	O
said	O
the	O
outbreak	O
south	O
of	O
Port	B-City
Macquarie	I-City
had	O
resulted	O
in	O
more	O
than	O
60	O
mortalities	O
on	O
one	O
property	O
and	O
2	O
mortalities	O
on	O
the	O
2nd	O
.	O

``	O
NSW	O
DPI	O
regulatory	O
officers	O
have	O
identified	O
cattle	O
tick	O
on	O
several	O
properties	O
to	O
date	O
and	O
will	O
be	O
examining	O
cattle	O
herds	O
on	O
adjoining	O
properties	O
to	O
see	O
if	O
cattle	O
tick	O
are	O
present	O
,	O
''	O
he	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
Any	O
herds	O
with	O
cattle	O
tick	O
are	O
subject	O
to	O
a	O
DPI	O
supervised	O
cattle	O
tick	O
eradication	O
program	O
that	O
can	O
take	O
up	O
to	O
12	O
months	O
.	O

``	O
Regulatory	O
officers	O
are	O
tracing	O
the	O
location	O
of	O
any	O
cattle	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
moved	O
off	O
the	O
infested	O
property	O
and	O
are	O
in	O
the	O
process	O
of	O
examining	O
these	O
animals	O
.	O
''	O

Owners	O
of	O
affected	O
properties	O
have	O
been	O
advised	O
not	O
to	O
move	O
any	O
stock	O
on	O
or	O
off	O
the	O
properties	O
,	O
and	O
remaining	O
cattle	O
have	O
been	O
given	O
anti-tick	O
fever	O
treatment	O
.	O

Cattle	O
ticks	O
are	O
the	O
most	O
serious	O
external	O
parasite	O
of	O
cattle	O
in	O
Australia	B-Country
.	O

They	O
can	O
attach	O
to	O
cattle	O
,	O
horses	O
and	O
other	O
livestock	O
and	O
can	O
transmit	O
tick	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
,	O
a	O
potentially	O
fatal	O
disease	O
of	O
cattle	O
.	O

The	O
tick	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
agent	O
is	O
carried	O
in	O
the	O
blood	O
and	O
transmitted	O
by	O
cattle	O
ticks	O
when	O
they	O
feed	O
.	O

Livestock	O
owners	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
are	O
reminded	O
to	O
remain	O
conscious	O
of	O
farm	O
biosecurity	O
and	O
be	O
on	O
the	O
look-out	O
for	O
cattle	O
ticks	O
.	O

Signs	O
of	O
affected	O
animals	O
may	O
include	O
fever	O
and	O
depression	O
,	O
anaemia	O
initially	O
followed	O
by	O
staggering	O
and	O
sometimes	O
apparent	O
blindness	O
,	O
hyper	O
excitability	O
and	O
jaundice	O
.	O

If	O
treated	O
early	O
the	O
chances	O
of	O
recovery	O
are	O
good	O
.	O

Important	O
steps	O
for	O
owners	O
of	O
cattle	O
,	O
horses	O
and	O
other	O
livestock	O
include	O
:	O
-	O
maintain	O
fencing	O
in	O
good	O
order	O
to	O
prevent	O
livestock	O
from	O
straying	O
-	O
ensure	O
any	O
livestock	O
brought	O
onto	O
the	O
property	O
are	O
not	O
carrying	O
cattle	O
ticks	O
-	O
ensure	O
any	O
livestock	O
brought	O
in	O
from	O
Queensland	O
are	O
inspected	O
and	O
treated	O
appropriately	O
Cattle	O
tick	O
and	O
tick	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
are	O
notifiable	O
diseases	O
in	O
NSW	O
which	O
means	O
stockowners	O
are	O
required	O
by	O
law	O
to	O
inform	O
NSW	O
DPI	O
or	O
Local	O
Land	O
Services	O
of	O
any	O
findings	O
on	O
their	O
stock	O
.	O

Visit	O
<	O
www.dpi.nsw.gov.au	O
>	O
and	O
search	O
'cattle	O
E	O
tick	O
'	O
for	O
more	O
information	O
.	O

authorities	O
are	O
testing	O
more	O
samples	O
from	O
2	O
Adelaide	B-City
bakeries	O
associated	O

a	O

this	O

[	O
2013	O
]	O
,	O
an	O
illness	O
so-named	O
for	O
the	O
common	O

of	O

in	O

.	O

Dr	O
Kelsey	O
Brandon	O
of	O

Veterinary	O
Service	O

the	O

in	O

from	O
the	O
Fort	B-City
Macleod	I-City
and	O
Lethbridge	B-City
areas	O
.	O

Though	O
not	O
usually	O
fatal	O
,	O
the	O
fever	O
results	O
in	O

that	O
have	O
to	O
mature	O
before	O
they	O
can	O
be	O

,	O

,	O
and	O
regularly	O

while	O

.	O

``	O

(	O
the	O

)	O

while	O
they	O
have	O
the	O

they	O
're	O
maturing	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Brandon	O
.	O

Ultrasound	O
tests	O
reveal	O
the	O
proper	O
time	O
for	O
lancing	O
and	O
treatment	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
done	O
under	O
sedation	O
.	O

Pigeon	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
is	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bacterium	O
spread	O
by	O
flies	O
.	O

When	O
the	O
flies	O
bite	O
horses	O
,	O
they	O
can	O
transmit	O
the	O
illness	O
.	O

Horse-to-horse	O
spread	O
is	O
possible	O
but	O
rare	O
because	O
it	O
involves	O
direct	O
transfer	O
of	O
pus	O
or	O
exudate	O
from	O
one	O
horse	O
to	O
an	O
open	O
sore	O
of	O
another	O
.	O

Early	O
swelling	O
can	O
be	O
confused	O
with	O
results	O
from	O
bruising	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
can	O
appear	O
on	O
one	O
or	O
both	O
sides	O
of	O
the	O
chest	O
,	O
with	O
swelling	O
also	O
common	O
on	O
the	O
belly	O
,	O
neck	O
and	O
head	O
.	O

``	O
Some	O
horses	O
do	O
get	O
sick	O
from	O
it	O
and	O
some	O
do	O
get	O
internal	O
abscesses	O
.	O

About	O
8	O
percent	O
of	O
the	O
horses	O
that	O
get	O
external	O
abscesses	O
get	O
internal	O
abscesses	O
and	O
of	O
those	O
8	O
percent	O
that	O
get	O
internal	O
abscesses	O
,	O
30	O
to	O
40	O
percent	O
of	O
those	O
are	O
fatal	O
,	O
''	O
Brandon	O
said	O
.	O

This	O
year	O
[	O
2013	O
]	O
was	O
considered	O
a	O
bad	O
fly	O
year	O
for	O
livestock	O
.	O

Brandon	O
said	O
she	O
recalls	O
a	O
few	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
region	O
several	O
years	O
ago	O
but	O
the	O
illness	O
is	O
far	O
more	O
common	O
in	O
the	O
southern	O
and	O
western	O
United	O
States	O
.	O

Prairie	O
winters	O
tend	O
to	O
limit	O
survival	O
of	O
the	O
bacteria	O
and	O
current	O
risk	O
has	O
been	O
reduced	O
by	O
cooler	O
weather	O
.	O

``	O
It	O
's	O
usually	O
a	O
late	O
summer	O
,	O
early	O
fall	O
thing	O
,	O
when	O
there	O
's	O
lots	O
of	O
flies	O
and	O
its	O
dryer	O
out	O
.	O
''	O

Prevention	O
involves	O
fly	O
control	O
,	O
use	O
of	O
fly	O
spray	O
,	O
masks	O
,	O
and	O
sheets	O
on	O
horses	O
,	O
and	O
wearing	O
gloves	O
when	O
handling	O
horses	O
with	O
draining	O
abscesses	O
.	O

Anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
caused	O
by	O
bacteria	O
that	O
come	O
from	O
the	O
ground	O
.	O

It	O

animals	O
but	O
sometimes	O
can	O
infect	O
humans	O
.	O

and	O

,	O

.	O

are	O

as	O

''	O

``	O

to	O

disease	O
,	O
''	O

.	O

.	O

]	O

.	O

A	O

indicated	O
that	O
the	O
virus	O
involved	O
in	O
these	O
cases	O
is	O
derived	O
from	O
a	O
vaccine	O
virus	O
and	O
therefore	O
would	O
be	O
less	O
virulent	O
causing	O
a	O
slight	O
paralysis	O
,	O
while	O
the	O
wild-type	O
virus	O
usually	O
causes	O
severe	O
paralysis	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
those	O
cases	O
associated	O
with	O
poliovirus	O
vaccine	O
derived	O
from	O
making	O
the	O
eradication	O
of	O
polio	B-Virus
more	O
complex	O
,	O
according	O
to	O
scientists	O
,	O
especially	O
in	O
the	O
wild	O
south	O
of	O
Madagascar	B-Country
,	O
the	O
location	O
of	O
the	O
new	O
epidemic	O
,	O
where	O
they	O
are	O
struggling	O
with	O
challenges	O
related	O
to	O
the	O
health	O
and	O
sanitation	O
including	O
malnutrition	O
.	O

This	O
compounds	O
the	O
problem	O
of	O
low	O
vaccination	O
coverages	O
.	O

A	O
report	O
released	O
by	O
the	O

of	O
Health	O
in	O
2010	O

that	O
only	O

of	O

against	O
polio	B-Virus
and	O

includes	O
areas	O
in	O
the	O
south	O
,	O
the	O
most	O

zones	O
on	O
the	O
large	O

.	O

An	O

will	O

if	O
there	O
are	O
other	O
cases	O
in	O

.	O

[	O
against	O

]	O

in	O

.	O

Colorado	B-Province

were	O
reported	O
.	O

Humans	O
can	O

with	O

through	O

can	O

in	O

,	O
including	O
in	O
animal	O
droppings	O
.	O

Uganda	B-Country
's	O

can	O
be	O

,	O

's	O

foods	O
,	O

.	O
''	O

Mr	O
Tunabuna	O
said	O
the	O
bacterium	O
killed	O
honey	O
bee	O
larvae	O
in	O
brood	O
cells	O
.	O

``	O

,	O

the	O

.	O

AFB	O

in	O

which	O
are	O

.	O

``	O

of	O

.	O
''	O

.	O

Monkeypox	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
rare	O
disease	O
that	O
occurs	O
throughout	O
remote	O
parts	O
of	O
Central	O
and	O
West	O
Africa	O
,	O
often	O
near	O
tropical	O
rain	O
forests	O
.	O

People	O
at	O
risk	O
for	O
monkeypox	B-Virus
are	O
those	O
who	O
get	O
bitten	O
by	O
an	O
infected	O
animal	O
or	O
have	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
animal	O
's	O
rash	O
,	O
blood	O
,	O
or	O
body	O
fluids	O
.	O

It	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
transmitted	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
through	O
respiratory	O
or	O
direct	O
contact	O
and	O
contact	O
with	O
contaminated	O
bedding	O
or	O
clothing	O
.	O

Fever	O
,	O
headache	O
,	O
muscle	O
aches	O
,	O
swollen	O
lymph	O
nodes	O
,	O
and	O
exhaustion	O
are	O
followed	O
by	O
a	O
rash	O
.	O

Patients	O
are	O
usually	O
ill	O
for	O
2-4	O
weeks	O
.	O

Monkeypox	B-Virus
is	O
fatal	O
in	O
as	O
many	O
as	O
10	O
%	O
of	O
people	O
who	O
get	O
it	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
specific	O
treatment	O
for	O
monkeypox	B-Virus
.	O

The	O
North	B-Province
Carolina	I-Province
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
has	O
confirmed	O
eastern	B-Virus
equine	I-Virus
encephalitis	I-Virus
(	O
EEE	O
)	O
in	O
an	O
unvaccinated	O
yearling	O
donkey	O
jenny	O
in	O
Duplin	B-City
County	I-City
,	O
the	O
Equine	O
Disease	O
Communication	O
Center	O
reported	O
on	O
30	O
Jul	O
2018	O
.	O

A	O
viral	O
disease	O
,	O
EEE	O
affects	O
the	O
central	O
nervous	O
system	O
and	O
is	O
transmitted	O
to	O
equids	O
by	O
infected	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

Clinical	O
signs	O
of	O
EEE	O
include	O
moderate	O
to	O
high	O
fever	O
,	O
depression	O
,	O
lack	O
of	O
appetite	O
,	O
cranial	O
nerve	O
deficits	O
(	O
facial	O
paralysis	O
,	O
tongue	O
weakness	O
,	O
difficulty	O
swallowing	O
)	O
,	O
behavioral	O
changes	O
(	O
aggression	O
,	O
self-mutilation	O
,	O
or	O
drowsiness	O
)	O
,	O
gait	O
abnormalities	O
,	O
or	O
severe	O
central	O
nervous	O
system	O
signs	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
head-pressing	O
,	O
circling	O
,	O
blindness	O
,	O
and	O
seizures	O
.	O

The	O
course	O
of	O
EEE	O
can	O
be	O
swift	O
,	O
with	O
death	O
occurring	O
2	O
to	O
3	O
days	O
after	O
onset	O
of	O
clinical	O
signs	O
despite	O
intensive	O
care	O
;	O
fatality	O
rates	O
reach	O
75-80	O
percent	O
among	O
horses	O
.	O

Equids	O
surviving	O
might	O
have	O
long-lasting	O
impairments	O
and	O
neurologic	O
problems	O
.	O

Vaccines	O
have	O
proven	O
to	O
be	O
a	O
very	O
effective	O
EEE	O
prevention	O
tool	O
.	O

Equids	O
that	O
have	O
been	O
vaccinated	O
in	O
past	O
years	O
will	O
need	O
an	O
annual	O
booster	O
shot	O
;	O
in	O
areas	O
with	O
a	O
prolonged	O
mosquito	O
season	O
,	O
veterinarians	O
might	O
recommend	O
2	O
boosters	O
annually	O
,	O
one	O
in	O
the	O
spring	O
and	O
another	O
in	O
the	O
fall	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
if	O
an	O
owner	O
did	O
not	O
vaccinate	O
their	O
animal	O
in	O
previous	O
years	O
,	O
the	O
equid	O
will	O
need	O
the	O
2-shot	O
vaccination	O
series	O
within	O
a	O
3-	O
to	O
6-week	O
period	O
.	O

addition	O
to	O

,	O
owners	O
also	O
need	O
to	O
reduce	O
the	O
mosquito	O
populations	O
and	O
their	O
possible	O
breeding	O
areas	O
.	O

Recommendations	O
include	O
removing	O
stagnant	O
water	O
sources	O
,	O
keeping	O
animals	O
inside	O
during	O
the	O
bugs	O
'	O
feeding	O
times	O
,	O
which	O
are	O
typically	O
early	O
in	O
the	O
morning	O
and	O
evening	O
,	O
and	O
applying	O
mosquito	O
repellents	O
approved	O
for	O
equine	O
use	O
.	O

with	O
EVD	O
.	O

.	O

Liberia	B-Country
was	O

from	O
EVD	O
.	O

Liberia	B-Country
was	O
again	O
declared	O
EVD-free	O
on	O
3	O
Sep	O
2015	O
.	O

To	O
date	O
,	O
EVD	O
has	O
killed	O
approximately	O
11	O
300	O
people	O
in	O
West	O
Africa	O
.	O

Cases	O
of	O
encephalitis	B-Disease
possibly	O
due	O
to	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	O
or	O
other	O
similar	O
virus	O
have	O
been	O
detected	O
by	O
the	O

in	O
Central	B-Province
Macedonia	I-Province
,	O

for	O
Disease	O

and	O

.	O

They	O
are	O
taking	O

measures	O
.	O

Under	O
KEELPNO	O
,	O
2	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
confirmed	O
and	O
9	O
others	O
are	O
possible	O
.	O

The	O
final	O
documentation	O
of	O
the	O
diagnosis	O
is	O
pending	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
transmitted	O
only	O
through	O
the	O
bite	O
of	O
infected	O
mosquitoes	O
and	O
not	O
from	O

as	O

.	O

.	O

A	O
minimum	O
figure	O
of	O
less	O
than	O
1	O
percent	O
in	O
the	O
mostly	O

and	O

in	O

[	O
of	O

]	O
.	O

,	O

to	O

for	O

,	O

.	O

[	O

]	O

and	O

area	O
of	O
the	O
body	O
(	O

,	O

)	O
.	O

Epidemics	O
of	O
West	B-Virus
Nile	I-Virus
virus	O
have	O
occurred	O
since	O
1996	O
in	O
EU	O
(	O
European	O
Union	O
)	O
countries	O
and	O
in	O
the	O
USA	O
.	O

This	O
is	O
the	O
1st	O
outbreak	O
in	O
Greece	B-Country
.	O

Outbreaks	O
are	O
associated	O
with	O
warming	O
and	O
population	O
growth	O
of	O
mosquitoes	O
.	O

The	O
Klickitat	B-City
County	I-City
Health	O
Department	O
says	O
it	O
has	O
received	O
a	O
handful	O

calls	O
from	O
schools	O
saying	O
some	O
children	O
in	O
Goldendale	B-City
[	O
Washington	B-Province
state	O
]	O
have	O
been	O
diagnosed	O
with	O
hand	B-Disease
,	I-Disease
foot	I-Disease
and	I-Disease
mouth	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
.	O

The	O
department	O
has	O
not	O
issued	O
a	O
health	O
alert	O
on	O
the	O
outbreaks	O
because	O
the	O
reports	O
are	O
unconfirmed	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
not	O
required	O
to	O
be	O
reported	O
by	O
physicians	O
.	O

Six	O
calls	O
were	O
received	O
from	O

who	O
say	O
they	O
took	O
their	O
children	O
to	O

who	O
diagnosed	O
their	O
children	O
with	O
hand	B-Disease
,	I-Disease
foot	I-Disease
and	I-Disease
mouth	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
.	O

The	O
reports	O
are	O

to	O
some	O
who	O
have	O
seen	O
the	O
diagnosed	O
children	O
being	O
taken	O
around	O

into	O

.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
(	O
CDC	O
)	O
,	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
readily	O
spread	O
by	O
close	O
personal	O
contact	O
,	O
contact	O
with	O
contaminated	O
surfaces	O
and	O
objects	O
such	O
as	O

,	O

and	O

.	O

are	O

that	O
affected	O

may	O

disease	O
to	O

.	O

.	O

to	O

?	O
''	O

the	O

is	O

to	O

.	O

``	O

,	O
and	O

ca	O
n't	O

.	O
''	O

The	O
CDC	O
says	O
there	O
is	O
no	O
vaccine	O
to	O
protect	O
against	O
the	O
viruses	O
that	O
cause	O
hand	B-Disease
,	I-Disease
foot	I-Disease
and	I-Disease
mouth	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
.	O

A	O
person	O
can	O
lower	O
their	O
risk	O
of	O
being	O
infected	O
by	O
:	O
-	O
Washing	O
hands	O
often	O
with	O
soap	O
and	O
water	O
,	O
especially	O
after	O
changing	O
diapers	O
and	O
using	O
the	O
toilet	O
.	O

-	O
Cleaning	O
and	O
disinfecting	O
frequently	O
touched	O
surfaces	O
and	O
soiled	O
items	O
,	O
including	O
toys	O
.	O

-	O
Avoiding	O
close	O
contact	O
such	O
as	O
kissing	O
,	O
hugging	O
,	O
or	O
sharing	O
eating	O
utensils	O
or	O
cups	O
with	O
people	O
with	O
hand	B-Disease
,	I-Disease
foot	I-Disease
and	I-Disease
mouth	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
.	O

If	O
a	O
person	O
has	O
mouth	O
sores	O
,	O
it	O
might	O
be	O
painful	O
to	O
swallow	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
it	O
is	O
important	O
for	O
people	O
with	O
hand	B-Disease
,	I-Disease
foot	I-Disease
and	I-Disease
mouth	I-Disease
disease	I-Disease
to	O
drink	O
enough	O
liquids	O
to	O
prevent	O
dehydration	O
(	O
loss	O
of	O
body	O
fluids	O
)	O
.	O

If	O
a	O
person	O
can	O
not	O
swallow	O
enough	O
liquids	O
,	O
they	O
may	O
need	O
to	O
receive	O
them	O
through	O
an	O
IV	O
in	O
their	O
vein	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
specific	O
treatment	O
for	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
the	O
CDC	O
states	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
some	O
things	O
can	O
be	O
done	O
to	O
relieve	O
symptoms	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
:	O
-	O

over-the-counter	O
medications	O
to	O
relieve	O
pain	O
and	O
fever	O
(	O
caution	O
:	O
aspirin	O
should	O
not	O
be	O
given	O
to	O
children	O
)	O
.	O

-	O
Using	O
mouthwashes	O
or	O
sprays	O
that	O
numb	O
mouth	O
pain	O
.	O

African	B-Disease
swine	I-Disease
fever	I-Disease
(	O
ASF	B-Virus
)	O
has	O
hit	O
Viet	O
Nam	O
's	O
southern	O
Tay	B-Province
Ninh	I-Province
province	I-Province
,	O
Vietnam	B-Country
News	O

district	O
have	O
been	O

positive	O
to	O
ASF	O
virus	O
,	O
and	O
then	O
culled	O
to	O

.	O

ASF	B-Virus
has	O
spread	O
to	O

and	O

across	O
Viet	O
Nam	O

.	O

,	O

to	O

the	O
country	O
this	O
year	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
due	O
to	O
ASF	B-Virus
,	O
its	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
and	O
Rural	O
Development	O
said	O
late	O

[	O

2019	O
]	O
.	O

Viet	O

reported	O
the	O
1st	O
ASF	B-Virus
outbreak	O
in	O
February	O
[	O
2019	O
]	O
in	O
northern	O
Hung	O
Yen	O
province	O
.	O

ASF	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
severe	O
viral	O
disease	O
affecting	O
domestic	O
pigs	O
and	O
boars	O
which	O
can	O
be	O
spread	O
by	O
live	O
or	O
dead	O
pigs	O
and	O
pork	O
products	O
.	O

The	O
ASF	B-Virus
virus	O
is	O
harmless	O
to	O
humans	O
,	O
but	O
causes	O
hemorrhagic	O
fever	O
in	O
pigs	O
and	O
wild	O
boars	O
that	O
is	O
almost	O
fatal	O
.	O

than	O
70	O
000	O
people	O
were	O
infected	O
with	O
dengue	B-Virus
fever	I-Disease
last	O

[	O

]	O

[	O

.	O

.	O

.	O

A	O

Congo	I-Virus

fever	I-Virus
(	O

)	O
.	O

A	O
letter	O
written	O
by	O
acting	O
Oshikoto	B-Province
regional	O
health	O
director	O
,	O
Helena	O
Nkandi-Shiimi	O
states	O
that	O

a	O

.	O

``	O

was	O

,	O

the	O
Ontananga	O

,	O
''	O

that	O
the	O
patient	O
was	O
admitted	O

and	O
tests	O
were	O
done	O
on	O
her	O
blood	O
,	O
which	O
discovered	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
transmitted	O
to	O
people	O
either	O
by	O
tick	O
bites	O
or	O
through	O
contact	O
with	O
infected	O
animal	O
blood	O
or	O
tissues	O
during	O
and	O

vomiting	O
blood	O
.	O

.	O

Swedish	O
health	O
authorities	O
have	O
warned	O
an	O
outbreak	O
of	O
rabbit	O
fever	O
(	O

)	O
is	O
expected	O
to	O
grow	O
,	O

of	O

affected	O
so	O
far	O
.	O

A	O
total	O
of	O
212	O

cases	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
to	O
The	O
Public	O
Health	O
Agency	O
of	O
Sweden	B-Country
(	O
Folkhallsomyndigheten	O
)	O
so	O
far	O
in	O
2019	O
,	O
sharply	O
increasing	O
from	O
late	O

2019	O
.	O

That	O
is	O
twice	O
as	O

as	O
in	O
a	O

.	O

But	O

has	O
not	O

of	O
it	O
,	O

.	O

(	O
of	O

)	O
is	O
usually	O

A/H1N1	O
(	O

the	O
Centers	O
for	O
Disease	O
Control	O
and	O
Prevention	O
,	O
rabies	B-Virus
is	O
a	O
viral	O
disease	O
that	O
infects	O
the	O
central	O
nervous	O
system	O
.	O

Initial	O
symptoms	O
can	O
include	O
a	O
fever	O
or	O
headache	O
and	O
may	O
give	O
way	O
to	O
neurological	O
symptoms	O
,	O
like	O
insomnia	O
,	O
partial	O
paralysis	O
,	O
or	O
hallucinations	O
.	O

Death	O
usually	O
occurs	O
within	O
days	O
after	O
symptoms	O
appear	O
.	O

Pinal	B-City
County	I-City
Public	O
Health	O
recommends	O
taking	O
precautions	O
:	O
-	O
keep	O
people	O
and	O
pets	O
away	O
from	O
wild	O
animals	O
.	O

Do	O
not	O
pick	O
up	O
,	O
touch	O
,	O
or	O
feed	O
wild	O
or	O
unfamiliar	O
animals	O
,	O
especially	O
sick	O
or	O
wounded	O
ones	O
.	O

If	O
someone	O
has	O
been	O
bitten	O
or	O
scratched	O
,	O
or	O
has	O
had	O
contact	O
with	O
the	O
animal	O
,	O
report	O
it	O
immediately	O
to	O
animal	O
control	O
or	O
health	O
officials	O
;	O
-	O
vaccinate	O
all	O
dogs	O
and	O
cats	O
against	O
rabies	B-Virus
.	O

Pets	O
should	O
be	O
kept	O
in	O
a	O
fenced	O
yard	O
;	O
-	O
take	O
precautions	O
when	O
camping	O
,	O
hunting	O
,	O
or	O
fishing	O
.	O

Avoid	O
sleeping	O
on	O
the	O
open	O
ground	O
without	O
the	O
protection	O
of	O
a	O
closed	O
tent	O
or	O
camper	O
.	O

Keep	O
pets	O
on	O
a	O
leash	O
and	O
do	O
not	O
allow	O
them	O
to	O
wander	O
.	O

For	O
more	O
information	O
,	O
contact	O
the	O
Pinal	B-City
County	I-City
Public	O
Health	O
Services	O
District	O
at	O
520-866-7138	O
or	O
the	O
Arizona	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Health	O
Services	O
at	O
602-364-4562	O
.	O

For	O
2	O
weeks	O
already	O
,	O
the	O
population	O
of	O
the	O
community	O
of	O
Bakongola	O
,	O
Ovudu	O
grouping	O
,	O
Kimbombo	O
territory	O
in	O
Maniema	B-Province
has	O
suffered	O
from	O
this	O
rare	O
epidemic	O
named	O
monkeypox	B-Disease
.	O

Monkeypox	B-Disease
,	O
a	O
rare	O
disease	O
,	O
is	O
caused	O
by	O
the	O
simian	B-Virus
pox	I-Virus
virus	O
(	O
monkeypox	O
)	O
which	O
is	O
structurally	O
related	O
to	O
smallpox	O
and	O
causes	O
a	O
similar	O
disease	O
,	O
but	O
less	O
severe	O
.	O

It	O
is	O
part	O
of	O
the	O
group	O
of	O
_orthopoxviruses_	O
.	O

The	O
residents	O
who	O
contacted	O

of	O

.	O

.	O

A	O
Congo	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
alert	O
had	O

last	O
year	O
[	O
2020	O
]	O

visiting	O

.	O

was	O

by	O
the	O
KMC	O
to	O
hospitals	O
,	O
directing	O
them	O
to	O

special	O

for	O
a	O
Congo-affected	O
patient	O
.	O

It	O
had	O
further	O
asked	O
hospitals	O
to	O
establish	O
special	O
wards	O
for	O
Congo	B-Virus
patients	O
,	O
and	O
run	O
awareness	O
campaigns	O
about	O
the	O
virus	O
.	O

The	O
disease	O
is	O
caused	O
when	O
a	O
tick	O
attaches	O
itself	O
to	O
the	O
skin	O
of	O
[	O
infected	O
]	O
cattle	O
and	O
when	O
that	O
infected	O
tick	O
or	O
animal	O
comes	O
in	O
contact	O
with	O
people	O
,	O
the	O
highly	O
contagious	O
virus	O
is	O
transmitted	O
into	O
the	O
human	O
body	O
and	O
the	O
person	O
falls	O
ill	O
.	O

The	O
initial	O
symptoms	O
of	O
Congo	B-Virus
fever	O
included	O
headache	O
,	O
high	O
fever	O

,	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

.	O

Thousands	O
of	O
people	O
in	O
Democratic	B-Country
Republic	I-Country
of	I-Country
Congo	I-Country
's	O
capital	O

[	O

vigilant	O

they	O
were	O
in	O
any	O
of	O
the	O
.	O

]	O

.	O

(	O

)	O
,	O
Para	B-Province
is	O
the	O
state	O
[	O
in	O
Brazil	B-Country
]	O
with	O
the	O
most	O
cases	O
of	O
the	O

.	O

In	O
2011	O
,	O
141	O
cases	O
were	O
registered	O
.	O

From	O
1	O
Jan	O
-	O
August	O
,	O
2012	O
,	O
the	O
Secretariat	O
total	O
is	O
35	O
cases	O
.	O

The	O
researcher	O
Ana	O
Maria	O
Guaralda	O
explained	O
that	O
the	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
the	O
protozoan	O
_Trypanosoma	O
cruzi_	O
,	O
which	O
is	O
very	O
resistant	O
and	O
can	O
survive	O
in	O
frozen	O
acai	O
.	O

``	O
Freezing	O
does	O
not	O
interrupt	O
transmission	O
.	O

Contaminated	O
ocai	O
maintained	O
at	O
-20C	O
for	O
24	O
hours	O
can	O
still	O
kill	O
laboratory	O
mice	O
,	O
''	O
stated	O
the	O
researcher	O
.	O

Adequate	O
preparation	O
of	O
the	O
acai	O
is	O
one	O
method	O
to	O
avoid	O
contamination	O
.	O

It	O
should	O
be	O
passed	O
through	O
a	O
sieve	O
,	O
washed	O
3	O
times	O
in	O
tap	O
water	O
and	O
later	O
soaked	O
for	O
20	O
min	O
in	O
hypochlorite	O
.	O

Before	O
being	O
ground	O
up	O
,	O
the	O
acai	O
must	O
go	O
through	O
a	O
a	O
bleaching	O
process	O
,	O
which	O
consists	O
of	O
immersing	O
the	O
fruit	O
in	O
water	O
at	O
80	O
C	O
for	O
10	O
seconds	O
,	O
then	O
cooling	O
the	O
fruit	O
again	O
.	O

Ugandan	O
health	O
experts	O
are	O
monitoring	O
neighbouring	O
Democratic	B-Country
Republic	I-Country
of	I-Country
Congo	I-Country
where	O

Ebola	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
disease	O

.	O

:	O

Officials	O
in	O
both	O
New	B-Province
York	I-Province
and	O
Maine	B-Province
have	O
issued	O
alerts	O
asking	O
spring	O
[	O
wild	O
]	O
turkey	O
hunters	O
to	O
help	O
them	O
identify	O
birds	O
that	O
may	O
be	O
suffering	O
from	O
lymphoproliferative	B-Virus
disease	I-Virus
virus	O
(	O
LPDV	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
,	O
which	O
causes	O
Elephant	O
Man-like	O
lesions	O
on	O
a	O
turkey	O
's	O
head	O
and	O
legs	O
,	O
has	O
already	O
been	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
Maine	B-Province
population	O
,	O
while	O
biologists	O
in	O
New	B-Province
York	I-Province
are	O
seeking	O
further	O
information	O
to	O
determine	O
whether	O
the	O
disease	O
has	O
impacted	O
their	O
flocks	O
.	O

According	O
the	O
Maine	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Inland	O
Fisheries	O
and	O
Wildlife	O
:	O
``	O
LPDV	O
is	O
thought	O
to	O
spread	O
between	O
turkeys	O
by	O
direct	O
skin	O
contact	O
or	O
through	O
mosquito	O
bites	O
.	O

Some	O
turkeys	O
can	O
fend	O
off	O
minor	O
infections	O
and	O
survive	O
,	O
while	O
others	O
can	O
develop	O
extreme	O
lesions	O
that	O
inhibit	O
their	O
sight	O
and	O
ability	O
to	O
eat	O
,	O
which	O
ultimately	O
leads	O
to	O
death	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
disease	O
poses	O
no	O
risk	O
to	O
human	O
health	O
.	O

However	O
,	O
like	O
all	O
infections	O
,	O
caution	O
is	O
advised	O
while	O
handling	O
a	O
bird	O
with	O
LPDV	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
a	O
potential	O
for	O
secondary	O
bacterial	O
infections	O
if	O
birds	O
are	O
handled	O
improperly	O
.	O

Thoroughly	O
cooking	O
the	O
meat	O
to	O
an	O
internal	O
temperature	O
of	O
a	O
minimum	O
of	O
165	O
F	O
[	O
74	O
C	O
]	O
is	O
also	O
advised	O
.	O

``	O
Although	O
wild	O
turkeys	O
can	O
not	O
pass	O
this	O
virus	O
on	O
to	O
humans	O
,	O
if	O
you	O
shoot	O
a	O
bird	O
and	O
you	O
do	O
not	O
want	O
to	O
eat	O
it	O
,	O
do	O
not	O
register	O
it	O
,	O
and	O
please	O
contact	O
a	O
Wildlife	O
Biologist	O
at	O
one	O
of	O
the	O
regional	O
offices	O
,	O
or	O
call	O
the	O
Department	O
of	O
Public	O
Safety	O
in	O
Augusta	O
at	O
(	O
800	O
)	O
452-4664	O
to	O
be	O
connected	O
with	O
a	O
game	O
warden	O
.	O

After	O
examining	O
the	O
bird	O
,	O
the	O
department	O
staff	O
member	O
will	O
determine	O
your	O
eligibility	O
to	O
harvest	O
another	O
turkey	O
.	O

``	O
Little	O
is	O
known	O
about	O
the	O
origin	O
of	O
LPDV	O
in	O
the	O
United	B-Country
States	I-Country
.	O

LPDV	O
was	O
1st	O
detected	O
in	O
domestic	O
turkeys	O
in	O
Europe	O
.	O

Since	O
that	O
time	O
,	O
we	O
have	O
confirmed	O
several	O
cases	O
throughout	O
the	O
state	O
.	O

Currently	O
,	O
known	O
cases	O
occur	O
virtually	O
wherever	O
wild	O
turkeys	O
are	O
present	O
.	O
''	O

New	B-Province
York	I-Province
biologists	O
,	O
who	O
are	O
attempting	O
to	O
determine	O
reasons	O
behind	O
wild	O
turkey	O
population	O
decreases	O
in	O
the	O
state	O
,	O
ask	O
that	O
samples	O
from	O
suspected	O
birds	O
be	O
provided	O
to	O
the	O

of	O

.	O

DEC	O
advises	O
against	O

any	O
wild	O
animals	O
that	O
appear	O
sick	O
.	O

The	O
Ministry	O
of	O
Health	O
of	O
Egypt	B-Country
has	O
announced	O
a	O
new	O
confirmed	O
case	O
of	O
human	O
infection	O
with	O
avian	B-Virus
influenza	I-Virus
A/	I-Virus
(	I-Virus
H5N1	I-Virus
)	I-Virus
virus	O
.	O

The	O
case	O
is	O
a	O
38-year-old	O
female	O
from	O
Ismailia	B-Province
Governorate	I-Province
.	O

She	O
developed	O
symptoms	O
on	O
1	O
Mar	O
2011	O
and	O
was	O
hospitalized	O
on	O
7	O
Mar	O
2011	O
.	O

was	O
in	O
a	O
critical	O
condition	O
under	O
artificial	O

and	O
died	O
on	O
11	O
Mar	O
2011	O
.	O

Investigations	O
into	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
infection	O
indicate	O
that	O
the	O
case	O
had	O
exposure	O
to	O
sick	O
poultry	O
suspected	O
to	O
have	O
avian	O
influenza	O
.	O

The	O
case	O
was	O
confirmed	O
by	O
the	O
Egyptian	O
Central	O
Public	O
Health	O
Laboratory	O
,	O
a	O
National	O
Influenza	O
Center	O
of	O
the	O
WHO	O
Global	O
Influenza	O
Surveillance	O
Network	O
.	O

the	O
130	O
cases	O
confirmed	O
to	O
date	O
in	O
Egypt	B-Country
,	O
44	O
have	O

.	O

The	O

``	O

''	O

.	O

.	O

influenza	O
does	O
not	O

when	O
poultry	O
and	O

.	O

do	O
not	O

with	O
infected	O
birds	O
.	O

,	O

infection	O
,	O
JE	O
has	O
a	O
high	O
morbidity	O
and	O
mortality	O
.	O

Dr	O
Neelu	O
Desai	O
,	O
the	O
paediatric	O

who	O

,	O
said	O
that	O

has	O
been	O
treating	O
patients	O
with	O
JE	O

.	O

``	O

is	O
just	O
that	O
we	O
must	O
have	O
not	O
tested	O
all	O
patients	O
for	O
the	O
infection	O
.	O

in	O
most	O
cases	O
as	O
the	O

only	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

_Culex	O

.	O

,	O

.	O

.	O

_E	O
.	O

``	O

The	O

is	O

that	O

and	O

--	O

--	O
can	O
sometimes	O
have	O

such	O
as	O
_E	O
.	O

coli_	O
on	O
them	O
.	O

The	O

of	O
such	O
foods	O
has	O
been	O

in	O
numerous	O

in	O
recent	O
years	O
.	O

The	O

to	O

fresh	O
produce	O
before	O
preparing	O
and	O

it	O
raw	O
.	O

Investigators	O

on	O
the	O
outbreak	O
and	O
will	O
post	O

as	O
new	O
information	O
becomes	O
available	O
.	O

One	O
Washington	B-Province
[	O
State	O
]	O
county	O
[	O
Yakima	B-City
County	I-City
]	O
has	O
experienced	O
almost	O

the	O

disease	O

so	O

in	O
2013	O

in	O
[	O
all	O
of	O
]	O
2012	O
.	O

Though	O
officials	O
are	O
not	O
certain	O
of	O
the	O
cause	O
,	O
they	O
are	O
urging	O

to	O
seek	O
STD	O
tests	O
to	O
see	O
if	O

have	O
this	O

.	O

In	O
2013	O
,	O
there	O
have	O
been	O
108	O
reported	O
cases	O
of	O
gonorrhea	B-Disease
in	O
Yakima	B-City
County	I-City
,	O
which	O
is	O
a	O
74	O
percent	O
increase	O
in	O
cases	O
since	O
the	O

before	O
.	O

According	O
to	O

Washington	B-Province
State	O

Department	O
,	O
the	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
now	O
be	O
classified	O
as	O
an	O
``	O
outbreak	O
.	O
''	O

In	O
order	O
to	O
combat	O
the	O
disease	O
,	O
health	O
officials	O
are	O
encouraging	O
residents	O
to	O
seek	O
STD	O
testing	O
,	O
especially	O
if	O
they	O
are	O
at	O
risk	O
.	O

Those	O
who	O
have	O
sex	O
with	O
multiple	O
partners	O
or	O
are	O
between	O
the	O
ages	O
of	O
20	O
and	O
24	O
are	O
the	O
most	O
vulnerable	O
for	O
the	O
STD	O
,	O
noted	O
CBS	O
affiliate	O
KIMATV	O
.	O

The	O
Health	O
Department	O
has	O
encouraged	O
people	O
both	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
and	O
at	O
the	O
local	O
colleges	O
to	O
get	O
tested	O
if	O
they	O
think	O
they	O
may	O
be	O
at	O
risk	O
.	O

An	O
outbreak	O
of	O
_Vibrio	O
parahaemolyticus_	O
,	O
related	O
to	O
shellfish	O
,	O
has	O
been	O
declared	O
following	O
9	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
in	O
the	O
Canadian	O
province	O
of	O
New	B-Province
Brunswick	I-Province
.	O

``	O
As	O
Public	O
Health	O
continues	O
to	O
investigate	O
the	O
specific	O
cause	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
,	O
I	O
am	O
advising	O
all	O
New	O
Brunswickers	O
to	O
ensure	O
that	O
they	O
obtain	O
shellfish	O
and	O
other	O
seafood	O
from	O
a	O
licensed	O
establishment	O
or	O
harvest	O
shellfish	O
from	O
fishing	O
zones	O
which	O
are	O
currently	O
open	O
by	O
Fisheries	O
and	O
Oceans	O
Canada	B-Country
,	O
''	O
said	O
Dr.	O
Jennifer	O
Russell	O
,	O
chief	O
medical	O
officer	O
of	O
health	O
.	O

``	O
Cook	O
all	O
shellfish	O
such	O
as	O
mussels	O
,	O
oysters	O
and	O
clams	O
thoroughly	O
before	O
eating	O
.	O
''	O

_Vibrio	O
parahaemolyticus_	O
is	O
commonly	O
associated	O
with	O
the	O
consumption	O
and	O
handling	O
of	O
raw	O
shellfish	O
such	O
as	O
oysters	O
,	O
clams	O
,	O
and	O
mussels	O
.	O

The	O
confirmed	O
cases	O
have	O
been	O
reported	O
in	O
the	O
northern	O
and	O
eastern	O
parts	O
of	O
the	O
province	O
.	O

New	B-Province
Brunswick	I-Province
typically	O
averages	O
2	O
to	O
3	O
cases	O
of	O
_Vibrio	O
parahaemolyticus_	O
a	O
year	O
.	O

``	O
New	O
Brunswickers	O
are	O
encouraged	O
to	O
enjoy	O
healthy	O
seafoods	O
such	O
as	O
clams	O
,	O
mussels	O
,	O
and	O
oysters	O
but	O
should	O
be	O
aware	O
that	O
warmer	O
temperatures	O
may	O
increase	O
the	O
risks	O
of	O
bacteria	O
in	O
these	O
foods	O
,	O
''	O
said	O
Russell	O
.	O

``	O
The	O
risk	O
of	O
food	O
poisoning	O
can	O
be	O
minimized	O
by	O
following	O
some	O
simple	O
food	O
safety	O
guidelines	O
such	O
as	O
washing	O
your	O
hands	O
before	O
and	O
after	O
handling	O
these	O
foods	O
;	O
store	O
raw	O
shellfish	O
and	O
seafood	O
at	O
4	O
deg	O
C	O
(	O
39	O
deg	O
F	O
)	O
in	O
the	O
refrigerator	O
or	O
on	O
ice	O
before	O
cooking	O
and	O
refrigerate	O
leftovers	O
promptly	O
.	O
''	O

_Vibrio	O
parahaemolyticus_	O
are	O
a	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
bacteria	O
in	O
sea	O
water	O
.	O

The	O
bacteria	O
can	O
grow	O
in	O
shellfish	O
such	O
as	O
clams	O
,	O
oysters	O
and	O
mussels	O
when	O
seawater	O
temperatures	O
are	O
warmer	O
such	O
as	O
in	O
summer	O
months	O
.	O

Handling	O
or	O
eating	O
raw	O
or	O
undercooked	O
shellfish	O
can	O
result	O
in	O
illness	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
usually	O
appear	O
within	O
12	O
to	O
24	O
hours	O
after	O
a	O
person	O
becomes	O
infected	O
.	O

Most	O
people	O
who	O
become	O
ill	O
have	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
but	O
they	O
can	O
also	O
have	O
headache	O
,	O
nausea	O
,	O
vomiting	O
and	O
fever	O
.	O

Symptoms	O
usually	O
last	O
less	O
than	O
a	O
week	O
.	O

The	O
illness	O
is	O
not	O
spread	O
from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
.	O

Samples	O
from	O
the	O
carcass	O
of	O
a	O
yearling	O
bison	O
heifer	O
on	O
the	O
Flying	O
D	O
Ranch	O
in	O
Gallatin	B-City
County	I-City
has	O
been	O
killed	O
by	O
naturally	O
occurring	O
anthrax	B-Disease
,	O
according	O
to	O
animal	O
health	O
officials	O
with	O
the	O
Montana	B-Province
Department	O
of	O
Livestock	O
.	O

Field	O
tests	O
on	O
the	O
dead	O
bison	O
,	O
found	O
Monday	O
near	O
a	O

where	O

287	O
bison	O
2	O

ago	O
,	O
were	O
confirmed	O
at	O
the	O
Montana	B-Province
Veterinary	O
Diagnostic	O

in	O

.	O

The	O

,	O

state	O

Dr	O
Martin	O
Zaluski	O
,	O
and	O
the	O
ranch	O
is	O

its	O

that	O

.	O

Zaluski	O
said	O
a	O
repeat	O
of	O
outbreak	O
in	O
2008	O
,	O
which	O
lasted	O
3	O
weeks	O
,	O
is	O
n't	O
likely	O
.	O

``	O

the	O

implemented	O
by	O
the	O
ranch	O
after	O
the	O
outbreak	O

would	O
not	O
expect	O
to	O

by	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O
''	O

The	O
positive	O
test	O
was	O
not	O

,	O
Zaluski	O
said	O
,	O
as	O
anthrax	B-Disease
is	O
known	O
to	O
be	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

Most	O

disease	O
at	O

2008	O
.	O

area	O

to	O

more	O
about	O

,	O

,	O
and	O

of	O
the	O
disease	O
.	O

are	O

.	O

``	O

,	O

.	O
''	O

Cambodia	B-Country
reported	O
13	O
700	O
malaria	B-Disease
cases	O
in	O

1st	O
5	O

this	O

[	O
2013	O
]	O

from	O

Monday	O
.	O

From	O

this	O

[	O
2013	O

the	O
disease	O

4	O

27	O

in	O

last	O

Char	O

Chuor	O
,	O

was	O
thanks	O
to	O
a	O
mosquito	O
net	O
distribution	O
and	O
awareness	O
campaign	O
.	O

Last	O
year	O
[	O
2012	O
]	O
,	O
more	O
than	O
a	O
million	O
mosquito	O
nets	O
were	O
given	O
free-of-charge	O
to	O

groups	O
of	O
people	O
throughout	O
the	O
country	O
.	O

He	O
said	O
the	O
country	O
is	O
committed	O
to	O
eliminating	O
the	O
disease	O
by	O
2025	O
.	O

Malaria	B-Disease
is	O
a	O
mosquito-borne	O
infectious	O
disease	O
.	O

In	O
Cambodia	B-Country
,	O
the	O
disease	O
is	O
often	O
found	O
in	O
the	O
rainy	O
season	O
and	O
mostly	O
happens	O
in	O
forest	O
and	O
mountainous	O
areas	O
,	O
particularly	O
provinces	O
along	O
the	O
border	O
.	O

Last	O
year	O
[	O
2012	O
]	O
,	O
the	O
country	O
recorded	O
45	O
553	O
cases	O
of	O
malaria	B-Disease
,	O
with	O
45	O
deaths	O
,	O
the	O
report	O
said	O
.	O

Disease	O
Phenotype	O
Coral	O
;	O
''	O
>	O
Location	O
Person	O
Organizaion	O
Two	O
separate	O
cases	O
of	O
the	O
Schmallenberg	B-Virus
virus	I-Disease
(	O
SBV	O
)	O
infection	O
have	O
been	O
confirmed	O
in	O
Coral	O
;	O
''	O
>	O
Ireland	B-Country
by	O
the	O
Department	O
of	O
Agriculture	O
.	O

The	O
cases	O
were	O
found	O
in	O
aborted	O
bovine	O
foetuses	O
,	O
one	O
submitted	O
from	O
Co.	O
Cork	B-City
and	O

from	O
Co.	O
Laois	B-City
.	O

These	O
are	O
the	O
1st	O
virus	O
positive	O
cases	O
that	O
the	O
Department	O
knows	O
to	O
have	O
occurred	O
in	O
Coral	O
;	O
''	O
>	O
Ireland	B-Country
since	O
the	O
Spring	O
of	O
2013	O
.	O

A	O
resurgence	O
of	O
SBV	O
was	O
anticipated	O
because	O
of	O
recent	O
reports	O
of	O
clinical	O
cases	O
in	O
Belgium	O
,	O
the	O

and	O
the	O
UK	O
.	O

According	O
to	O
the	O
Department	O
,	O
the	O
main	O
impact	O
of	O
SBV	O
infection	O
is	O
congenital	O
malformation	O
of	O
calves	O
and	O
lambs	O
that	O
are	O
exposed	O
to	O
the	O
virus	O
at	O
a	O
particular	O
stage	O
of	O
pregnancy	O
.	O

Therefore	O
it	O
is	O
usually	O
a	O
low	O
impact	O
infection	O
except	O
in	O
those	O
herds	O
and	O
flocks	O
which	O
use	O
synchronised	O
breeding	O
methods	O
and	O
are	O
then	O
exposed	O
to	O
infection	O
during	O
that	O
particular	O
stage	O
of	O
pregnancy	O
,	O
it	O
said	O
.	O

The	O
virus	O
is	O
transmitted	O
by	O
biting	O
midges	O
so	O
there	O
is	O
unlikely	O
to	O
be	O
any	O
further	O
spread	O
of	O
the	O
virus	O
over	O
the	O
next	O
few	O
months	O
as	O
biting	O
midges	O
are	O
only	O
active	O
between	O
April	O
and	O
December	O
in	O
Coral	O
;	O
''	O
>	O
Ireland	B-Country
.	O

While	O
a	O
vaccine	O
is	O
available	O
it	O
is	O
only	O
effective	O
when	O
used	O
to	O
prevent	O
infection	O
occurring	O
during	O
pregnancy	O
(	O
i.e	O
.	O

when	O
midges	O
are	O
actively	O
spreading	O
the	O
virus	O
)	O
.	O

The	O
Department	O
is	O
undertaking	O
a	O
serological	O
survey	O
of	O
cattle	O
to	O
establish	O
the	O
extent	O
of	O
exposure	O
to	O
the	O
virus	O
across	O
the	O
country	O
as	O
the	O
initial	O
indications	O
are	O
that	O
exposure	O
is	O
more	O
likely	O
to	O
have	O
occurred	O
in	O
southern	O
and	O
eastern	O
counties	O
than	O
in	O
the	O
north	O
and	O
west	O
as	O
previously	O
in	O
2012/2013	O
.	O

To	O
assist	O
in	O
these	O
national	O

Department	O
is	O
also	O

and	O
farmers	O
to	O
submit	O
suspected	O
cases	O
(	O
foetuses	O
or	O
newborn	O
calves	O
and	O
lambs	O
exhibiting	O
congenital	O
abnormalities	O
)	O
to	O
their	O
nearest	O
Regional	O
Veterinary	O
Laboratory	O
for	O
laboratory	O
confirmation	O
of	O
diagnosis	O
--	O
the	O
Department	O
will	O
provide	O
this	O
service	O
free	O
of	O
charge	O
.	O

An	O

of	O
hepatitis	B-Virus
A	I-Virus
in	O
North	B-City
Lanarkshire	I-City

.	O

NHS	O

.	O

Dr	O

Cat	O
owners	O
are	O
being	O
warned	O
about	O
a	O
parasite	O
that	O
can	O
be	O
deadly	O
.	O

Just	O
this	O
week	O
,	O
a	O
Springdale	B-City
[	O
Arkansas	B-Province
]	O
veterinary	O
clinic	O
has	O
seen	O
3	O
cases	O
of	O
bobcat	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
[	O
_Cytauxzoon	O
felis_	O
]	O
,	O
2	O
of	O
which	O
have	O
been	O
fatal	O
.	O

The	O
parasite	O
,	O
known	O
as	O
cytaux	O
,	O
has	O
a	O
number	O
of	O
clinical	O
signs	O
.	O

If	O
not	O
treated	O
quickly	O
,	O
cats	O
can	O
die	O
in	O
just	O
a	O
matter	O
of	O
days	O
.	O

``	O
In	O
cats	O
,	O
there	O
is	O
disease	O
called	O
cytauxzoon	O
.	O

Somewhat	O
of	O
a	O
lay	O
name	O
,	O
I	O
guess	O
is	O
bobcat	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
,	O
''	O
veterinarian	O
Dr	O
Eric	O
Steinlage	O
said	O
.	O

``	O
(	O
It	O
)	O
can	O
be	O
quite	O
lethal	O
to	O
a	O
very	O
high	O
percentage	O
of	O
cats	O
that	O
get	O
it	O
.	O
''	O

Vets	O
said	O
the	O
disease	O
can	O
be	O
caused	O
by	O
a	O
bite	O
from	O
an	O
infected	O
tick	O
.	O

The	O
parasite	O
got	O
its	O
name	O
from	O
the	O
thinking	O
that	O
a	O
tick	O
would	O
have	O
to	O
bite	O
a	O
bobcat	O
,	O
then	O
bite	O
a	O
domestic	O
cat	O
,	O
but	O
it	O
has	O
recently	O
been	O
discovered	O
that	O
cats	O
are	O
already	O
carriers	O
of	O
the	O
parasite	O
.	O

In	O
Arkansas	B-Province
,	O
cats	O
are	O
more	O
prone	O
to	O
the	O
disease	O
because	O
of	O
the	O
number	O
of	O
ticks	O
in	O
the	O
area	O
.	O

Clinical	O
signs	O
include	O
poor	O
to	O
no	O
appetite	O
,	O
lethargy	O
,	O
breathing	O
hard	O
and	O
moderate	O
to	O
severe	O
pain	O
.	O

There	O
is	O
no	O
vaccine	O
for	O
bobcat	B-Disease
fever	I-Disease
.	O

Vets	O
urge	O
cat	O
owners	O
to	O
use	O
tick	O
prevention	O
,	O
such	O
as	O
flea	O
and	O
tick	O
collar	O
,	O
and	O
to	O
keep	O
cats	O
indoors	O
during	O
tick	O
season	O
.	O

If	O
they	O
happen	O
to	O
go	O
outside	O
,	O
cat	O
owners	O
should	O
check	O
their	O
pets	O
regularly	O
for	O
ticks	O
.	O

``	O
There	O
[	O
are	O
]	O
probably	O
more	O
tickborne	O
diseases	O
that	O
we	O
do	O
n't	O
know	O
about	O
than	O
we	O
do	O
,	O
and	O
in	O
people	O
too	O
,	O
''	O
Steinlage	O
said	O
.	O

Dog	O
and	O
cat	O
owners	O
are	O
also	O
cautioned	O
to	O
look	O
out	O
for	O
tick	O
paralysis	O
,	O
which	O
can	O
also	O
be	O
fatal	O
and	O
has	O
been	O
seen	O
locally	O
.	O

cases	O

this	O

[	O
According	O
to	O
a	O

Thu	O
25	O

2017	O
the	O
WHO	O

that	O

and	O
cholera	O
kits	O
has	O

landed	O
at	O
Sana	B-Province
'	I-Province
a	I-Province
airport	O
,	O
noting	O
this	O
is	O
the	O
largest	O

of	O

WHO	O
has	O

the	O

.	O

The	O
Texas	B-Province
_Cyclospora_	O
outbreak	O
is	O
growing	O
and	O
more	O
than	O
half	O
of	O
the	O
state	O
's	O
cases	O
are	O
in	O
Travis	B-City
County	I-City
.	O

People	O
get	O
the	O
disease	O
from	O
eating	O
fruits	O
or	O
vegetables	O
contaminated	O
with	O
fecal	O
matter	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
have	O
n't	O
pinpointed	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
the	O
outbreak	O
.	O

_Cyclospora_	O
symptoms	O
include	O
:	O
severe	O
diarrhea	O
,	O
abdominal	O
cramping	O
,	O
weight	O
loss	O
,	O

.	O

2	O

,	O
Texas	B-Province
has	O
seen	O
72	O
cases	O
of	O
_Cyclospora_	O
and	O
37	O
of	O
the	O
cases	O
are	O
in	O
Travis	B-City
County	I-City
.	O

Dallas	B-City
County	I-City
has	O
5	O
cases	O
,	O
Harris	B-City
County	I-City
has	O
3	O
cases	O
,	O

Williamson	B-City

has	O
one	O
case	O
.	O

``	O
I	O
suspect	O
,	O
in	O
Travis	B-City
County	I-City
,	O
we	O
probably	O
have	O
a	O

.	O

,	O

is	O

.	O

as	O

,	O
''	O

.	O

with	O
_Cyclospora_	O
.	O

're	O

to	O

out	O
what	O
the	O
patients	O
have	O
in	O
common	O
since	O

disease	O
does	O

from	O
person	O
to	O
person	O
.	O

``	O
Specially	O
,	O
we	O
're	O
looking	O
at	O
places	O
they	O
may	O
have	O
eaten	O
or	O
common	O
events	O
they	O

attended	O
...	O
like	O

at	O
the	O
same	O
place	O
or	O
they	O
attended	O
the	O
same	O
wedding	O

,	O
''	O
says	O
Jeff	O
Taylor	O
,	O
an	O
epidemiologist	O
with	O
Austin/Travis	O
County	O
Health	O
and	O
Human	O
Services	O
The	O
challenge	O
is	O
symptoms	O
do	O
n't	O
set	O
in	O
until	O
7-10	O
days	O
after	O
you	O
've	O
eaten	O
the	O
contaminated	O
food	O
.	O

So	O
without	O
a	O
good	O
memory	O
,	O
it	O
's	O
possible	O
the	O
source	O
of	O
this	O
outbreak	O
could	O
come	O
and	O
go	O
without	O
ever	O
being	O
identified	O
.	O

The	O
2	O
suspects	O
health	O
officials	O
are	O
honing	O
in	O
on	O
are	O
cilantro	O
and	O
raspberries	O
.	O

Cilantro	O
caused	O
_Cyclospora_	O
outbreaks	O
in	O
Texas	B-Province
in	O
2014	O
.	O

Health	O
officials	O
recommend	O
washing	O
produce	O
well	O
before	O
eating	O
,	O
but	O
even	O
then	O
,	O

is	O
difficult	O
to	O
remove	O
all	O
of	O
the	O
_Cyclospora_	O
spores	O
.	O

Cooking	O
does	O
kill	O
the	O
parasite	O
.	O

_Cyclospora_	O
is	O
not	O
typically	O
life	O
threatening	O
.	O

A	O
patient	O
at	O
Holy	O
Family	O
Hospital	O
(	O
HFH	O
)	O
[	O
Rawalpindi	B-City
,	O
Punjab	B-Province
]	O
tested	O
positive	O
for	O
Congo	O
fever	O
on	O
.	O

The	O
62-year-old	O
man	O
was	O
brought	O
to	O
the	O
hospital	O
4	O
days	O
ago	O
from	O
Choha	O

in	O
Chakwal	O
[	O
district	O
,	O
Punjab	B-Province
]	O
with	O
a	O
high	O
fever	O
.	O

The	O
hospital	O
suspected	O

could	O
be	O

for	O

.	O

that	O

from	O
Crimean-Congo	B-Disease
haemorrhagic	I-Disease
fever	I-Disease
(	O

)	O
.	O

.	O

HFH	O

[	O

]	O

Sarwar	O
said	O

.	O

[	O

.	O

7	O

8	O
